div0.head: *b
div0.entryFree: b, bh=ta, indecl., second letter of the Gr. alphabet: hence as numeral, b/ = du/o and deu/teros, but b' = 2,000. to represent v, freq. in Hsch., esp. in Lacon. words, cf. bei/kati, etc.

ba=, shortd. form of basileu=,
king! A.Supp.892 (lyr.). an exclam.
baa! (with ref. to the
baaing of a lamb), Hermipp.19.

baba/zw,
speak inarticulately, or
shout, Hsch.; but aor. inf. baba/cai
dance, Id. (Cf. baba/kths.）

babai/, exclam. of surprise or amazement,
bless me! E.Cyc.156, Ar.Av.272, etc.; doubled,
hurrah! Achae.28, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic.3.178; ou)xi\ tw=n metri/wn, a)lla\ tw=n babai\ babai/, to denote persons
extravagant in their expressions, Alex.206: c. gen., babai\ tou= lo/gou
bless me what an argument! Pl.Phlb.23b, cf. Jul.Caes.309b, etc. (On the accent, cf. Hdn.Gr.1.502; babai= cod. B in Pl. l.c.)
babaia/c, strengthd. for babai/, Ar.Ach.64, al.; babai\ babaia/c Id.Pax248.
ba/bakoi, in Elis, = te/ttiges; in Pontus, = ba/traxoi, Hsch.

baba/kths,
reveller, of Pan, Cratin.321, cf. Eust.1431.46; of Dionysus, Corn.ND30; expld. by o)rxhsth/s, EM183.45, Hsch.
ba/balon: ai)doi=on, Hsch.: also ba/balon: krau/gason (Lacon.), Id.

ba/bac, akos, o(,
chatterer, Archil.33, Lyc.472.
babe/lios, Pamph., = a)e/lios, h(/lios, Eust.1654.20.
babi/zw or a)wt-u/zw, = bau/+zw, Zenod. ap. Ammon.p.231 V.

ba/bion, to/, Syrian word for
child, Dam.Isid.76.

babra/zw,
chatter, chirp, of the grasshopper, Anan.5.6.

ba/brhkes, oi(,
gums, or
food in the teeth, Hsch. babrh/n,
lees of olive-oil (Maced.), Id. babu/as, o(,
mud, Id.:—also babu/lms, Suid.
babukw/s, = peleka/n, Philet. ap. Hsch.

*ba^bu^lw/n, w=nos, h(,
Babylon, Alc.Supp.16.10, etc.:—*ba^bu^lw/nioi, oi(,
Babylonians, Hdt.1.77, etc., and *ba^bu^lwni/a, h(,
Babylonia, Arist. Oec.1352b27:—also *ba^bu^lwneu/s, e/ws, o(, St.Byz.; fem. *ba^bu^lwni/s, i/dos, Nonn.D.40.303:—Adj. *ba^bu^lw/nios, a, on, Hdt.1.106, etc.; os, on, Arr.An.6.29.6; or *ba^bu^lwniako/s, h/, o/n, Alex.308.

babu/rtas: o( para/mwros, Hsch. (Cf. Lat.
baburrus.）

entryFree.sense:
title of Zeus in Phrygia, Id. (Cf. Slav.
bog[ucaron] 'good'.)

div0.entryFree: bagaro/n: xliaro/n (Lacon.), Hsch. bagei=: ei)selqou=sai, Id. ba/gion: me/ga, Id., Suid.

ba/gma, atos, to/, (ba/zw)
speech, A.Pers.637 (lyr.,pl.).
bago/s: basileu/s, kai\ strathgo/s (i.e. Lacon., = a)go/s), Hsch.

bagw/as, o(, Lat. Bagoas and
Bagöus, Persian word, said to be = eu)nou=xos, as pr. n. in Str.15.3.24, etc.
bada/s: ki/naidos, Amerias ap.Hsch. badelegei=: a)me/lgei, Id. (bade/lgei Cyr., alii alia).

ba/dhn [a^], Adv., (bai/nw)
step by step, b. a)pio/ntos Il.13.516; a)/raxnos w(s b. A.Supp.887;
in marching step, h)=ge b. Hdt.9.57; h(gou= b. Ar.Lys.254; b. taxu\ e)fe/pesqai
at quick march, opp. dro/mw| qei=n, X.An.4.6.25; qa=tton h)\ b. Id.HG5.4.53, Men.837, Aristaenet.2.14; b. u(poxwrei=n Arist.HA629b14.
gradually, more and more, peinh=n Ar.Ach.535.
on foot, opp. e)f' i(/ppwn, e)pi\ naw=n, A.Pers. 19 (anap.); opp. e)p' a)ph/nhs, App.Gall.1.

ba^di/zw, Att. fut. badiou=mai Ar.Th.617, Pl.495, Pl.Smp.190d, etc.; later badi/somai Gal.UP12.10, and badiw= Nicol.Prog.p.69F., Ael.Tact. 36.4, (dia-) Luc.Dem.Enc.1; badi/sw D.Chr.10.8: aor. e)ba/disa Hp.Int. 44, Pl.Erx.392b, Arr.An.7.3.3, etc.: pf.beba/dika Arist.Metaph.1048b31,J.Ap.2.39:—Med., imper. badi/zou Cratin.391:—
walk, e)pistrofa/dhn d' e)ba/dizen h.Merc.210; b. a)rru/qmws Alex.263; opp. tre/xw, X.Cyr. 2.3.10, etc.; of horsemen, interpol. in Id.An.6.3.19; e)pi\ kth/nous b. D.Chr.34.5;
go by land, opp. ple/w, D.19.164,181; also of
sailing, X. Oec.16.7; of a ship, LXXJn.1.3;
march, of armies, Ael.Tact. l.c.; of certain animals, kata\ ske/lh b., v. ske/los I: c. acc. cogn., ba/don b. Ar.Av.42; o(do/n Hp. l. c., X.Mem.2.1.11; a)ei\ mi/an a)trapo/n Arist.HA 622b25; o(dw=| b. Luc. Tim.5; ba/dize
go! Men.Epit.159, Sam.43.
go about, bh= bh= le/gwn b. Cratin.43, al.; kata\ zuga/ in pairs, Arist.HA 544a5. generally,
go, proceed, Antipho 5.24; e)p' oi)ki/as b.
enter houses, D.18.132, cf. Test. ap. eund.21.121; b. e)pi/tina yeudoklhtei/as
proceed against him for . . , D.53.15; ei)s to\ poli/teuma, ei)s ta\s a)rxa/s, ei)s ta\ a)rxei=a, Arist.Pol.1293a24, 1298a15, 1299a36; b. ei)s ta\ patrw=|a
enter on one's patrimony, Is.3.62;
proceed (in argument), pro\s ta\ kathgorh/mata D.18.263, cf. Arist.AP0.97a5; ei)s a)/peiron b., of an infinite
process, Metaph.1000b28; o(mo/se th=| fh/mh| b. Plu.Thes.10. of things, ai( timai\ e)p' e)/latton e)ba/dizon prices
were getting lower, D. 56.9; to\ pra=gma porrwte/rw b. Id.23.203.—Very rare in Poets: [h(/lios] b. to\n e)niau/sion ku/klon E.Ph.544.

ba/dillos, o(, = Lat.
batillus, shovel, b. sidhrou=s POxy.521.13 (ii A. D.).
ba/dion, to/, Dim. of ba/dos or ba/tos, a measure, = 50 ce/stai, PBaden 43.10 (iii A. D.), POxy. 1658.4 (iv A. D.).

ba/d-i^sis [a^], ews, h(,
walking, going, Ar.Pl.334; badi/sei xrh=sqai Hp.
Aër.15; of hares, texna/zein th=| b. X.Cyn.8.3; opp. pth=sis, a(/lsis, Arist.EN1174a31.

ba/d-isma, atos, to/,
walk, gait, X.Ap.27, D.37.55: pl., Luc.Herm.18; e)lqw\n e)n h)remai/w| b. Palaeph.31.

bad-isma^ti/as, ou, o(,
a good walker, Cratin.392.
bad-ismo/s, o(, = ba/disis, Pl. Chrm.160c.

bad-iste/on,
one must walk or
go, soi\ b. pa/ros S.El. 1502, Str.17.1.54;
one must proceed, e)pi\ to\ kaqo/lou Arist.EN1180b21: pl., badiste/a Ar.Ach.394.

bad-isthla/ths [la^], o(,
driver of riding-donkeys, PTeb.262 (ii B. C.), POxy.1514.2 (iii A. D.), etc.

bad-isth/s, ou=, o(,
goer, taxu\s b. a quick
runner, E.Med.1182; i(/ppos b. Hsch. s.v. ka/lpis: o)/nos b.
riding-donkey, PGrenf.2.14b5 (iii B. C.); b. alone, = o)/nos, PFlor.376.23 (iii A. D.).

bad-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
good at walking, Ar.Ra.128, Thphr.Fr.180;
able to walk, Simp.in Ph.887.17; to\ b.
that which is capable of walking, Arist.Int.21b16; pou\s . . o)/rganon b. Gal.UP2.9. Adv.-kw=s Porph.Gaur.1.3.
for riding animals, sta/blon POxy.146.1 (vi A. D.).

bad-isto/s, h/, o/n,
that can be passed on foot, Arr.Ind.43.10:—but ba/distoi: badu/tatoi, Hsch. (i.e. h(d-).
ba/domai: a)gapw=, Hsch. (For h(/domai.）

ba/dos, o(,
walk, ba/don badi/zein, coined by Ar.Av.42. v. ba/tos.
*badro/mios, *badromiw/n, v. *bohdro/mios, *bohdromiw/n.
ba_du/s (i.e. vadu/s), Elean for h(du/s, Pherecyd.Fr.79J., Paus.5.3.2, cf. ba/dhdoi: h)xei=oi (leg. badu/: h(du/: *)hlei=oi), Hsch.

ba/zw, poet. Verb, used chiefly in pres. and impf.: aor. e)/baca Hsch.: pf. Pass. (v. infr.):—
speak, say, a)/rtia ba/zein Il.14.92, al.; a)nemw/lia b. Od.4.837; pepnume/na ba/zeis Il.9.58; oi(/t' eu)= me\n ba/zousi kakw=s d' o)/piqen frone/ousin Od.18.168; nh/pia b. Pi.Fr.157; e)blhxhme/na b. AP7.636 (Crin.): c. dupl. acc., tau=ta/ m' a)geiro/menoi qa/m' e)ba/zete Il.16.207, cf. E.Hipp.119; polla\ kakw=s b. e(sti/an *)atreida=n Id.Rh.719 (lyr.); kaqeu/dousin ma/thn a)/kranta b. A.Ch.882: c. dat. modi, xalepoi=s ba/zontes e)/pessi
address with sharp words, Hes.Op.186; kakoi=si b. polla\ *tude/ws bi/an A.Th.571; u(pe/rauxa b. e)pi\ pto/lei ib. 483; ei)/ ti mh\ yeu=dos h( paroimi/h ba/zei Herod.2.102; *dionu/sw| o)/rgia ba/zwn IG14.1642:—Pass., e)/pos . . be/baktai a word
has been spoken, Od.8.408. (Cf. ba/cis, ba/skein (for ba/k-skein）, a)bakh/s.）
baqaki/zwn: kakw=s e(/rpwn, Hsch. baqa/lh: krh/nh, Amerias ap. eund. baqani/an: neossia/n (Cret.), Hsch. baqa/ra: puklih/ (Maced.), purlo/s (Athaman.), Id.
baqi/wn, ba/qistos, Comp. and Sup. of baqu/s.

baqm-hdo/n, Adv., (baqmo/s)
by steps, Gal.18(1).793, Ath.1.1c.

baqm-i/s, h(, gen. i/dos Pi.N.5.1, i=dos AP7.428.4 (Mel.):—
step or
threshold, a)kra=n baqmi/dwn a)/po Pi.P.5.7, cf. J.AJ15.11.5; cf. basmi/s.
base, pedestal, Pi.N.5.1.
socket, Hp.Fract.2: generally,
hollow in a joint, ib.37.

baqm-oeidh/s, e/s,
like steps, Democr.155, Zos.Alch. p.176B.

baqm-o/s or basmo/s, o(, (bai/nw)
step, threshold, LXX IKi.5.5,
[S.]Fr.1127;
degree on the dial, LXX 4 Ki.20.9 sq.;
fifteen degrees of the zodiac, Vett.Val.31.2;
interval in a musical scale, Iamb.VP26.120.
rung of a ladder, Luc.Trag.221.
base or
plinth of a tower, GDI5524.10 (Cyzicus). metaph.,
step, degree in rank (oi( b. kli/makos prokoph\n shmai/nousi Artem.2.42), 1 Ep.Ti.3.13, Procop.Arc.24, Lyd.Mag.2.8, al.; oi( ta=s a)ci/as ba/smoi IG12(2).243.16 (Mytil.); simply,
degree, tolmhma/twn baqmoi/ J.BJ4.3.10; w(/sper h(donh=s kli/maka sumphca/menos e)/rws prw=ton e)/xei b. o)/yews Luc.Am.53;
step in an argument, Simp.in Cael.718.35; of a genealogy, a)pwte/rw duoi=n b. two
steps farther back, i.e. farther back than one's grandfather, D.Chr.41.6.
tax paid on stairs, POxy.574 (ii A. D.): acc. to Phryn.296, Moer.97, baqmo/s is Ion., basmo/s Att., but basmo/s occurs GDI5524.10 (Cyzic.), Jahresh.3.55 (Scepsis).
baqm-w/dhs, expl. of balbidw/dhs, Bacch. ap. Erot.Fr.42.
ba_qo/hmi, Aeol., = bohqe/w, impf. e)baqo/h IG12(2).645.21 (Nesus); dat. part. baqo/enti ib.526.27 (Eresus).

ba/qos [a^], eos, to/, （baqu/s)
depth or
height, acc. as measured up or down, *tarta/rou ba/qh A.Pr.1029; ai)qe/ros ba/qos E.Med.1297, cf. Ar. Av.1715; ba/qous mete/xein to be a solid, possessing
depth as well as length and breadth, Pl.R.528b; ei)/t' e)n ba/qesin ei)/t' e)n ta/xesin Id.Plt. 299e; ba/qous au)/ch Id.R.528d; opp. mh=kos, pla/tos, Arist.Ph.209a5; mege/qous to\ e)pi\ tri/a [sunexe\s] b. Id.Metaph.1020a12: with Preps., e)k ba/qeos
in depth, Hdt.1.186; e)k ba/qous
through and through, Plot. 5.8.10; ei)s ba/qos Arist.Mete.386a23, al.; e)n ba/qei Id.Sens.440a14, etc.; kata\ ba/qous Id.Mete.339b12; kata\ ba/qos
in a descending scale, metaph. of causation, Dam.Pr.95: freq. in military sense,
depth of a line of battle, X.HG3.4.13, etc.; e)pi\ ba/qos ta/ssesqai
in depth of line, Th.5.68; e)s b. e)kta/cai Arr.An.1.2.4; b. trixw=n, of
long thick hair, Hdt.5.9; a)/toma pw/gwnos ba/qh Ephipp.14.7;
interior of a country, Str.3.3.7, al.;
depth, of perspective in a picture, Procop.Gaz.Ecphr. p.157 B.: pl., ba/qh
depths, Pl.Ti.44d, etc.;
deep water, opp. shallows near shore, LXXPs.68(69).2, al., Ev.Luc.5.4; e)n toi=s ba/qesin Arist. HA599b9. Astron., = tapei/nwma, Vett.Val.241.26. metaph., kakw=n o(rw=n b. A.Pers.465; h)\ makrou= plou/tou ba/qei S.Aj.130, cf. Ep.Rom.11.33; b. h(gemoni/as Plu.Pomp.53;
depth of mind, b. ti e)/xein gennai=on, of Parmenides, Pl.Tht.184a; e)n ba/qei po/sios
deep in drink, Theoc.14.29; b. kardi/as a)nqrw/pou LXXJu.8.14; ta\ b. tou= qeou=, tou= *satana=, 1 Ep.Cor.2.10, Apoc.2.24. of lit. style,
bathos, u(/yous h)\ b. Longin.2.1. (Substituted for be/nqos under the influence of baqu/s.）
ba/qra, h(, = baqmo/s, Ar.Fr.513, cf. Poll.10.47, Sammelb.402 (iii A. D.), Lyd.Mag.1.3; = ba/sis, Et.Gud.: = a)poba/qra, dub. in Plu.2.347b.
baqra/dion, to/, Dim. of ba/qron, Ar.Fr.514 codd. Poll.（10.47): leg. baqri/dion.
baqrei/a, h(, = ba/qron, A.Supp.860 (dub.l.).
baqri/dion, v. baqra/dion.

baqri/on, to/, Dim. of ba/qron, Suid. s.v. klini/s:—also baqrei=on, to/, Cumont
Études Syriennes 336 (Cyrrhus, pl.).

ba/qron, to/, (bai/nw)
that on which anything steps or
stands, hence,
base, pedestal, to\ b. kai\ o( qro/nos Hdt.1.183; of a statue, Id.5.85, X.Eq.1.1; daimo/nwn i(dru/mata . . e)cane/streptai ba/qrwn A. Pers.812;
throne, u(yhlo\n *di/kas b. S.Ant.854.
stage, scaffold, Hdt.7.23. generally,
solid base, a)mfiru/tou *salami=nos b. S.Aj. 135 (anap.), cf. Ph.1000, OC1662; w)= patrw=|on e(sti/as b., i.e.
house of my father, Id.Aj.860: metaph., *eu)nomi/a ba/qron poli/wn Pi.O.13.6: pl.,
foundations, *)ili/ou . . e)canasth/sas ba/qra E.Supp.1198; e)n ba/qrois ei)=nai stand
firm, Id.Tr.47; e)k ba/qrwn a)nh|rh=sqai
utterly, Id.El.608, cf. D.H.8.1, Lyc.770, AP9.97 (Alph.).
step, S.OC 1591;
rung of a ladder, E.Ph.1179.
bench, seat, S.OT142, OC 101, Phryn.Com.3.5; ta\ b., of a lecture-room or school, Pl.Prt.315c, 325e, etc.; ta\ ba/qra spoggi/zwn D.18.258;
seats in the council-chamber, Lys.13.37. b. *(ippokra/tous
machine for reducing dislocation, Ruf. ap. Orib.49.26. metaph., po/nous a)fi=gmai ka)pi\ kindu/nou ba/qra
the verge of danger, E.Cyc.352.

ba/qrwsis, ews, h(,
stand in the Delphic stadium, BCH23.567.

ba^qu^-agkh/s, e/s,
with deep dells, *)/alpeis AP9.283 (Crin.); ta\ b. Thphr.HP3.11.4.

ba^qu^-ai/doios, on,
mentulatus, of Priapus,EM2.24, Sch.Lyc.831.

ba^qu^/-boulos, on,
deep-counselling, fronti/s A.Pers.142 (lyr.).

ba^qu^/-geios, on, Call.Ap.65, Thphr.HP4.11.9, Str.6.3.5, D.S. 20.109: Sup., Ph.1.332, al.: Ion. ba^qu^/-gaios Hdt.4.23; Att. ba^qu^-ge/ws, wn, Thphr.CP2.4.10:—
with deep soil, productive, ll.cc.

ba^qu^-ge/neios, on,
with deep, full beard, Poll.2.88, Jul.Mis.349c.

ba^qu^/-glwssos, on,
of unintelligible speech, lao/s LXXEs.3.5: but expld. by e)llo/gimos, Hsch., Suid.

ba^qu^-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos,
of profound wisdom, *)alhqi/h Babr.126.5, cf. Eun.VSp.481 B., Hist.p.254 D.

ba^qu^-dei/elos, on,
steeped in sunshine, po/lis B.1.29; cf. eu)dei/elos.

ba^qu^/-dendros, on,
deep-wooded, Lyr.Adesp.96; *(elikw/n Pae.Delph.I.

ba^qu^-di/nhs [i_], on, o(,
deep-eddying, potamo/s Il.20.73, etc.; w)keano/s Hes.Op.171:—also ba^qu^-di_nh/eis, essa, en, Il.21.15:
ba^qu^-di/nhs, es, Dem.Bith.4.4:
ba^qu^-di_nh/ths, Doroth.11.

ba^qu^/-docos, on,
far-famed, illustrious, Pi.P.1.66, Pae. 2.58.

ba^qu^-erge/w,
plough deep, Gp.2.23.14（Pass.).

ba^qu^/-zwnos, on,
deep-girded (cf. baqu/kolpos）, baquzw/nous te gunai=kas Il.9.594, Od.3.154; barba/rwn gunaikw=n to\ e)pi/qeton Sch.Od.l.c.; baquzw/nwn . . *persi/dwn A.Pers.155 (lyr.); but epith. of Leto, B.10.16, Pi.Fr.89; *xa/rites Id.P.9.2, B.5.9; [*mou=sai] Pi.I.6(5).74; nu/mfa baqu/zwne S.Ichn.237 (lyr.).—Not in E.

ba^/qu^-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
with thick, long mane, Opp.C.1.314; of sheep,
with thick or
long wool, h.Ap.412.

ba^qu^-kamph/s, e/s,
strongly curved, AP6.306 (Ariston).

ba^qu^-ka/rdios, on,
of profound mind, Procl.Par.Ptol.222.

ba^qu^/-karpos, on,
rich in fruits, ei)rh/nh IG3.170.

entryFree.sense: deep yawning sea, Thgn.175; cf. megakh/ths.

div0.entryFree: ba^qu^-kleh/s, e/s, = baqu/docos, AP9.575 (Phil.).

ba^qu^/-klhros, on,
with rich lands, of persons, Hom.Epigr.16.
very rich, of land, Coluth.218, Man.3.239.

ba^qu^-knh/mi_s, i_dos,
wearing high greaves, Q.S.1.55.

ba^qu^/-knhmos, on,
with high mountain-spurs, *plataiai/ Nonn.D.4.336.

ba^qu^/-kolpos, on,
with dress falling in deep folds (cf. baqu/zwnos), epith. of Trojan women, Il.18.122,339,24.215; of Nymphs, h.Cer.5, Ven.257; Muses, Pi.P.1.12; parqe/nos (of Aegina) Id.Pae.6.135: hence,
with deep, full breasts, e)k b. sthqe/wn A.Th.864(lyr.): metaph. of the earth,
deep-bosomed, Pi.P.9.101. simply,
very deep, xeih/ Nonn.D.12.327;
with deep foundations, ib.40.534;
set deep, o)xh=a ib.21.94. = a)rxai/a, palaia/, koi/lh, Hsch.

ba^qu^-ko/mhs, ou,
with thick hair, Poll.2.24.

ba^qu^/-komos, on,
with thick leaves, o)/rea b.
covered with thick forests, Ar.Fr.698 (lyr.).

ba^qu^/-krhmnos, on,
with high cliffs, a(/ls Pi.I.4(3).56; b.a)ktai/
deep and rugged banks, Id.N.9.40; *suh/nh D.P.244, cf. 618.

ba^qu^-krh/pi_s, i+dos, o(, h(,
with deep foundations, *)/abudos Musae.229.

ba^qu^-kte/a^nos, on,
with great possessions, wealthy, *mh=doi Eleg.Alex.Adesp.2.13; tu/xh AP10.74 (Paul. Sil.); r(e/eqron Nonn.D.12.126.

ba^qu^-ku/mwn [u_], on, gen. onos,
deep in waves, o)/xqai Musae.189; fwnh/, of Oceanus, Nonn. D.23.320, cf. Antioch.Astr.in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.110.
ba^qu^/-leimos, on, = sq., Il.9.151,293.

ba^qu^-lei/mwn, on, gen. onos,
surrounded by rich meadows, pe/tra b., i.e. Cirrha, where the land was forbidden to be ploughed, Pi.P.10.15.

ba^qu^-lh/i+os, on,
with deep crop, very fruitful, te/menos, v.l. for basilh/ion in Il.18.550, cf. A.R.1.830, AP9.110 (Alph.).

ba^qu^/-mallos, on,
thick-fleeced, Pi.P.4.161, App.Mith. 103.

ba^qu^/-mhta^, o(, Aeol. for baqumh/ths,
deep-counselling, Pi.N. 3.53.

ba^qu^/-noos, on, contr. ba^qu^/-nous, oun,
of deep mind, *ne/stwr [Arist.] Pepl.9.

ba^qu/nw:—Pass., plpf. beba/qusto Nonn.D.39.305: (baqu/s):—
deepen, hollow out, ba/qune de\ xw=ron a(/panta, of a torrent, Il.23.421; e)/skaye kai\ e)ba/qune dug and
dug deep, Ev.Luc.6.48; e)ba/qune pe/don tarsw=|, of a dog, Nonn.D.47.239: metaph., o( limo\s baqu/nei e(auto/n J. BJ5.12.3: esp. as military term,
deepen, th\n fa/lagga X.Cyr.6.3.23, 8.5.15, cf. Arr.Tact.25.11:—Pass.,
become deep, be deepened, li/mnh b. Thphr.HP4.11.3; krhmno\s baqu/netai ei)s a)porrw=ga J.BJ1.21.3; na/sws baqunome/nas a)po\ r(iza=n, of Delos, Hymn.Is.160; to\ baquno/menon th=s r(hgmi=nos Agath.2.2; of a deep wound, Nonn.D.39.305; baqunome/nais xersi/
in or
with the hollowed hands, ib.11.180. Math.,
add a third dimension, b. ta\ e)pi/peda Procl.
in R.2.52 K., cf. in Ti.1.146 D.:—Pass., kuklikw=s baqunqe/ntes Simp. in Ph.59.17. intr.,
sink deep, Ph.1.248, 2.402;
sink, crumble, Apollod.Poliorc.157.8. metaph.,
go deeply into a subject, baqu/nas qewrh=sai Procl.in Prm.p.622 S.

ba^qu/-cu^los, on,
with deep wood, u(/lhs e)n baqucu/lw| fo/bh| E.Ba.1138; b. drumoi/ Arist.Mu.392b18.
built high with wood, [pura/] B.12.169.
deeply carued, glufai/, of coffered ceilings, J.AJ15.11.5.

ba^qu-oru^gh/, h(,
deep excavation, PHal.1.81 (iii B. C.).

ba^qu/-pedos, on,
with deep plain, lying low (between hills), of Nemea, Pi.N.3.18 (prob. for -pedi/w|).

ba^qu/-pelmos, on, (pe/lma)
thick-soled, eu)/maris AP 7.413 (Antip.).

ba^qu/-peplos, on,
with long robe, Q.S.13.552.

ba^qu/-pikros, on,
intensely bitter, a)yi/nqion Ps.-Dsc.3.23.

ba^qu-plekh/s, e/s,
close-knit, Opp.H.4.638.

ba^qu/-pleuros, on,
deep-flanked, Gp.17.2.1.

ba^qu-plh/c, h=gos, o(, h(,
deep-striking, skorpi/os Nic.Fr.31.

ba^qu-plo/ka^mos, on,
with thick hair, B.10.8 (prob.), A.R.1.742, Mosch.2.101, Orph. Fr.114.

ba^qu/-plokos, on, (ple/kw)
deeply involved, in Comp. -w/tera pro\s a)pisti/an Eun.Hist.p.259 D.

ba^qu/-ploos, on,
going deep in the water, nau=s prob. in D.S.3.40.
ba^qu-plou/sios, on, = sq., Poll.3.109.

ba^qu/-ploutos, on,
exceeding rich, zwa/ B.3.82; xqw/n A.Supp.554 (lyr.); *ei)rh/na E.Fr.453, copied by Ar.Fr.109; of persons, Ph.1.635, Alciphr.3.10; b. kataskeuai\ oi)kiw=n D.H.20.4.

ba^qu-po/lemos, on,
plunged deep in war, Pi.P.2.1.

ba^qu-po/nhros, on,
deeply depraved, Ptol.Tetr.159, Vett.Val.104.4.

ba^qu/-poros, on,
causing heavy going, pedi/on, cj. for baqu/teron in Plu.Eum.16.

ba^qu/-pteros, on,
deep-winged, Epic. in Arch.Pap.7p.4.

ba^qu-pu/qmhn, o(, h(, gen. enos,
with deep foundations, AB1339, EM696.35.

ba^qu-pw/gwn, on, gen. wnos,
with thick beard, D.S.34.1, Plu.2.710b, Luc.JTr.26.
ba^qu-rrei/ths, ou, o(, （r(e/w）, = baqu/rroos, Ep. gen. baqurrei/tao Il.21.195, Hes.Th. 265.
ba^qu-rrei/wn, on, gen. ontos, = baqu/rroos, A.R.2.659,795.
ba^qu/-rrh: galh=, i)kti=nos (Lydian), Hsch.

ba^qu/-rrhnos, on, (r(h/n)
with thick wool, ta/phs AP6.250 (Antiphil.).

ba^qu-rri_zi/a, h(,
depth of root, Thphr.HP1.7.1.

ba^qu/-rri_zos, on,
deep-rooted, dru=s S.Tr.1195, cf. A.R.1.1199, Q.S. 4.202; pe/tra, i.e.
lofty, Trag.Adesp.203: Comp.-rizo/teros Thphr. HP1.7.2.

ba^qu/-rroos, on, contr. ba^qu/-rous, oun,
deep-flowing, *)wkeano/s Il. 7.422, cf. Hes.Cat.Oxy.1358.2.23, etc.; b. potamo\n *eu)/hnon S.Tr.559. [ba^qu^rous Poet.
deherb.118.]

ba^qu/-rrwxmos, on, (r(wxmh/)
with deep clefts, Q.S.1.687.

ba^qu/s, baqei=a Ion. baqe/a^, baqu/; fem. baqu/s Call.Del.37, Eratosth. 8; gen. baqe/os, baqei/as Ion. baqe/hs: dat. baqe/i+, baqei/h| Ion. baqe/h|: Comp. baqu/teros, poet. baqi/wn [i_ Att., i^ Theoc.5.43], Dor. ba/sswn (q. v.): Sup. baqu/tatos, poet. ba/qistos:—
deep or
high, acc. to one's position, Hom., etc.; baqe/hs e)ca/lletai au)lh=s a court
within a high fence, Il.5.142, cf. Od.9.239; h)i+o/nos propa/roiqe baqei/hs
the deep, i.e.
wide, shore, Il.2.92; ta/fros 7.341, al.; krath/r S.Fr.563; ku/likes Id.
Aj.1200 (lyr.); baqu\ ptw=ma a fall
from a high rock, A.Supp.796; pleura\ baquta/th (vulg. baruta/th), of an athlete, Ar.V.1193; of a line of battle, baqu/terai fa/lagges X.Lac.11.6, cf. HG2.4.34; b. tomh/, plhgh/, a
deep cut, Plu.2.131a, Luc.Nigr.35.
deep or
thick in substance, of a mist, h)e/ra baqei=an Il.21.7, cf. Od.9.144; of sand, a)ma/qoio baqei/hs Il.5.587; e)pi\ qi=na baqu/n Theoc.22.32; of ploughed land, neioi=o baqei/hs Il.10.353; b. gh=, opp. to stony ground, E.Andr.637, Thphr.CP1.18.1; of luxuriant growth,
deep, thick, of woods, etc., baqei/hs ta/rfesin u(/lhs Il.5.555; baqei/hs e)k culo/xoio 11.415; baqu\ lh/i+on 2.147, Thgn.107; tou= lhi/+ou to\ . . baqu/taton Hdt.5.92.z/; leimw/n A.Pr.652; si=tos X.HG3.2.17; xlo/a E.Hipp.1139 (lyr.); xai/th, tri/xes, pw/gwn, Semon.7.66, X.Cyn.4.8, Luc.Pisc.41.
deep, of colour, PHolm.21.9: Comp., Ael.VH6.6, Lyd.Mag.2.13, porfu/rion -u/teron PLond.3.899.4 (ii A. D.). of quality,
strong, violent, baqei/h| lai/lapi Il.11.306. generally,
copious, abundant, b. kla=ros Pi.O.13.62; b. a)nh/r
a rich man, X.Oec.11.10; b. oi)=kos Call. Cer.113; b. plou=tos Ael.VH3.18, Jul.Or.2.82b; b. xre/os
deep debt, Pi.O.10(11).8; stefa/nwn b. te/ryis S.Aj.1200 (lyr.); b. kle/os Pi.O. 7.53; ki/ndunos Id.P.4.207; b. u(/pnos
deep sleep, Theoc.8.65, AP7.170, cf. Luc.DMar.2.3; ei)rh/nh Id.Tox.36; siwph/ App.Mith.99, BC4.109 (Sup.). of the mind, a)/xos o)cu\ kata\ fre/na tu/ye b. in the
depths of his soul, Il.19.125; but also,
profound, frh/n Pi.N.4.8; fronti/s A. Supp.407; me/rimna Pi.O.2.60; baqei=an a)/loka dia\ freno\s karpou/menos A.Th.593; mousikh\ pra=gm' e)sti\ b. Eup.336; baqu/tera h)/qh
more sedate natures, Pl.Lg.930a (but,
more recondite, i.e.
civilized, manners, Hdt.4.95): of persons,
deep, wise, b. th=| fu/sei strathgo/s Posidipp. 27.4; tai=s yuxai=s Plb.6.24.9; also,
deep, crafty, Men.1001; h)=qos Ph. 2.468. of time, b. o)/rqros
dim twilight, Ar.V.216, Pl.Cri. 43a, etc.; b. nu/c
a late hour in the night, Luc.Asin.34; peri\ e(spe/ran b. Plu.2.179e, cf. Paus.4.18.3; baqu\ th=s h(liki/as Ar.Nu.514; b. gh=ras cj. in AP7.163 (Leon.), cf. Eun.VSp.457 B., al.; b. w(/ra e)/tous Charito 1.7. Adv. -e/ws Theoc.8.66;
profoundly, Procl.in Prm.p.475 S.: Sup. baqu/tata, ghrw=n Ael.VH2.36. (bṇqu/s, cf. be/nqos.）

ba^qu/sarkos [u^], on,
fleshy: ta\ b. Hippiatr.71,72.

baqu/sikos, o(, kind of
cheese, Gal.6.697 (Lat.
vatusicus).

ba^qu/-skarqmos, on, (skai/rw)
high-leaping, Nonn.D.10.238.

ba^qu-ska^fh/s, e/s,
deep-dug, S.El.435.

ba^qu/-ski^os, on,
deep-shaded, dark, pe/trhs keuqmw=na h.Merc.229, cf. Theoc.4.19; u(=lai Babr.92.2; oi)ki/ai Ath. Med. ap. Orib.inc.23.18. Act.,
throwing a deep shade, a)sth/r Musae.111.

ba^qu-sko/pelos, on,
with high cliffs, Orph.A.638, Q.S. 1.316.

ba^qu/-skotos, on,
murky, qu/ella Tz.H.10.294.

ba/qusma [a^], atos, to/,
deep place, li/mnhs Thphr.HP4.11.8.

ba^qu-smh=rigc, iggos, o(, h(,
thick-haired, Nonn.D.1.528.
ba^qu-sofo/s, gloss on glafuro/s, EM233.44.

ba^qu-sph=lugc, uggos, o(, h(,
with deep caves, Nonn.D.40.260.

ba^qu/-sporos, on,
deep-sown, fruitful, E.Ph. 648 (lyr.). -spo/ros, = baqei=an spei/rwn gh=n, Hsch.

ba^qu/-sternos, on,
deep-chested, le/wn Pi.I.3.12; b. ai)=a
deep-bosomed earth, Cypr. Fr.1; xqw/n Pi.N.9.25; po/ntos Orph.H.17.3.

ba^qu-stole/w,
wear long flowing robes, Str.11.14.12.

ba^qu/-stolmos, on,
with deep, full robe, prob. cj. in AP7.413 (Antip.).

ba^qu/-stomos, on,
deep-mouthed, deep, sph/laia Str.16.2.20.
cutting deep, bouplh/c Q.S.1.337.

ba^qu/-strwtos, on,
deep-strewn, well-covered, le/ktra Musae.266; koi/th Babr.32.7.

ba^qu/-sxi_nos, on,
deep-grown with sxi=nos, AP9.744 (Leon.).

ba^qu/-sxoinos, on,
deep-grown with rushes, *)aswpo/s Il.4.383; xlo/h Babr.46.2.

ba^qu-te/rmwn, on, gen. onos,
deep, large, nau=s Opp.C.2.87.

ba^qu/ths, htos, h(, = ba/qos,
depth, Luc.Icar.5: metaph. of character, Phld.Ir.p.60 W.; of mental
profundity, Cic.Att.4.6.3,al.
ba^qu/-ti_mos [u^], v. baru/timos.

ba^qu-tome/w,
cut deeply, to\n masto/n Leonid. ap. Aët.16.44.

ba^qu/-u+dros, on,
with deep water, Sch.Il.16.3.

ba^qu/-u+pnos, on,
in deep sleep, Nic.Th.394.

ba^qu-frosu/nh, h(,
profundity of mind, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.161.5.
ba^qu/-frwn, on, gen. onos, = baqu/boulos, Sol.33.1; *moi=rai Pi.N.7.1.

ba^qu/-fullos, on,
thick-leafed, leafy, Mosch.Fr.1.11.

ba^qu/-fwnos, on,
of deep, i.e.
hollow, voice, LXX Is.33.19.

ba^qu-xa/i+os or ba^qu-xai=os, on,
of old nobility, A.Supp.858 (lyr.); cf. xa/i+os.
ba^qu-xaith/eis, essa, en, = sq., A.Eleg.4.

ba^qu-xai/ths, ou, o(,
with thick long hair, Hes.Th.977, Ph.2.479; *)/adwnis Orph.H. 56.7.
ba^qu-xeu/mwn, on, gen. onos, （xeu=ma） = baquku/mwn, Procl.H.3.6.
ba^qu/-xqwn, on, gen. onos, = baqu/geios, ai)=a A.Th.306 (lyr.).
ba^qu-xrh/mwn, on, gen. onos, = baqu/ploutos, Man.4.66.

ba^qu/-xroos, on, contr. ba^qu/-xrous, oun,
deep-coloured, Dsc.5.94.

bai/+a, h(,
nurse, Str.Chr.5.39.
bai=buc, ukos, o(, = peleka/n, Hdn.Gr.2.741, Philet. ap. Hsch.

bai/deion: e(/toimon (Elean), Hsch. baidumh=n: a)rotria=n (Boeot.), Id.:—also baitreu/ein, Id. bai/essa: bo/trus, Id. bai=kan: krh=tes, Id. bai/kulos: probatw/dhs, Id. baima/zein: basileu/ein, h)\ basta/zein, Id.

bai+no/s, o/n, (ba/i+s)
of palm-leaves, Sm.Ge.40.16: bai+nh/, h(,
palmrod, LXX 1 Ma.13.37.

bai/nw (inf. bai/menai Hsch.), fut. bh/somai Il.2.339, etc., Dor. ba_seu=mai Theoc.2.8, etc.: pf. be/bhka Il.15.90, etc., Dor. be/ba_ka Pi.I.4(3).41, etc., with shortd. forms beba/a_si Il.2.134, contr. beba=si A.Pers. 1002 (lyr.), Eu.76, etc.; subj. bebw=si （e)m-) Pl.Phdr.252e; inf. beba/men Il.17.359, beba/nai E.Heracl.610 (lyr.); part. bebaw/s, -aui=a Il.14.477, Hom.Epigr.15.10, contr. bebw/s: plpf. e)bebh/kein Il.11.296, etc., Ep. bebh/kein 6.495; sync. 3pl. be/ba^san 17.286, etc.: aor. 2 e)/bhn Il. 17.112, etc., Dor. e)/ba_n Pi.O.13.97, etc.; Ep. 3sg. bh= Il.13.297, Ep. 3dual ba/thn [a^] 1.327, 3pl. e)/ban A.Pers.18 (lyr.), (kat-) S.Tr.504 (lyr.), Ep. ba/n Il.20.32; imper. bh=qi, Dor. ba=qi S.Ph.1196 (lyr.); ba_ in compds. e)/mba, kata/ba, etc., 2pl. ba=te A.Supp.191, Eu.1033 (lyr.); subj. bw=, Ep. 3sg. bh/h| （u(per-) Il.9.501, bh/w 6.113, e)m-be/h| GDI5075.4 (Cret.), Dor. ba=mes (for bw=men) Theoc.15.22; opt. bai/hn; inf. bh=nai (Att. Prose only in compds.), Ep. bh/menai Od.19.296, Dor. ba=men Pi.P.4.39; part. ba/s ba=sa ba/n, Dor. pl. e)k-bw=ntas Th.5.77:— Med., Ep.aor.1 e)bh/seto （a)p-) Il.1.428:—Pass., pres. (v. infr.A.11.1): in compds., aor. a)n-, par-, cun-eba/qhn, X.Eq.3.4, Th.3.67, 4.30; later par-eba/nqhn D.C.48.2,al.; a)na-, para-, cum-be/ba^mai, X.Eq.Mag.1.4, Th.1.123, 8.98; para-be/basmai D.17.12: fut. para-baqh/somai Sch.E. Hec.802.—For the Act. fut. and aor. 1, v. infr. B; for pres. part. biba/s, v. bi/bhmi.—In correct Att. Prose the pres. bai/nw is almost the only tense in use; but in compds. Prose writers used all tenses freely. in the above tenses, intr.,
walk, step, prop. of motion
on foot, posi\ bh/seto Il.5.745, etc.; but also of all motion
on ground, the direction being commonly determined by a Prep.:—the kind of motion is often marked by a part., bh= feu/gwn, bh= a)i/+casa, Il.2.665, 4.74: c. part. fut., denoting purpose, bh= r(' *)=ison . . e)cenari/cwn
he went to slay, Il.11.101: with neut. Adj. as Adv., sau=la posi\n b. h.Merc.28; a(bro\n b. palleu/kw| podi/ E.Med.1164, cf. 830 (lyr.); i)/sa or o(moi/ws b. tini/, D.19.314, X.Eq.1.3; e)n poiki/lois b. A.Ag.936, cf. 924;
march or
dance, meta\ r(uqmou=, e)n r(uqmw=|, Th.5.70, Pl.Lg.670b: freq. c. inf. in Hom., bh= d' i)e/nai
set out to go,
went his way, Il.4.199, etc.; bh= d' i)/men 5.167, etc.; bh= de\ qe/ein
started to run, 2.183, etc.; bh= d' e)la/an 13.27: c. acc. loci, ne/as Od.3.162, cf. S.OT153 (lyr.), OC378; e)pi\ nho\s e)/bainen
was going on board ship, Od.11.534; but e)n de\ e(ka/sth| [nhi\+] . . e(kato\n kai\ ei)/kosi bai=non
were on board, Il.2.510; e)f' i(/ppwn ba/ntes
having mounted the chariot, 18.532; e)pi\ pw/lou bebw=sa
mounted on . . , S.OC313; e)s di/fron Il.5.364; e)s a(/rmata E.El.320; bai/nein di' ai(/matos
wade in blood, Id.Ph. 20. in pf.,
stand or
be in a place, xw=ros e)n w(=| bebh/kamen S.OC52; bebhkw\s sfo/dra firmly
poised (opp. krema/menos) Pl.Ti.62c; b. ma/xh
steady fight, Plu.Phil.9: freq. almost, = ei)mi/ (
sum), eu)= bebhkw/s
on a good
footing, well
established, prosperous, [qeoi\] eu)= bebhko/tas u(pti/ous kli/nous' Archil.56.3; turanni/da eu)= bebhkui=an Hdt.7.164, cf. S.El.979; eu)= bi/ou bebhko/ta prob. for e)n bi/w| bebiwko/ta Nicom. Com.2; a)sfale/ws bebhkw\s possi/ Archil.58.4; e)pisfalw=s beb. LXX Wi.4.4; a)/galma bebhko\s a)/nw ta\ ka/tw de\ kexhno/s Eub.107.23; oi( e)n te/lei e)o/ntes, bebw=tes, they who
arein office, Hdt.9.106, S.Ant.67; tou=ton ou)x o(rh=|s o(/kws be/bh-[ken] a)ndria/nta; Herod.4.36; [li/qous] e)n tai=s i)di/ais xw/rais bebhko/tas IG7.3073.163 (Lebad.); e)n kakoi=s beb. S.El.1057; moi/ra| ou)k e)n e)sqla=| b. ib.1095 (lyr.); bou=s, klei\s e)pi\ glw/ssh| be/bhken, v. bou=s IV, klei/s 4; fro/nei bebw\s e)pi\ curou= tu/xhs S.Ant.996. Geom. of figures,
stand on a base, e)pi/ tinos Arist.IA709a24, cf. Apollon.Perg.Con.3.3; purami\s e)pi\ tetragw/nou bebhkui=a Hero
*Stereom.1.31; of an angle,
stand on an arc, e)pi/ tinos, pro/s tini, Euc.3Def.9, cf. 16.26. bebhkw\s r(uqmo/s
stately rhythm, Syrian.in Hermog.1p.69R.; a)na/pausis ib.p.18 R.
go away, depart, e)n nhusi\ fi/lhn e)s patri/d' Il.12.16; e)/ban a)/gontes, e)/ban fe/rousai,
have gone and taken away, 1.391, 2.302; a)/far be/baken S.Tr. 134; qana/simos be/bhken Id.OT959, cf. 832; beba=si frou=doi E.IT1289; be/bhka euphem. for te/qnhka, A.Pers.1002 (lyr.); of things, e)nne/a e)niautoi\ beba/asi nine years
have come and gone, Il.2.134; ph=| o(/rkia bh/setai; ib.339, cf. 8.229.
come, ti/pte be/bhkas; 15.90;
arrive, S.OT81, Aj.921.
go on, advance, e)s to/de to/lmhs, e)s tosou=ton e)lpi/dwn, Id.OT125,772; e)p' e)/sxata Id.OC217 (lyr.). c. part. as periphr. for fut., bai/nw katagge/llwn PMag.Par.1.2474. c. acc.,
mount, Hom. only in aor. Med. bh/sasqai di/fron Il.3.262, Od.3.481: in Act. (fut. part. Med. bhso/menos Them.Or.21.248b), of the male,
mount, cover, Pl.Phdr.250e, Achae.28, Arist.HA575a13, etc.:—in Pass., i(/ppoi baino/menai
brood mares, Hdt.1.192. c. acc. cogn., b. *dwri/an ke/leuqon u(/mnwn Pi.Fr.191; *kallabi/das Eup.163; e)/ba r(o/on
went down stream, i.e.
died, Theoc.1.140. metaph. of metre,
scan, D.H.Comp.21 (Pass.), Aristid. Quint.1.23,24, etc.; bai/netai to\ e)/pos
is scanned, Arist.Metaph.1093a30. xre/os e)/ba me debts
came on me, Ar.Nu.30; o)du/na m' o)du/na bai/nei E.Hipp.1371 (lyr.). Poet. with acc. of the instrument of motion, bai/nein po/da E.El.94, 1173 (lyr.). bai/nein: filei=n, kolakeu/ein, Hsch. Causal, in fut. bh/sw, （e)pi-) Il.8.197, (ei)s-) E.IT742: aor. 1 e)/bhsa—
make to go, fw=tas bh=sen a)f' i(/ppwn
he made them
dismount, Il.16.810; a)mfote/rous e)c i(/ppwn bh=se kakw=s
he brought them
down from the chariot in sorry plight, 5.164; o)/fra ba/somen o)/kxon Pi.O. 6.24.—Rare in Trag. (exc. in compds.), E.Med.209 (lyr.).—The simple Verb is uncommon in later Gr. (For ba/m-
yw, cf. Lat.
venio, Skt.
gamyáte; ba/skw corresponds to Skt.
gácchati (
g[uglide]ṃ-sk-); root
g[uglide]em- in OHG.
quëman 'come'; e)/bhn, bh/somai fr. root
g[uglide]ā-, Skt.
jigāti, aor.
ágāt.）

ba/i+on, to/, = ba/i+s, Ev.Jo.12.13; for gen. pl. bai/+wn v. ba/i+s.
measuring-rod, b. dikai/w| e(caph/xei PFlor.37.3 (v/vi A.D.), cf. BGU 1094.12 (vi A.D.).

baio/s, a/, o/n,
little, small, baia\ poiki/llein e)n makroi=sin ktea/nwn Pi.P. 9.77; b. nh=sos A.Pers.448; me/ros b. e)/xein Id.Ag.1574 (lyr.); o)/lbos prob. in E.Fr.825; glw=tta Ar.Nu.1013; mallo\s ei)ri/wn Herod.8.12;
scanty, and of number,
few, su=ka baia/ Anan.3, cf. Hp.Lex1; baia/ g' w(s a)po\ pollw=n A.Pers.1023 (lyr.); b. ku/lic a
scanty cup, i.e. one only, S.Fr.42, Lyc.Fr.3; r(a/kh b.
a few, paltry, S.Ph.274; ei)=pe pro/s me baia/
few words, Id.Aj.292; but baia\n . . lo/gwn fa/man
low-spoken, Id.Ph.845 (lyr.); h(/sqhn de\ baia/, pa<*>nu de\ baia/, te/ttara Ar. Ach.2; e)xw/rei baio/s he was going
with scanty escort, i. e.
alone, S. OT750; of condition,
mean, humble, baioi/, opp. oi( mega/loi, Id.Aj.
160 (anap.); e)k ka/rta baiw=n gnwto\s a)\n ge/noit' a)nh/r from
a low condition, Id.Fr.282; ou)xi\ baia\ ta)nqumh/mata Id.OC1199; baia=| th=|d' u(po\ ste/gh| Id.Ph.286; of time,
short, Sol.10, S.Tr.44; baih=s a)/po from
infancy (of a girl), IG14.1892: neut. baio/n as Adv.,
a little, S.Aj. 90, Ph.20: of time, Id.OC1653, Tr.335: pl., baia/, fronh/sei tu/xh ma/xetai Democr.119; kata\ baio/n
by little and little, D.P.622: Comp. baio/teros, opp. mei/zwn, Parm.8.45, cf. Opp.C.3.86: Sup. -o/tatos AP9.438 (Phil.).—Poet., Ion., and later Prose, as Phld.Rh.1.195, 244S., Id.Ir.p.95 W.

bai+o-fore/w,
bear a palm-leaf, of a priest, PTeb.294.10 (ii A. D.):
bai+o-fori/a, h(, ib.295.11 (ii A. D.).

baio/xronos, on,
brief, [bi/os] Inscr.Prien.287 (i B.C.).

ba/i+s, h(, acc. ba/i+n Horap.1.3:—
palm-leaf (Coptic
bai), Chaerem. ap.Porph.Abst.4.7, PMag.Leid.V.7.16, PLond.1.131r384 (i A. D.), etc.; gen. pl. bai/+wn PMag.Leid.V.7.17, LXX 1 Ma.13.51.
baish/nhs: par' *)indoi=s to\ strato/pedon, Hsch. bai/shnos: o( strato/s, Id. baisso/n: ba/qos, Id. baita/s, a/dos, h(, = eu)telh\s gunh/, Id.

bai/th, h(, Dor. bai/ta Sophr.38:—
shepherd's or
peasant's coat of skins, Hdt.4.64, Theoc.3.25, IG5(2).268.48 (Mantinea, circ. i A. D.); th\n b. qa/lpousan eu)= dei= kai\ r(a/ptein 'one good turn deserves another', Herod.7.128.
tent of skins, S.Fr.1031. bai/ths, ou, o(,
warmed hall, Inscr.Magn.179.12,15, IG5(2).268.48 (Mantinea, i B. C.). (Thracian word; Goth.
paida 'garment'.)
bai/tion, to/, = di/ktamnos, Ps.-Dsc.3.32, Hsch.

baitofo/ros, on, (bai/th)
wearing a coat of skin, prob. for batt- in D.S.Fr.29.
baitreu/ein, v. baidumh=n.

bai/tu_los, o(,
meteoric stone, held sacred, because it fell from heaven, Dam.Isid.94,203; of the stone swallowed by Kronos, Hsch.

bai=tuc, ugos, h(,
leech, Hsch., AB<*>199. baitw=na: to\n eu)telh= a)/ndra, Hsch.
baiw=mfai: ai( ai)=ges, e)n i(eratikoi=s, Hsch., Suid.

baiw/n, o/nos, o(, = ble/nnos, Epich.64: prov., mh/ moi b.: kako\s i)xqu/s Ath.7.288a. at Alexandria,
a measure, Hsch.
baiw=tis, h(, title of Aphrodite at Syracuse, Hsch.

ba/kanon, to/,
cabbage, PFay.117.12 (pl.); also,
cabbage-seed, Aët. 10.2, Alex.Trall.9.1, Paul.Aeg.7.11.42.

ba/khlos [a^], o(,
eunuch in the service of Cybele, Gallus, Luc.Eun.8, Sat.12.
womanish, Antiph.113, Men.477, Telesp.24H., Zen.2.62.
baki/as: phlo/s (Tarent.), EM186.1.

*ba^ki/zw,
prophesy like Bacis, Ar.Pax1072.
*baki/nqios, v. *(uaki/nqios.

ba^ki/s, i/dos, o(, Boeotian prophet, Hdt.8.20,77, al.; acc. *ba/kin Ar. Pax1071; others are mentioned in Sch.Ar. l.c.: hence in pl., *baki/des, oi(,
soothsayers, Arist.Pr.954a36.
ba/kkar, to/, = a)/saron, Plin.HN21.29,30.

ba/kka^ris, h(, gen. idos, dat. idi Ar.Fr.319, Magnes 3, but bakka/ri_ Semon.16, Hippon.41: acc. -in Hp.Nat.Mul.6: pl., bakka/reis A.Fr. 14, Ion Trag.24:—
unguent made from a)/saron, Il.cc. (Lydian word, Sch.A.Pers.42: one kind, = mu/ron *lu/dion, Hsch.）

ba/klon, to/, = Lat.
baculum, stick, cudgel, Aesop.188, Sch.Ar.Pl. 476 (pl.): pl., ba/kula, = Lat.
fasces, Plu.Rom.26:—hence bakli/zw,
cudgel, PMasp.5.18(vi A. D.).
bakni/des: ei)=dos u(podhma/twn, Hsch. ba/koa: ba/qron, Id. bakoi/as: phlo/s, Id. bako/n: peso/n (Cret.), Id. ba/ktai: i)sxuroi/, Id.
baktarikrou=sa, barbarous word in Ar.Av.1629.
bakthr-eu/w, = baktreu/w, Suid.

bakthr-i/a, h(,
staff, cane, Ar.Ach.682, Th.8.84, Lys.24.12, X.Eq.11.4, etc.; suki/nh b., = s. e)pikouri/a (q.v.), Alciphr.1.39, Macar.7.83.
wand, as a badge of office, carried by dikastai/, D.18.210; o( labw\n th\n b. badi/zei ei)s to\ dikasth/rion to\ o(mo/xrwn th=| b. Arist.Ath.65.2. (Cf. Lat.
baculum, imbēcillus, OIr.
bacc 'crook, curved stick'.)
bakthr-i/dion, to/, Dim. of bakthri/a, Hsch. s.v. ka/lion.
bakth/r-ion, to/, Dim. of bakthri/a, Ar.Ach.448, Men.Sam. 232 bakthr-i/s, i/dos, h(, = bakthri/a, prob. in Achae.21.

*ba/ktra, ta/,
Balkh, Hdt.9.113, Arist.Mir.833b14, Str.11.8.9: the people were *ba/ktrioi, Hdt.3.102; or *baktrianoi/, Str.l.c.; cf. *baktrianh/, h(, Id.11.9.2:—the Bactrian camels were famous, Arist. HA498b8.

ba/ktr-euma, atos, to/,
a staff, baktreu/masi tuflou= podo/s
by support lent to . . , E.Ph.1539 (lyr.).

baktr-eu/w,
support as a staff, a)lao\n po/da, of Antigone, Arg.metr.S.OC
baktr-iasmo/s, o(, f.l. in Poll.4.101 for maktrismo/s.

ba/ktron, to/ (cf. bakthri/a),
stick, cudgel, A.Ag.202, Ch.362, E.Ph. 1719 (all lyr.), Theoc.25.207: metaph., toke/wn b. prob. in Epigr.Gr. 257.2 (Cyprus).

baktro-prosai/ths, ou, o(,
going about begging with a staff, epith. of a Cynic, AP11.410 (Lucill.).

baktro-fo/ras, ou, o(,
the staff-bearer, epith. of Diogenes the Cynic, Cerc.1.2.
ba/kxar, to/, = a)/saron, Ps.-Dsc.1.10; cf. ba/kkar.

ba/kxari, to/,
unguent prepared therefrom, Aret.CA2.10.

ba/kxa^ris, h(,
sowbread, Cyclamen hederaefolium, Cephisod.3, Dsc. 3.44.
*bakxa=s, o(, = *bakxeuth/s, S.Fr.674.

*bakxa/w,
to be in Bacchic frenzy, to rave, A.Th.498.

*bakxe/bakxon a)=|sai sing
the song (to Bacchus) beginning with *ba/kxe *ba/kxe! Ar.Eq.408.

*bakx-ei/a, h(,
Bacchic frenzy, revelry, *bakxei/as kalh=s A.Ch.698, cf. E.Ba.232, Arist.Pol.1342b4; h(donh=| dou\s e)/s te *b. pesw/n (prob. for -ei=on) E.Ph.21; th=s filoso/fou mani/as te kai\ *bakxei/as the madness and
frenzy of philosophy, Pl.Smp.218b: in pl.,
Bacchic orgies, E.Ba. 218,1293.
*bakx-eiako/s, h/, on, = *bakxei=os 11.3, me/tron Heph.13.1, al.

*bakx-ei=on, to/,
Bacchic revelry, Ar.Lys.I: pl., Id.Ra.357; *ba/kxia, dub. l. in E.Ba.126.
congregation of Bacchic worshippers, IG7.107 (Megara, ii A. D.),
Archivesdes Missions1876.150 (Perinthus). = telesth/rion, na/rqhc, Hsch.

*ba/kx-eios or *bakxei=os, a, on, also *ba/kxios, a, on (to suit the metre), fem. os Luc.Ocyp.171:—
of or
belonging to Bacchus and
his rites, bo/trus S.Fr.255.2; no/mos E.Hec.686 (lyr.); r(uqmo/s X.Smp.9.3, etc.: hence,
frenzied, rapt, *b. *dio/nusos h.Hom.19.46, cf. Hdt.4.79; o( *b. qeo/s S.OT1105 (lyr.); *ba/kxeie despo/t' Ar.Th.988 (lyr.), cf. IG4.558.20 (Argos), etc.; to\n *b. a)/nakta, of Aeschylus, Ar.Ra.1259. as Subst., *ba/kxios, o(, = *ba/kxos, S.Ant.154 (lyr.), E.Cyc.9:—also, = oi)=nos, Id.IT953, Cyc.519, Antiph. 237. *ba/kxia or *bakx-ei=a, ta/, v. *bakxei=on. *bakxei=os (sc. pou/s), o(,
the bacchius, a metrical foot of three syllables, _ _ ^, D.H.Comp.17 (opp. u(pob. ^ _ _); but later ^ _ _, Heph.3 (opp. palimb. _ _ ^), etc.; also b. a)po\ troxai/ou (_ ^ ^ _), a)p' i)a/mbou (^ _ _ ^), Aristid.Quint. 1.17, cf. Anon.Rhythm.Oxy.9 iii 12; = ^ ^ _ _, Bacch.Harm. 101.
*bakx-eioxo/reios (sc. pou/s), o(, the foot _ _ ^ _ ^, Diom.p.482 K.

*ba/kx-euma, atos, to/, in pl.,
Bacchic revelries, E.Ba.40,317, Plu.TG 10.
*bakx-eu/s, e/ws, o(, = *ba/kxos, A.Fr.341, S.Ant.1121, E.Ba.145, etc. (only in lyr.), Orph.H.45.2, APl.4.156, SIG1014.147 (Erythrae), 1024.27 (Myconos).

*bakx-eu/simos, on,
Bacchanalian, frenzied, E.Ba. 298.

*ba/kx-eusis, ews, h(,
Bacchic revelry, ib.357.

*bakx-euth/s, ou=, o(,
a Bacchanal, any one full of Bacchic frenzy or
of wine, Orph.H.11.21, 47.6; b. qeo/s APl.4.290 (Antip.):—fem. *bakx-eu/tria AB225, Hsch.s.v. *ba/kxou *diw/nhs. as Adj., *b. r(uqmo/s AP11.64.2 (Agath.).

*bakx-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
disposed to Bacchic revels, Arist.Pol.1342b26.
*bakx-eu/twr, oros, o(, = *bakxeuth/s, CIG38, AP9.524.

*bakx-eu/w,
celebrate the mysteries of Bacchus, Hdt.4.79.
speak or
act like one frenzy-stricken, S.Ant. 136 (lyr.), E.Ion1204, etc.: also of places, b. ste/gh A.Fr.58, cf. E. IT1243(lyr.). causal,
inspire with frenzy, au(=tai/ se bakxeu/ousi suggenh= fo/non; E.Or.411, cf.HF966:—Pass., Id.Or.835; filosofi/a eu)= ma/la bebakx.
full of mysticism, Plu.2.580c.
initiate in the Bacchic mysteries, in Pass., Schwyzer792 (Cyme, v B. C.).

*bakxe/xoros, on,
leading the Bacchic dance, *diw/nusos Orph.H.57.3, 75.1.

*ba/kxh, h(,
Bacchante, A.Eu.25, S.Ant.1122 (lyr.), Ar.Nu.605, Pl. Ion534a, etc.: generally, *ba/kxh *(/aidou
frantic handmaid of Hades, E.Hec.1077; b. neku/wn Id.Ph.1489 (lyr.). a kind of
pear, Nic. Al.354, Th.513.
*bakx-ia/zw, = *bakxeu/w I, E.Cyc.204; = bakxeu/w II, Id.Ba.931, Philod.Scarph.14.
*bakx-iako/s, h/, o/n, = *ba/kxios, nu/ktes Orph.H.79.9.
*bakx-ia/s, a/dos, h(, poet. fem. of *ba/kxeios, o)pw/rh AP6.72 (Agath.), Nonn.12.296, al.

-[ia]sth/s, ou=, Dor. *bakx-ta/s, o(,
Bacchic reveller, Philod.Scarph.144.

*bakx-iko/s, h/, o/n, = *ba/kxeios, Arist.Pr.922b22; e)/ph D.S.1.11; -ko/n, to/, Str.10.3.10: Sup. -w/tatos Luc.
Bis Acc.9. Adv. -kw=s Str.15.1.8: Comp. -w/teron Duris 24.
*ba/kx-ios, a, on, = *ba/kxeios (q.v.).

*bakx-io/w,
fill with the divine presence, bebakxiwme/nhn . . *nu=san S. Fr.959.
*bakx-i/s, i/dos, h(, = *ba/kxh, *nu/mfai Id.Ant.1129.

*bakx-istai/, oi(,
worshippers of Bacchus, IG12(3).1296 (Thera).
*bakx-iw/n, w=nos, o(, name of a month at Myconos, SIG1024.26.
*bakx-iw/ths, ou, o(, = *bakxeuth/s, S.OC678 (lyr.).
bakxo/an: bo/qron (Aeol.), Hsch.; cf. ba/koa, bakoi/as.

*ba/kxos, o(,
Bacchus, name of Dionysus, first in S.OT211 (lyr.), cf. E.Hipp.560 (lyr.), al., Limen.19, Theoc.Ep.18.3, etc. *zeu\s *b. Epigr.Gr.1035.22.
wine, E.IA1061 (lyr.), etc.
Bacchanal, Heraclit.14, E.Ba.491: generally,
any one inspired, frantic, *(/aidou *ba/kxos Id.HF1119; polloi\ me\n narqhkofo/roi, *b. de/ te pau=roi Orph.Fr.5.
branch carried by initiates, Xenoph.17. a kind of
grey mullet, Hices. ap. Ath.7.306e; = o)ni/skos II, Dorio ap. Ath.3.118c, cf. Xenocr.I.
garland, ba/kxoisin kefala\s peria/nqesin e)ste/ yanto Nic.Fr.130. = klauqmo/s (Phoenician), Hsch.
bakxou/ria, ta/, Hebr. word in LXX, = prwtogennh/mata, Ne.13.31.

ba/kxu^los, o(,
bread baked in hot ashes, Elean word, Nic.Fr.121.

*bakx-w/dhs, es, (*ba/kxos)
filled with the spirit of Bacchus, Arr.Ind. 8.1 (Sup.).
*ba/kx-wn, wnos, o(, Dim. of *bakxuli/dhs, Sch.D.T.p.227 H.

ba/lagros, o(, a fresh-water fish, prob. a kind of
carp, Arist.HA 538a15.
balaika/kes, Hsch.:—also ba/lekes, Id., and ba/lakes, bala/des, Cyr.
balakro/s, Maced. = fal-, Plu.2.292e.

ba^la^n-a/gra, h(,
key or
hook for pulling out the ba/lanos 11.4, Hdt. 3.155, X.HG5.2.29, Aen.Tact.18.9: in pl., = ba/lanos 11.4, Plb.7.16.5, Them.Or.26.315d.

ba^la^n-a/rion, to/,
bath-towel (or-
bag), PAmh.2.126.45 (ii A. D.), POxy.921.18 (iii A. D.).

ba^la^n-eio/mfa^los, on,
with a boss like the valve of a bath, fia/lh b. a cup
with a round bottom, Cratin. 50.

ba^la^n-ei=on, to/,
bath, bathing-room, Ar.Nu.837,1054, etc.; b. dhmo/sion BGU1130.9 (i B. C.): more freq. in pl., Ar.Nu.991, Eq.1401, etc.
bath taken, Aristo Stoic.1.88, Gal.11.46.—Prose word for poet. loutra/.
ba^la^n-ei/ths, ou, o(, = sq., Plb.30.29.4.

ba^la^n-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
bath-man, Ar.Eq.1403, Ra.710, Pl.R.344d, etc.: prov., balaneu\s e)pi\ tw=n polupragmo/nwn Diogenian.3.64.

ba^la^n-euth/s, ou=, o(, = balaneu/s,
PSI5.584 (iii B. C.), PTeb.401.24 (i A. D.), etc.: —fem. ba^la^n-eu/tria, Poll 7.166, Lib.Decl.26.19.

ba^la^n-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for baths, e)/laion PTeb.117.61 (i B. C.); koni/a Gp.10.29.4; h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), Pl.Sph. 227a.

ba^la^n-eu/w,
heat the bath, Ar.Lys.337; but b. e(autw=|
to be one's own
bath-man, Id.Pax1103;
drench like a bath-man, oi)/nw| kata\ tou= kera/mon b. Pherecr.130.6:—Pass., Timocl.2 (dub.).
bawl, shout, Hsch.

ba^la^n-hro/s, a/, o/n, (ba/lanos)
of the acorn type, Thphr.HP1.11.3.

ba^la^nh-fa^ge/w,
live on acorns, App.BC1.50.

ba^la^nh-fa^gi/a, h(,
a living on acorns, Ph.2.409.

ba^la^nh-fa/gos [fa^], on,
acorn-eating, esp. of Arcadians, Alc.(?).91, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.66, Plu.Cor.3, Nonn.D.13.287, Them.Or.26.316c.

ba^la^nh-fo/ros, on,
bearing dates, foi/nikes Hdt.1.193.

ba^la^n-i/dion, to/,
small bathing-establishment, dhmo/sion b. POxy. 1430.13 (iv A. D.).

entryFree.sense: shake acorns from the oak, hence as prov. answer to beggars, a)/llhn dru=n bala/nize AP11.417, Zen. 2.41, etc.

(ba/lanos 11.6) b. tina/
administer a suppository to him, Hp. ap. Poll.10.150.

div0.entryFree:
ba^la^n-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the bath: to\ b., = e)pi/loutron, Sch.Luc.Lex.2.

ba^la^/n-i^nos, h, on,
made of ba/lanos, b. e)/laion oil
of zukkum, Thphr.Od.29, Dsc.1.34, cf. 19.
of the colour of b., POxy.265.3 (i A. D.).

ba^la^/n-ion, to/,
decoction of acorns, used as a restorative after drunkenness, Nicoch.15. = ba/lanos 11.6, Hp. Mul.1.92, Ruf. ap. Orib.8.39, Dsc.4.176.

ba^la^n-i/s, i/dos, h(,
pessary, Hp.Mul.2.155, Steril.221.
peg, stopper, PLond.3.1177.178 (ii A. D.). = bala/nissa, Suid.
ba^la^/n-i^sis, ews, h(, = sq., Gloss.

ba^la^n-ismo/s, o(,
administration of a suppository, Aët.8.49, Cael. Aur.TP4.7.105.

ba^la^/n-issa, h(, fem. of balaneu/s,
bathing-woman, AP5.81.

ba^la^n-iste/on,
one must administer a suppository, Archig. ap. Aët.9.27, Paul.Aeg.2.98.

ba^la^n-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who collects acorns, Zen.2.41.

ba^la^n-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
acorn-shaped, b. li/qos a precious stone, Plin.HN37.149. b. bi/os of
those who live on acorns, Eust. 1859.47.

ba^la^n-i=tis, idos, h(, a sort of
sweet chestnut, Plin.HN15.93.

ba^la^no-do/kh, h(, (de/xomai)
socket in a door-post to receive the ba/lanos (11.4), Aen.Tact.18.3, al.

ba^la^no-eidh/s, e/s,
like an acorn, Dsc.5.137.

ba^la^no-ka/sta^non, to/,
chestnut, prob. for bolbo-, Alex. Trall.5.6.

ba/la^nos [ba^], h(,
acorn, Od.10.242, 13.409, Arist.HA603b31, Thphr.HP3.8.3:
any similar fruit, date, Hdt.1.193, X.An.2.3.15, Arr.Ind.11.8; *dio\s b. v. *diosba/lanos; b. mureyikh/
bān, Balanites aegyptiaca, Dsc.4.157, cf. Thphr.HP4.2.1.
tree which bears ba/lanoi, ib.6, Plb.34.8.1, LXX Ge.35.8. from similarity of shape, a sea shell-fish,
barnacle, Arist.HA535a24,547b22, Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.50.
glans penis,Arist.HA493a27,Ar.Lys. 413, Gal.10.381.
air-vessel of a seaweed,
bladder-wrack, Fucus vesiculosus, Thphr.HP4.6.9.
iron peg, bolt-pin, Ar.V.200, Th.2.4, Aen.Tact.18.1,al.
fastening for necklaces, Ar.Lys.410. Medic.,
suppository, Hp.Epid.1.26.a/, Aret.CA 1.1.
pledget, pessary, Hp.Mul.1.84.
ballot-ball, Arist.Ath.63.2. (Lat.
glans, Slav. želądi^, Lith. gi\le_.）
ba^la^no-fa^ge/w, = balanhfage/w, Sch.Od.19.163.
ba^la^no-fa/gos [fa^], = balanhfa/gos, EM790.36.

ba^la^no/w,
fasten with a ba/lanos (11.4), bebala/nwke th\n qu/ran Ar.Ec. 361:—Pass.,
to be shut close, secured, Id.Av.1159: metaph. in pf. part. Pass.,
constipated, Id.Ec.370.
balanti/dion, bala/ntion, balantiotome/w, ba^la^no-to/mos, v. ball-.

ba^lanti^okle/pths, ou, o(,
cutpurse, Phryn.201 (who condemns the form balanto-).

ba^la^n-w/dhs, es,
acorn-like, Thphr.CP4.3.4,HP3.16.1.

ba^la^/n-w[sis], ews, h(,
right of gathering acorns, prob. in IG5(2).456 (Megalopolis).

ba^la^n-wto/s, h/, o/n, (balano/w)
fastened with a ba/lanos (11.4), o)xeu/s Parm.1.16; qu/ra X.Oec.9.5.
adorned with acorns, fia/lh Ath.11.502b.
ba/laris, = bru/on qala/ssion, Ps.-Dsc.4.98. = bota/nh tri/fullos, Hsch. (ba/ll-), = luxni\s stefanwmatikh/, Ps.-Dsc.3.100.
balaro/s, o(, Corsican word for fuga/s, Paus.10.17.9.

balau/stion, to/,
flower of the wild pomegranate, Dsc.1.111, Gal.11.847:—hence Adj. balau/stinos, PSI4.333.8 (iii B. C.). balaustiourgo/s, o(,
dyer (?), dub. in Alciphr.1.2.

balau/strinos, h, on,
of the colour of pomegranate flowers, Stud.Pal. 20.41 (ii A. D.).

balbi_dou=xos, o(,
judge in races, Hsch.

balbi_dw/dhs, es,
with cavities or
grooves, Hp.Mochl.1.

balbi/s, i=dos, h(, prop.
rope drawn across the race-course at the starting and finishing-point: mostly in pl.,
posts to which this rope was attached, Ar.Eq.1159: so in sg.,
turning-post, nh=sos b. cesth=| ei)/kastai Philostr.VA5.5: also,
platform from which the quoit was thrown, Id.Im.1.24: hence,
any starting-point, Antipho Soph.69; balbi/dwn a)/po E.HF867, cf. Ar.V.548: metaph., e(/rpe pro\s balbi=da luphra\n bi/ou E.Med.1245; e)k b. ei)s te/rma Them.Or.13.177d; b. lo/gou be/blhtai Philostr.VS2.20.3; bibli/ou AP4.3b.75 (Agath.); but,
edge, ib.39. since
the starting-point was also
the goal, balbi=des was used for
any point to be gained, as
the battlements (by one scaling a wall), S.Ant.131 (lyr.), cf. Lyc.287, Opp.C.1.513. = koilo/ths paramh/khs, Gal.19.87; v. foreg.

ba/le,
O that! would God! c. opt., Alcm.26, Call.Hec.26.2; cf. a)/bale.

ba/leros or bali=nos, o(, kind of
carp, Arist.HA568b27:—also balliro/s, ib.602b26; cf. ba/lagros.
balh/n, o(, v. ballh/n.
ba/lhos, epith. of Zeus in Bithynia, Ath.Mitt.19.373.
ba/lion phro/n (Cret.), Hsch.

balidiko/s, h/, o/n, epith. of a kind of
nut, ka/rua balidika/ PPetr.3p.332.
balikiw/ths (val-), Cret. for h(likiw/ths, Hsch. bali=nos, v. ba/leros.

ba^lio/s, a/, o/n,
spotted, dappled, e)/lafos, lu/gkes, E.Hec.90, Alc.579 (both lyr.); pe/rdic AP7.203 (Simm.). parox., bali/os, as name of one of Achilles' horses,
Piebald, Dapple, Il.16.149, al., cf. E.IA 222.
swift, Opp.C.2.314, Tryph.84, Nonn.D.9.156, al.
bali/s, = si/kus a)/grios, Ps.-Dsc.4.150.
baliw=tai: pro/gonoi, Hsch. ba/llai: baqmoi/ (Cypr.), Id.(Aeol. = bhlo/s).
ballantiato/mos, v. ballantioto/mos.
ballanti/dion [i_], to/, Dim. of sq., to be read for bal- in Eup.23, Hld.2.30.

balla/ntion, to/,
bag, pouch, purse, [Simon.]178, Epich.10 (bal-), Ar.Eq.707, al., Thphr.Char.17.5; pai=s e)k ballanti/ou a supposititious child, TeleclId.41.
javelin (as if from ba/llw), a pun in Dionys. ap.Ath.3.98d. (The spelling ball-is better attested than that with bal-, cf. Phld.Rh.1.354 S., etc.; cf. ballantiotome/w, -to/mos.）

ballantio-tome/w,
cut purses, Pl.R.575b, X.Mem.1.2.62 (bal-).

ballantio-to/mos, o(,
cutpurse, footpad, Ecphantid.4, TeleclId.15, Aeschin.3.207, v. l. in Pl.R.552d (leg. ballantia_to/moi （bal- codd. AF)); toi=si ballantioto/mois, prob. for toi=s balantioto/mois, Ar.Ra.772.

ballaxra/dai, oi(,
pear-throwers, nickname among boys at Argos, Plu.2.303a.
ba/lleka: yh=fon, Hsch. ballhi/ai: oi( a)krobolismoi/, Id.

ballh/n, o( (not balh/n Hdn.Gr.2.923),
king, A.Pers.657, S.Fr.515. —Prob. Phrygian word acc. to Hsch., but Thurian acc. to Hermesianax Hist. ap. Ps.-Plu.Fluv.12.4: ballhnai=on o)/ros, = basiliko/n (in Phrygia) and ballh/n, a fabulous precious stone, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.12.3,4.
ballhna/^de ble/pein, a pun between ba/llw and the Attic deme *pallh/nh, Ar.Ach.234.

ballhtu/s, u/os, h(,
throwing, Ath.9.406d, 407c; festival of Demeter at Athens with a sham fight, Hsch.

balli/zw,
dance, jump about, in Sicily and Magna Graecia, Epich. 79, Sophr.11,12, Ath.8.362bsq.
balli/on, to/, = fallo/s, Herod.6.69. balliro/s, o(, v. ba/leros.

ba/llis, ews, h(,
plant with wonderful medicinal properties, Xanth. 16.

ballismo/s, o(,
jumping about, dancing, Alex.107, Ath.8.362b.
ballisth/s, ou=, o(, a constellation, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.204.14.

balli/stra, h(,
catapult, engine of war, Procop.Goth.1.22, al., Steph. in Hp.2.384 D.

ba/llw, fut. ba^lw= (in Att. Prose only in compds.), Ion. bale/w Il. 8.403, ballh/sw Ar.V.222,1491: aor. 2 e)/ba^lon, Ion. pro-ba/leske Od. 5.331; later aor. 1 e)/bala LXX3 Ki.6.1 (5.18); Ep. and Ion. inf. bale/ein Il.2.414,al., Hdt.2.111,al., but balei=n Il.13.387, 14.424; opt. blei/hs in Epich.219, part. blei/s Id.176, as if from e)/blhn (v. sumba/llw): pf. be/blhka: plpf. e)beblh/kein, Ep. beblh/kein Il.5.661:—Med., Ion. impf. balle/sketo Hdt.9.74: fut. ba^lou=mai （pro-) Ar.Ra.201, (e)pi-) Th.6.40, etc., Ep. baleu=mai （a)mfi-) Od.22.103: aor. 2 e)ba^lo/mhn, Ion. imper.baleu= Hdt.8.68.g/, used mostly in compds.:—Pass., fut. blhqh/somai X.HG7.5.11, (dia-) E.Hec.863; also beblh/somai Id.Or.271, Hld.2.13, (dia-) D.16.2; part. dia-beblhso/menos Philostr. VA6.13 (Ep. fut. cum-blh/somai, v. sumba/llw): aor. e)blh/qhn Hdt.1.34, Th.8.84, etc.: Hom. also has an Ep. aor. Pass., e)/blhto Il.11.675, cu/mblhto 14.39; subj. blh/etai Od.17.472; opt. blh=|o or blei=o Il.13.288; inf. blh=sqai 4.115; part. blh/menos 15.495: pf. be/blhmai, Ion. 3pl. beblh/atai 11.657 (but 3sg. h.Ap.20), opt. dia-beblh=|sqe And.2.24: plpf. e)beblh/mhn （peri-) X.HG7.4.22, (e)c-) Isoc.18.17; Ion. 3pl. peri-ebeble/ato Hdt.6.25.—Ep. pf. bebo/lhmai in special sense, v. bole/w. Act.,
throw: with acc. of person or thing aimed at,
throw so as to hit, hit with a missile, freq. opp.
striking with a weapon in the hand, blh/menos h)e\ tupei/s Il.15.495; to\n ba/len, ou)d' a)fa/marte 11.350, cf. 4.473, al.; so even in e)ggu/qen e)lbw\n beblh/kei . . douri/ 5.73; and douri\ w)/mwn messhgu\s sxedo/qen ba/le 16.807; but later opp. toceu/ein, D.9.17, X.An.4.2.12; e)k xeiro\s b. ib.3.3.15: c. dat. instrumenti, b. tina\ douri/, pe/trw|, keraunw=|, etc., Il.13.518, 20.288, Od.5.128, etc.: blh/menos h)\ i)w=| h)\ e)/gxei+ Il.8.514: c. dupl. acc. pers. et partis, min ba/le mhro\n o)i+stw=| 11.583: c. acc. partis only, 5.19,657; so to\n d' *)oduseu\s kata\ laimo\n . . ba/len i)w=| Od.22.15; douri\ balw\n pro\s sth=qos Il. 11.144: c. acc. cogn., e(/lkos. ., to/ min ba/le *pa/ndaros i)w=| 5.795; also ba/le *tudei/+dao kat' a)spi/da
smote upon it, ib.281. less freq. of things, h(ni/oxon koni/hs r(aqa/migges e)/ballon 23.502; of drops of blood, 11.536, cf. A.Ag.1390: metaph., khli\s e)/bale/ nin mhtrokto/nos E.IT 1200, cf. HF1219; of the sun, a)kti=sin e)/ballen [qa/mnous] Od.5.479; e)/balle . . ou)rano\n *)hw/s A.R.4.885 (so Pass., selh/nh . . di' eu)trh/twn ballome/nh quri/dwn AP5.122 (Phld.));
strike the senses, of sound, i(/ppwn w)kupo/dwn a)mfi\ ktu/pos ou)/ata ba/llei Il.10.535, cf. S.Ant.1188, Ph.205 (lyr.); of smell, o)smh\ b. tina/ Id.Ant.412; ta/x' a)\n pe/mfic se bronth=s kai\ dusosmi/as b. Id.Fr.538. metaph., b. tina\ kakoi=s, fqo/nw|, yo/gw|,
smite with reproaches, etc., Id.Aj.1244, E.El.902, Ar. Th.895; stefa/nois b. tina/ Pi.P.8.57 (hence metaph.,
praise, Id.O.2.98); fqo/nos ba/llei A.Ag.947; fi/lhma ba/llei th\n kardi/an Ach.Tat. 2.37. with acc. of the weapon thrown,
cast, hurl, of missiles, rare in Hom., balw\n be/los Od.9.495; xalko\n e)ni\ sth/qessi balw/n Il.5.
346, cf. Od.20.62; e)n nhusi\n . . pu=r b. Il.13.629: c. dat., of the weapon,
throw or
shoot with a thing, oi( d' a)/ra xermadi/oisi . . ba/llon 12.155; be/lesi Od.16.277: in Prose abs., b. e)pi/ tina
throw at one, Th.8.75; e)pi\ skopo/n X.Cyr.1.6.29; e)pi/skopa Luc.Am.16; alone, oi( yiloi\ ba/llontes ei)=rgon Th.4.33: c. gen., ba/llonta tou= skopou=
hitting the mark, Pl.Sis.391a. generally of anything thrown, ei)s a(/la lu/mat' e)/ballon Il.1.314; ta\ me\n e)n puri\ ba/lle Od.14.429; [nh=a] b. poti\ pe/tras 12.71; eu)na\s b.
throw out the anchor-stones, 9.137; b. spo/ron
cast the seed, Theoc.25.26; b. ko/pron POxy.934.9 (iii A. D.): hence b. a)rou/ras
manure, PFay.118.21 (ii A. D.): metaph., u(/pnon . . e)pi\ blefa/rois b. Od.1.364; b. sko/ton o)/mmasi E.Ph.1535(lyr.); b. lu/phn tini/ S.Ph.67. of persons, b. tina\ e)n koni/h|sin, e)n dape/dw|, Il.8.156, Od. 22.188; gh=s e)/cw b. S.OT622; b. tina\ a)/qapton Id.Aj.1333; a)/timon Id.Ph.1028:—Pass., u(po\ xlai/nh| beblhme/nos AP5.164 (Mel.); beblhme/nos
on a sick-bed, Ev.Matt.8.14: then metaph., e)s kako\n b. tina/ Od. 12.221; o(/s me met' . . e)/ridas kai\ nei/kea b. Il.2.376; b. tina\ e)s e)/xqran, e)s fo/bon, A.Pr.390, E.Tr.1058; also e)n ai)ti/a| or ai)ti/a| b. tina/, S.OT657, Tr.940 (but in E.Tr.305 b. ai)ti/an e)/s tina）; kindu/nw| b. tina/ A.Th. 1053.
let fall, e(te/rwse ka/rh ba/len Il.8.306, cf. 23.697; b. a)po\ da/kru pareiw=n Od.4.198, cf. 114; kata\ blefa/rwn b. da/krua Thgn. 1206; kat' o)/sswn E.Hipp.1396; ai(/matos pe/mfiga pro\s pe/dw| b. A.Fr. 183; b. tou\s o)do/ntas
cast, shed them, Arist.HA501b2, etc.; so ba/llein alone, ib.576a4; bou=s beblhkw/s SIG958.7 (Ceos). of the eyes, e(te/rwse ba/l' o)/mmata
cast them, Od.16.179; o)/mmata pro\s gh=n E.Ion 582; pro/swpon ei)s gh=n Id.Or.958: intr., o)fqalmo\s pro\s to\ fw=s balw/n
aiming at . . , Plot.2.4.5; balw\n pro\s au)to/
directing one's gaze at . . , Id.3.8.10. of animals,
push forward or
in front, tou\s sou\s [i(/ppous] pro/sqe balw/n Il.23.572; plh/qei pro/sqe balo/ntes (sc. i(/ppous) ib.639; ba/lle ka/twqe ta\ mosxi/a Theoc.4.44: metaph., b. yuxa\n poti\ ke/rdea BionFr.5.12. in a looser sense,
put, place, with or without a notion of haste, tw\ me\n . . bale/thn e)n xersi\n e(tai/rwn Il.5.574, cf. 17.40, 21.104; mh=la . . e)n nhi/+ b. Od.9.470; e)pi\ ga=n i)/xnos podo\s b. E.Rh.721 (lyr.); fa/sganon e)p' au)xe/nos b. Id.Or.51; tou\s daktu/lous ei)s ta\ w)=ta Ev.Marc.7.33; b. pli/nqous
lay bricks, Edict.Diocl.7.15;
pour, oi)=non ei)s a)skou/s Ev.Matt.9.17; ei)s pi/qon Arr.Epict.4.13.12, cf. Dsc.1.71.5 (v.l. for e)mb.): metaph., e)n sth/qessi me/nos ba/le poime/ni law=n Il.5.513; o(/pws . . filo/thta met' a)mfote/roisi ba/lwmen
may put friendship between them, 4.16; manteu/somai w(s e)ni\ qumw=| a)qa/natoi ba/llousi Od.1.201; e)n kardi/a| b. Pi.O.13.16; but also qumw=|, e)s qumo\n b.,
lay to heart, A.Pr.706, S.OT975. esp. of
putting round, a)mf' o)xe/essi qow=s ba/le kampu/la ku/kla Il.5.722; of clothes or arms, a)mfi\ d' *)aqh/nh w)/mois . . ba/l' ai)gi/da 18.204;
put on, faia\ i(ma/tia Plb. 30.4.5.
place money
on deposit, a)rgu/rion toi=s trapezi/tais Ev.Matt.25.27.
pay, PLond.3.1177 (ii A. D.), POxy.1448.5 (iv A. D.). of dice,
throw, tri\s e(\c balei=n A.Ag.33, cf. Pl.Lg.968e; a)/lla blh/mat' e)n ku/bois balei=n E.Supp.330: so prob. yh=fos balou=sa, abs.,
by its throw, A.Eu.751: metaph., eu)= or kalw=s ba/llein
to be lucky, successful, Phld.
lr.p.51 W., Rh.1.10 S. intr.,
fall, potamo\s *minuh/i+os ei)s a(/la ba/llwn Il.11.722, cf. A.R.2.744, etc.; a)/nemos kat' au)th=s (sc. new/s） e)/bale Act.Ap.27.14; [i(/ppous] peri\ te/rma balou/sas
having run round the post, Il.23.462; e)gw\ de\ . . ta/x' e)n pe/dw| balw= (sc. e)mauth/n) A.Ag.1172 (lyr.); li/mnhqen o(/t' ei)s a(lo\s oi)=dma ba/lhte
arrive at . . , A.R.4.1579; ei)/sw b.
enter a river's mouth, Orac. ap.D.S.8.23; balw\n ka/qeude
lie down and sleep, Arr.Epict.2.20.10; ti/ ou)=n, ou) r(e/gkw balw/n; ib.4.10.29; balw\n e)pi\ th=s stiba/dos e)pexei/rei kaqeu/dein Anon. ap. POxy.1368.51; cf. A. 11.4. in familiar language, ba/ll' e)s ko/rakas
away with you! be hanged! Ar.V.835, etc.; ba/ll' e)s makari/an Pl.Hp.Ma.293a, cf. Men.Epit.389. Med.,
put for oneself, w(s e)ni\ qumw=| ba/lleai that thou
may'st lay it to heart, Il.20.196, cf. Od.12.218; su\ d' e)ni\ fresi\ ba/lleo sh=|sin Hes.Op.107; ei) me\n dh\ no/ston ge meta\ fresi\ . . ba/lleai Il.9.435; e)s qumo\n bale/sqai ti Hdt.1.84, etc.; ei)s or e)pi\ nou=n, ei)s mnh/mhn, Plu.Thes. 24, Jul.Or.2.58a, etc. (v. supr. A.11.6); e)p' e(wutw=n balo/menoi
on their own
responsibility, Hdt.4.160, cf. 3.71, al.; e(te/rws e)ba/lonto qeoi/, v. l. for e)bo/lonto in Od.1.234; qeoi\ d' e(te/rwse ba/lonto Q.S.1.610. to/ca or ci/fos a)mf' w)/moisin ba/llesqai
throw about one's shoulder, Il.10.333, 19.372, etc.; e)pi\ ka/ra ste/fh b. E.IA1513(lyr.). e)s gaste/ra ba/llesqai go/non
conceive, Hdt.3.28.
lay as foundation, krhpi=da bale/sqai Pi.P.7.3, cf. 4.138, Luc.Hipp.4; also,
lay the foundations of, begin to form, oi)kodomi/as Pl.Lg.779b; xa/raka Plb.3.105.10, Poll. 8.161; simply,
build, i(ero\n peri/ ti Philostr.VA4.13; b. a)/gkuran
cast anchor, Hdt.9.74, etc.; kaqa/per e)c a)gkurw=n ballo/menos yuxh=s desmou/s Pl.Ti.73d. rarely, xro/a ba/llesqai loutroi=s
dash oneself with water,
bathe, h.Cer.50 (but loutra\ e)pi\ xroi\+ balei=n E.Or.303). (Arc. -de/llw in e)s-de/llontes, = e)k-ba/llontes, IG5(2).6.49: ze/llein: ba/llein, Hsch. Root
g[uglide]el- 'throw', Skt.
galati 'trickle', OHG.
quellan 'spurt up', Lith.
gulēti 'lie'.)

ballwth/, h(,
black horehound, Ballota nigra, Dsc.3.103.
balmo/s, o(, = sth=qos, Hsch., Suid. baloith/seiron: para\ to\ diestramme/non ei)=nai tou\s po/das, Hsch.
ba_lo/s, o(, Dor. for bhlo/s (q.v.).
balsa^m-e/laion, to/, = si/lfion, Sch.Ar.Pl.926.

balsa^m-i/nh, h(, = bou/fqalmon, Ps.-Dsc.3.139;
balsaminum, = o)poba/lsamon, Plin.HN23.92.

ba/lsa^m-on, to/,
balsam-tree, Balsamodendron Opobalsamum, Thphr. HP9.6.1, Dsc.1.19; cu/la balsa/mou BGU953.6 (iii/iv A. D.). the fragrant oil of this tree,
Mecca balsam, Arist.Fr.110, Thphr.HP9.4.1, POxy.1052 (bars-, iv A. D.).
an aromatic herb, costmary, Chrysanthemum Balsamita, Gp.11.27tit.—Prob. Semitic. [ba/lsa_mon in Nic.Th.947, but a^ in Androm. ap. Gal.14.39, and Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.97, as in
balsa^mum in Lat. Poets.]

balsa^m-w=des, to/, a
bark like cassia, Plin.HN12.97.
balw/stion, to/, = balau/stion, PSI5.489 (iii B. C.).
ba/mba, = ba/mma (Syrac.), Hsch.

bambai/nw, onomatop. word,
chatter with the teeth, Il.10.375;
stammer, BionFr.6.9, AP5.272 (Agath.), Procop.Arc.Praef.:—so also bamba^ku/zw,
chatter with cold, Hippon.17:—also bamba^lu/zw, Phryn.PSp.54B., Hsch.; possibly to be restored (for bombulia/zw) in Arist.Pr.949a13.
bamba^k-ei/a, h(, bamba^k-keu/tria, h(, = farmakei/a, -keu/tria, Hsch.: ba/mba^kos, o(, = farmako/s (Cilic.), AB85.

bamba/kion [a^], to/,
cotton, Suid. s.v. pa/mbac.

bamba^koeidh/s, e/s,
like cotton, v. l. for bombuk-, Dsc.3.16.

bamba/kths, ou, o(,
highway, causeway, Cyr.Dresd.
ba/mbala: xeimerina\ i(ma/tia, Hsch.: in sg. also, = to\ ai)doi=on (Phryg.), Id. bamba/lein: tre/mein, yofei=n toi=s xei/lesi, Id.
bamba^lu/zw, v. bambai/nw.
bambra^dw/n, o/nos, h(, = bembra/s, Epich.60, Sophr.65.
bambra/ssei: o)rgi/zetai, and bambrasmo/s: kaxlasmo/s, Cyr.Dresd.
ba=mes, Dor. for bw=men, I pl. subj. aor. 2 of bai/nw, Theoc.15.22.

ba/mma, atos, to/, (ba/ptw)
that in which a thing is dipped, dye, Pl.Lg. 956a; ba/mma *sardianiko/n, *kuzikhniko/n, v. ba/ptw 1.2: in pl., dia/fora b. POxy.914.7 (v A. D.); b. leukw/matos a whitish
tinge, Arist.Phgn. 813a28.
sauce, Nic.Th.622, cf. Hsch. s.v. ba/mba. = o)/a, AB362.
ba/n [a^], Ep. for e)/ban, e)/bhsan, 3pl. aor. 2 of bai/nw.
ba^na/, Boeot. for gunh/, Corinn.21: pl., banh=kes, Hsch.

ba^naus-i/a, h(,
handicraft, Hdt.2.165, Pl.R.590c, etc.
the habits of a mere artisan, vulgarity, bad taste, Arist.EN1107b19, Pol. 1317b41, UPZ62.3 (ii B. C.).
quackery, charlatanism, Hp.Morb. Sacr.18.

ba^naus-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for artisans: te/xnh b.
handicraft, X. Smp.3.4, Oec.4.2; to\ b. Arist.Pol.1321a6.

ba/nausos [a^], on, (for bau/nausos, from bau=nos, au)/w acc. to EM187.40, cf. banausi/a: pa=sa te/xnh dia\ puro/s, Hsch.; banau/swn seems to be f.l. for bau/nwn in Heraclit.All.69):—epith. of the class of handicraftsmen or artisans, to\ b., = to\ peri\ ta\s te/xnas w(=n a)/neu po/lin a)du/naton oi)kei=sqai Arist.Pol.1291a1, etc.; o( b. dh=mos, opp. o( gewrgiko/s, o( a)gorai=os, ib.1289b33: as Subst.,
artisan, ib.1277b35; h( belti/sth po/lis ou) poih/sei b. poli/thn ib.1278a8; to\ b., = oi( ba/nausoi, ib.1329a20. te/xnh b. a
mechanical art,
handicraft, S.Aj.1121, Pl.Tht.176c(pl.); b. e)/rgon Arist.Pol.1337b8; banauso/tatai tw=n e)rgasiw=n ib.1258b37; b. bi/on zh=n a
mere mechanic's life, ib.1278a21, 1328b39; b. po/noi Plu.Num. 14: hence,
vulgar, in bad taste, Arist.EN1123a19, Pl.Ep. 334b; of persons, Axiop.1.4. Adv. -sws, prosble/pein
unworthily, meanly, Phld.D.1.11. later,
fastidious, AP11.326 (Autom.), 12.237 (Strat.).
ba^nausotexne/w, = sq., Str.16.4.25.

ba^nausourg-e/w,
follow a mere mechanical art, Poll.7.6.

ba^nausourg-i/a, h(,
handicraft, Plu.Marc.14.

ba^nausourg-o/s, o(,
handicraftsman, Poll.7.6.

banqw=sai: skotodinia=sai, Hsch. ba/nisos: ei)=dos qumia/matos, Id. banko/n: mwro/n, Id. ba/nnas: basileu/s (Ital.), Id. banna/tai: ai( locoi\ o(doi/ (Tarent.); also ba/nnatroi, Id. ba/nneia and ba/nnima, ta/, = a)/rneia, Id. banoi/: te/xnai, Id. bano/n: lepto/n, Id. ba/nos: kla/sma, mwro/s, kai\ tuflo/s, Id. banou/s: o)/rh stroggu/la, Id. banu/sei: mwrai/nei, e)pimai/netai, Id.

banwto/s, o(, a kind of
vase used as a measure, PSI4.428.12 (iii B.C.), 5.535.23 (iii B. C.), Callix.2:—Dim. banw/tion, to/, PSI4.428.22 (iii B.C.).

ba/cis, ews, h(, (ba/zw) poet. Noun,
saying, esp.
an oracular saying, inspired ulterance, klu/ein eu)hke/a b. Emp.112.11; e)nargh\s b. h)=lqen *)ina/xw| A.Pr.663; qesfa/twn b. S.Tr.87.
report, rumour, min . . b. e)/xei xaleph/ Mimn.15; b. a)rgale/h Id.16; qew=n e)popi/zeo mh=nin ba/cin t' a)nqrw/pwn Thgn.1298; b. a)lgeinh/n, b. kalh\n labei=n, S.Aj.494, El. 1006; spei/rein matai/an b. e)s pa=san po/lin ib.642, cf. 638; dia\ de\ po/leas e)/rxetai b. E.Hel.224 (lyr.); o)cei=a ga/r sou b. . . dih=lq' *)axaiou/s
a report concerning thee, S.Aj.998; a(lw/simos b.
tidings of the capture, A.Ag.10; qano/ntos b. a)ndro/s E.Hel.351 (lyr.); so th/n t' a)mfi\ *qhse/ws b. Id.Supp.642.
voice, Epigr.Gr.989.2.
ba=con (i.e. va=con）: kata=con (Lacon.), Hsch.

ba/pths, ou, o(,
dipper, bather: in pl. of those who celebrated the mysteries of Cotytto; title of play by Eupolis, cf. Luc.Ind.27, Sch. Juv.2.91.

bapt-i/zw,
dip, plunge, ci/fos ei)s sfagh/n J.BJ2.18.4; spa/qion ei)s to\ e)/mbruon Sor.2.63:—Pass., of a trephine, Gal.10.447; ba/ptison seauto\n ei)s qa/lassan Plu.2.166a; b. *dio/nuson pro\s th\n qa/lassan ib. 914d:—in Pass.,
to be drowned, Epict.Gnom.47; of ships,
sink or
disable them, Plb.1.51.6, 16.6.2 (Pass.); e)ba/ptisan th\n po/lin
flooded the city, metaph., of the crowds who flocked into Jerusalem at the time of the siege, J.BJ4.3.3; b. tina\ ei)sforai=s D.S.1.73; b. tina\ u(/pnw| AP11.49 (Even.); u(/pnw| bebaptisme/nos Archig. and Posidon. ap. Aët. 6.3:—Pass., w(s e)k tou= bebapti/sqai a)napne/ousi Hp.Epid.5.63;
to be drenched, Eub.68: metaph., bebaptisme/noi
soaked in wine, Pl.Smp. 176b; o)flh/masi beb.
over head and ears in debt, Plu.Galb.21; gnou\s baptizo/menon to\ meira/kion seeing that he was
getting into deep water, Pl.Euthd.277d; b. ei)s a)naisqhsi/an kai\ u(/pnon J.AJ10.9.4; o( tw=| qumw=| bebaptisme/nos katadu/etai Ach.Tat.6.19; yuxh/ bebaptisme/nh lu/ph| Lib.Or.64.115.
draw wine by dipping the cup in the bowl, Aristopho 14.5; fia/lais b. e)k . . krath/rwn Plu.Alex.67.
baptize,
tina/ Ev.Marc.1.4; e)n u(/dati ei)s meta/noian Ev.Matt.3.11:—Pass., baptisqh/tw e(/kastos ei)s a)/fesin a(martiw=n Act.Ap.2.38; ei)s *xristo/n Ep.Rom.6.3, etc.:—Med.,
dip oneself, LXX4 Ki.5.14;
get oneself baptized, Act.Ap.22.16, 1 Ep.Cor.10.2:—Pass.,
perform ablutions, Ev.Luc. 11.38.

bapt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
for dyeing, xrw/mata Sch.Lyc.1138.
suited for gilding or
silvering, opp. smhktiko/s, Ps.-Democr.Alch. p.47 B.: Comp.,
more suited for a wash, Zos.Alch.p.129 B.

ba/pt-i^sis, ews, h(,
dipping: baptism, J.AJ18.5.2.

ba/pt-isma, atos, to/,
baptism, Ev.Matt.3.7, etc.; b. ei)s to\n qa/naton Ep.Rom.6.4.

bapt-ismo/s, o(,
dipping in water, immersion, Ev.Marc.7.4, Ep.Hebr.9.10, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.3.9. metaph., ei)s kaki/as b. oi)xh/setai Theol.Ar.30.
lethargic sleep, Archig.and Posidon. ap. Aët.6.3.
baptism, J.AJ 18.5.2.

bapt-isth/rion, to/,
swimming-bath, Plin.Ep.2.17.11.

bapt-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one that dips: baptizer, o( b.
the Baptist, Ev.Matt.3.1, cf. J.AJ 18.5.2, etc.: metaph. of the Passion, Ev.Luc.12.50.

bapt-o/s, h/, o/n,
dipped, dyed, D.S.5.30;
bright-coloured, o)/rnis Ar.Av.287; i(ma/tia Id.Pl.530; ta\ ba/pt' e)/xontes
dyed, i.e.
black, garments, Hegesipp.1.13, cf. Plu.Ages.30.
for dyeing, xrw/mata Pl.Lg.847c. of water,
drawn by dipping vessels, E.Hipp.123 (lyr.).
ba/pt-ria, h(, fem. of ba/pths, Eup.401.

ba/ptw, fut. ba/yw （e)m-) Ar.Pax959: aor. e)/baya S.Aj.95, etc.:— Med., fut. ba/yomai Ar.Lys.51: aor. e)baya/mhn Arat.951, AP9.326 (Leon.):—Pass., fut. ba^fh/somai LXXLe.11.32, M.Ant.8.51: aor. e)ba/fqhn AP6.254 (Myrin.), (a)p-) Ar.Fr.416; in Att. generally e)ba/fhn [a^] Pl.R.429e, etc.: pf. be/bammai Hdt.7.67, Ar.Pax1176. trans.,
dip, w(s d' o(/t' a)nh\r xalkeu\s pe/lekun . . ei)n u(/dati yuxrw=| ba/pth| (so as to temper the red-hot steel) Od.9.392; b. ei)s u(/dwr Pl.Ti.73e, cf. Emp.100.11; ta)/ria qermw=| Ar.Ec.216; ei)s me/li, ei)s khro/n, Arist.HA 605a29, de An.435a2:—Pass., bapto/menos si/dhros iron
in process of being tempered, Plu.2.136a; and of coral,
become hard, Dsc.5.121 (s. v. l.). of slaughter in Trag , e)n sfagai=si ba/yasa ci/fos A.Pr. 863; e)/bayas e)/gxos eu)= pro\s *)argei/wn stratw=|; S.Aj.95; fa/sganon ei)/sw sarko\s e)/bayen E.Ph.1578 (lyr.); in later Prose, ei)s ta\ pleura\ b. th\n ai)xmh/n D.H.5.15; b. to\n da/ktulon a)po\ tou= ai(/matos LXXLe.4.17. also,
dip in poison, e)/bayen i)ou/s S.Tr.574; xitw=na to/nd' e)/baya ib.580.
dye, e)/bayen . . ci/fos the sword
dyed [the robe]
red, A.Ch.1011; b. ta\ ka/llh
dye the beautiful cloths, Eup.333; b. e)/ria w(/st' ei)=nai a(lourga/ Pl.R.429d; ei(/mata bebamme/na Hdt.7.67; tri/xas ba/ptein AP11.68 (Lucill.): abs. in Med.,
dye the hair, Men.363.4, Nicol.Com.1.33;
glaze earthen vessels, Ath.11.480e; of
gilding and
silvering, Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.46 B.: Com., ba/ptein tina\ ba/mma *sardianiko/n
dye one in the [red] dye of Sardes, i. e. give him a bloody coxcomb, Ar. Ach.112; but be/baptai b. *kuzikhniko/n
he has been dyed in the dye of Cyzicus, i. e. is an arrant coward, Id.Pax1176 (v. Sch.).
draw water
by dipping a vessel, a)nq' u(/datos ta=| ka/lpidi khri/a ba/yai Theoc. 5.127; a)ru/tainan . . e)k me/sou ba/yasa tou= le/bhtos ze/ontos u(/datos
draw water
by dipping the bucket, Antiph.25, cf. Thphr.Char.9.8; ba/yasa ponti/as a(lo/s (sc. to\ teu=xos)
having dipped it
so as to draw water from the sea, E.Hec.610.
baptize, Arr.Epict.2.9.20 (Pass.). intr., nau=s e)/bayen the ship
dipped, sank, E.Or.707; b. ei)s yuxro\n [ai( e)gxe/lus] Arist.HA592a18; ei) d' o( me\n (sc. h)e/lios） a)ne/felos ba/ptoi r(o/ou e(speri/oio Arat.858 (r(o/on Sch.): c. acc., nh=a . . ba/ptousan h)/dh ku=ma kurto/n
dipping into . . , Babr.71.2:—also Med., potamoi=o e)ba/yato Arat. 951. ba/yas (sc. th\n kw/phn) Ar.Fr.225. (Cf. O Norse
kuefia 'dip'.)
ba/ra: no/shma/ ti karhbariko/n, h)\ qre/mmata (Lacon.), Hsch.
ba^ragxia/w, ba^ra/gxia, = bragx-, Hdn.Gr.2.481, Hsch.
ba/ragxos [ba^], o(, = bra/gxos, Hippon.106.

ba/raqron [ba^], Ep. and Ion. be/reqron (q. v., cf. ze/reqron), shortd. be/qron (q. v.), to/,
gulf, pit, Arist.Pr.947a19; esp.at Athens,
a cleft into which criminals were thrown, Hdt.7.133, Ar.Nu.1450, Com.Adesp. 24.10 D., Pl.Grg.516c, AB219, Sch.Ar.Pl.431. metaph., e)n tw=| b. xeima/zein D.8.45;
ruin, perdition, Luc.Am.5, etc.; name of a courtesan, Theophil.Com.11. a woman's
ornament, Ar.Fr. 320.8. = bra/qu, f.l. for bo/raton, Dsc.1.76. (Root
gseq[uglide]er 'devour', cf. bora/.）

ba/raqros [ba^], o(,
one that ought to be thrown into the pit, Luc. Pseudol.17 (but perh. neut.).

ba^raqrw/dhs, es,
like a pit or
gulf, Str.13.1.67, Plu.Lyc.16; b. pe/lagos
abysmal, of a dangerous sea, Ph.2.514;
precipitous, of a road, Str.5.1.11: metaph., qolero\s kai\ b. bi/os Ph.1.322; of a person, th\n yuxh\n a)/dikos kai\ b. Agath.2.23.
barakinh=|sin: a)ka/nqais, sko/loyi, Hsch. baraki/s: glau/kinon i(ma/tion, Id.

ba/rakos, a kind of
fish, Hsch.; also = ba/traxos, Id.

ba/rac, akos, o(, a kind of
cake, Epil.3; cf. bh/rhc.
ba/rbac or ba/rac, a Libyan bird, Hsch.

barba/ra, h(, a kind of
plaster, Alex.Trall.5.5.

barba^r-i/zw,
behave or
speak like a barbarian, Hdt.2.57, Philostr. VA1.21, Arr.An.7.6.5;
speak broken Greek, speak gibberish, Pl. Tht.175d codd. (sed leg. battari/zwn）; barbarizo/ntwn e(terofw/nwn Phld.Po.994.6;
violate the laws of speech, commit barbarisms, th=| le/cei b. Arist.SE165b21, cf. Plb.39.1.7, Str.14.2.28, Luc.Rh.Pr.17, 23, etc.; distd. from soloiki/zw, Phld.Rh.1.154 S. trans.,
'murder', mangle, th\n *(rwmai/wn fwnh/n Luc.Merc.Cond.24.
side with the barbarians, i.e.
the Persians, X.HG5.2.35, Max.Tyr.4.2.

barba^r-i/kion, to/, name of a
foreign garment, POxy.1684.5, 9 (iv A. D.).

barba^r-iko/s, h/, o/n,
barbaric, non-Greek, xei/r Simon.136; yukth/r OGI214.47 (Didyma, Seleucus I); to\ b., = oi( ba/rbaroi, Th.1.6, 7.29; ta\ b. e)/qnh Arist.Pol.1257a25, etc.; no/mima b.
leges barbarorum, name of a treatise by Arist.; no/moi li/an a(ploi= kai\ b. Pol.1268b40; esp. of the Persians, X.An.1.5.6; e)s to\ b.
in barbaric fashion, Luc.
D Mort. 27.3; b. e)pidromh/ inroad
of barbarians, P Masp.321.5 (vi A. D.); e)s to\ barbarikw/teron
more in the Persian fashion, Arr.An.4.8.2: Sup. -w/tatos Sch.Th.7.29. Adv., e)bo/a kai\ -kw=s kai\ *(ellhnikw=s, i. e. both in Persian and Greek, X.An.1.8.1, cf. Phld.Lib.p.13 O.; keklhme/non b.
in the language of the country, Arist.Mir.846a32;
in foreign fashion, App. Hisp.72.
barbarous, violent, pe/nqh Plu.2.114e. Adv. -kw=s
barbarously, w)mw=s kai\ b. Id.Dio 35: Comp.-w/teron Id.Alex.2.

barba^r-ismo/s, o(,
use of a foreign tongue or
of one's own tongue amiss, barbarism, Arist.Po.1458a26, Diog.Bab.Stoic.3.214, Ph.1.124, Plu.2.731e; mia=s le/cews kaki/a o( b., e)piplokh=s de\ le/cewn a)katallh/lwn o( soloikismo/s A.D.Synt.198.7.

barba^r-isti/, Adv.
in barbarous fashion, Plu.2.336c.
in barbarian or
foreign language, kekra/contai b. Ar.Fr.79; a)cu/neta barbaristi\ parakalou/ntwn App.Mith.50, cf. A.D.Adv.162.5.
barba^ro/-glwssos, on, = barbaro/fwnos, Sch.Lyc.276.

barba^ro-kto/nos, on,
slaughtering barbarians, Thom.Mag.p.141 R.

ba/rba^ros, on,
barbarous, i.e.
non-Greek, foreign, not in Hom. (but cf. barbaro/fwnos）; b. yuxai/ Heraclit.107; esp. as Subst. ba/rbaroi, oi(, originally
all non-Greek-speaking peoples, then specially of the Medes and Persians, A.Pers.255, Hdt.1.58, etc.: generally, opp. *(/ellhnes, Pl.Plt.262d, cf. Th.1.3, Arist.Pol.1252b5, Str.14.2.28; barba/rwn *(/ellhnas a)/rxein ei)ko/s E.IA1400; b. kai\ dou=lon tau)to\ fu/sei Arist.Pol. 1252b9; oi( b. doulikw/teroi ta\ h)/qh fu/sei tw=n *(ellh/nwn ib.1285a20; b. po/lemon war
with the barbarians, Th.2.36 codd.; h( ba/rbaros (sc. gh=), opp. ai( *(ellhni/des po/leis, Th.2.97, cf.A.Pers.187, X.An.5.5.16. Adv. -rws, opp. *(ellhnikw=s, Porph.Abst.3.3. esp. of language, fwnh\ b. A.Ag.1051, Pl.Prt.341c; glw=ssa b. S.Aj.1263, cf. Hdt.2.57, Str. l. c. supr., etc.; sullrafai/ Hippias 6 D.; of birds, Ar.Av.199. Adv., barba/rws, w)no/mastai have
foreign names, Str.10.3.17. Gramm., of
bad Greek, Gell.5.20.5; to\ b., of style, opp. *(ellhniko/n, S.E.M.1.64. after the Persian war,
brutal, rude, a)maqh\s kai\ b. Ar.Nu. 492; to\ th=s fu/sews b. kai\ qeoi=s e)xqro/n D.21.150; skaio\s kai\ b. to\n tro/pon Id.26.17; b. a)nhleh/s te Men.Epit.477: Comp. -w/teros X. Eph.2.4: Sup., pa/ntwn barbarw/tatos qew=n Ar.Av.1573, cf. Th.8.98, X.An.5.4.34. used by Jews of
Greeks, LXX2 Ma.2.21. name for various
plasters, Androm. and Herasap.Gal.13.555. (Onomatopoeic acc. to Str.14.2.28.)

barba^ro-stomi/a, h(, (sto/ma)
barbarous way of speaking, Str.14.2.28.

barba^ro/-ths, htos, h(,
nature or
conduct of a ba/rbaros, Tz.H.9.972, Sch.E.Hec.1129.

barba^ro-fwne/w,
speak Greek barbarously, Str.14.2.28.

barba^ro/-fwnos, on,
speaking a foreign tongue, *ka=res Il.2.867; of the Persians, Orac. ap. Hdt.8.20,9.43.
speaking bad Greek, Str. 14.2.28.

barba^r-o/w,
make barbarous: only used in Pass.,
to become barbarous, E.Or.485, Antipho Soph.Oxy.1364.274; oi( barbarwqe/ntes to/poi PLond.5.1674.22 (vi A. D.); kakw=| kla/zontas oi)/strw| kai\ bebarbarwme/nw|
unintelligible, of birds, S.Ant.1002.

barba^r-w/dhs, es,
barbaric, Sch.Ar.Pax752: Comp., Tz.H.4.601.

ba/rbi^los, h(,
seedling peach-tree, Gp.10.13.5 (v.l. bra/bilos).

barbi^t-i/zw,
play on the barbiton, Ar.Fr.752.

barbi^t-isth/s, ou=, o(,
player on the barbiton, name of play by Magnes, Sch.Ar.Eq. 519.

ba/rbi^t-os, h( or o(,
musical instrument of many strings (polu/xordos Theoc.16.45), invented by Terpander, Pi.Fr.125; freq. used for
the lyre, Anacr.143, B.Scol.Oxy.1361.1.1, E.Cyc.40, Ar.Th.137, etc.: fem. in Anacreont.23.3, but masc. in 14.34: in earlier Poets the gender is not determined:—later ba/rbi^ton, to/, as in Latin, Neanth. 5, D.H.7.72, Ath.4.175e, etc. (Prob. a foreign word, Str.10.3.17.)

barbi^t-w|do/s, o/n,
singing to the barbiton, Luc.Lex.14.
barbo/s, o(, = mu/stron, Ar.Fr.341.
bardh=n: to\ bia/zesqai gunai=kas (Ambrac.), Hsch.; cf. bardi/sagnos: o( ta\s gunai=kas biazo/menos, Suid., Zonar.
ba/rdistos, h, on, poet. for bra/distos, Sup. of bradu/s, Il.23.310, Theoc.15.104, Doroth.(?)ap.Heph.Astr.3.30: Comp. bardu/teros Theoc.29.30.

ba/rdoi, oi(,
poets of the Celts, bards, Posidon.23, D.S.5.31, Str.4.4.4. ba/rdos, o(,
sumpter animal, BGU276.11 (iii A. D.).
bardu/nw, = bradu/nw, Babr.110.4.

bare/w, Aeol. bor-, v. infr., fut. -h/sw Luc.DMort.10.4: pf. beba/rhka D.C.78.17:—Pass., v. infr.:—
weigh down, depress, barh/sei tau=ta to\ porqmei=on Luc. l. c. (censured, Id.Sol.7); th\n th=s di/khs r(oph\n b. Procop.Arc.14; o(/tan ta\ pra/gmata barh=| tou\s a)ntidi/kous Hermog. Inv.2.7; i(/na mh\ th\n po/lin barw=men IG14.830.15 (Puteoli), cf. POxy. 1159.2 (iii A. D.); to\ e)/qnos e)ba/rei tai=s ei)sforai=s J.BJ2.14.1, cf. D.C. l. c.:—Pass., kh=r . . bo/rhtai Sapph.Supp.25.17; b. dia/ tina Diog. Oen.64, cf. POxy.525.3 (ii A. D.); b. tw=| e)kfori/w| PGiss.6.7 (ii A. D.): c. acc.,
to be indignant at, au)tw=n th\n eu)ge/neian Hdn.8.8.1; ou(\s barou=ntai M.Ant.8.44.
charge an account, POxy.126.8 (vi A. D.). intr. in Ep. pf. part. bebarhw/s
weighed down, heavy, oi^nw| bebarho/tes Od.3.139, cf. 19.122:—later, pf. part. Pass. bebarhme/nos, mequsqei\s tou= ne/ktaros b. hu(=den Pl.Smp.203b; oi)/nw| b. Ph.1.373; tou\s o)fqalmou\s b. u(p' oi)/nou ib.377; w)di/nessin Theoc.17.61; u(/pnw| AP 7.290 (Stat. Flacc.), Gp.13.1.8, Ev.Luc.9.32 (without u(/pnw| Ev.Matt. 26.43); b. ta\ pro/swpa pe/nqei Plu.Aem.34; ta\ sw/mata plhsmonh=| b. Id.Mar.19; gunh\ polloi=s e)/tesi b. PTeb.327.25 (ii A. D.); oi(=on bebarhme/nos as though
pregnant, Plot.3.8.8:—Pass., pres. bare/etai Hp. Morb.4.49: aor. e)barh/qhn Parth.9.8: pf. beba/rhtai Placit.3.12.2.

ba/rhkes,
gums, cheeks, or
particles of food adhering to the teeth; also, = tolu/ph, EM188.37.

ba/r-hma [ba^],atos, to,
burden, load, v.l. in D H.10.16.

ba/r-hsis, ews, h(,
pressure, oppression, Iamb.Protr.21.ke/: pl., SIG888.141 (Thrace, iii A. D.).

ba_ri/bas [i^], o(,
one that goes in a boat, S.Fr.517.
bari/h, h(, = ba/ros, tou= h)e/ros Aret.SD1.11 (sed leg. a)pori/h).
bari=nos, o(, v.l. for ba/lagros (q.v.).
ba/rion: pro/baton and ba/rixoi: a)/rnes (Lacon.), Hsch. (b for v, cf. a)rh/n, a)/rixa.）

ba=ris, idos (also-ews J.AJ14.16.2, cf.
Et.Gud., AB84), Ion. ios, h(: acc. ba=rin J.AJ10.11.7, Iamb.Myst.6.5; dat. ba/rei J.AJ11.4.6: pl. ba/reis LXX 2 Ch.36.19, al., Ion. ba/ries Hdt.2.41; gen. bare/wn LXX Ps. 44(45).8; poet. dat. pl. bari/dessi A.Pers.553 (lyr.):—
flat-bottomed boat, used in Egypt, Id.Supp.874(lyr.), Hdt.2.41,96,179, PHib.100.13(iii B.C.), Procop.Aed.1.6; ba/rbaroi ba/rides E.IA297(lyr.); of Odysseus'
raft, Lyc.747. later,
large house, tower, LXX Ps. 44(45).8,Da.8.2,al.,J.ll.cc., Kalinka
Antike Denkmälerin Bulgarien 142 (Apollonia, ii A.D.); le/getai b. h( oi)ki/a, w(s *posei/dippos, kai\ h( sunoiki/a w(s *)/eforos St.Byz. (Egyptian word.)

bari/ths [i_], ou, o(, a
bird, Dionys.Av.3.2.
ba/rixoi, v. ba/rion.
barka/zw: barbari/zw, EM188.43. ba/rkalis, v. bw/kkalis.

barki/wn, name of an
Egyptian plant, Hsch. barmi/gkallos: u(pe/rkallos, Id.
ba/rmos, o(, = ba/rbitos, Alc.Supp.23.4, Phillisap.Ath.14.636c:— also ba/rwmos, Euph.Fr.Hist.8.
ba/rnaka: a)/gria la/xana du/spluta, EM291.46 (cf. bra/kana).
ba/rna^mai, = ma/rnamai, IG12.943, 9(1).868(Corc.).

ba/ros [a^], ous, Ion. eos, to/,
weight, Hdt.2.73, etc.
a weight, burden, load, te/knwn A.Ch.1000, etc.; b. perisso\n gh=s S.Fr.945: pl., ba/rh
weights, Arist.Mech.850a30.
oppressiveness, to\ th=s o)smh=s a)fo/rhton b. LXX 2 Ma.9.10; ba/ros fe/rein to give
trouble, tini/ POxy.1062.14 (ii A.D.).
heaviness, torpor, b. narkw=des Plu. 2.345b; splhno\s ba/rea Hp.Acut.（Sp.）4; ba/rh kai\ dusaresth/mata perh.
feeling of oppression, Antyll. ap. Stob.4.37.15. metaph.,
heavy weight, sigh=s b. S.Ant.1256; ba/ros phmonh=s, sumfora=s, Id.El. 939, Tr.325; xrh\ tou= ba/rous metadido/nai toi=s fi/lois X.Mem.2.7.1; w(/sper ba/rous metalamba/nein Arist EN1171a31; ta\ b. o(/sa yuxh\n kaqe/lkoi Ph.2.674: hence alone,
grief, misery, A.Pers.946(lyr., pl.), S. OC409; kefalh=s po/nos kai\ b. Arist.HA603b8; to\ b. e)/xein Id.EN 1126a23; e)n sunoxai=s kai\ ba/resi Vett.Val.292.6; of
oppressive demands, b. tw=n e)pitagma/twn, tw=n fo/rwn, Plb.1.31.5, 1.67.1; th=s leitourgi/as BGU159.5 (iii A. D.); ou)ke/ti duna/meqa fe/rein ta\ b. SIG888.67(Thrace, iii A. D.); koufi/sai ta\ b. PGiss.7.13 (ii A. D.). in good sense,
abundance, plou/tou, o)/lbou, E.El.1287, IT416; ai)w/nion b. do/chs 2 Ep.Cor.4.17;
strength, stratope/dwn Plb.1.16.4; b. th=s u(lakh=s
violence of . . , Alciphr.3.18.
weight, influence, Plb.4.32.7, D.S.19.70, Plu.Per.37, etc.;
gravity, dignity of character, Id.2.522e; opp. xa/ris, Id.Demetr.2. Gramm.,
stress of accent, A.D. Synt.98.1. in Music, = baru/ths,
low pitch, Aristid.Quint.1.11.

ba=ros, o(, or ba=ron, to/, a kind of
spice, Mnesim.4.62.

ba^roulko/s (sc. mhxanh/), h(,
lifting-screw, invented by Archimedes, Papp.1060, al., prob. in Vitr.10.1.1.
ba/rpurgos: pormei=o peri\ a)mfwdw=n, Hsch. barraxei=n: h)xei=n, skirta=n, Id. barrei=: a)polei=, Id.

baru/, to/,
perfume used in incense, AB225.

ba^ru^-a_h/s, e/s,
breathing hard, u(/pnos Opp.C.3.421.
strong-smelling, Nic.Th.43.

ba^ru^-algh/s, e/s,
