grievously suffering, Orph.H. 69.7. = sq., nou=sos Epigr.Gr.228（Ephesus), 803（Delos).

ba^ru^-a/lghtos, on,
very grievous, neut. pl., -a/lghta kagxa/zein S.Aj.199 (lyr.).

ba^ru^-a_xh/s, e/s, Dor. for baruhxh/s, tau=roi
bellowing, B.15.18; *)wkeano/s, brontai/, Ar.Nu.278, Av. 1750; me/lissai Lyr.Alex.Adesp.7.15.
awakening sore lament, S.OC1561, Sch. (al. baruaxei=).

ba^ru^-ba/mwn [a_m], on, gen. onos,
slowly moving, flo/c Man.4.318.

ba^ru^-bo/as, ou, o(,
heavy-sounding, porqmo\s *)axe/rontos Pi.Fr.143.2.

ba^ru^-breme/ths, ou, o(,
loud-thundering, *zeu/s S.Ant.1117:—also ba^ru^-bromh/ths pe/tros prob. in AP7.394（Phil.):—fem. ba^ru^-breme/teira Orph.H.10.25.

ba^ru^-brw/s, o(, h(, gen. brw=tos,
gnawing, corroding, sto/nos S.Ph.695(lyr.).

ba^ru^/-gdoupos, on,
loud-thundering, loud-roaring, *zeu/s Pi.O.8.44; a)/nemoi Id.P.4.210, cf. AP9.674; e)/rwtes Ion Lyr.9.3.
ba^ru^-ge/tas: a)lazw/n, EM206.23, cf. Hsch.

ba^ru^/-glwssos, on,
grievous of tongue, v.l. for baqu-, LXXEz.3.5.

ba^ru^/-gounos, on,
heavy-kneed, lazy, Call.Del. 78, Coluth.121:—also ba^ru^-gou/natos Theoc.18.10.

ba^ru^/-guios, on,
weighing down the limbs, wearisome, ke/leuqa Opp.H.5.63; nou=sos AP6.190.9 (Gaet.).

ba^ru^-daimone/w,
to be grievously unlucky, Ar.Eq. 558.

ba^ru^-daimoni/a, h(,
grievous ill-luck, Antipho2.2.2.
surliness, churlishness, Lys.4.9, Ph.1.487,558.

ba^ru^-dai/mwn, on, gen. onos,
pressed by a heavy fate, luckless, po/lis Alc.37 A, cf. E.Alc.865, Ar.Ec. 1102, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.162.30.
ba^ru^-da/kruos, on, = sq., Nonn.D.40.194.

ba^ru^/-dakrus, u,
weeping grievously, a)hdw/n AP9.262 (Phil.).
baruda/nin, baru/dan (leg. bari/ban h)\ bariba/n）: to\n nausiba/thn, Hsch.

baru/-desmos [u^], on,
loaded with chains, Nonn.D.25.140, al.

baru/-di^kos, on,
taking heavy vengeance, poina/ A.Ch.936.

ba^ru/dion, Dim. of ba/ros,
small weight, f.l. for baru/llion, Hero Spir.2.4.

ba^ru^-do/teira, h(,
giver of ill gifts, *moi=ra A.Th.977.
ba^ru^/-doupos, on, = baru/gdoupos (q.v.), Mosch.2.120; qrh=nos Epigr.Gr.344.13.
ba^ru^-dro/mou: megalofw/nou, Hsch. (fort. barubr-).

ba^ru^-egke/fa^los, o(,
heavy-headed, Epicur.Fr.237.

ba^ru^-erge/w,
plough deep, Gp.2.23.14（Pass.).

ba^ru^-ergh/s, e/s,
strongly influenced, e)s ta\ toiau=ta App.BC1.83.

ba^ru/-zhlos, on,
exceeding jealous or
envious, Lyc.57; *)/erws AP 5.242（Maced.).

ba^ru-hkoe/w,
to be hard of hearing, Hp.Morb.2.4.

ba^ru-hkoi/+a, h(,
hardness of hearing, Id.Aph.3.17.

ba^ru-h/koos, on, (a)kou/w)
hard of hearing, Aret.SD1.4, Poll.2.81. Act.,
impairing the hearing, no/toi Hp.Aph.3.5, cf. Ph.2.99, S.E.M.6.49.
ba^ru/-hxos, on, = foreg., AB225: Sup. -hxo/tatos Agath.5.8.

ba^ru/-qroos, on,
deep- or
loud-sounding, Mosch.2.123.

ba^ru-qu_me/w,
to be weighed down: to be melancholy or
indignant, LXXNu.15.16, App.BC2.20; e)pi/ tini D.S. 20.41:—Med., Plu.Sull.6.

ba^ru/-qu_mos, on,
heavy in spirit: indignant, sullen, o)rgh/ E.Med.176, cf. Call.Cer.81, etc.; opp. o)cu/qumos, Plu.2.13e: Sup., Phld.Ir.p.64 W. Adv. -mws, e)/xein Alciphr. 2.3; rejected by Poll.3.99.

ba^ru/qw [u^],
to be weighed down, baru/qei de/ moi w)=mos u(p' au)tou= [tou= e(/lkeos] Il.16.519; baru/qei de/ q' u(p' au)th=s (sc. u(/brews) Hes.Op.215; kama/tw| A.R.2.47; u(po\ ku/matos Nic.Th.135. abs.,
to be heavy, sta/la AP7.481 (Philet.); baru/qeske . . gui=a A.R.1.43:—Pass., Max. 212, Q.S.13.6.
ba/ruka: ai)doi=on (Tarent.), Hsch. baru/kan: sfu=ran, Id.

ba^ru^-ka/rdios, on,
heavy, slow of heart, LXXPs.4.2.

ba^ru^-karpe/w,
bear a heavy crop of fruit, Aegyptus 5.129 (ii B. C.).

ba^ru^-ke/fa^los, on,
large- or
heavy-headed, of dogs, Arr.Cyn.4.4. metaph.,
top-heavy, Vitr.3.3.5.

ba^ru^/-kompos, on,
loud-roaring, le/ontes Pi.P. 5.57.

ba^ru^/-kotos, on,
heavy in wrath, A.Eu.780 (lyr.).

ba^ru^/-ktu^pos, on,
heavy-sounding, loud-thundering, epith. of Zeus, h.Cer.3, Hes. Op.79; of Poseidon, Id.Th.818, Pi.O.1.72, Pae.4.41; also of the sea, AP9.753 (Claudian).

ba^ru^-lai=lay, a^pos, o(, h(,
loud-storming, au)=rai ib.247 (Phil.).

ba^ru/llion, to/, Dim. of ba/ros:
instrument to find the weight of liquids, Hero Spir.1.39, al.

ba^ru/-lu_pos, on,
very sad, Plu.2.114f（Sup.).

ba^ru/-mastos, on,
with large, heavy breasts, Str.17.3.4.

ba^ru-melh/s, e/s, (me/los)
with heavy limbs, Sch.Opp.H. 1.360.

ba^ru-mhnia/w,
to be exceedingly wrathful, Hld.1.15.
ba^ru-mh/nios, on, Dor. ba^ru-ma/nios, = sq., h(/rws Theoc.15.138.

ba^ru/-mhnis, i,
heavy in wrath, exceeding wrathful, dai/mwn A.Ag.1482; h( b. *klwqw/ IG14.1466; of persons, Ph.2.94,al., Hld.7.20: baru/mhni, to/, Ph.2.108.
ba^ru/-mhnos, on, = foreg., pro/swpa Doroth.(?) ap.Heph.Astr.3.4.

ba^ru/-misqos, on,
largely paid, grasping, AP5.1.

ba^ru/-moxqos, on,
toilsome, grammatikh/ AP10.97（Pall.);
painful, oi)=stros Nonn.D.42.170.
hard-working, ku/wn ib.5.469; epith. of Heracles, APl.4.102.

ba^ru^mwroka/rdios, on,
stubborn and foolish, Sm.Pr.14.14.

ba/run-sis [a^], ews, h(,
oppression, annoyance, Artem.1.17.
weighing down, Plot.4.3.15.

barun-te/on,
one must mark with the grave accent, Sch.Il.14.264.
one must bear hardly, D.Chr.7.115.

barun-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
weighing down, Arist.Cael.310a32.
retracting the accent, *ai)olei=s EM548.19, AB663.

baru/n-w, Pi.P.1.84, Pl.Phdr.247b: impf., Od.5.321: fut. -u^nw= X.Ap.9: aor. e)ba/ru_na Plu.2.127c, etc.:—Pass., pres., Il.19.165, etc.: fut. barunqh/somai S.Fr.697, Plb.5.94.9, LXXSi.3.26: aor. e)baru/nqhn Il.20.480, etc.: pf. beba/rummai Hp.Ep.17, Arist.Phgn. (v. infr.), LXX Na.2.9 (10): (baru/s):—
weigh down, oppress, depress, ei(/mata ga/r r(' e)ba/rune Od.5.321; ba/rune de/ min do/ru makro\n e(lko/menon Il.5.664, etc.; h)/n se baru/nh| di/yos Epigr. ap. Sotion p.39 W.:—Pass., la/qrh| gui=a baru/netai
he is heavy, i. e.
weary, in limb, Il.19.165; xei=ra barunqei/s
disabled in hand, 20.480; bebaru/nqai
to be oppressed by surfeit, etc., Arist.Phgn.810b22, cf. HA582b8, Ph.1.38; u(po\ ko/pou D.H.1.39; baru/nesqai th\n gaste/ra
to be pregnant, Luc.Merc.Cond.34, cf. X.Mem. 2.2.5; to/kois E.IT1228; b. alone, Nonn.D.26.270; baru/netai/ tini to\ ske/los Ar.Ach.220, cf. Pl.Phd.117e; o)/mma b., of one dying, E. Alc.385; baruno/men' e)/nqa kai\ e)/nqa e)k paqe/wn Timo 9; also o(\ au)tai=s e)baru/nqh
weighed upon them, Plot.4.3.15. metaph.,
oppress, weary, a)stw=n a)koa\ kru/fion qumo\n b. Pi.P.1.84; tou\s dikasta/s X.Ap.9; of cold, Arist.Somn.Vig.456b26;
make more grievous, a)ni/an Ph.2.425:— Pass.,
to be oppressed, distressed, Simon,184.5, Pi.N.7.43, S.El.820, Th.8.1; ph/masin
by calamities, A.Ag.836, cf. 189(lyr.); xo/lw| S.Aj. 41; kakh=| o)smh=| Id.Ph.890; o)smh=s Id.Fr.697; cuntuxi/a| Cratin.166; dia/ ti Th.5.7; u(po/ tinwn Nic.Dam.p.38 D.; e)baru/nqh h( kardi/a
was made stubborn, was hardened, LXXEx.8.15(11), al.; also c.acc., ta\ luphra\ th=s tu/xhs D.H.4.14; gh=ras J.BJ1.32.2, cf. Plu. Cor.31, D.Chr.43.6; tina/ Id.40.1, Plu.Thes.32, POxy.298.26(i A.D.); to\n plou=ton
to be overloaded with, Eun.Hist.p.248D.
mark with the grave accent, Hdn.Gr.1.18, A.D.Synt.120.4,Ath.2.52f.—baru/nw 1 is replaced by bare/w in later Greek.

ba^ru/-nwtos [u^], on,
with heavy back, ko/gxai Emp.76.

ba^ru-odmi/a, h(,
oppressiveness of smell, Aret.SA1.5.

ba^ru/-odmos, on,
of oppressive smell, Nic.Th.51, cf.Aret.CA1.6.

ba^ru/-ozos, on, (o)/zw) = foreg., Dsc.5.
106.
ba^ru-olko/s, = baroulko/s, h( b. Tz.H.2.155.

ba^ru-o/pa_s, o(, (o)/y)
loudvoiced, of Zeus, in acc. -a_n, Pi.P.6.24.

ba^ru-o/rghtos, on,
exceeding angry, *pieri/des AP5.106 (Phld.).
ba^ru/-osmos, on, = baru/odmos, Arist.Mir. 831b24, Sor.2.29: Comp., Dsc.3.121. metaph., 'in bad odour', PSI2.158.25.

ba^ru-pa^qe/w,
to be much annoyed, Plu.2.167f(v.l.).

ba^ru-pa/la^mos [pa^], on,
heavy-handed, xo/los Pi.P.11.23.

ba^ru-pe/nqeia, h(,
heavy, deep affliction, Plu.2.118b.

ba^ru-penqh/s, e/s, = sq., Ph.2.269, IG12(5).675.6 (Syros), Orph.Fr.32c:—a fem. form ba^ru-penqa/s Epigr.Gr.367 (Cotiaeum).
causing grievous woe, ma/xai B.13.12; to/ca APl.4.134 (Mel.).

ba^ru-pe/nqhtos, on,
mourning heavily, AP7.743 (Antip.).

ba^ru-pesh/s, e/s,
heavy-falling, pou/s A.Eu.369 (lyr.).

ba^ru-ph/mwn, Dor. ba^ru-pa/mwn, on, gen. onos,
miserable, Hymn.Is.44, Suid.

ba^ru/-ploutos, on,
very wealthy, Nic.Dam.p.144D.

ba^ru-pnei/wn, ontos,
blowing fiercely, a)h=tai Musae.216,309.

ba^ru/-pnoia, h(,
laboured breathing, Sor.2.26.
ba^ru/-pnoos, on, = baruah/s II, Nic.Th.76, Al.338.

ba^ru/-potmos, on, = barudai/mwn, of persons, S.Ph.1096 (lyr.); of sufferings,
grievous, Id.OC1449 (lyr.): Comp. -o/teros Plu2.989e: Sup. -o/tatos Id.TG5, Ph.1.637; but cumfora=s barupotmwta/tas (metri gr.) E.Ph. 1345 (lyr.).

ba^ru/-pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos, of a club,
heavy at the end, APl.4.104 (Phil.).
ba^ru-preph/s, e/s, = megalopreph/s, eu)wxi/a Anon. ap. Suid.

ba^ru/-puknos, on,
in the lower part of the pukno/n (q.v.), fqo/ggoi Aristid.Quint.3.10, Cleonid.Harm.4, etc.

ba^ru-rrh/mwn, on, gen. onos,
using heavy words, Sch.Ar.Ra.863.

ba^ru/s, ei=a, u/, poet. gen. pl. fem. barew=n dub. in A.Eu.932 (anap.): Comp. baru/teros, Sup. baru/tatos:—
heavy in weight, b. a)ei/resqai, opp. kou=fos, Hdt.4.150, cf. Pl.Tht.152d, Arist.Cael.310b25, etc.: in Hom. mostly with collat. notion of
strength and force, xei=ra barei=an Il.1.219, cf. 89; a)kma=| baru/s Pi.I.4(3).51; b. to\ sw=ma App.Mac.14; of athletes, Philostr.Gym.31; o)fru/s
bushy, ib.48; but also,
heavy with age, infirmity or
suffering, no/sw| S.Tr.235; su\n gh/ra| Id.OT17; e)n gh/ra| Id.Aj.1017; u(po\ gh/rws Ael.VH9.1; u(po\ th=s me/qhs Plu.2.596a;
pregnant, PGoodsp.Cair.15.15 (iv A. D.); b. ba/sis
heavy, slow, S.Tr.966; tupa/di barei/a| Id.Fr.844. Adv. kou=fon bare/ws Pl.Tht.189d.
heavy to bear, grievous, a)/th, e)/ris, kako/ths, Il.2.111, 20.55, 10.72; *klw=qes Od.7.197; kh=res Il.21.548; b. kh\r to\ mh\ piqe/sqai A.Ag.206 (lyr.); baru\ or bare/a stena/xein sob
heavily, Od.8.95,534, Il.8.334, etc.: in Trag. and Prose,
burdensome, grievous, oppressive, b. cumfora/, tu/xai, katallagai/, etc., A.Pers.1044 (lyr.), Th.332 (lyr.), 767 (lyr.), etc.; h(donh/ S.OC1204; a)ggeli/a b. h)\n e)n toi=s baru/tat' a)\n e)ne/gkaimi Pl.Cri.43c; po/lemos D.18.241; baru\ kou)xi\ di/kaion Id.21.66; no/sos
causing disgust, S.Ph.1330; au)da/, h)xw/, ib.208 (lyr.), E.Hipp.791;
unwholesome, xwri/on X.Mem.3.6.12; plhsmonh/ Id.Cyn.7.4;
indigestible, Ath.3.115e; b. no/tos Paus.10.17.11. Adv. -e/ws, fe/rein ti take a thing
ill, suffer it
impatiently, Hdt.5.19; b. fe/rein e)pi/ tini Plb.15.1.1 (but b. fe/rein bear
with dignity, D.S.26.3); b. e)/xein, c. part, Arist. Rh.Al. 1424b5; pro/s ti Id.Pol.1311b9; toi=s logi/ois Arg.E.Heracl.: Comp. barute/rws tini\ e)nantiwqh=nai LXX3 Ma.3.1; bare/ws a)kou/ein hear
with disgust, X.An.2.1.9.
violent, o)rgh/ S.Ph.368; mh=nis Id.OC1328; a)pe/xqeiai Pl.Ap.23a (Sup.); qumo/s Theoc.1.96.
weighty, grave, e)pistolai/ 2 Ep.Cor.10.10; ai)tiw/mata Act.Ap.25.7; ta\ baru/tera tou= no/mou Ev.Matt.23.23;
ample, baruta/thn eu)daimoni/an toi=s a)rxome/nois pare/cein Hdn.2.14.3. of persons,
severe, stern, b. e)pitimhth/s A. Pr.77; eu)/qunos Id.Pers.828, cf. S.OT546; *ku/pri barei=a Theoc.1.100;
wearisome, troublesome, E.Supp.894, Pl.Tht.210c, etc.; cu/noikos A. Supp.415, S.Fr.753; gei/tones Plb.1.10.6.
overbearing, semno/teroi h)\ baru/teroi Arist.Rh.1391a27 (but semno\s kai\ b. Str.14.1.42); u(perh/fanoi kai\ b. Plu.2.279c;
important, powerful, po/lis Plb.1.17.5, etc. of soldiers,
heavy-armed, X.Cyr.5.3.37 (s.v.l.); of the o(pli/ths Pl.Lg.833b (Comp.); ta\ b. tw=n o(/plwn Plb.1.76.3.
difficult, o(/rkos ga\r ou)dei\s a)ndri\ fhlh/th| b. S.Fr.933. of impressions on the senses, of sound,
strong, deep, bass, opp. to o)cu/s, Od.9.257, S.Ph.208, Pl.Prt.332c, Arist.EN1125a14, etc.; baru\ a)mbo/ason A.Pers. 572 (lyr.); fqe/ggontai baru/taton a)nqrw/pwn Hp.
Aër.15; baru/tata u(pakou/ein, of diseases, Id.Prorrh.2.39; penqei=n Ael.VH12.1; esp. of musical pitch,
low, opp. o)cu/s, baruta/th xordh/ Pl.Phdr.268e; a)=xos, fwna/, Archyt. I, cf. Arist.EE1235a28, Aristox.Harm.p.3 M.; of accent,
grave, a)nti\ o)cei/as th=s me/shs sullabh=s barei=an e)fqegca/meqa Pl. Cra.399b; o)cei/a| kai\ barei/a| kai\ me/sh| fwnh=| Arist.Rh.1403b30, etc.: hence h( barei=a (sc. prosw|di/a)
accentus gravis, D.T.630.1, etc.; b. ta/sis D.H.Comp.11, A.D.Synt.307.13; b. to/nos D.T.674.13, cf.A.D.Pron. 36.5; b. sullabh/
unaccented, Id.Synt.100.8, al. Adv. bare/ws
with the accent thrown back, Id.Pron.51.1, Ath.2.53b: Comp.-u/teron, opp. o)cu/teron （ou) opp. ou(=), Arist.SE178a3 (but,
on a lower note, au)lei=n Id.GA 788a22). of smell,
strong, offensive, Hdt.6.119. Adv. bare/ws
slowly, e)pispa=sqai Hero Aut.26.6. (
guṛr-u- from
gu[rmacr ]ṛ-u-, Skt.
gurús 'heavy', Lat.
gravis (from fem.
gur[schwa]wī-), Goth.
kaúrus 'heavy'.)
ba^ru^-sarkos, on, = baqu/sarkos, Hippiatr.30 (s.v.l.).

ba^ru^-si/dhros [i^], on,
heavy with iron, Plu.Aem.18.

ba^ru^-skelh/s, e/s,
heavy in the legs, slow, Trag.Adesp.250.

ba^ru^-ski/pwn [i_], on, gen. wnos,
with a heavy club, Call.Fr.120.
ba^ru^-sma/ra^gos [sma^], on, = baru/ktupos, Nonn.D.1.156.

ba^ru^/-splagxnos, on,
ill-tempered, Ph.2.269.

ba^ru^-staqme/w,
weigh heavy, Ps.-Dsc.1.26.

ba^ru^/-staqmos, on,
weighing heavy, Ar.Ra.1397, Canthar.2, Arist.EN1142a22; no/misma Plu.Lys.17.
ba^ru^-ste/naktos, on, = baru/stonos, Sch.Opp.H.5.152.

ba^ru^-stena/xwn [na^], ousa,
sobbing heavily, better written baru\ st-divisim, Il.1.364, etc.

ba^ru^/-stomos, on,
heavy in pronunciation, of the first syllable of skh=ptron, Phld.Po.2.14 (dub.).
of heavy, i.e.
abusive, mouth, Nonn.D.48.420. of a weapon,
cutting deeply, Opp.H.4.481.

ba^ru^/-stonos, on,
groaning heavily, toi=s barusto/nois e)pikaloume/nois . . u(pokritai=s nicknamed
the bellowers, D.18.262, cf. Epicur.Fr.114,237;
resounding, li/qos AP9.246 (Marc. Arg.). Adv. -nws A.Eu.794. of things,
heavily lamented, grievous, S.OT 1233, Orac. ap. Paus.10.9.11.

ba^ru^-su/mforos, on,
weighed down by ill-luck, in Sup.-w/tatos Hdt.1.45, App.Mac.19. Adv. -w/tata D.C.78.41. Act.,
calamitous, po/lemos Them.Or.15.184c (Sup.).

ba^ru^-sfa/ra^gos [fa^], on, = barusma/ragos,
loud-thundering, of *zeu/s, Pi.I.8(7).23.

ba^ru^/-swmos, on,
heavy in body, Sch.Pi.N.8.41.

ba^ru^-ta/lantos [ta^], on, =
weighing heavily, Zonar. s.v. o(lko/s.

ba^ru^-tarbh/s, e/s,
terrifying, ei)kw/n A.Fr.57.11.

ba^ru^-telh/s, e/s,
heavily taxed, PLond.5.1674.33 (vi A. D.).

ba^ru^-ti_me/w,
raise the price of goods, EM759.5, Suid. s.v. timoulke/w.

ba^ru^/-ti_mos, on,
punishing severely, of the gods below, A.Supp. 24.
very costly, Str.17.1.13, Ev.Matt.26.7.
selling dearly, Hld.2.30 (s.v.l.).

ba^ru^/-tlhtos, Dor. ba^ru^/-tla_tos, on,
bearing heavy weight, dub. in Naumach. ap. Stob.4.22.32;
unfortunate, *)attiki/h b. AP7.343. Pass.,
ill to bear, sumfora/ B.13.4; o)du/nai APl.4.245 (Leont.).

ba^ru^-tone/w,
pronounce with the grave accent, D.H.2.58: abs.,
use the grave accent, Cleonid.Harm.12.

ba^ru^-to/nhsis, ews, h(,
grave accentuation, Eust.70.45.

ba^ru^-tonhte/os, a, on,
to be marked with the grave accent, Sch.Ar.Ra.864, al.

ba^ru^/-tonos, on, (to/nos)
deep-sounding, b. fwnei=n, of dogs, Arist.Phgn.813b2; so prob. b. sth=qos X.Cyn.5.30;
deep, of musical notes, Bacch.Harm.32. Gramm., of enclitics,
unaccented, A.D.Pron.35.25; of words,
not oxytone, ib.38.12, D.T.674.18, etc. Adv. -nws POxy.1012 Fr.16.16, Eust.41.3, Moer.109.

ba^ru^/-u+pnos, on,
sleeping heavily, Nonn.D.48.765.
ba^ru^-fqe/gkths, ou, o(, = sq., le/wn Pi.Fr.239.

ba^ru^/-fqonos, on,
heavy with envy, xei/r Epigr.Gr.376a (Aezani), al.

ba^ru^/-floisbos, on,
loud-roaring, gene/qlh Procl.H.1.20.

ba^ru^/-fortos, on,
heavy-burdened, i.e.
pregnant, Nonn.D.48.769.

ba^ru^-frosu/nh, h(,
melancholy, Plu.2.710f (pl.),
Fr.inc.146;
indignation, Id.Cor.21, Porph ap.Stob.1.49.60 (prob.).

ba^ru^-fwne/w,
utter low-pitched sounds, Arist.Pr.900b13.

ba^ru^-fwni/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
deepness of voice, a bass voice, Hp.
Aër.8, Alex.311, Arist.GA786b35.

ba^ru^/-fwnos, on,
with a deep, bass voice, opp. o)cu/fwnos, Hp.
Aër. 6, Arist.GA786b7, etc.

ba^ru^/-xeilos, on,
thick-lipped, APl.2.20 (Ammian.).

ba^ru^-xei/mwn, on, gen. wnos,
with heavy storms, Theognost.Can. 460.

ba^ru^/-xordos, on,
deep-toned, fqo/ggos AP12.187 (Strat.).

ba^ru^/-xrous, oun,
deep-coloured, v.l. for baqu-, Dsc.5.94.

ba^ru^/-yu_xos, on,
heavy of soul, dejected, S.Aj.319, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.198.
ba^ru^-w/dhs, es, （o)/zw） = baru/odmos, Nic.Th.895.

ba^ru^-w/du^nos, on, (o)du/nh)
suffering grievous pangs, Nonn.D.47.163.
causing grievous pangs, ib.48.808.

ba^ru^-wpe/w,
to be dim-sighted, LXX Ge.48.10.
basa/: ai)sxu/nh: o(/ e)sti dru=s, Hsch. basagei=: a)lesxoi=, Id.
basagi/koros, = o( qa=sson sunousia/zwn, Hippon.107.

ba^sa^n-astra^ga/lh [ga^], Dor.ba^/sa^n-a, h(,
plague of the joints, of the gout, in voc., Luc.Trag.199.
ba^sa^n-eu/w, = -i/zw, Hsch. (Pass.).

ba^sa^n-hdo/n, Adv.
by means of torture, Man.4.197.

ba^sa^n-i/zw, Att. fut. -i^w= Ar.Ra. 802, 1121, Ec.748: aor. e)basa/nisa, subj. basani/sw v.l. in Id.Ra.618 cod. R:—Pass., aor. e)basani/sqhn: pf. bebasa/nismai:—
rub upon the touch-stone (ba/sanos）, xruso/n Pl.Grg.486d: hence,
put to the test, prove, Arist.GA747a3 (Pass.), etc.;
investigate scientifically, Hp.
Aër.3; of the instances used in inductive inference, a)po\ tw=n pantaxo/qen bebasanisme/nwn [metabai/nomen] Phld.Sign.29. of persons,
examine closely, cross-question, Hdt.1.116, 2.151, Ar.Ach.110, Ra.802, etc.; bebasanisme/nos ei)s dikaiosu/nhn
having his love of justice
put to the test, Pl.R.361c, cf. 413e, Smp.184a; u(po\ dakru/wn basani/zesqai, i.e.
to be convicted of being painted by tears (washing off the cosmetic), X.Oec.10.8.
question by applying torture, torture, rack (v. ba/sanosIII), Ar.Ra.616,618; [dou/lous] pa/ntas paradi/dwmi basani/sai Antipho 2.4.8, cf. 5.36:—Pass.,
to be put to the torture, Th.7.86, Lys.4.14, Arist.Rh.Al.1443b31; ai)wni/ois a)moibai=s basanisqhso/menoi pro\s tw=n qew=n Phld.D.1.19;
to be tortured by disease (censured by Luc.Sol.6), Ev.Matt.8.6; u(po\ tw=n kuma/twn ib.14.24; of animals, Philostr.VA 1.38: metaph. of the earth, ib.6.10. metaph. of style,
strain, Longin.10.6; bebasanisme/nos
forced, unnatural, D.H.Th.55.

ba^sa^n-ismo/s, o(,
torture: o( ga\r *kori/nqios (sc. oi)=nos） b. e)sti Alex.290, cf. Apoc.9.5.

ba^sa^n-iste/os, a, on,
to be proved or
tested under suffering, Ar.Lys. 478, Pl.R.540a. basaniste/on
one must put to the test, prove, tina/ ib.503d, Max.Tyr.24.4, Gal.17(1).337, Jul.Or.7.226a, Them. Or.23.287c;
one must put to the torture, D.29.35.

ba^sa^n-isth/rion, to/,
question-chamber, Theopomp.Com.63, Polyaen.8.62, Phalar.Ep.82, 115; of the stocks, Sm.Je.20.2. in pl.,
instruments of torture,
Plu.2.315d, Charito 4.2, Them.Or.13.175c.
touchstone, test, xrusou=, porfu/ras ib.21.247b: metaph., ib.248a.

ba^sa^n-isth/rios, on,
of or
for torture, o)/rgana J.BJ2.8.10.

ba^sa^n-isth/s, ou=, o(,
examiner, questioner, torturer, Antipho 5.32, D.37.40, Plu.2.498d;
gaoler, Ev. Matt.18.34.
one who tests, Them.Or.21.247c:—fem. ba^sa^n-i/stria,
examiner, e)pw=n Ar.Ra.826.

ba^sa^n-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
given to or
for torturing, Vett.Val.78.15, AB306, EM769.11.
for testing, Them. Or.21.247c.
ba^sa^n-i/ths li/qos, = sq., Hsch.

ba^/sa^n-os, h(,
touchstone, on which pure gold leaves a yellow streak, e)s ba/sanon d' e)lqw\n paratri/bomai w(/ste molu/bdw| xruso/s Thgn.417; xruso\n tribo/menon basa/nw| Id.450, cf. 1105; paratri/besqai pro\s ta\s b. Arist.Col.793b1, cf. HA 597b2: metaph., b. tou= a)rw/matos (sc. tou= kinnamw/mou） th\n ai)=ga ei)=nai Philostr.VA3.4.
the use of this as a test, xruso\s e)n b. pre/pei Pi.P.10.67: generally,
test, trial of genuineness, ou)k e)/stin mei/zwn b. xro/nou [Simon.]175.1; do/men ti basa/nw| e)s e)/legxon Pi.N.8.20; sofo\s w)/fqh basa/nw| q' a(du/polis S.OT510 (lyr.), cf. 494; ba/sanon lamba/nein peri/ tinos Pl.Lg.648b; ei)s b. ei)= xerw=n wilt come to
a trial of strength, S. OC835; plou=tos b. a)nqrw/pou tro/pwn Antiph.232.5; [no/sou] e)/sx' e)pi\ soi\ ba/sanon had
experienced it in you, i. e. you had had it first, IG14.1320; ba/sanon u(pokei/sontai will be subjected to
a test, of candidates, POxy.58.25 (iii A. D.).
inquiry by torture, e)s pa=san b. a)pikne/esqai Hdt.8.110; ei)s b. ai)tei=n Herod.2.88; e)ceta/sai dia\ basa/nwn SIG780.12 (Astypalaea, Aug.); esp. at Athens, used to extort evidence from slaves, ei)s b. de/xesqai Antipho1.12; ei)s b. paradou=nai Is.8.17; e)k basa/nwn ei)pei=n ib.12: in pl.,
confession upon torture, D. 53.24, Hyp.Fr.5, Arist.Rh.1355b37.
agony of battle, h( kata\ to\ e)/rgon b. S.E.M.6.24;
tortures of disease, Ev.Matt.4.24; cf. e)pa/grupnos b. Vett.Val.211.28; also yuxikai/ Id.182.19;
torments of hell,Ev.Luc.16.23.
trespass-offering, LXX 1 Ki.6.17.—Oriental word.
ba^sei/dion, to/, Dim. of ba/sis, BGU781iii6 (i A. D.).
basi/arc, dub. in BGU630i22 (ii A. D.).

ba^si/l-eia^ [i^], h(, basile/a Pi.N.1.39: fem. of basileu/s:—
queen, princess, Od.4.770, A.Ag.84 (lyr.), Hdt.1.11, etc.; of goddesses, *ku/pris b. Emp.128.3, cf. Hymn.Is.I, etc.; b. qea/ Ar.Pax974; b. gu/nai A.Pers.623 (lyr.), E.El.988 (lyr.).

ba^sil-ei/a_, Ion. ba^sil-hi/+h, h(,
kingdom, dominion, Hdt.1.11, etc.; paido\s h( b. Heraclit.52;
hereditary monarchy, opp. turanni/s, e)pi\ r(htoi=s ge/rasi patrikai\ b. Th.1.13; basilei/as ei)/dh te/ttara Arist.Pol.1285b20; h( prw/th politei/a meta\ ta\s b. after
the age of monarchies, ib.1297b17: metaph., e)poi/hsen h(ma=s b. Apoc.1.6; b. tw=n ou)ranw=n Ev.Matt.3.2; tou= qeou= ib.6.33, etc.
kingly office, b. kai\ strathgi/a Arist.Pol.1273a37. at Athens,
the office of the archon basileu/s, Paus.1.3.1. Pass.,
being ruled by a king, th=s u(p' e)kei/nou basilei/as Isoc.9.43.
diadem, D.S.1.47, OGI90.43 (Rosetta).
reign, ib.331.40 (Pergam.), D.S.17.1, POxy.1257.7(iii A. D.); so ai( b.
the reigns of the Kings, title of book of VT;
accession to the throne, BGU646.12 (ii A. D.). concrete,
His Majesty, LXX 4 Ki.11.1, 1 Ma.6.47.

ba^sil-eia/w, Desid.,
aim at royalty, Com.Adesp.958, J.
BJ Praef.2, 1.4.1.

ba^sil-ei/dhs, ou, o(,
prince, tw=n de/ka basileidw=n Pl.Criti.116c.

ba^sil-ei/dion, to/, Dim. of basileu/s,
tiny king, Plu.Ages.2.

ba^si/l-eion, Ion. ba^sil-h/i+on, to/,
kingly dwelling, palace, X.Cyr.2.4.3, etc.; more common in pl., Hdt.1.30, 178, Arist.Oec.1352a11, etc.
seat of empire, capital, Plb.3.15.3, D.S.19.18, Str.1.2.25.
royal treasury, Hdt.2.149: pl., Isoc. 3.31.
tiara, diadem, LXX 2 Ki.1.10, Roussel
Cultes Égyptiens 233 (Delos, ii B.C.), OGI90.45 (Rosetta), Plu.2.358d, Porph. ap. Eus. PE3.11, Horap.1.15: metaph., to\ b. th=s eu)prepei/as
diadem of beauty, LXX Wi.5.16. = a(/limos, Ps.-Dsc.1.91; = leuko/i+on, Id.3.123. *basi/leia, ta/,
festival of Zeus Basileus, in Boeotia, IG7.552, Sch.Pi.O.7.153, IG12(1).78; at Olbia, IPE1.105.

ba^si/l-eios, on, also a, on A.Pers.589, IG12.115; Ion. and Aeol. ba^sil-h/i+os, h, on, also ba^sil-h=|os Melinnoap.Stob.3.7.12, Hymn.Is.138:—
royal, deino\n de\ ge/nos basilh/i+o/n e)sti ktei/nein Od.16.401; o( b. qro/nos Hdt.1.14, etc.; used by Trag. in lyr., b. oi)=koi, me/laqra, A.Ag.157, Ch.343; i)sxu/s, tia/ra, Id.Pers.589,661; no/stos o( b.
the king's return, ib.8; toi=s b. no/mois S.Ant.382; cf. ph=xus.
of the archon basileu/s, h( b. stoa/ IG12.115, Arist.Ath.7.1, Paus.1.3.1 (also of the
basilica of Herod at Jerusalem, J.AJ15.11.5). 'royal', i.e.
choice, mu/ron Sapph.Supp.23.19, Crates Com.2; cf. basi/leia: ge/nos i)sxa/dwn, Hsch. *)/artemis basilhi/+h, divinity in Thrace, Hdt.4.33.

ba^si^l-eu/s, o(, gen. e/ws, Ep. h=os, Cypr. h=vos Inscr.Cypr.104,135H.: acc. basile/a, contr. -h= Orac. ap. Hdt.7.220, E.Fr.781.24 (lyr.): nom. pl. basilei=s, Aeol. -hes Sapph.Supp.6.4, IG12(2).6 (Mytil.), -eies ib. 646a45, al., Ep. -h=es, old Att. -h=s S.Aj.188,960 (both lyr.), cf. Hdn. Gr.1.430: acc. pl. basile/as IG12.115, later basilei=s ib.2.243, etc.:—
king, chief, Hom., etc.: freq. with collat. sense of
captain or
judge, Hes. Op.202; diotrefe/es b. Il.2.445, etc.; qei=oi Od.4.691, etc.; later,
hereditary king, opp. tu/rannos, Arist.EN1160b3, etc.; but also of tyrants, as Hiero, Pi.O.1.23; of Gelo, Hdt.7.161; of Pisistratus, Eup.123, cf. Sch. Ar.Ach.61: joined with a Subst., basileu\s a)nh/r Il.3.170, etc.; a)nh\r b. Hdt.1.90; a)/nac b. lord
king, A.Pers.5, cf. B.17.1: c. gen., b. new=n A. Ag.114 (anap.); oi)wnw=n b., of the eagle, ibid., Pi.O.13.21: Comp. basileu/teros
more kingly, Il.9.160,392, Od.15.533, Tyrt.12.7: Sup. basileu/tatos Il.9.69. of the gods, *zeu\s qew=n b. Hes.Th.886, cf. Pi.O.7.34, Emp.128.2, etc. (in this sense Hom. uses a)/nac); as cult title of Zeus, IG7.3073.90 (Lebad.), SIG1014.110 (Erythrae), etc. (but *zeu\s b., = Ahuramazda, X.Cyr.3.3.21, al., Arr.An.4.20.3); o( me/gas b., of
God, LXX Ps.47(48).2, Ph.2.107: Sup. basileu/tatoi tw=n qew=n Max.Tyr.29.5. as a title of rank,
prince, b. ei)si\ kai\ a)/lloi polloi\ e)n . . *)iqa/kh| Od.1.394, cf. 8.390, etc.; of Cyrus, X.Oec. 4.16.
descendant of a royal house, esp. in Ionia, Arist.Ath. 41.3; basile/wn oi)=koi 'estates
of the royal house', name of a district in Chios, *)aqhna= 20.168. generally,
lord, master, Il.18.556, Pi.O.6.47. metaph., po/lemos pa/ntwn b. Heraclit.53; no/mos o( pa/ntwn b. Pi.Fr.169. at Athens,
the second of the nine Archons, IG12.76, al., Antipho 6.38, Lys.6.4, Arist.Pol.1285b17, Ath. 57, etc.; h( tou= b. stoa/ Pl.Euthphr.2a. title of magistrates in other Greek states, as basila=es at Elis, GDI1152, cf. IG12(2).6 (Mytil.), etc., Arist.Pol.1322b29. at Rome, b. tw=n i(erw=n, =
rex sacrorum, D.H.5.1, cf. D.C.54.27. after the Persian war (without Art.),
the king of Persia, Hdt.7.174,al.; a)/nac *ce/rchs b. A.Pers.5, cf. 144, Ar.Ach.61, Th.8.48, IG22.141 (basilh=s basile/ws u(/poxoi mega/lou, of the Satraps, A.Pers.24, cf. 44, S.E.M.2.22); less freq. o( basileu/s Hdt.1.132,137, Arist.Pol.1304b13; b. o( me/gas Hdt. 1.188. of Alexander and his successors, usually with Art., IG22.641,687, Men.293,340(pl.); *se/leukos Antiph.187; *)anti/gonos Alex.III; *ptolemai=os Id.244; *)osumandu/as basileu\s basile/wn D.S. 1.47; title used by Parthian
kings, Plu.Pomp.38, D.C.37.6, etc.; by Antony, Plu.Ant.54; of
God, Apoc.17.14,19.16. of the Roman
emperors, AP10.25 (Antip. Thess.); b. *(rwmai/wn BGU588.10 (i A.D.), etc., cf. 1 Ep.Ti.2.2, J.AJ14.15.14; b. au)tokra/twr IG3.13 (Hadrian), Hdn.1.6.5; without Art., Paus.10.32.19. of any
great man, pe/nhsi/ te kai\ basileu=sin Ps.-Phoc.113.
first or
most distinguished of any class, *(hrw/dhn to\n b. tw=n lo/gwn Philostr. VS2.10.1, cf. Luc.Rh.Pr.II;
winner at a game, Poll.9.106, Sch.Pl. Tht.146a; Stoic
sage, mo/nos b. Luc.Herm.16; basile/ws e)gke/falos 'morsel fit for a king', Clearch.5; b. su=ka, name of a
choice kind, Philem.Lex. ap. Ath.3.76f., cf. Poll.6.81. = sumposi/arxos, Plu.2.622a, Luc.Sat.4.
wren, Arist.HA592b27.
queen-bee, ib.623b9, GA759a20, etc. (The form basile/a is scanned ^ ^ _ in Pi.N.1.39; codd. basi/leia.）

ba^si^l-euto/s, h/, o/n,
suited for monarchical rule, Arist.Pol.1288a8.
ba^si^l-eu/twr, oros, o(, = basileu/s, Antim.5.

ba^si^l-eu/w,
to be king, rule, reign, ou) me/n pws pa/ntes basileu/somen e)nqa/d' *)axaioi/ Il.2.203; i)=son e)moi\ basi/leue 9.616; e)n u(mi=n . . basi/leue
was king among you, Od.2.47; o)/fr' *)iqa/khs kata\ dh=mon . . basileu/oi 22.52; also of a woman, h)\ basi/leuen u(po\ *pla/kw|
reigned as queen, Il.6.425; h( de\ *pu/lou basi/leue Od.11.285: in aor.,
to have become king, Hdt.2.2: c. gen.,
to be king of, rule over, e)n . . *)iqa/kh| basileu/sei *)axaiw=n Od.1.401, etc.; basileu/ontos basile/wn *)arsa/kou PAvrom.1A1: c. dat.,
to be king among, *giga/ntessin basi/leuen Od. 7.59; later b. e)pi\ ta\s du/o basilei/as LXX 1 Ma.1.16:—Pass.,
to be governed by a king, Pl.R.576d, 576e,al., Arist.Pol.1284b39, etc.: c.acc. cogn., basilei/an pasw=n dikaiota/thn basileu/esqai Pl.Lg.680e: generally,
to be governed or
administered, Pi.P.4.106, etc.; u(po\ no/mou Lys. 2.19: hence,
submit to the king, Plu.Sull.12.
to be a)/rxwn b. at Athens, Isoc.18.5,IG12.7<*>6, al.; of other magistrates, SIG709 (Chersonesus), 1054 (Samothrace). later h( basileu/ousa po/lis the
imperial city, of Rome, Ath.3.98c, cf. CPHerm.125ii3.
enjoy as master, tw= xrusw= b. Theoc.21.60 codd. abs.,
live royally, b. e)n peni/a| Plu.2.101d, cf. 1 Ep.Cor.4.8. causal,
appoint as king, tina/ LXXJd.9.6; but b. tisi\ basile/a
make them
a king, ib. 1 Ki.8.22, 12.1.

ba^si^/l-h, h(, = basi/leia^,
queen, princess, S.Fr.310, cf. Hdn.Gr.1.275. a divinity, worshipped with Neleus and Codrus at Athens, IG12.94, Pl.Chrm.153a.
ba^si^l-hi/+h, ba^si^l-h/i+os, Ion. for basilei/a_, -leios.

ba^si^l-hi/+s, i/+dos, h(, pecul. fem. of basi/leios,
royal, timh/ Il.6.193, Hes.Th.462, E.Hipp.1280(lyr.). = basi/leia^,
a queen, Man.1.283, Epigr.Gr.989.3 (Memnon).

ba^si^l-i/zw,
to be of the king's party, Plu. Flam.16: also, c.acc., e)gw/ ei)mi o( basili/zwn to\n to/pon ei)s o)no/mati (sic) *mwus [h=] Stud.Pont.3 No.10g (Amisus):—Med.,
affect, assume the state of a king, App.BC3.18; so in Act., J.AJ1.10.4.

ba^si^l-iko/s, h/, o/n,
royal, kingly, poie/eis ou)damw=s -ka/ Hdt.2.173; b. ge/nos A.Pr.869; b. [monarxi/a] Pl.Plt.291e; opp. turanniko/s, Arist.Pol.1285b3; basilikoi\ a)pe/bhsan proved themselves
truly kingly, Plb.8.10.10; basiliko/n [e)sti] pra/ttein me\n eu)=, kakw=s d' a)kou/ein Arr.Epict.4.6.20; h)=qos b. X. Oec.21.10; to\ b. Id.Cyr.1.3.18: basilikh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
art of ruling, Andronic.Rhod.p.574M.: Comp. -w/teros Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.45, Jul.Or.2.54d: Sup. basilikw/tatos kai\ a)/rxein a)ciw/tatos X.An.1.9.1, cf. Isoc.2.29; -wta/th xa/ris Plu.Alex.21. Adv. -kw=s, parw/n
as a king, with kingly authority, X.Cyr.1.4.14; b. a)/rxein Arist.Pol.1259b1.
of or
belonging to a king, oi( b.
the king's friends or
officers, Plb.8.12.10; e)gklh/mata b. charges
of high-treason, Id.25.3.1; o)feilh/mata b. debts
to the king, ib.3; b. pro/sodoi PPetr.3p.56; grammateu/s (cf. 11.1) Wilcken Chr.233.2 (ii B.C.), etc.; gewrgoi/ PTeb.5.200 (ii B.C.), etc.; o(do\s b. the
king's highway, LXXNu.20.17, PPetr.3p.65(iii B.C.); mh\ ei)=nai b. a)trapo\n e)pi\ gewmetri/an no
royal road, Euc. ap.Procl.in Euc.p.68F.; b. no/mos OGI483.1, Ep.Jac.2.8; ai( b. bi/bloi the books
of Kings, Ph.1.427.
choice (cf. basi/leios 3), mi/ndac Amphis27. ka/rua b.
walnuts, Dsc.1.125; karu/ai PSI4.428.65(iii B.C.). b. ku/minon, = a)/mi, Dsc.3.62. as Subst., basiliko/s (sc. grammateu/s), o(, official in Egyptian nomoi/, POxy.1219.15 (iii A. D.). (sc. oi)=kos)
basilica, CIG2782.25 (Aphrodisias). (sc. o)/rnis) = a)kalanqi/s, Sch.Ar.Pax1078. (sc. a)sth/r) = basili/skos v, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.201.23. basilikh\ stoa/
hall divided into aisles by columns, IG12(3).326.18 (Thera), Str.5.3.8 (pl.); b. alone, OGI511.15 (Aezani), Lat.
basilica, Vitr.5.1.4,6.3.9, cf. Plu.Publ.15, Cat.Mi.5, App.BC2.26. basiliko/n (sc. tamiei=on), to/,
treasury, ei)s to\ b. a)pometrh=sai, telei=n, PSI4.344.17 (iii B.C.), D.S.2.40, etc.; o)fei/lein PRev.Laws5.1, al.;
royal bank, OGI90.29 (Rosetta),
PRein.13.19, al., BGU830.18 (i A. D.). (sc. dw=ma)
palace, D.C. 60.4. (sc. pro/stagma)
royal decree, LXX Es.1.19. (sc. fa/rmakon) name for various remedies, = tetrafa/rmakon, Gal.12.601; of other compounds, ibid.;
a plaster, Id.13.184;
an eyesalve, Id.12.782 (also -ko/s, o(,
a bandage, Id.18(1).777). (sc. futo/n)
basil, Ocimum basilicum, Suid. basilika/, ta/,
communications received from kings, SIG333.23 (Samos), 426.26 (Teos); also,
interests or
revenues of the crown, PRev.Laws 15.4 (iii B. C.), PTeb.5.256 (ii B. C.), LXX 1 Ma.10.43;
prerogatives, ib.15.8.
basi_li^nau=, barbarism for basi/linna (i.e. basi/leia^), Ar.Av.1678.
ba^si^l-i/nda, Adv., h( b. paidia/ 'king of the castle', a game, Poll.9.110, AB1353.
ba^si^/l-inna, v. basi/lissa.

ba^si^l-i/s, i/dos, h(, = basi/leia^,
queen, princess, S.Ant.941 (dub.l.), E.Hec.552; b. nu/mfh, gunh/, E.Med.1003, Hipp.778: in Prose, b. gunaikw=n Pl.Lg.694e, cf. Plu.Alex.21; of a Roman Imperial
princess, Philostr.VA1.3. = basi/lissa 2, Eust. 1425.42. as Adj.,
royal, e(sti/a, eu)nai/, E.Rh.718, IA1307 (lyr.); of cities, b. *(rw/mh IG14.830 (Puteoli); b. po/lis, of Rome, Gal.14.796; of Constantinople, OGI521.22 (Abydos), Them.Or.11.144a, Agath.1.4, etc.; so b. alone, Lyd.Mag.2.14; also b. xw/ra, = Rome, Vett.Val.226.14. metaph., kardi/h b. Hp.Nat.Hom.6.
kingdom, D.S.29.22.

ba^si^l-i/skos, o(, Dim. of basileu/s,
princelet, chieftain, Plb.3.44.5, OGI200.18 (Axum); also, = basilei/dion, Ath.13.566a.
kind of serpent, basilisk, perh.
Egyptian cobra, Hp.Ep.19 (Hermes 53.65), LXX Ps.90(91).13,al., Hld.3.8, Artem.4.56, Horap. 1.1, Democr.[300], Plin.8.78.
wren, Aesop. ap. Plu.2.806e, Ruf Fr.117, Artem.4.56;
gold-crest, Philagr. ap. Aët,11.11.
sea-fish, Opp.H.1.129, Marc.Sid.26.
the star a Leonis, Regulus, Gem.3.5, Heph.Astr.2.18, etc. kind of
shoe, Poll.7.85.

ba^si^/l-issa, h(, = basi/leia^,
queen, Alc.Com.6, X.Oec.9.15, Philem. 16.1, Arist.Fr.179, Supp.Epigr.1.366.34 (Samos, iii B. C.), Theoc.15.24, IG2.614b; h( b. tw=n melissw=n Arr.Epict.3.22.99; condemned by Phryn.202, but cf. Ael.Dion.Fr.91.
wife of the a)/rxwn basileu/s
at Athens, Poll.8.90:—also basi/linna, D.59.74, Men.907. the Roman
Empress, Hdn.1.7.4, etc. = basileu/s VI,
PMag.Leid. V.1.31.
ba^si^l-istai/, oi(, guild of worshippers of Ptolemy Euergetes II, OGI130.6, IG12(3).443 (Thera).

ba/si^mos [a^], on, （bai/nw)
passable, accessible, D.S.5.44,al. (dub. sens. in Tim.Pers.65); to/poi S.E.M.1.78: metaph. of a rhetorical to/pos, D.25.76, cf. D.S.23.15, al.; xro/nos i(stori/a| b. Plu.Thes.1.
fixed, stable, Eustr. in EN98.3.

ba/sis [a^], ews, h(, （bai/nw)
stepping, step, and collectively,
steps, A. Eu.36, S.Aj.8, etc.: metaph., h(su/xw| frenw=n ba/sei A.Ch.452 (lyr.); ou)k e)/xwn b.
power to step, S.Ph.691 (lyr.); troxw=n ba/seis the
rolling of the wheels, the
rolling wheels, Id.El.718; a)rbu/lhs b. the
print of the sandal, E.El.532; poi/mnais th/nd' e)pempi/ptei ba/sin S.Aj.42.
measured stepor movement, b. xorei/as Ar.Th.968, cf. Pi.P.1.2: hence,
rhythmical or
metrical movement, Pl.R.399e, Lg.670d: in Rhet.,
rhythmical close of a sentence, Hermog.Id.1.6, al.;
clause forming transition from pro/tasis
to a)po/dosis, Id.Inv.1.5: and in Metric,
metrical unit, monometer, Arist.Pol.1263b35, Metaph.1087b36, Heph.11, Longin.Proll.Heph.3, Mar. Vict.p.47.3 K., etc.
order, sequence, qe/sis kai\ b. Epicur.Ep.1p.10U.
that with which one steps, a foot, Pl.Ti.92a, Arist.GA750a4; podw=n b. E.Hec.837; qhlu/pous b. their women's
feet, Id.IA421; b. di/xhlos, of the ostrich, D.S.3.28.3: abs., ai( ba/seis Ph.1.226, Act.Ap.3.7; sfi\gc ei)=xe b. le/ontos Apollod.3.5.8;
leg, Id.1.3.5; ba/sewn a)pokopai/ Diog.Oen.39.
that whereon one stands, base, pedestal, [krath=ros] Alex.119; of statues, OGI705.6, etc.; tri/a e)/rga . . e)pi\ mia=s b. Str.14.1.14, cf. Luc.Philops. 19; lebh/twn Plb.5.88.5; of an engine, Hero Bel.88.1, al.; of a column, PLond.3.755v6 (iv A. D.): Medic., tou= e)gkefa/lou Herophil. ap. Placit.4.5.4, cf. Plu.Per.6; traxh/lou Id.Pyrrh.34; koi=lai blefa/rwn i)otupei=s ba/sies AP5.86 (Rufin.); ai( e)n o)fqalmoi=s b. Sor. 1.27, cf. Archig. ap. Aët. 16.101(91); of the heart, Gal.UP6.13; e)pano/rqwsis th\n tou= kenoume/nou ba/sin a)naplhrou=sa Id.1.474;
foundation, basement, r(i/za pa/ntwn kai\ b. a( ga= e)rh/reistai Ti.Locr.97e; so, of the soil, pedi/wn spori/ma b. Hymn.Is.162. Geom.,
base of a solid or plane figure, Pl.Ti.55b, Arist.APr.41b15,al.; [kw/nou] Democr.155; purami/dos Speus. ap. Theol.Ar.63.
position, fixedness, opp. fora/, etym. of be/baios, Pl.Cra.437a. Astrol., = w(rosko/pos, Vett.Val.88.6, Paul.Al.T.2, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).132.
ba/ska: make/lh, Hsch.; cf. ma/skh.

bask-ai/nw, fut. -a^nw= LXX De.28.56: aor. e)ba/skhna Philostr. (v. infr.), -a_na Arist.Pr.926b24:—Pass., aor. e)baska/nqhn (v. infr.):—
bewitch by the evil eye, etc., Arist. l.c., LXX De.28.56: metaph., Ep.Gal.3.1; e)ba/skhne pa/nta . . tu/xh Hdn.2.4.5:—Pass., w(s mh\ baskanqw=si Arist.Fr.347; w(s mh\ baskanqw= tri\s e)/ptusa Theoc.6.39. c. acc.,
malign, disparage, Pherecr.174, D.8.19; a)/n ti du/skolon sumbai/nh| tou=to baskai/nei Id.18.189; ei)si/n tines . . ou(\ to\ baskai/nein tpe/fei Dionys.Com.11:—Pass., u(po\ tw=n a)ntite/xnwn baskanqh=nai Str.14.2.7. c. dat.,
envy, grudge, D.20.24, etc.; tini/ tinos
grudge one a thing, D.Chr.78.37, Philostr.VA6.12; tini\ e)pi/ tini D.Chr. 78.25: abs., Luc.Nav.17: tino/s
keep to oneself, Id.Philops.35. c. acc. et inf., mh\ baskh/nas gela/sai kai\ a)/llon Ael.VH14.20.

bask-a^ni/a, h(,
malign influence, witchery, Pl.Phd.95b; b. faulo/thtos a)mauroi= to\ kalo/n LXX Wi.4.12; baskani/as fa/rmakon to\ ph/ganon Arist.Pr.926b20.
malignity, a)gnwmosu/nh kai\ b. D.18.252; o)/xlos kai\ b. Id.19.24: pl., LXX4 Ma.2.15.
jealousy, h)/eisen kre/ssona baskani/hs Call.Epigr.23, cf. Ph.2.81, al.

bask-a/nion [a^], to/,
charm, amulet, Ar.Fr.592, Str.16.4.17, cf. Phryn.68. in pl.,
malign influences, *)ai/+dew b. Epigr.Gr.381 (Aezani).

ba/sk-a^nos, o(,
one who bewitches, sorcerer, as a term of abuse, D.21.209, Men.Pk.279, Str. 14.2.7; b. kai\ fqoropoio/s St.Byz. s.v. *qi/ba.
slanderer, D.18.132, Vett.Val.358.5. Adj. ba/skanos, on,
slanderous, malicious, Ar.Eq.103, Pl.571; o( sukofa/nths pantaxo/qen ba/skanon D.18.242, cf. Str.14.1.22; du/skolos kai\ b. Plu.Fab.26; b. pra=gma . . poiou=ntes D. 18.317; b. e)/ss', *)ai/+da Erinna 6.3; kw/mwn b. e)sti li/qos AP9.756 (Aemil.); m' o( b. h(/rpase dai/mwn Epigr.Gr.345; freq. in sepulchral inscriptions, IG14.1362, etc.: Sup. -w/tatos Com.Adesp.359. Adv. -nws J.AJ11.4.9, Porph.VP53. b. o)fqalmo/s
evil eye, Plu.2.680c, cf. Alciphr.1.15.

bask-antiko/s, h/, o/n,
envious, fqonhtikh\ kai\ b. e(/cis Plu.2.682d, cf. Phld.Vit.p.42J.
baska^ri/zein (i.e. vask-）: <a)>skari/zein (Cret.), Hsch.

baska/s (or -a=s), a/dos, h(, a kind of
duck, Ar.Av.885; cf. boska/s, faska/s.

baskau/lhs, ou, o(, perh. = Lat.
vasculum, POxy.109.22 (iii/iv A. D.).
ba/skein: le/gein, kakologei=n, kai\ a)ni/stasqai, Hsch.; cf. ba/zw.
baskeutai/: faski/des, a)gka/lai, Id.:—also ba/skioi: desmai\ fru/ganwn, Id. ba/skillos: ki/ssa, Id. ba/skon: xw=ron, Id.

baskosu/nh, h(, poet. for baskani/a, Poet.
de herb.51,131, PMag.Lond.122.34, PMag.Par.1.1400.

ba/skw (akin to bai/nw), only imper., ba/sk' i)/qi
speed thee! away! II.2.8, etc.; ba/sket', e)pei/gete Ar.Th.783; but ba/ske
come! A.Pers. 663,671 (both lyr.); ba/sk', a)/laste Mim. Oxy.413.60. (ba/skou: poreu/ou is prob. f.l. in Hsch.).

entryFree.sense:
flat block
used as a base, Haussoullier Milet p.172, Rev.Phil.43.188.

div0.entryFree: basmi/s, basmo/s, v. baqm-.
ba=ssa, h(, Dor., = bh=ssa:—hence ba_ssai/as: ta\s e)n bh/ssh| gegonui/as, Hsch.

bassa/r-a [a^r], h(, = a)lw/phc,
fox, Sch.Lyc.771 (Cyren. acc. to Hsch.).
dress of Thracian bacchanals, made of
fox-skins, AB 222, Hsch.
Thracian bacchanal, in pl., title of play by A., Sch. Ar.Th.142, cf. Callix.2.
impudent woman, courtesan, Lyc.771, 1393.
bassar-eu/s, e/ws, o(, name of Bacchus, Corn.ND30, Hor. Od.1.18.11.
bassar-e/w, = *bakxeu/w, v. a)nabassare/w.
bassar-iko/s, h/, o/n, = bakxiko/s, qi/asos AP6.165 (Phalaec.): bassarika/, ta/, = *dionusiaka/, Soterich. ap. Suid.

bassa/r-ion, to/, Dim. of bassa/ra 1,
little fox, Hdt.4.192.
bassar-i/s, i/dos, h(, = bassa/ra 1, Hsch. s.v. yui=ai. = bassa/ra 11.2, Anacr. 55, AP6.74 (Agath.).
ba/ssar-os, o(, = *bassareu/s, Orph.H.45.2. = bassa/ra 1, EM191.1.
ba/ssos, eos, to/, = bassa/ra, EM191.1.

ba/sswn, on, gen. onos, Dor. Comp. of baqu/s, Epich.188.
baggage-train, Petr.Patr.p.434 D.
basta/: u(podh/mata (Ital.), Hsch.

basta^g-a/rios, o(,
transport-worker, Stud. Pal.20.82.5 (iv A.D.).

basta^g-h/, h(,
transport, tw=n a)nagkai/wn Lyd.Mag.1.13.

basta/gion, to/,
baldric, Eust.828.35.

ba/stagma, atos, to/,
that which is borne, burden, E.Supp.767, Plb. 36.6.7, Plu.2.59b, etc.; ei)=nai baru\ b. basilei/an J.AJ19.9.2.

basta/zw, Od.11.594, etc.: fut. -a/sw A.Pr.1019, S.Aj.920; late -a/cw Ps.-Callisth.1.45, etc.: aor. e)ba/stasa Od.21.405, Ar.Th. 437 (lyr.), etc.; late e)ba/staca PFay.122, LXXSi.6.25, J.AJ3.8.7, Epigr. ap. Stob.1.49.52:—Pass., fut. bastaxqh/somai Ps.-Callisth.1.42: aor. e)basta/xqhn Nic.Dam.p.114D., D.L.4.59, Ath.15.693e: aor. 2 bastagh=nai Artem.2.68: pf. beba/stagmai （e)m-) Luc.Ocyp.14:—
lift up, raise, la=an basta/zonta . . a)mfote/rh|si Od.11.594; e)pei\ me/ga to/con e)ba/stase 21.405; peptw=ta b. tina/ S.Aj.827, etc.;
lift a veil, Id.El. 1470:—Pass., of sluice-gates, PRyl.81.6 (ii A. D.). metaph.,
lift up, exalt, ennoble, Pi.O.12.19; b. tina\ xari/tessin Id.I.3.8.
bear, carry, A.Pr.1019, etc.; xersi\n b. tina/ S.El.1129, cf. 1216; do/ru Hermipp.46.2 (anap.), Theoc.16.78; o(/pla Men.Epit.107.
hold in one's hands, S.El.905; xeroi=n Id.Ph.657, cf. 1127 (lyr.); of books, sunexw=s b. Epicur.Ep.2p.35U.:—in Pass.,
to be popular, Arist.Rh. 1413b12. b. e)n gnw/mh|
bear in mind,
consider, weigh, A.Pr.888; freni/ Ar.Th.437 (lyr.); b. probou/leuma
deliberate on . . , Eup.73; basta/sas ai(rh/somai
on consideration, Id.303.
bear, endure, ou)ke/ti basta/zw th\n sei=o diazugi/hn AP5.8 (Rufin.).
produce, yield, of land, PGiss.6 iii 8 (ii A. D.).
carry off, take away, Ev.Jo.20.15;
steal, Plb.32.15.4, J.AJ1.19.9, D.L.4.59, Luc.Asin.16, PTeb.330.7 (ii A. D.), perh. also in Ev.Jo.12.6, Ath.2.46f (Pass.). in Pass.,
to be sublimated, Zos.Alch.p.198 B. in Trag.,
touch, xe/ra a)/naktos . . th=|de b. xeri/ A.Ag.35;
embrace, sw=ma S.OC1105.—Not in Att. Prose: Pass. first in Plb.
ba/stakes: plou/sioi kai\ eu)genei=s (Boeot.), EM191.12.

bastak-te/on,
one must bear, Sch.E.Or.769. Adj. bastakte/os, a, on,
to be borne or
carried, Sch.Ar.Ach.258.

bastak-th/s, ou=, o(,
bearer, porter, Gloss.

bastak-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for bearing: Adv. -kw=s, gloss on a)e/rdhn, Sch.A.Ag.240.

bastak-to/s, h/, o/n,
borne, AP12.52 (Mel.).
ba/staxas: tou\s traxh/lous (Boeot.), and bastaxa/zei: traxhli/zei, Hsch. (bastr- cod.):—also ba/straxes, Boeot., = oi( tra/xhloi, and bastraxali/sai, = traxhlia/sai, EM191.11.

baste/rnion, to/, Lat.
basterna, closed litter, Cod.Just.8.10.12, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.103:—hence basterna/rioi, oi(,
litter-bearers, IG3.1433.7.

basuni/as (sc. plakou=s), o(, a kind of
cake, Semus 3.
batai/nel: kalei=, Hsch. batai=s: porfuri/sin, h)\ o(doi/, Id.

ba_ta^li/zomai,
live like a ba/talos, Theano Ep.1.3:—later in Act., b. ta\ o)pi/sqia
wriggle, of a horse, Hippiatr.30.

ba/ta^los [ba_], o(, = prwkto/s, Eup.82; cf. ba/tas, bate/w.
stammerer (cf. battari/zw), a nickname given to Demosthenes, Aeschin. 2.99, cf. D.18.180. (Codd. vary between ba/talos and ba/ttalos: *ba/ttalos is pr. n. in Hedyl. ap. Ath.4.167d.)
ba^ta/nh [ta^], h(, = pata/nh, Matro Conv.85:—Dim. ba^ta/nion, to/, Antiph.95, Eub.38, Alex.24,172.18, POxy.739.9 (i A. D.), Bilabel *)oyart. p.18, Zos.Alch.p.222B. (Sicel word for lopa/dia, Hsch.）
ba/tas: o( kataferh/s (Tarent.), Hsch. (Fort. bata=s, = ba/talos.）
ba=te, Dor. imper. aor. 2 of bai/nw.

ba^tei/a, h( (scanned -ei^a),
bush, thicket, Pi.O.6.54.

ba/tella, h(, = Lat.
patella, POxy.741.18 (ii A. D.):—Dim. bate/llion, to/, Ostr.1218, POxy.1657.5 (iii A. D.).

ba^teu/w, perh.
trample, damage, ta\ bebat[eu]me/na BGU45.21 (iii A. D.).

ba^t-e/w, (bai/nw)
cover, ta\s xima/ras e)ba/teun AP9.317:—Pass., of she-goats, oi(=a bateu=ntai Theoc.1.87. at Delphi, = pate/w, Plu. 2.292e.

ba^t-h/r, h=ros, o(,
that on which one treads, threshold, e)p' au)to\n h(/keis to\n b. th=s qu/ras, prov. of those who 'come to the point', 'hit the nail on the head', Amips.26;
base of a statue, IG11(2).147.18 (Delos, iv B. C.), *)arx. *)ef. 1913.7 (Nisyros, iii B. C.).
place from which one jumps, AB224, Hsch., Eust.1404.56. = bakthri/a, Nic.Th.377.
bridge of a lyre, Nicom.Harm.6; also,
part of flute, ib.10.
one who walks, Hsch.
ba^t-hri/a, Ion. -ih, h(, = bakthri/a, Herod.8.60.
ba^t-h/rion le/xos (cf. ba/ths), = o)xei/a, Ps.Phoc.188.

ba^t-hri/s, i/dos, h(, kli=mac b. a
mounting ladder, AP7.365 (Zon. or Diod.).

ba^/t-hs, ou, o(,
one that treads or
covers, expld. by pi/qhkos, a)naba/ths, Id.

ba^ti^a/kh [a^k], h(, a kind of
cup, Diph.80; b. xrusai=, xalkai=, Alexandr. Epist. ap. Ath.11.784a, Arist.Mir.834a4, IG11(2).137 (Delos, iv B. C.):—Dim. ba^ti^a/kion, to/, dub. in Philem.87, cf. IG11.199B8 (Delos, iii B. C.).

ba^ti^dosko/pos, on,
looking after skates, greedy for them, Ar.Pax 811.

ba/tinon, to/,
fruit of ba/tos,
blackberry, Gal.6.589, 12.920.

ba/tion, to/, Dim. of ba/tos (A), Salaminian name for
mulberry, Parth. ap. Ath.2.51f.

ba^ti/s, i/dos, h(, a flat fish, perh.
skate or
ray, Epich.59.1, 90.1, Ar. V.510, Hermipp.45.2, Arist.HA565a22, al.
bird that frequents bushes, possibly
stone-chat, ib.592b17.
samphire, Crithmum maritimum, Plin.21.86, 174, Colum.12.7.
ba/tnos: au)lo/s (Messen.), Hsch.

ba^todro/pos, on,
pulling up brambles, h.Merc.190.

ba^to/eis, essa, en, (ba/tos A)
thorny, Nic.Al.267.

ba/ton [a^], to/,
blackberry, D.S.1.34.

ba/tos (A) [a^], h(,
bramble, Rubus ulmifolius, Od.24.230, Aen. Tact.28.6, Theoc.1.132; o(, Hp.Mul.2.112, Ar.Fr.754 (Att. acc. to Moeris), Thphr.HP1.5.3, LXX Ex.3.2: whence e)pi\ tou= (v.l. th=s） ba/tou in Ev.Marc.12.26: fem., Dsc.4.37, Ev.Luc.20.37. b. *)idai/a
raspberry, Rubus Idaeus, Dsc.4.38; = b. o)rqofuh/s Thphr.HP3.18.4. b. *mosuli=tis, a kind of
cassia, Dsc.1.13. = e(le/nion,
elecampane, Ps.-Dsc.1.28.

ba/tos (B), o(, a
fish, a kind of
skate, Epich.59.2, 90.2, Arist.HA 489b6, al.

ba/tos (C), o(, the Hebrew liquid measure
bath, = Egypt. a)rta/bh or Att. metrhth/s, LXX 2 Es.7.22, Ev.Luc.16.6, J.AJ8.2.9:—also ba/dos, v.l. in LXX l.c., Hsch.

ba^to/s, h/, o/n, (bai/nw)
passable, accessible, toi=s u(pozugi/ois X.An. 4.6.17, cf. Men.924, Arr.An.4.21.3, Nonn.D.1.54, al.; = be/bhlos, opp. a)/batos, Porph.Abst.4.11: metaph.,
permissible, Just.Nov.30.8 Intr. Act.,
speeding, pou/s Nonn.D.2.96, 18.55.

ba^tra/x-eios [ra^], on, （ba/traxos)
of or
belonging to a frog: batra/xeia (sc. xrw/mata)
frog-colour, pale-green, Ar.Eq.523:—also batra/xeos, a, on, Nic.Fr.85.5.
ba^trax-i/dion, to/, Dim. of ba/traxos, Plu.Nob. 21.

ba^trax-i/zw,
to be or
move like a frog, Hippiatr.26.

ba^tra/x-ion, to/,
Ranunculus, Hp.Nat.Mul.32, Dsc.2.175 (who incl.
R. asiaticus, garden r., b. xrusa/nqemon Gp.2.6.30, and
R. sardous, hairy crowfoot, cf. Dsc.Alex.14). = ba/traxos I, Paus.9.21.1. = ba/traxos III, Ptol.Phas.p.27H., al.
malachite, Syn.Alch. p.64B.

ba^trax-iou=n, to/,
a court of law at Athens, so called from its colour (cf. *foinikiou=n), Paus.1.28.8:—Adj. ba^tra^xe( i) ou=s IG2.758Bii23.

ba^trax-i/s, i/dos, h(,
frog-green garment, Ar.Eq.1406, IG2.754.16, D.C.59.14. = batra/xion I, Alex.Trall.3.6: but, ba^tra^xi/s, i=dos, Dim. of ba/traxos, Nic.Th.416.

ba^trax-i/skoi, oi(,
part of the kiqa/ra, Hsch.

ba^tra^xomu^oma^xi/a, h(,
battle of the frogs and mice, title of mockepic poem ascribed to Homer, cf. Plu.2.873f.

ba/tra^xos [ba^], o(,
frog, Batr.6,18,59, al., Hdt.4.131, etc.: prov., u(/dwr pi/nein ba/traxos
a very frog to drink, Aristopho10.3; batra/xois oi)noxoei=n, of those who give what is not wanted, Pherecr.70.5; me/lei moi tw=n toiou/twn h(=tton tw=n e)n toi=s te/lmasi b. Jul.Mis.358a; xlwro\s b., of the tree-
frog, Thphr.Sign.15. = a(lieu/s, a kind of
fish, fishing-frog or
sea-angler, Lophius piscatorius, Arist.GA749a23, Ael. NA13.5.
frog of a horse's hoof, Gp.16.1.9, Hippiatr.8: hence Astron., of the star b Centauri, Ptol.Alm.8.1. e)sxa/ras ei)=dos, Hsch.
swelling under the tongue, Aët.8.39.—Dial. forms are cited by Gramm., Ion. ba/qrakos, cited from Hdt. (prob.4.131) by Sch.Il.4.243, Eust.1570.11, and found in PLond.1.124.31 (iv/v A. D.); Ion. also bo/traxos Hp. ap. Gal.19, bro/taxos Xenoph.40 (as pr. n., GDI5577,5592). bra/taxos Hsch. (as pr. n., GDI5727d29). Cypr. brou/xetos Hsch. Phoc. briagxo/nh Id. Pontic ba/bakos Id. Cf. bu/rqakos, bru/tixos.
ba/ttalos, o(, v. ba/talos.

batta^r-i/zw, onomatop. word,
stammer, Hippon.108, Pl.Tht.175d (prob.l.), Cic.Att.6.5.1, Luc.JTr.27.

batta^r-ismo/s, o(,
stuttering, Phld. Rh.2.136S., Porph.Hist.Phil.Fr.11; also,
twittering of swallows, Eust.1914.32.

batta^r-isth/s, ou=, o(,
stutterer, Hsch.
ba/ttikes: gunai=kes (Boeot.), Hsch.

batto-loge/w, = battari/zw,
speak stammeringly, say the same thing over and over again, Ev.Matt.6.7, Simp. in Epict.p.91D.
batto-logi/a: a)rgologi/a, a)kairologi/a, Hsch. (bato- cod.).

ba/ttos, o(,
stammerer, lisper, Hsch.

batu/lh, h(,
she-dwarf, dub. name of a play by Theopompus, Sch. Ar.Pl.1012.

ba^tw/dhs, es,
thorny, Str.4.3.5.
like a blackberry, to\ mo/ron to\ b. Phan.Hist.33.
overgrown with thorns, Plb.2.28.8.

bau/, bau/,
bow, wow, imit. of a dog's bark, Com.Adesp.1304.

bau=, a kind of
flower, Hsch.
bauba^li/zw, = baukala/w, Alex.229 (bab- cod. Hsch.).

bauba/w,
sleep, E.Fr.694, Trag.Adesp.165, Canthar.3. Act.,
lull to sleep, Hsch.
baubw/, h(, = koili/a, Emp.153.
baubw/n, w=nos, o(, = o)/lisbos, Herod.6.19.

ba^u/+zw (bau/zw disyll. Lyc.1453 is f.l. for ba/zw), Dor. bau/+sdw, onomatop. word,
cry bau/ bau/,
bark, Theoc.6.10; of angry persons,
snarl, yelp, pau=sai bau/+zwn Ar.Th.173, cf. 805; ta/de si=ga/ tis bau/+zei thus they
snarl in secret, A.Ag.449 (lyr.); oi(=' a)/tta b. Cratin.6. trans.,
shriek aloud for, tina/ A.Pers.13; of dogs,
bark at, tina/ Heraclit.97 codd.

bauka^l-a/w,
lull to sleep, Crates Ep.33, Luc.Lex.11 (wrongly said to be Att. by Moer.102): metaph.,
nurse, look after, Aret.SD2.11.

bauka^/l-h, h(,
cradle, Sor.1.106,109.

bauka^/l-hma, atos, to/,
lullaby, Socr.Ep.27.

bauka^/l-hsis, ews, h(,
lulling a child to sleep, Ruf. ap. Orib.inc.20.26, Crat.Ep.33.
bauka^l-i/zw, = baukala/w, AB85, Hsch.

bauka^/l-ion, to/,
narrow-necked vessel, that gurgles when water is poured in or
out, POxy.936.6 (iii A. D.), Olymp. in Mete.93.6: pl., Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.94 (kauk- codd.).

bau/ka^l-is, idos, h(,
vessel for cooling wine or
water in, elsewh. yukth/r, AP11.244; b. h( tetra/kuklos Sopat.24.—Alexandr. word acc. to Ath.11.784b; on the accent cf. Hdn.Gr.1.90.
bau/kalon: malakizo/menon, trufero/n, kai\ w(rai+sto/n, EM192.20.
baukanh/setai: boh/setai, Hsch. (For bu_k-.）

bauki/des, ai(, a kind of
woman's shoes, Ar.Fr.342, Alex.98.7, Herod. 7.58.

bauk-i/zw, (bauko/s)
to play the prude, AB225:—Med., Alex.222.9, Hsch.

bau/k-isma, atos, to/,
coyness, affectation, AB225 (pl.), Hsch. (pl.).

bauk-ismo/s, o(, kind of
dance, Poll.4.100, Hsch.

baukopa^nou=rgos, o(,
humbug, Arist.EN1127b27.

bauko/s, h/, o/n,
prudish, affected, Arar.9.

bau=nos or bauno/s, o(,
furnace, forge, Eratosth.24, Max.Tyr.22.3, Asp. in EN104.23; also, = xutro/pous, Poll.10.100:—in Hsch. also bau/nh, h(.
bauri/a, h(, = oi)ki/a, Messapian word, EM389.25.
baurio/qen (cf. foreg.), = oi)/koqen, Cleon Sic.2.

ba^u+stiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to bark, Sch.Opp.H.1.721.
bafa/: zwmo/s (Lacon.), Hsch.

ba^f-ei=on, to/,
dyer's house or
workshop, Str.16.2.23, PLond.2.371.3 (i A.D.).

ba^f-eu/s, e/ws, o(, (ba/ptw)
a dyer, Pl.R.429d, Diph.72, Plu. Per.12, etc.; the bafei=s formed a guild at Thyatira, IGRom.4.1265; also in the nomo\s *)arsinoi/+ths, PTeb.287.3 (ii A.D.).
gilder, Zos.Alch.p.154B.

ba^f-h/, h(,
dipping of red-hot iron in water, S.Aj. 651: hence,
temper or
edge of a blade or tool
produced thereby, th\n b. a)fia=sin w(/sper o( si/dhros ei)rh/nhn a)/gontes Arist.Pol.1334a8, cf. Plu.Alex. 32, Pyrrh.24; ta\ sidh/ria th\n b. a)ni/hsi lose
their edge, Thphr.HP5.3.3, cf. CP1.22.6; xalkou= bafai/ prob. poet. for sidh/rou b. in A.Ag.612 (v. Sch. ad loc., but cf. ba/yis): metaph.,
temper, th=s a)ndrei/as oi(=on b. tis o( qumo/s e)sti kai\ sto/mwma Plu.2.988d; of wine, ib.650b.
dye, Thphr.HP4.6.5; porfura= b. A.Pers.317 (metaph. of blood), cf. Pl.R. 430a; kro/kou bafa/s the saffron-
dyed robe, A.Ag.239 (lyr.); bafai\ u(/dras
the arrows dipped in the hydra's blood, E.HF1188 (lyr.); xeile/wn b. Philostr.Ep.22: metaph., b. turanni/dos Plu.2.779c.
enamelling, xalkou= . . bafh=| kua/nou sti/lbontos ib.395b.
gilding, silvering, ai( du/o b. Zos.Alch.p.168B., cf. p.208B.
infection, Aret.CD2.13.

ba^f-iko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for dyeing, ko/kkos Dsc.Eup.1.37; bota/nh Luc.Alex.12: -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
art of dyeing, Ph.1.353, Plu.2.228b, PRyl.98.2 (ii A. D.). bi/bloi bafikai/, in Alchemy, books
on gilding and silvering, Ps.-Democr. ap. Syn.Alch.p.57 B.; kau=sis b. Zos.Alch.p.208B. bafiko/n, to/, form of i)ndiko/n, Dsc.5.92.
ba^/f-ion: o)cu/bafon (Tarent.), Hsch.

ba^/f-is<s>a, h(,
female dyer(?), Sammelb.1957.

ba/yimos, on,
to be dyed, Lysis ap.Iamb.VP17.76.

ba/yis, ews, h(,
dipping, tempering, xalkou= kai\ sidh/rou Antipho Soph. 40.
a dye, Perict. ap. Stob.4.28.19.
ba/w, = bai/nw, only in compds.

bda^leu/s, e/ws, o(,
milk-pail, Sch.Luc.Hes.4.

bda/llw, aor. part. bda/las Alciphr.3.16: aor. opt. Med., bdh/laio
Nic.Al.262:—
milk cows, polu\ bda/llwn
milking many kine, rich in kine, Pl.Tht.174d; b. tina/ ibid.; o( bda/llwn
the milker, Arist.HA 522b17; b. ga/la Procop.Aed.3.6:—Med.,
yield, of the cow, boi/+dia . . w(=n e(/kaston bda/lletai ga/la polu/ Arist.HA522b15; bo/es bda/llontai e(ka/sth a)mfore/a ib. 16: also in sense of Act., ne/on gla/gos Nic.l.c.
suck, Arist. GA746a20, cf. Gal.7.130:—Pass., Arist.HA522a5,20.
bdaloi/: r(afi/des qala/ssiai, kai\ fle/bes krissw/deis, Hsch.

bda/lsis, ews, h(,
suction, Gal.7.131, Aët.9.19.
bdaroi/: dru/es, de/ndra, Hsch.

bde/ll-a^, h(, (bda/llw)
leech, Hdt.2.68, Arist.IA709a29, Theoc.2.56, Nic.Al.500, LXX Pr.24.50 (30.15): metaph., b. spila/dwn, of a fisherman, AP6.193 (Flacc.).
lamprey, Str.17.3.4. = bde/llion, J.AJ3.1.6, Peripl.M.Rubr.37, al., Edict.Diocl.32.54, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.129, PMag.Berol.1.286, PMag.Leid.V.12.24.
bdell-a/zetai: a)me/lgetai, Erot. (perh. v.l. for e)kqhla/zetai Hp.Mul.1.73).

bdell-i/zw,
bleed with leeches, in Pass., Antyll. ap. Orib.7.21.3, Gal.11.317.

bde/llion, to/, the aromatic gum obtained from
Balsamodendrum africanum and
B. Mukul, Dsc.1.67, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.118, Plin. HN12.35, Aq., Sm., Thd.Ge.2.12. (Semitic word.)

bdelliste/on,
one must apply leeches, Herod.Med.in Rh.Mus.58.113.

bdellola/rugc [a^], uggos, o(,
leech-throat, name for
a greedy parasite, Cratin.44.
bde/llwn: tre/mwn h)\ bde/wn, Hsch.; cf. bde/lesqai: koiliolutei=n, Id.

bde/lug-ma, atos, to/,
abomination, toi=s *ai)g. pa=s poimh/n b. LXX Ge. 43.32, etc.; b. tw=n e)rhmw/sewn, e)rhmw/sews, of an idol, ib.Da.9.27, 1 Ma. 1.54, cf. Ev.Matt.24.15.

bdelug-mi/a, h(,
nausea, sickness, Cratin.251, X. Mem.3.11.13.
filth, nastiness, Hp.Fist.1.

bdelug-mo/s, o(,
abomination, LXX 1 Ki.25.31, Na.3.6.

bdeluk-to/s, h/, o/n,
disgusting, abominable, LXX Pr.17.15, Ep.Tit.1.16, Ph.2.261.
bdelu/k-tropos, on, = foreg., A.Eu.52.

bdelu^r-eu/omai,
behave in a beastly manner, D.17.11.

bdelu^r-i/a, h(,
beastly, coarse, or
objectionable behaviour, And.1.122, Is.8.42 (pl.), D. 22.52, Aeschin.1.105, Thphr.Char.11, Plu. Caes.9.
disgust, nausea, Hp.Int.26, Jul.Or.6.190d.

bdelu^r-o/s, a/, o/n,
disgusting, loathsome, blackguardly, Ar.Ra.465, Pl.R.338d, Thphr. Char.11; qeoi=s e)xqro\s kai\ b. D.21.197; qrasu\s kai\ b. Plu.2.10c: Comp. -wte/ra, politei/a Jul. Or. 7.210c: Sup. -w/tatos D.19.206,208. Adv. rw=s Ph.1.209. of things,
disgusting, Gal.12.291; to\ b. Alex. Trall.4.1. bdelura/, = xamelai/a, Ps.-Dsc.4.171.

bdelu/ssomai, Att. bdelu^/r-ttomai, fut. -u/comai Hp.Mul.1.39,41 (Act. bdelu/cein wrongly cited by Erot.): aor. e)bdelu/xqhn Ar.V.792, Plu. Alex.57, etc.; later e)bdeluca/mhn LXX Ge. 26.20, al., J.BJ6.2.10, Jul. Or.7.210d:—
feel a loathing for food, Hp Il. cc.;
to be sick, Ar.V. 792. c. acc.,
feel a loathing at, Id.Ach.586, LXX l. c., al., Plu. Alex.57; b. [tragw|di/as] Jul. l.c.; w)mofagi/an ib.6.193c: b. a)po/ tinwn LXX Ex.1.12. later causal, in Act.,
cause to stink, make loathsome or
abominable, fut. -u/cw LXX Le.20.25: aor. e)bde/luca ib.Ex. 5.21:—Med. and Pass.,
to be loathsome, fut. -uxqh/somai ib.Si.20.8: aor. -u/xqhn ib.Ps. 13(14).1: pf. e)bde/lugmai ib.Pr.8.7; oi( e)bdelugme/noi
the abominable (in ref. to the use of bde/lugma as
an idol), Apoc. 21.8:—this pf. in causal sense, LXX Pr.28.9. (Cf. bde/w.）
bdeluxro/s, a/, o/n, Dor. for bdeluro/s, Epich.63.
bde/nnumai: e)kkenou=mai th\n koili/an, Suid.; bde/nesqai (sic), Hsch.

bde/sma, atos, to/, (bde/w)
stench, Gloss.
bdeu=, (bde/w) comic parody on *zeu=, w)= *bdeu= de/spota Com.Adesp.28.

bde/w, poet. aor. bde/sa AP11.242 (Nicarch.); later e)/bdeusa Hierocl. Facet.233, al.:—
break wind, Ar.Pl.693, Pax151, etc.: c. acc. cogn., ou) libanwto\n bde/w Id.Pl.703:—Med. or Pass., Id.Eq.900. of the cockroach, si/lfhs katoikidi/ou th=s bdeou/shs to\ ste/ar Archig. ap. Aët.8.35, cf. Gal.12.861. (Onomatopoeic word: root
bzd, cf. Czech
bzditi, Slov.
pezdēti, Lat.
pēdo.）

bdo/los, o(,
stench, stink, Com.Adesp.781.

bdu/llw,
to be in deadly fear of, tina/s Ar.Lys.354, cf. Eq.224, Luc. Lex.10.

be/baios, on (so always in Th., Pl.), also a, on (v. infr.): (bai/nw):—
firm, steady, kru/stallos Th.3.23; o)/xhma Pl.Phd.85d (Comp.); gh= b.
terra firma, Arr.An.2.21.5;
steadfast, durable, o(mili/a . . pisth\ kai\ be/baios S.Ph.71; a)reth=s be/baiai . . ai( kth/seis mo/nhs Id.Fr.194; yh=fos bebai/a E.El.1263; th\n xa/rin be/baion e)/xein Th.1.32; ou)de/pw be/baios h)=n h( swthri/a And.1.53; ei)rh/nhn bebai/an a)gagei=n Isoc.4.173; fili/a be/baios Pl.Smp.182c; bebai/ou te kai\ kaqara=s h(donh=s geu/esqai Id.R. 586a; do/cai kai\ pi/steis be/baioi kai\ a)lhqei=s Id.Ti.37b, etc.
sure, certain, te/kmar A.Pr.456; a)/kea Id.Eu.506 (lyr.); toceu/mata S.Ant.1086; pu/las b. pare/xein make
safe, secure, Th.4.67; bebaio/teros ki/ndunos a
surer game, Id.3.39: Sup. -o/tatos Id.1.124; be/baio/n e)sti/ tini o(/ti . . D.H.3.35; ta\ par' a)nqrw/pwn au)tw=| b. h)=n ibid.; but b. pare/xein ta\n w)na/n
confirm, guarantee, GDI1867, al. (Delph.); me/nein kuri/an kai\ b. . . sugxw/rhsin BGU1058.47 (i B. C.). of persons, etc.,
steadfast, constant, fi/los A.Pr.299 (Comp.), cf. Th.5.43, etc.: c. inf., bebaio/teroi mhde\n newteriei=n
more certain to make no change, Th.3.11. to/ b.
certainty, Hdt.7.50, cf. Pl.Phlb.59c, etc.; but to\ b. th=s dianoi/as
firmness, resolution, Th.2.89.
security, guarantee, to\ dhmo/sion b. IG12.189. Adv. -ws A.Ag.15; b. klh|sto/n Th.2.17; b. oi)kei=sqai Id.1.2; e)/xein, gnw=nai, dhmokratei=sqai, D.8.41, 39, 10.4: Comp. -o/teron, oi)kei=n Th.1.8; -ote/rws Isoc.8.60, Porph.Abst.1.11: Sup. -o/tata Th.6.91.

bebaio/ths, htos, h(,
steadfastness, stability, th=s ou)si/as Pl.Cra.386a; meta\ h(suxi/as kai\ bebaio/thtos zh=n Id.R.503c, cf. Lg.735a, 790b, Arist. EN1100b12.
assurance, certainty, Pl.Phdr.277d;
security, safety, bebaio/thtos e(/neka Th.4.66; b. kai\ a)sfa/leia Plu.Fab.19.

bebaio/tropos, on,
firm, resolute, Dam.Isid.16.

bebai-o/w,
confirm, establish, make good, toi=s dikastai=s th\n do/can Pl.Cri.53b; dwrea\n Is.1.18; ei)/te decia\s doi=en e)bebai/oun X.Cyr.8.8.2, etc.; e)/rgw| bebaiou/mena, opp. a)koh=| lego/mena, Th.1.23; b. lo/gon
make good one's word, Lys.20.32; b. th\n pra=cin X.An.7.6.17;
treat as valid, ta\s au(tw=n ai)sqh/seis Metrod.1, cf. Epicur.Sent.24; b. tini/ ti
secure one
the possession of a thing, ou)d' h(mi=n au)toi=s bebaiou=men [th\n e)leuqeri/an] Th.1.122; toi=s qeoi=s bebaiou=ntes tou\s no/mous ou)\s e)yhfi/sasqe Lys.6.29, cf. D.21.30; th\n a)rxh/n tini Plu.Sull.22; to\n lo/gon Ev.Marc.16.20:—Med.,
establish for oneself, secure, sfa=s au)tou/s Th. 1.33; th\n a)rxh/n, th\n fili/an tino/s, Id.6.10,78; b. tina/s
confirm them
in one's interest, ib.34; basilei/an Paus.3.11.4; ta\ peri\ th=s bohqei/as Plb.2.51.5. Med.,
secure one's ground in argument, Pl.Tht. 169e;
confirm oneself in an opinion, Id.Grg.489a, Prt.348d.
guarantee the validity of a purchase,
warrant the purchaser's title, b. tini\ to\ balanei=on Is.5.23, cf. Din.1.42, D.37.12, SIG46.4 (Halic., v B. C.); th\n mi/sqwsin BGU1119.47 (i B. C.): generally, b. tou\s kano/nas Arr.Epict.2.11.24. intr.,
determine, show itself positively, toi=sin e)ndoiastw=s e)/xousi . . e)bebai/wse [h( nou=sos] Hp.Epid.1.2.

bebai/-wma, atos, to/,
confirmation, proof, J.AJ2.12.4, 17.1.1.

bebai/-wsis, ews, h(,
confirmation, b. gnw/mhs Th.1.140, cf. 4.87, Demetr. Lac.Herc.1012.38F., Ph.1.486, al., D.H.Rh.10.18, Hermog.Prog. 5; ei)s b. in
perpetuity, h( gh= ou) praqh/setai ei)s b. LXX Le.25.23. legal
warranty, Aeschin.3.249 (pl.), PTeb.311.27 (ii A. D.), etc.; bebaiw/sews di/kh Poll.8.34.

bebai-wte/on,
one must confirm, o(/rkous Ph.2.272; u(po/sxesin Id.1.23.
bebai-wth/r, h=ros, o(, = sq. 2, GDI1684 (Delph.), al.

bebai-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
confirmatory, Epict.Ench.52, S.E.P.1.169, etc. -ko/n, to/,
tax paid to the Government as warrantor of sales, BGU156.9 (iii A. D.).
bebai-w/tria, h(, fem. of bebaiwth/s, ib.994 iii 7 (ii B. C.), PStrassb. 88.29 (ii B. C.), etc.
beba/men, v. bai/nw.
beba^rhw/s, v. bare/w.
be/ba^san, v. bai/nw.

beba^sa^nisme/nws, Adv.
with severe scrutiny, Poll.6.150.
be/basis: to\ eu)zo/menon, Hsch.

be/bhl-os, on, Dor. be/ba_los IG3.3845, Ps.-Lysisap.Iamb.VP17.75: (bai/nw, bhlo/s):—
allowable to be trodden, prob. of ground (opp. i(ero/s, D.H.7.8); kai\ pw=s b. a)/lsos a)\n r(u/oito/ me
; A.Supp.509; h)\ pro\s bebh/lois h)\ pro\s a)/lsesin qew=n either on
profane ground or . . , S.OC10; e)/s te ta)/bata kai\ pro\s be/bhla Id.Fr.88: hence generally,
permitted, kai\ be/bhla kai\ kekrumme/na lo/gia
public, current, E.Heracl.404; e)n bebh/lw| Th.4.97; be/bhla
permitted meats, Ath.2.65f. of persons,
unhallowed, = a)mu/htos, S.Fr.154, Orph.Fr.245;
impure, E.Fr.648; b. te kai\ a)/groikos Pl.Smp.218b; b. kai\ a)no/sia e)nqumh/mata Ph.2.165: c. gen.,
uninitiated, teleth=s AP9.298 (Antiphil.); a)podeiktikh=s meqo/dou Gal.UP12.6. Adv. -lws Ph.1.523.

bebhl-o/w,
profane, to\ sa/bbaton LXX Ex.31.14, Ev.Matt.12.5; ta\ a)nqrw/pina Jul.Or.7.228d.
pollute, defile, tina/ LXX Le.21.9, Hld.2.25.

bebh/l-wsis, ews, h(,
profanation, LXX Le.21.4, Ph.1.523.
be/blein and be/blesqai, = me/llein, Hsch.
bebolh/ato, bebolhme/nos, v. ba/llw.

bebouleume/nws, Adv.
advisedly, designedly, D.21.41.
bebra/da: a)qeri/nhn, Hsch. bebra/canta: sunto/nws kekrago/ta, Id. be/brhkes: to\ e)/ndon tw=n siago/nwn me/ros, Id. be/broc: a)gaqo/s, xrhsto/s, kalo/s, Id.

bebro/s, a/, o/n,
stupid, despo/tew bebrou= Hippon.64; also bembro/s, Hsch.
be/bru_xe, v. bru/xw.
bebrw/qois, v. bibrw/skw.
bebukw=sqai (bebhk- codd.): peprh=sqai (Thess.), Hsch.; cf. bu/kths.
bebullw=sqai: bebu/sqai, Id.
bebw/s, bebw=sa, v. bai/nw.
be/du, to/, Phryg., = a)h/r, Philyll.20; also, = u(/dwr, Orph.Fr.219.
be/h, v. be/omai.
be/qron, to/, contr. from be/reqron, Euph.148, Crates ap.EM194.22.

beie/lopes: i(ma/ntes, used as crowns for victors at Sparta, Hsch. beika/des,
the skins of animals which die naturally (Lacon.), Id. beika/sqwn: kat' o)li/gon proba/s, Id. (leg. biba/sqwn). bei/kati (b = v), = ei)/kosi (Lacon.), Id. bei/khla: nwxelh=, a)xrei=a (Lacon.), Id. beilarmo/stas, beila/rxas, = vil- (Tarent.), Id. bei/lomai, Boeot., = bou/lomai (q. v.). bei/omai, bei/w, v. sub be/omai.
bei/rakes: i(e/rakes, Hsch. beirakh/: h( a(rpaktikh/, Id. bei/ric: e)/lafos, Id. beiro/n: dasu/, Id.

bekkese/lhnos, on, (be/kos, cf. prose/lhnos, and v. Hdt.2.2) = a)rxai=os,
superannuated, doting, coined by Ar.Nu.398, cf. Plu.2.881a.

be/kos or beko/s, to/, gen. be/kous Aristid.2.3J.:—
bread, Phryg. acc. to Hdt.2.2, cf. Jahresh.8Beibl.95; but *kupri/wn b. Hippon.82.
bekw=s: makro/qen, Hsch. (veka/s).
be/la: h(/lios kai\ au)gh/ (Lacon.), Hsch.:—also bella/setai: h(liwqh/setai, Id. bela/s: ei)/rwn kai\ katagelasth/s, Id.

belehfo/ros, on,
bearing darts, AP14.111.
be/lekkoi, oi(, = o)/spria, Ar.Fr.755.

be/lemnon, to/, poet. for be/los,
dart, javelin, Il. only in pl., pikra\ b. 22.206: later in sg., a)mfito/mw| b. A.Ag.1496 (lyr.), cf. 1520, Theoc. 11.16; poet., of
hail-stones, Orph.L.597.

belenkw/qion, to/,
basket(?), PFay.118.20 (ii A. D.).

belessixa^rh/s, e/s,
joying in darts, of Apollo, AP9.525.3.

beliko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
belonging to projectiles: belika/, ta/, work by Agesistratus, Ath.Mech.8.6.

beli/ths [i_] ka/lamos reed used
for making darts, Gp.2.6.23.
be/llai: r(afi/des qala/ssiai, Hsch. be/llion: a)tuxe/s (Cret.), Id. be/llir: trufa/leia (Lacon.), Id. be/llomai, v. bou/lomai. bellou/nhs: trio/rxhs, Id.

beloqh/kh, h(,
quiver, Lib.Decl.30.9.

belo/nh, h(, (be/los)
needle, Batr.130, Eup.259, Arist.Cael.313a19; belo/nas diei/rein Aeschin.3.166.
pipe-fish, Syngnathus, Arist. HA567b23;
garfish, Belone acus, ib.506b10, Dorio ap.Ath.7.319d; but prob. f.l. for ba/lanos, Archipp.24.

beloni/s, i/dos, h(, Dim. of foreg.,
little needle, Hermipp.49. a little
fish, Sch.Opp.H.3.577.

belono-eidh/s, e/s,
needle-shaped, sxh/mata Thphr.Sens.77; b. e)/kfusis
styloid process of the temporal bone, Gal.UP7.19, al.

belono-qh/kh, h(,
needle-case, Sch.Ar.Pl.175.

belono-poiki/lths, ou, o(,
embroiderer, Hsch.

belono-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
needle-seller, Critias 70 D., Ar.Pl.175:— fem. belono/-pwlis, idos, Poll.7.197.

belo-poii/+a, h(,
manufacture of missiles, Hero Bel.72.6, Poll.7.156: —also belo-poii+kh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(, Hero Bel.74.11.

belo-poio/s, o/n,
making missiles, Ph.Bel.58.50, Poll.7.156.

be/los, eos, to/,
missile, esp.
arrow, dart, freq. in Hom.; of the piece of rock
hurled by the Cyclops, to/ntonde balw\n b. Od.9.495; of an ox's leg
thrown by one of the suitors at Ulysses, 20.305; of a stool, 17.464; u(pe\k bele/wn out
of the reach of darts, out
of shot, Il.4.465; e)k bele/wn 11.163; e)/cw belw=n X.Cyr.3.3.69, etc.; e)/cw be/lous Arr.An. 2.27.1, Luc.Hist.Conscr.4; opp. e)nto\s be/lous, D.S.20.6, Arr.An. 1.2.5; ei)/sw b. parelqei=n ib.1.6.8. used of
any weapon, as
a sword, Ar.Ach.345, cf. S.Aj.658; an
axe, E.El.1159;
the sting of a scorpion, A.Fr.169; of the gad-fly, Id.Supp.556. a)gana\ be/lea of Apollo, Il.24.759, Od.3.280, and of Artemis, ib.5.124, denote
sudden, easy death of men and women respectively; be/los o)cu/, of Ilithyia,
pangs of childbirth, Il.11.269, cf. Theoc.27.29. after Hom. of
anything swift-darting, *dio\s be/lh
the bolts of Zeus, lightnings, Pi.N.10.8, cf. Hdt.4.79, etc.; *zhno\s a)/grupnon b. A.Pr.360; pu/rpnoun b. ib.917; be/lesi purpno/ou za/lhs, of a storm, ib.373; pa/gwn du/sombra b. S.Ant.358: metaph., o)mma/twn b.
glance of the eye, A.Ag. 742; fi/loikton b. a piteous
glance, ib. 241 (lyr.); i(me/rou b. the
shaft of love, Id.Pr.649; qumou= be/lh S.OT893 (s.v.l.); of arguments, pa=n teto/ceutai b. A.Eu.679, cf. Pl.Phlb.23b; b. ta\ a)po\ tou= sto/matos, of invective, Lib.Or.51.8; of
mental anguish or
fear, a)/tlaton b. Pi.N. 1.48 (v.l. de/os） o( fqo/nos au)to\s e(auto\n e(oi=s bele/essi dama/zei AP10.111.
engine of war, Ph.Bel.82.8: pl.,
artillery, ib.97.10. (Cf. ba/llw, Lith.
gélti 'sting',
gēla\ 'sharp pain', OHG.
quelan 'feel sharp pain'. Root
g[uglide]el- 'pierce', cf. de/lliqes.)

belo-sta^si/a, h(,
range or
battery of warlike engines, Ath.Mech.22.11.
belo/-sta^sis, ews, h(, = foreg., Plb.9.41.8, Ph.Bel.81.17, D.S. 20.85.

belo-sfendo/nh, h(,
dart wrapped with pitch and tow, and thrown while on fire from an engine, Plu.Sull.18.

beloulk-e/w,
draw out darts, au)to\s e(auto\n beloulkei=
extracts the weapon (i.e.
hook from itself, Plu.2.977b.

beloulk-hte/on,
one must draw out darts, Paul.Aeg.6.88.

beloulk-i/a, h(,
drawing out of darts, Eust.464.41(pl.).

beloulk-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for beloulki/a, Paul.Aeg. 6.88.

beloulk-o/s, o(,
instrument for drawing out darts, ibid. = di/ktamnos, Ps.-Dsc.3.32.

belofo/roi, oi(, = Lat.
sagittarii, Lyd.Mag.1.46.

be/lt-eros, a, on, = belti/wn, poet. Comp. of a)gaqo/s,
better, more excellent, Hom. only in neut., be/ltero/n [e)sti]
it is better, c. inf., Il.15.511, 21.485: c. dat. pers. et inf., Od.17.18; be/lteron ei) . . 6.282, cf. Thgn.92, A.Th.337, etc.: Sup. be/ltatos, h, on, Id.Eu.487, Supp. 1054.

belt-io/ths, htos, h(,
superiority, Sch.Pi.O.1.5.

belt-io/w,
improue, Ph.1.202, al., Stud.Pal.1.7 ii 20 (v A. D.), etc.:—Pass., Ph.1.169, al., Plu.2.85c, SIG888.5 (Thrace, iii A. D.), Antyll. ap. Orib.10.23.18, etc.; ou)/te beltiou=si th\n ai)ti/an tw=n paqw=n
give no
better reason for, Posidon. ap. Gal.5.469.

be/lt-istos, h, on, Dor. be/nt-, Sup. of a)gaqo/s,
best, most excellent, b. a)nh\r genenh=sqai peri\ to\n dh=mon Ar.Eq. 765; w)= be/ltiste or b., a common mode of address,
my dear friend, Id.Pl.1172, Antiph.289, Pl.R.337e, etc.; w)= be/ltiste su/ Eub.106; w)= b. a)ndrw=n Pl.Grg.515a; w)= a)/riste kai\ b. Id.Lg.902a; be/ntisq' ou(=tos Theoc.5.76; u(pe\r to\ b. A.Ag.378; oi( b. or to\ b.
the aristocracy, X. HG5.2.6, Cyr.8.1.16, Ath.1.5, etc.; to\ b., in Philos.,
the highest good, Pl.Phd.99a, 99b, Epict.Ench.51, etc.; ta\ b. bouleu/ein Th.4.68; ou)k a)po\ tou= b. a)nastre/fesqai SIG593.7(ii B. C.), PTeb.282.8 (ii A. D.). Adv. be/ltista X.Oec.7.29, etc.; belti/stws Simp. in Cael.419.25.

belt-i/wn, on, gen. onos, Comp. of a)gaqo/s,
better (not in Hom.), be/ltio/n [e)sti]
it is fitting, conuenient, Arist.Pol.1264b28; manqa/nein belti/ona [S.]Fr. 1120.5; e)pi\ to\ b. xwrei=n
improve, advance, Th.7.50; e)pi\ to\ b. e)lqei=n Din.1.65; a)/gein ib.29; ta\ belti/w prosdoka=n a)ei/ Apollod.Com.9. Adv. beltio/nws, e)/xein Hp.Mul.1.2, cf. Pl.R.484a. [i_ Att., but be/lti^on Mimn.2.10.]
belt-iw/teros, a, on, = belti/wn, prob. in Telesill.6.
belto/s: blhto/s, Hsch. be/lfin, Aeol., = delfi/s, EM200.24.
belfo/s, -oi/, Boeot. and Aeol. for *delf-.

bembeu/ei: dineu/ei, Hsch. bembi/dion, a small
fish, Id. (leg. bembr-, cf. bembra/s).

bembi_k-ia/w, (be/mbic)
spin like a top, Ar.Av.1465.

bembi_k-i/zw,
set a-spinning, e(autou/s Id.V.1517.

bembi_k-w/dhs, es,
like a top, Ath.11.496a.

be/mbic, i_kos, h(,
whipping-top, Ar.Av.1461, Call.Epigr.1.9.
whirlpool, Opp.H.5.222.
cyclone, Hsch.
bussing insect, Nic.Al.183, Th.806, Parmeno 4.
be/mbleto, v.l. for me/mbleto in Il.21.516, Sch.Il.Oxy.221 xi 35: bemo/leto (sic) Hsch., who also gives be/mblwka for membl-.
bembra/s, a/dos, h(, = membra/s, Aristomen. 7, Numen. ap. Ath.7.287c: —Dim. bemb<r>i/dion, Hsch.

bembra^fu/h [u^], h(,
a dish of membra/des
and a)fu/ai, Aristonym.2.
bembrei=: dineu/ei, Hsch. bembro/s, v. bebro/s. bemei=: donei=, Id. bemo/leto, v. be/mbleto. bemo/ric (prob. for be/mbric), = be/mbic, Id.

bendi=s, i=dos, h(, acc. *bendi=n (not *be/ndis, idos, Hdn.Gr.1.107):—
Bendis, the Thracian Artemis, worshipped under this name at the Piraeus, Hippon.120, IG12.310, Luc.JTr.8, Orph. Fr.200:—hence *bendi/d-eion, to/,
temple of Bendis, X.HG2.4.11:

bembi_/k-eia, ta/,
her festiual, Pl.R.354a, IG2.741 (written -ea):
bembi_/k-eios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Bithynia, Hemerolog.Flor.

Benetiano/s, o(,
a favourer of the blues, M.Ant. 1.5, IG14.1503.

be/netos, on, = kalla/i+nos,
blue, Lyd.Mens.4.30: esp. of
the blue faction in the Circus,
Tab. Defix. Aud.166.38 (Rome, iv/v A. D.), Lyd. l.c., Procop.Pers.1.24: Adj. *bene/teios, on,
of the *be/netoi, stoa/ ibid.

be/nqos, eos, to/, poet., = ba/qos,
depth of the sea, kata\ be/nqos a(lo/s Il. 18.38,49; a(lo\s be/nqosde Od.4.780, 8.51: in pl., o(/ste qala/sshs pa/shs be/nqea oi)=den 1.53; e)n be/nqessin a(lo/s Il.1.358; be/nqesi li/mnhs 13.21, 32; also baqei/hs be/nqesin u(/lhs Od.17.316: metaph., be/nqei+ sh=s kradi/hs AP5.273 (Paul. Sil.).—Used also by Emp.35.3, al., Pi. O.7.57, and in lyr., E.Fr.304, Ar.Ra.666. (Cf. baqu/s.)
be/ntistos, a, on, v. be/ltistos.

be/omai and bei/omai, Homeric subj. used as fut., I
shall live, ou)/ ti *dio\s be/omai fresi/n Il.15.194; ou)d' au)to\s dhro\n be/h| 16.852, cf. 24.131; ti/ nu bei/omai ai)na\ paqou=sa
; 22.431. (Cf. bio/mesqa, bi/ontai (v. bio/w), whence bi/omai, bi/e' should perh. be restored in Hom.）
berbei/a, title of Aphrodite in Cyprus, Eriph.2.13.

be/rberi, eos, to/,
pearl-mussel, foreign word, Androsth. ap. Ath. 3.93b.
berberi/zw, = battari/zw, in later Greek, EM191.35.

berbe/rion, to/,
shabby garment, Anacr.21.3.

berbi/nia, ta/,
pegs for hanging up vases, Hermipp.in Gloss. Oxy. 1801.57, Hsch.

bergai/+zw,
romance, St.Byz. s.v. be/rgh: bergai=os u(/qlos Alex. in Gloss. Oxy.1801.50; b. dih/ghma Str.2.3.5 (Antiphanes of Berga in Thrace was proverbial for his 'tall' stories).

be/redos, o(, = Lat.
veredus, post-horse, Procop.Pers.2.20:—hence bereda/rios, o(, Id.Aed.5.3:—also written berhda/rios, ti/ e)sti/ nau/ths; qala/sshs b. Secund.Sent.18.

be/reqron, Ep. and Ion. for ba/raqron, Il.8.14, Pherecyd.51(b) J., Epic.in Arch.Pap.7P.7; of the
underground course of a river, Thphr. HP3.1.2, 5.4.6, Posidon.55.
bereku/ndai: dai/mone/s tines, Hsch.

bere/kuntes, oi(, a Phrygian people, Str.10.3.12, 12.8.21: acc. sg. *bere/kunta A.Fr.158; bere/kunta bro/mon, of the Phrygian flute, S.Fr. 513:—also bere/kuntai, Hsch.:—Adj. bereku/nqios, a, on,
Phrygian, devoted to Cybele, Call.Dian.246; bereku/ntios, Hsch.
berekunti/as, o(, = a)phliw/ths (Pontic word), Thphr. Vent.62.

bereni/kh [i_], h(, Macedon. form for *fereni/kh, freq. pr. n. in the time of the Ptolemies:—also berni/kh Act.Ap.25.13: bereni/khs plo/kamos, a
constellation, Gem.3.8, etc.; also, a
throw of the dice, Hsch.:— hence bereni/kion, to/, a
plant, Hsch.; also,
nitre of the best quality, Gal.13.568:—Dim. berenika/rion or bernika/rion ni/tron, Orib.Fr.107, Aët.6.54:—bereniki/des, ai(, women's
shoes, Hsch.

bere/sxeqoi, oi(,
the Powers of Folly, Ar.Eq.635; bere/sxetoi Gloss. Oxy.1801.

beri/kokkon, to/,
apricot, Gp.10.73.2:—Dim. beriko/kkion ib.3.1.4, Artem.1.73; b. mh=lon Herod.Med.in Rh.Mus.58.100. (Lat.
praecoqua.）

be/rkios: e)/lafos (Lacon.), Hsch. berkni/s: a)kri/s, Id. (cf. breu=kos). bernw/meqa: klhrwsw/meqa (Lacon.), and berre/ai: klhrw=sai (prob. = mei/reai), Id. be/rrhs, ou, o(, = drape/ths,
a fugitive; and berreu/w, = drapeteu/w, Id. berro/n, = beiro/n, Id. berwnetw=n: a)lla\ a)netw=n, Id. be/skeroi: a)/rtoi (Lacon.), Id. beso/n: e)/qos, Id. (prob. Lacon. = veqo/n). bestiko/s: o( tw=n e)sqh/twn e)/mpeiros cj. in Id. s.v. beso/n. (Cf.
vestis.）

besti/on, to/,
clothing, PLond.5.1654 (iv A. D.).
be/ston and be/tton, = i(ma/tion, Diogenian. ap. EM195.45.

bettonikh/, h(, = brettanikh/, interpol. post Dsc.4.2 (p.170 Wellm.).
Paul's betony, Sideritis purpurea, Paul.Aeg.7.3. = ke/stros (q.v.), ibid.

beu=dos, eos, to/,
woman's dress, Sapph.155, Call.Fr.155, Nicaenet.(?) ap. Parth.11.4(pl.). = a)/galma, at Hermione, EM195.52.
be/fu_ra, Boeot. for ge/fura, Stratt.47.5.

bh=bh=,
baa, the ery of sheep, bh= bh= le/gwn badi/zei Cratin.43.cf. Ar. Fr.642, Varro RR2.1:—hence bhbh/n: pro/baton, and bh/zei: fwnei=, Hsch.

bh=gma, atos, to/, (bh/ssw)
expectoration, phlegm, Hp.Morb.2.47.
bh/qulos: ei)=dos o)rne/ou, EM196.54. bh=ka: a)nadendra/s, Hsch. bh/kh: xi/maira, Id.

bhki/a, ta/, = proba/tia, Hp. ap. Gal.19.88: but bhki/a and bhki/on (which = e)leli/sfakos, Ps.-Dsc.3.33, and = yeudodi/ktamnos, ib.32), = bh/xion, Erot., Ps.-Dsc.3.112. bhkw/nion: ei)=dos bota/nhs, Hsch. (leg. mhk-).
bhla/, w=n, ta/, = pe/dila, Panyas.23.
bh/lhma (i.e. vhl-), atos, to/, = kw/luma, fra/gma e)n potamw=| (Lacon.), Hsch., cf. IG5(1).1390.104 (Andania).
bhlh/ssei: blhxa=tai, Hsch.

bhlo/qu^ron, to/,
door-curtain, portière, Sch.Ar.Ra.969.
bh/lomai, v. bou/lomai.

bhlo/s, Dor. ba_lo/s (also usedin Trag., AB224), o(: （bai/nw):—
threshold, Il.1.591, A.Ch.571, Porph.Antr.14; b. a)stero/eis Q.S.13.483.

bh=ma, Aeol. and Dor. ba=ma, atos, to/, (bai/nw)
step, pace, h.Merc.222, 345, Pi.P.3.43, A.Ch.799 (lyr.); spoudh=| . . bhma/twn poreu/etai E.Andr. 880; toso/nde b. diabebhkw/s Ar.Eq.73;
footfall, e)rato\n ba=ma Sapph. Supp.5.17; *dio\s eu)/froni bh/mati molei=n to journey under the kindly
guidance of Zeus, S.El.163 (lyr.);
gait, b. ou)k o)rqo/n Hippiatr.27.
step, as a measure of length, = 10 palaistai/, about 2 1/2 feet, Hero
*Deff. 131. metaph.,
step, 'moment', pro/odos e)n trisi\ b. diistame/nh Dam.Pr.258. = ba/qron,
step, seat, S.OC193 (lyr.).
raised place or
tribune to speak from in a public assembly, etc., Th.2.34, LXX Ne.8.4, etc.; in the Pnyx at Athens, e)pi\ to\ b. a)nabh=nai enter
public life, D.18.66; ai( a)po\ tou= b. e)lpi/des Id.4.45; also in the lawcourts, Id.48.31, Aeschin.3.207; of a suppliant, e)pi\ tou= b. kaqedou/menon Ar.Pl.382; in the bouleuth/rion, Antipho6.40.
tribunal of a magistrate, tou= h(gemo/nos b. PTeb.434 (ii A. D.). = qume/lh, Poll.4.123; b. qeh/trou IG3.239.
base, pedestal, OGI219.36 (Ilium, iii B. C.), 299.15 (Pergam., ii B. C.).
bh=ma: pro/bata, Hsch.

bhma^t-i/zw, (Act. only in Hsch.)
measure by paces, Plb.3.39.8 (Pass.); o(do\s bebhmatisme/nh kata\ mi/lion Str.7.7.4:—Med., o)/mmati bhmati/saisqe to\n a)e/ra Dionys.Eleg.3.5.
step, walk, Aesop. 322b.

bhma^t-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who measures by paces, Ath.10.442c.
quartermaster, SIG303 (Olympia, iv B. C.).
bh/menai, v. bai/nw.
bhnw=sa: h( fwnh\ tw=n proba/twn, Hsch.

bh/c, bhxo/s,
cough, o(, Th.2.49; h(, Hp.Prog.14, Phryn.Com.60, Arist.de An.420b33, Thphr.HP3.18.3.
bhra/nqemon (i. e. vhr-）: na/rkissos, Hsch.
bh/rbh: kwdu/a （-di/a cod.) mh/kwnos, Hsch.

bh/rhc, hkos, o(, a kind of
loaf, Ar. in Gloss.Oxy.1801.59 (pl.), Ath.3.114f, AB226, Hsch. (who also has bh/rac); cf. ba/rac, pa/rac.
bhri/des, = e)mba/des, Hsch. bhri/xalkon: ma/ra[n]qon (Lacon.), Id.
bhru/llios, = a)eizwon to\ me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.4.88. = a)nemw/nh h( *foinikh=, Osthanes ap.eund.2.176; cf. Hsch. s.v. bh/rullos.

bh/rullos, h(,
gem of sea-green colour, beryl, LXX To.13.17, D.P. 1012, Tryph.70, PHolm.8.10, al.; *)indh\ b. AP9.544 (Adaeus); b. li/qos Luc.VH2.11:—Dim. bhru/llion, to/, LXX Ex.28.20, D.S.2.52.
bhrusseu/ein: spei/rein (perh. speira=n), Hsch.; cf. mhru/ein.
bh=rus: i)xqu/s, Hsch.; cf. mh=ruc.

bh/salon (or bis-), to/,
brick, Alex.Trall.9.2:—hence bhsaliko/n, to/,
brick-work, Hero
*Stereom.1.76.

bhsasa=, usu. indecl., but acc. bhsasa=n v.l. in Dsc.3.46:—
Syrian rue, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.23.26, etc.: bhsa/s, h(, PMag.Par.1.800.
bh/seto, v. bai/nw. bhsi/on, v. bhssi/on.

bh=ssa, Dor. ba=ssa, h(, poet. Noun,
wooded combe, glen, in Hom. mostly ou)/reos e)n bh/ssh|s in the mountain
glens, Il.3.34, al.; e)n kalh=| bh/ssh| 18.588, cf. Od.19.435; koi/lh d' u(pode/drome bh=ssa trhxei=a h.Ap.284: pl. for sg., e)n bh/ssh|si Od.10.210: used also by Pi., twice by S. (lyr.), OC673, Aj.197, and Arist.HA618b24.
drinkingcup at Alexandria, broader below and narrower above, Ath.11.784b.

bhssh/eis, essa, en,
of or
like a glen, woody, a)/gkea, dri/a, Hes.Op. 389,530; ou)/rea D.P.1183; nomo/s Coluth.41.

bhssi/on, to/,
cup, PHolm.16.3, Hsch., prob. in PMag.Par.1.750: bhsi/on Stud.Pal.20.67 (ii/iii A. D.).

bh/ssw, Att. bhma^/t-ttw, fut. bh/cw Hp.Mul.1.41: aor. e)/bhca Hdt.6.107, Hp.Prog.8: (bh/c):—
cough, ll.cc., Ar.Ec.56, etc.:—Med. in act. sense, Hp.Morb.2.52:—Pass., ta\ bhsso/mena Id.Epid.1.3.

bh=ta, to/, indecl.,
the letter b, Pl.Cra.393e, Arist.Metaph.1087a8, AP11.437 (Arat.), Luc.Herm.40, etc. (Aram.
bēthaā'.）

bhtarmo/s, o(,
dance, b. e)no/plion w)rxh/santo A.R.1.1135.

bhta/rmwn, onos, o(,
dancer, in pl., Od.8.250,383, Man.2.335:—later, as Adj., kapno/s Nonn.D.36.297; ka/pros ib.22.44. (bai/nw, a\rari/skw.)

bhxi/a, h( (or bhxi/as, o(), (bh/c)
hoarseness, Nicom.Harm.11, Exc. 4 (pl.), Menipp.Ep.

bhxiko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from cough, grai/h f.l. in Hp.Epid.7.105.
good for a cough, fa/rmaka Gal.11.769, al., cf. Alex.Trall.5.

bh/xion, to/,
colt's-foot, Tussilago Farfara, used to allay cough, Hp. Art.63, Dsc.3.112.
slight cough, Id.Eup.2.31.

bhxw/dhs, es,
coughing, Hp.Epid.1.3.
accompanied by, productive of coughing, kata/rrooi Id.Aph.2.31, cf. Id.Art.49 (Comp.).

bi/a, Ion. bi/h [i^], h(: Ep. dat. bi/hfi Od.6.6:—
bodily strength, force, Hom., etc.; xeirw=n bi/a B. 10.91:—in Hom., periphr. of strong men, bi/h *(hraklhei/h Il.2.658, where the part. masc. pe/rsas follows, cf. 11.690; bi/h *)eteoklhei/h, *)ifiklei/h, 4.386, Od.11.290, etc.; bi/h *diomh/deos Il.5.781; also i)\s . . bi/hs *)hraklhei/hs Hes.Th.332: so in Lyr. and Trag., *pe/lopos bi/a B.5.181; *tude/ws bi/a, *polunei/kous b., A.Th. 571,577; fi/ltat' *ai)gi/sqou b. Id.Ch.893; qh/reios b., = *ke/ntauroi, S. Tr.1059. personified, *kra/tos *bi/a te A.Pr.12. of the mind, ou)k e)/sti bi/h fresi/n Il.3.45. of an argument, bi/an ou)k e)/xein pro\s <to\> a)podeicai Phld.Sign.9.
act of violence, u(/bris te bi/h te Od.15.329: mostly in pl., kei/nwn ge bi/as a)potei/seai 11.117; bi/as u(pode/gmenos a)ndrw=n 16.189; bi/ai a)ne/mwn Il.16.213. bi/a| tino/s
against one's
will, in spite of him, A.Th.746 (lyr.), S.Ant.79, Th.1.43, etc.; b. frenw=n A.Th.612; b. kardi/as Id.Supp.798; b. alone as Adv.,
perforce, Od.15.231, B.17.10, A.Pr.74, al.; bi/h| e)peira=to Hdt. 6.5; opp. kata\ fu/sin, Arist.Ph.215a1; also pro\s bi/an tino/s A.Eu.5; pro\s bi/an a)/gein tina/ Id.Pr.210, cf.
