S.OT805, Eup.8.10 D., Ar.V.443, etc.; opp. e(kw/n, Pl.Phdr.236d; e)k bi/as S.Ph.563, al., Herod.5.58; u(po\ bi/hs Hdt.6.107; a)po\ bi/as D.S.20.51; of Zeus, eu)menei= bi/a kti/sas A.Supp.1068(lyr.). in Att. law,
rape, bi/as di/kh Sch.Pl.R.464e; bi/a| ai)sxu/nesqai/ tina Lys.1.32. = Lat.
vis, bi/as grafh/ D C.37.31, cf. 33; martu/romai th\n bi/an POxy.1120.11 (iii A. D.). (Cf. Skt.
jyā´ jiyā´ 'preponderating power',
jināti 'oppress'.)

bi^a/zw,
constrain, Act. once in Hom., h)= ma/la dh/ me bia/zete Od.12.297; e)bi/ase th\n gunai=ka/ mou Alc.Com.29: abs., ei) pa/nu e)bi/azon if
they used force, Hp.Epid.2.24; cf. infr.1.2:—Pass., fut. biasqh/somai Paus. 6.5.9: aor. e)bia/sqhn, pf. bebi/asmai (v. infr.):—
to be hard pressed or
overpowered, bele/essi bia/zetai Il.11.589; bia/zeto ga\r bel. 15.727; biasqe/ntes lu/a| Pi.N.9.14; no/sw| Ar.Fr.20 (= Trag.Adesp.70);
to be forced or
constrained to do, c. inf., Id.Th.890: c. acc. cogn., bia/zomai ta/de S.Ant.66, cf. 1073; biasqei/s Id.El.575; e)pei\ e)bia/sqh Th.4.44; u(po/ tinos Id.1.2; opp. a)dikei=sqai, ib.77; biasqei\s a)/kwn e)/pracen D.6.16; i(/na h)\ sugxwrh/swsin . . h)\ biasqw=sin Id.18.175; biazo/menos u(po/ tinos e)ch/marten Antipho 4.4.5; bebiasme/noi
forcibly made slaves, X.Hier.2.12; po/leis beb. Id.HG5.2.23: biazo/menos u(po\ th=s parou/shs a)pori/as Th.7.67; to\ biasqe/n
those who are forced, Arist.Pol.1255a11; of things, tou)/neidos o)rgh=| biasqe/n
forced from one by anger, S.OT 524; to\ bebiasme/non
forced to fit a hypothesis, Arist.Metaph.1082b2; beb. sxh/mata
forced figures of speech, D.H.Th.33, cf. Porph.Antr. 36. Act.,
make good, suffice to discharge a debt, PFlor.56.13. more freq. bia/zomai, aor. Med. e)biasa/mhn, pf. bebi/asmai D.19.206, Men.Sam.63, D.C.46.45:—
overpower by force, press hard, h)= ma/la dh/ se bia/zetai w)ku\s *)axilleu/s Il.22.229, etc.; b. tou\s polemi/ous
dislodge them, X.An.1.4.5; b. no/mous
to do them
violence, Th. 8.53; biasa/menos tau=ta pa/nta
having broken through all these restraints, Lys.6.52; b. gunai=ka
force her, Ar.Pl.1092; opp. pei/qein, Lys.1.32; b. au(to/n
lay violent hands on oneself, Pl.Phd.61c, 61d; b. tina/, c. inf.,
force one to do, X.An.1.3.1; ti/ me bia/zesqe le/gein; Arist. Fr.44: with inf. omitted, b. ta\ sfa/gia
force the victims [
to be favourable], Hdt.9.41; b. a)/stra Theoc.22.9: c. dupl. acc., au)dw= po/lin se mh\ b. to/de A.Th.1047. c. acc. rei,
carry by force, bia/sasqai to\n e)/kploun
force an exit, Th.7.72; th\n a)po/basin Id.4.11: c. acc. neut., And.4.17, X.HG5.3.12. abs.,
act with violence, use force, A.Pr. 1010, Ag.1509 (lyr.), S.Aj.1160, etc.; pro\s to\ lampro\n o( fqo/nos bia/zetai Trag.Adesp.547.12; opp. dika/zomai, Th.1.77; b. dia\ fula/kwn
force one's way, Id.7.83; b. e)s to\ e)/cw, b. ei)/sw, ib.69, X.Cyr.3.3.69; dro/mw| b. Th.1.63: c. inf., b. pro\s to\n lo/fon e)lqei=n Id.7.79; biazo/menoi bla/ptein
using every effort to hurt me, Lys.9.16; but biazo/menoimh\ a)podido/nai refusing
with violence to repay, X.HG5.3.12: esp. in part., i(/na biasa/menoi e)kpleu/swsi may sail out
by forcing their way, Th.7.67; sunece/rxontai biasa/menoi X.An.7.8.11; e)pi\ ma=llon e)/ti b. (of a famine)
grow worse and worse, Hdt.1.94.
contend or
argue vehemently, c. inf., Pl.Sph.246b; b. to\ mh\ o)\n w(s e)/sti kata/ ti ib. 241d: abs.,
persist in assertion, D.21.205.
biaioelupi/ou, dub. in PPetr.3p.317.

bi^aio-qa^na^si/a, h(,
violent death, Vett. Val.94.1, Paul.Al.N.2.

bi^aio-qa^na^te/w,
die a violent death, Vett. Val.67.8, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.7.3.

bi^aio-qa/na^tos [qa^], on,
dying a violent death, most freq. of
suicides, Vett.Val.74.29, Paul.Al.M.2, Olymp. in Phd.p.243 N., PMag.Par.1.1950, Suid. s.v. kunh/gion.—Freq. written bioqa/natos.

bi^aio-klw/y, w=pos, o(, (kle/ptw)
stealing forcibly, Lyc.548.

bi^aio-ma/xos (cod. Pal. -ma/xas） a^], o(,
fighting violently, AP6.129 (Leon.).

bi^aio-ma^xe/w,
fight at close quarters, of ships, opp. taxunautei=n, Plb.1.27.12: generally, Id.5.84.2, Phld.Rh.1.195 S.

bi/aios [i^], a, on, also os, on Pl.R.399a, Philostr.VA1.33: (bi/a):—
forcible, violent: Adj. once in Hom., e)/rdein e)/rga bi/aia Od.2.236, Adv. twice,
by force, perforce, kate/dousi biai/ws oi)=kon *)odussh=os 2.237; gunaici\ pareuna/zesqe biai/ws 22.37; freq. in all writers, e)/rga b. Thgn. 1343; no/mos a)/gei dikaiw=n to\ biaio/taton Pi.Fr.169; of persons, biaio/tatos tw=n politw=n Th.3.36; xro/nos katayh/xei kai\ ta\ biaio/tata Simon. 176; b. qa/natos a
violent death, Hdt.7.170, Pl.R.566b, etc.; b. no/sos S.Ant.1140(lyr.); b. a)/nemos Arist.Mete.370b9; e)pa/rdeusis Epicur.Ep. 2p.44U. (Comp.); o( po/lemos b. dida/skalos teaches
by violence, Th. 3.82; di/kh biai/wn an action
for forcible rescue, Harp.; toi=s b. or tw=n biai/wn e)/noxos, Lys.23.12, Pl.Lg.914e; biai/wn [e)gkalei=] D.37.33; ta\ [peri\] tw=n biai/wn ibid.; sunalla/gmata b., laqrai=a,
obligationes ex delicto, Arist.EN1131a8; klopai=a kai\ b. Pl.Lg.934c. Adv. biai/ws, a)poqanei=n Antipho 1.26; b. se/lma semno\n h(me/nwn
in their irresistible might, A.Ag.182 (lyr.); xalepw=s kai\ b. by struggling and
forcing their way, Th.3.23;
firmly, sxedi/as b. zeu/cantes Plb.3.46.1: neut. pl. as Adv., A.Supp.821 (lyr.); pro\s to\ b. Id.Ag.130; e)k tou= biaiota/tou D.H.10.36. esp. of magic, b. te/xnh Philostr.VA1.33. Adv. biai/ws, sofo/s
a wizard, ib.1.2. Pass.,
forced, constrained, opp. e(kou/sios, pra/ceis Pl.R.603c; b. ki/nhsis, = para\ fu/sin k., Arist.Ph.254a9, cf. Pl.Ti.64d; to\ b., = ou(= e)/cwqen h( a)rxh\ mhde\n sumballome/nou tou= biasqe/ntos Arist.EN1110b15; h( b. trofh/, of the diet of athletes, Id.
Pol.1338b41; po/noi mh\ b. ib.1335b9; o( xrhm.atisth\s (sc. bi/os） b. ti/s e)stin, Id.EN1096a6; biaio/teros lo/gos Jul. Or.6.191d. Adv. -ws, = para\ fu/sin, kinei=sqai Arist.Ph.253b34: Comp. -ote/rws Gal.17(1).19. = biaioqa/natos, PMag.Par.1.332.

bi^aio/ths, htos, h(,
violence, b. kai\ paranomi/a Antipho 5.8, And.4.10, cf. Lys.23.11.

bi^-arkh/s, e/s, (bi/os 11, a)rke/w)
supplying the necessaries of life, AP6.179（Arch.).
life-giving, Nonn.D.17.370.

bi^/-arxos, o(, (bi/os 11, a)/rxw)
commissary-general, Lyd.Mag.1.48, al., BGU316.4 (iv A. D.).

bi^as-te/on,
one must do violence to, tu/xhn E.Rh.584; a)lo/gws b. Phld.Oec.p.56J.
bi^as-th/r, h=ros, o(, = sq., prob. in Gorg.Hel. 12.
bi^as-th/s, ou=, o(, = biata/s, Ev.Matt.11.12.

bi^as-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
forcible, violent, no/mos Pl.Lg.921e, Arist.MA703a22: Comp., a)na/gkh Ph.2.395: Sup., fi/ltron ib. 28;
cogent, to\ b. [tou= logikou=] Jul.Or.7.216a. Adv. -kw=s
violently, EM197.11: of a
forced construction, Sch.Philostr. Her.p.484B.: Comp. -w/teron, e)pita/ttein S.E.M.6.7: also,
cogently, a)podei/knutai Gal.5.480.

bi^as-to/s, h/, o/n,
violent, pra/gmata Chor. in Lib.4.793 Reiske.

bi^a_ta/s, a, o(,
forceful, mighty, Pi.Pae.6.84, al.; sofoi\ kai\ xeroi\ biatai/ Id.P.1.42; b. no/os Id.O.9.75; of wine,
potent, Id.N.9.51; )/ *arhs AP7.492 (Anyte).
bia/twr: kua/qion mikro/n, koxlia/rion, Hsch.

bi^a/w, Ep. form of bia/zw,
constrain, Act. only in the pf., a)/xos, xreiw\ bebi/hken *)axaiou/s, Il.10.145,172, 16.22:—Pass.,
to be forcibly driven, of fire, a)ne/mw| biw/menon Hdt. 1.19; pu=r bebihme/non AP9.546 (Antiphil.); qana/tw| bihqei/s Hdt.7.83, cf. Hp.Mul.1.40: fut., ou) bih/setai (in pass. sense)
will not
yield to force, ib.2.132; biwome/nh (v.l. biaz-) Mosch.2.13. freq. as Dep. (pres. imper. bia/sqw Parm.1.34, fut. bih/setai Emp.4.6) in act. sense, oi(\ kei=non bio/wntai Od.11.503, cf. 23.9, Pl.Ti.63c; w(s ei)/ e( biw/|ato (opt.) . . *trw=es
should press him
hard, Il.11.467; bih/sato ku=m' e)pi\ xe/rsou it
forced me upon . . , Od.7.278; yeudessi bihsa/menos over-reaching, Il.23.576; to/te nw=i+ bih/sato misqo\n a(/panta
wronged us, deprived us of our wages, 21.451; to\ dokei=n kai\ ta\n a)la/qeian bia=tai Simon.76, cf. Pi.N. 8.34, B. 12.200;
force, ravish, parqe/non Hdt.4.43;
drive or
urge on, bia=tai d' a( ta/laina peiqw/ A.Ag.385 (lyr.).

bib-a/zw, fut. biba/sw, Att. bibw=, with part. bibw=n S.OC381, (dia-) Pl.Lg.900c, D.23.157, (e)m-) X.An.5.7.8, (pros-) Ar.Av.426, Pl. Phdr.229e (but diabiba/sontes codd. in X.An.4.8.8, 5.2.10): aor. e)bi/basa（a)n-) Id HG4.5.3, (a)p-) Pl.Grg.511e:—Med., pres. (a)na-) Th.7.33: fut. biba/somai, Att. bibw=mai （a)na-) Amips.30, Aeschin.2.146, D.19.310, but a)nabiba/somai codd. in And. 1.148, Lys.18.24: aor. e)bibasa/mhn （a)n-) Th.7.35, Lys.20.34, etc.:—Pann., fut. bibasqh/somai （dia-) D.S. 13.81 : aor. bibasqei/s Arist.HA577a30: pf. bebi/bastai （sum-) S.E. M.7.283 :—causal of bai/nw, mostly used in compds.,
cause to mount, exalt, pro\s ou)rano\n bibw=n S.OC381: simply,
cause to go, mh/ me ta=sd' e)c o(dou= bi/baze Id.Ichn.368. of animals,
put the female to the male, Alc.Com.18, Arist. HA573b7; also of the male, Horap.1.48:—Pass., of the female, Arist. HA577a29, LXXLe.18.23.

bib-a/sqw, = biba/w, only in part., makra\ biba/sqwn long-
striding, Il.13.809, 16.534.

bi/b-a^sis, ews, h(,
a Spartan dance, Poll.4.102. = o)xei/a, Gloss. = koi/th, stiba/s, Hsch.

bib-asth/s, ou=, o(,
stallion, Gloss.

bib-a/w, poet. collat. form of bai/nw,
stride, pe/lwra biba=| he
takes huge
strides, h.Merc.225; e)bi/baske, Ion. impf., h.Ap.133: elsewh. only part., makra\ bibw=nta （biba/nta Aristarch.), makra\ bibw=sa, Il.3.22, Od.11.539; kou=fa bibw=n lightly
stepping, Pi.O.14.17.

bi/b-hmi, poet. collat. form of bai/nw,
to stride, used by Hom. only in part., makra\ biba/s Il.7.213, al.; u(/yi biba/nta 13.371, al. (v. foreg.): Dor. 3sg. bi/banti Epigr.Lacon. ap. Poll.4.102.
bibl-, bubl-, v. bu/blos.

bibl-ari/dion, to/, Dim. of bi/blos,
small roll, Apoc.10.2.
bibl-a/rion, to/, = foreg., PLille1.7.7 (iii B. C.), AP11.78 (Lucill.).
bibliagra/fos, v. bibliogra/fos.
bibli-aigisqos, *)andre/as o( i)atro\s e)peklh/qh u(po\ *)eratosqe/nous: o(/ti la/qra au)tou= ta\ bibli/a mete/graye EM198.20.
bibli-ari/dion, to/, = biblari/dion, Gal.16.5.
bibli-a/rion, to/, = bibla/rion, Antisth. ap. D.L.6.3.

biblia_fo/ros, on,
letter-carrier, Plb.4.22.2, D.S.2.26: bubliofo/ros PHal.7.6 (iii B. C.).
biblida/rion, to/, = bibla/rion, Ar.Fr.756, Agatharch.111.

bibli/dion [i_d], to/, Dim. of bibli/on, D.56.1, Plb.23.2.5 (bubl-), SIG663.20 (Delos, iii/ii B. C.), AP12.208 (Strat.), Antiph.162 : biblei/dion, to/,
petition, Lat.
libellus, POxy.1032.4 (ii A. D.), etc.; e)pi\ bibleidi/wn, = Lat.
a libellis, IG14.1072:—written bublei/dion Demetr. Lac.Herc.1012.35F., 1013.12F.

bi/blinos, h, on,
made of bi/blos （bu/blos), BGU544.4 (ii A. D.).

biblio-gra^fi/a, h(,
writing of books, Dsc.1.85, D.L.7.36.

biblio-gra/fos [a^], o(,
writer of books, scribe, Antiph.197, Lib.Ep.263:—also biblia_gra/fos (correct form acc. to Phryn.67), Cratin.249, Luc.Ind. 24.

biblio-qh/kh, h(,
book-case, Cratin.Jun.11 (bubl-).
library, collection of books, Plb.12.27.4, LXX Es.2.23, Posidon.41, Phld.Sto. Herc.339.13 (bubl-), Str.13.1.54, al., J.AJ12.2.1; b. e)/myuxos, of Longinus, Eun.VSp.456B.
record-office, registry, PTeb.389. 18 (ii A. D.); b. e)gkth/sewn BGU76.1 (ii/iii A. D.); b. dhmosi/wn [lo/gwn] PRyl.291.1 (iii A. D.).
compilation from various sources, title of works by Apollod. and D.S.

biblio-ka/phlos [a^], o(,
dealer in books, Luc.Ind.4,24.

biblio-la/qas [la_], a, o(, （lh/qh)
book-forgetting, nickname of Didymus the Gramm., who had written so many books (3,500) that he could not remember them, Demetr. Troez. ap. Ath.4.139c.

biblio-ma^xe/w,
present a counter-petition, POxy.68.33 (ii A. D.).

bibli/on or bubli/on, to/,
strip of bu/blos, Thphr.HP4.8.4: hence,
paper, document, Hdt.1.123, 3.128, Ar.Av.974, etc.; to\ b. tou= yhfi/smatos IG22.1.61; b. a)postasi/ou
notice of divorce, Ev.Matt.19.7. = bibli/dion,
petition to the Government, = Lat.
libellus, BGU422 (ii A. D.), POxy.86.16 (iv A. D.), etc. = de/ltos,
tablet, LXX To.7.14.
book, Eup.304, Theognet.1.8, Pl.Ap.26d, etc.; me/ga b. i)/son tw=| mega/lw| kakw=| Call.Fr.359.
book as the division of a work, e)n tw=| prw/tw| b. Dsc.2 Praef., Ph.1.329, etc. ta\ b.
place in which books are kept, library, a)neqh/kate ei)s ta\ b. D.Chr.37.8. ta\ b. ta\ a(/gia the sacred
books or Scriptures, LXX 1 Ma.12.9; ta\ b. tou= no/mou ib.1.56.

biblio-pwlei=on, to/,
bookseller's shop, Ath.1.1e, Gal.Libr.Propr.1.

biblio-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
bookseller, Theopomp.Com.77, Nicoph.19.4, Aristomen.9, Arist.Fr.140.

biblio-fo/rion, to/,
book- or
letter-case, AB 314.

biblio-fu^la^ke/w,
to be a librarian, PBodl.ined. (MS. Gr. Class. d86 P r 9).

biblio-fu^la^ki/a, h(,
office of bibliofu/lac, PRyl.374.8 (i/ii A. D.).

biblio-fu^la/kion [a^], to/,
place to keep books in, ta\ basilika\ b. the royal
archives, LXX 1 Es.6.21, 23, PTeb.318.23 (ii A. D.).

biblio-fu/lac [u^], akos, o(,
keeper of archives, ib. 112 Intr.10 (ii B. C.), PFay.31.3 (ii A. D.): bubl- Milet.6.36 (Didyma), POxy.483.32, CPR1.18.41 (ii A. D.).

bibli/s, i/dos, h(, = bibli/on, EM197.30. pl.,
cords of bi/blos, ibid.
biblopw/lhs, = biblio-, Phryn.PS52B. bi/blos, h(, v. bu/blos.

bibrw/skw, Babr.108.9, (cf. brw/zw, bora/）: brw/somai Philostr.VA3.40: aor. e)/brwsa （a)n-) Nic.Th.134; inf. brw=cai （kata-) Epic. in Arch.Pap.7.5: Ep. aor. 2 e)/brwn Call.Jov.49, (kat-) h.Ap.127 : pf. be/brwka Il.22.94, Eup.68; sync. part. bebrw/s, w=tos, S.Ant.1022; opt. bebrw/qois, as iffrom pf. be/brwqa, Il.4.35:—Pass., pres., Hp.Aff.4:fut. brwqh/somai Lyc.1421, S.E.P.3.227; bebrw/somai Od.2.203: aor e)brw/qhn Hp.Acut.37, etc., (kat-) Hdt.3.16: pf. be/brwmai A.Ag.1097 (lyr.), (dia-) Pl. Ti.83a, (kata-) SIG2587.310: plpf. e)be/brwto Hp.Epid.4.19. —In Ion. Prose and LXX be/brwka e)brw/qhn be/brwmai take the place of Att. e)dh/doka h)de/sqhn e)dh/desmai:—
eat, eat up, bebrwkw\s kaka\ fa/rmak' Il.22.94, etc.; ou)de\n bebr. Eup.68: c. gen.,
eat of a thing, [le/wn] bebrwkw\s boo/s Od.22.403; tw=n melw=n bebrwko/tes Ar.V.463; kreiw=n te kai\ ai(/matos Theoc.25.224: abs., bebrwkw/s, opp. peinw=n, Arist.HA 629b9; b. kai\ pepwkw/s Id.Fr.232, cf. Plb.3.72.6, Ev.Jo.6.13:—Pass.,
to be eaten, Hp.Acut.37; of teeth,
decay, Id.Epid.4.19; xrh/mata d' au)=te kakw=s bebrw/oetai
will be devoured, Od.2.203; bebrwme/noi a)/rtoi
mouldy bread, LXX Jo.9.12; r(i/za bebr.
worm-eaten, Dsc.3.9;
to be bitten, u(po\ tw=n krokodei/lwn Gal.14.246.
bi/dhn, ei)=dos, krou=ma: a)/lloi
bi/qun, S.Fr.60 (ap.Hsch.); cf. budoi/.

bidiai=oi, oi(,
officers at Sparta, whose duties were connected with the charge of the ephebi, five in number, acc. to Paus.3.11.2; but six in Inscrr.:—written bi/deoi IG5(1).32 B, al., bi/duoi ib.41: sg. bi/duios ib. 1498.13 (Messenia, ii B. C.). (For vi/duioi, i. e.
overscers.）

biza/rion, to/,
she-camel or
suckling camel, PLond.ined.1821.
bizh=ai: koi=tai, stiba/des, Hsch.
bi^hma/xos [a^], on, = biaioma/xas, *)/erws AP5.292.1 (Paul.Sil.); basileu/s ib.4.3b.2 (Agath.).
bi/qun, v. bi/dhn.

bi_qu_ni^-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
President of the Provincial Council of Bithynia, OGI528.10 (Prusias), al.:

bi_qu_ni^-arxi/a, h(,
his office, Dig.27.1.6.14, IGRom. 3.1427 (beiq-).
bi=kas: sfi/ggas, Hsch.
bi_ki/on, to/, Dim. of bi=kos, v.l. in Dsc.2.78; b. u(e/linon Gp.10.69.1:— also bi_ki/dion, Suid.

bi^ki/on, to/,
vetch, Vicia sativa, Gal.6.550:—also bi^ki/a, h(, Edict.Diocl.17.6, Gp.3.6.7:—hence Adj. bi/keios, xo/rtos Hippiatr.104.

bi=kos, o(,
jar or
cask, Hdt.1.194, X.An.1.9.25, PHal.7.5 (iii B. C.), PHib.1.49 (iii B. C.), LXX Je.19.1, etc.
drinking-bowl, Pollux Par. ap. Ath.11.784d. a
measure, BGU112.15 (i A. D.), PTeb. 472 (ii A. D.). [i_, v. Ephipp.8.2, Archestr.Fr.38.2.]

bi_ko/stomon, to/,
opening of a receiving vessel, of a still, Zos.Alch. p.224B.
bili/skos, vulg., = o)beli/skos, PLond.2.329.

billariko/s, h/, o/n, perh. = Lat.
villaticus, POxy.1026.12 (v A. D.).
billa=s, dub. sens. in Hdn.Gr.1.55. billi/n: to\ ai)doi=on, ib. 158. bi/llos, = foreg., ibid. bimbiki/zetai: perikrou/etai, Hsch. bi/mblinos, = bi/blinos, Id.

bi_ne/w,
inire, coïre, of illicit intercourse, opp. o)pui/w, Sol. ap. Hsch., Ar.Ra.740: c. acc. pers., Id.Av.560, etc.:—Med., Ion. impf. binesko/mhn Id.Eq.1242:—Pass., of the woman, Eup.351.2, Philetaer. 9.4.

bi_nhtia/w, Desiderat. of bine/w,
coïre cupio, of the woman, Ar.Lys. 715, Machoap.Ath.13.583c; of the man, Luc.Pseudol.27.

bi^o-gra^fi/a, h(,
biography, Dam.Isid.8.

bi^o-do/ths, ou, o(,
giver of livelihood, qeo/s Pl.Lg.921a.

bi^o/-dwros, on,
life-giving, a)maxani/as a)/kos Pi.Pae.3.26; nu/mfais . . potamou= paisi/n b. A.Fr.168 (hex.); ai)=a S.Ph.1162 (lyr.): in late Prose, gh= Artem.2.39.
bi^o-dw/ths, ou, o(, = biodo/ths, of Apollo, AP9.525.3; voc. biodw=ta IG14.1015:—fem. bi^o-dw=tis, idos, Orph.H.29.3.

bi^o-dw/twr, oros, o(, = foreg., ib.73.2, IG3.
239.
furnishing a livelihood, [nau=s] AP7.585 (Jul.).

bi^o-zu^gh/s, e/s,
linking lives together, u(me/naioi Nonn.D.33.179.

bi^o-qa/lmios, on, (qa/llw)
strong, hale, h. Ven.189.
bi^o-qa^na^si/a, = biaio-, Ptol. Tetr. 85.
bi^o-qa/na^tos [qa^], = biaio-, PMag.Par.1.1950.

bi^o-qre/mmwn, on, gen. onos,
life-supporting, pa/ntwn Ar.Nu.570 (lyr.); fu=la Orph.H.34.19.
bi^o-qre/pteira, h(, fem. of foreg., ib.27.13.

bi^o-klw/steira, h(,
spinning the thread of life, of Fate, Arch.Pap.1.221 (ii B. C.).

bi^o/-kouros, o(, (
via, curo), = 111
vir viarum curandarum, IGRom.4.1307 (Lydia).

bi^o-kwlu/ths [u_], ou, o(,
an officer to suppress violence or
lawlessness, Just.Nov.8.12, al.

bi^o-loge/omai, Pass.,
to be sketched from life, esp.
common life, ta\ biologou/mena Longin. 9.15.

bi^o-logiko/s, h/, o/n,
of a biolo/gos, kwmw|di/ai, = mi=moi, Suid. s.v. *filisti/wn.

bi^o-lo/gos, o(,
one who represents to the life, player, IG14.2342, POxy.1025.7 (iii A. D.).

bi^o-mh/xa^nos, on,
clever at getting a living, Antipho Soph. 41; of birds, Arist.HA616b17, al.
bi^o/-moros, on, = biaioqa/natos, PMag.Par.1.1400.
bi^o/-plagktos, on, = sq., tu/xh Nonn. D.3.356.

bi^o-pla^nh/s, e/s,
wandering to get one's living, a beggar, bioplane/s (poet. nom. pl. for -plane/es) Call. Fr.497: neut. sg. bioplanes Hdn. Gr. ap. Et.Gen., A.D.Pron.93.8.
bi^o-ponhtiko/s, h/, o/n = sq., Hippodam. ap. Stob.4.1.94.

bi^o-po/nos, on,
living by labour, ib.93.

bi^o/-pra_gos, on,
prosperous, successful, Astramps. Orac.85, al.

bi^o/-pra_tos, o(,
ne'er-do-weel, POxy.1477.14 (iii/iv A. D.).
biorro/s: doulei/a, Hsch. (fort. ei)/reros).

bi/os[i^], o(,
life, i. e. not animal life (zwh/), but
mode of life (cf. ei) xro/non tis le/goi yuxh=s e)n kinh/sei meta batikh=| e)c a)/llou ei)s a)/llon bi/on zwh\n ei)=nai Plot.3.7.11),
manner of living (mostly therefore of men, v. Ammon. p.32 V.; but also of animals, diexw/rizon zw/|wn te bi/on de/ndrwn te fu/sin Epicr.11.14, cf. X.Mem.3.11.6, etc.; also zh=n futou= bi/on Arist. GA736b13); zw/eis d' a)gaqo\n bi/on Od. 15.491; e)mo\n bi/on a)mfipoleu/ein 18.254; ai)w=na bi/oio Hes.Fr.161; to\n makro\n tei/nein bi/on A.Pr.537 (lyr.); o( kaq' h(me/ran b. S.OC1364; bi/on diagagei=n Ar.Pax 439; telei=n S.Ant.1114; diatelei=n Isoc.6.45; die/rxesqai bi/ou te/los dub.in Pi.I.4(3).5; teleuta=n Isoc.4.84; u(p' a)/llou teleuth=sai b. Pl.Lg.870e; e)peida\n tou= a)nqrwpi/nou bi/ou teleuth/sw X.Cyr.8.7.17; te/rma bi/ou pera=n S.OT1530; o(do\s bi/ou Isoc.1.5, cf. X.Mem.2.1.21; dia\ bi/ou Arist.Pol.1272a37; prov., o( e)pi\ *kro/nou bi/os 'the Golden Age', Id.Ath.16.7; so *tarthssou= b. Him.Ecl.10.11; b. zwh=s Pl.Epin.982a (cf. bioth/）; zh=n qala/ttion b. Antiph.100; a)me/rimnon zh=n b. Philem.92.8; lagw\ b. zh=n dediw\s kai\ tre/mwn D.18.263; sklhro\s tw=| b. Men.Georg.66: rarely in pl., Alex.116.6 and 11, Men.855; ti/nes kai\ po/soi ei)si\ b.; Pl.Lg.733d, cf. Arist.EN1095b15, Pol.1256a20. in Poets sts. = zwh/, bi/on e)kpne/wn A.Ag.1517 (lyr.); a)poyu/xein S.Aj.1031; fei/desqai bi/ou Id.Ph.749; nosfi/zein tina\ bi/ou ib.1427, etc.
lifetime, e)s to\n a(/panta a)nqrw/pwn b. Hdt.6.109; tw=n e)pi\ tou= sou= b. gegono/twn lo/gwn Pl.Phdr. 242a, cf. PMagd.18.7 (iii B. C.), etc.
livelihood, means of living (in Hom. bi/otos）, bi/os e)phetano/s Hes.Op.31, Pi.N.6.10; to\n bi/on kta=sqai, poiei=sqai, e)/xein a)po/ tinos, to make one's
living off, to
live by a thing, Hdt.8.106, Th.1.5, X.Oec.6.11; a)peste/rhkas to\n bi/on ta\ to/c' e(lw/n S.Ph.931, cf. 933, 1282; kta=sqai plou=ton kai\ bi/on te/knois E. Supp.450; plei/on' e)kmoxqei=n b. ib.451; b. polu/s ib.861; o)li/gos Ar. Pl.751; bi/on kekthme/nos Philem.99.4; o( i^dios b. private
property, AJA17.29 (i B. C.), cf. SIG762.40, Iamb.VP30.170; b. *dhmh/trios, =
corn, A.Fr.44.
the world we live in, 'the world', oi( a)po\ tou= b., opp.
the philosophers, S.E.M.11.49; simply o( bi/os Id.P.1.211; o( b. o( koino/s ib. 237; muqika\s u(poqe/seis w(=n mesto\s o( b. e)sti/ Ph.1.226; e)kkaqai/rein to\n b., of Hercules, Luc.DDeor.13.1; to\n bi/on mimou/menoi, of comic poets, Sch. Heph.p.115C.; also, 'the public', i(/na o( b. ei)dh=| ti/na dei= metakalei=sqai Sor.1.4.
settled life, almost, =
abode, e)n th=| *qra|ki/a| nh/sw| bi/ous i(dru/santo D.H.1.68, cf. 72.
a life, biography, as those of Plu., Thes.1, cf. Ph.2.180.
caste, diei=le to\ plh=qos ei)s te/ttaras b. Str.8.7.1.
wine made from partly dried unripe grapes, Plin.HN14.77. Astrol.,
the second region, Paul.Al.L.2. (Cf. Skt.
jīv´s 'alive',
j[imacracute]vati 'live', Lat.
uīvus, etc.)

bi^o/s, o(,
bow, = to/con, Il.1.49, Heraclit.48, etc. (Ambracian acc. to AB1095. Cf. Vedic
jiyā´ 'bow-string', Lith.
gijà 'thread'.)
bio/ssao: to\ zh=n e)/dwkas, biw=sai e)poi/hsas, Hsch. (i. e. e)biw/sao).

bi^osso/os, on,
life-supporting or
-preserving, Nonn.D.33.109,41.333, al.

bi^osterh/s, e/s,
reft of the means of life, S.OC747.

bi^otei/a, h(,
way of life, X.Oec.6.10, Plb.6.7.5.
bi^o-telh/s, e/s, dub. sens., EM198.11.

bi^o-te/rmwn, on, gen. onos,
marking the beginning of life, w(/rh Man.4.77.
lasting till the close of life, plou=tos Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.110.

bi^o/t-euma, atos, to/,
manner of life, Soer.Ep.29.

bi^ot-eu/w,
live, Pi.N. 4.6; a)bi/wton xro/non b. E.Alc.243 (lyr.); b. a)kratw=s Arist.EN1114a16; faidrw=s X. Cyr.4.6.6.
get food, au)to/qen polemou=nta Th.1.11;
live by or off a thing, a)po\ pole/mou X.Cyr.3.2.25; a)po\ tw=n a)kanqw=n Arist. HA610a5.
reside, e)s qa/lassan Aret.CD1.2; e)n xw/rh|si qermh=|si ib.4.

bi^ot-h/, h(, = bi/otos, bi/os, Od.4.565, Phoc. 10; e(katontaeth\s b. Pi.P.4.282: Trag. in lyr., A.Pers.853, S.Ph.690, E.Andr.785; rare in Prose, Hdt. 7.47, Democr. 200, 297, X.Cyr.7.2.27, Acl.NA2.23: metaph. of foods, ta\ a)sqene/stera siti/a o)ligoxro/nion b. e)/xei Hp. Epid.6.5.14.
living, sustenance, S.Ph.164,1159, Ar.V.1452 (lyr.).
bi^o/t-hs, htos, h(, = foreg., h.Hom.8.10,IG14.1449.

bi^ot-h/sios, on,
supporting life, w)=nos A.R. 2.1006; vautili/h b. voyage
of life, AP 9.208; i)/xnos o(/pou lh/gei b. benndorf-Niemann
Reisen in Lykien u. Karien p.79.

bi^o/t-ion, to/, Dim. of bi/otos,
scant living, Ar.Pl. 1165.

bi^/ot-os, o(, Ep., = bi/os 1,
life, bio/toio teleuth/ Il.7.104, cf. Emp. 15.2, A.Pers.360, al. = bi/os 11,
means of living, substance, nai=e de\ dw=ma a)fneio\n bio/toio Il.14.122; b. katakei/rete pollo/n Od.4.686; gu/ai fe/rousi b. a)/fqonon brotoi=s A.Fr.196; bio/tou kth=sis Ar. Av.718, cf. Ec.669:—in late Prose, PLond.5.1889 (vi A.D.). = bi/os 111,
the world, mankind, mnh/mh| bio/tou pare/dwken Epigr.Gr.319 (Philadelphia).

bi^otosko/pos, on,
of or
for casting a nativity, w(/rh Man.4.572.

bi^o-tro/fos, on,
life-sustaining, pnoh/ Aenigm. in App.Anth.7.69.

bi^o-feidh/s, e/s,
penurious, AP6.251 (Phil.).

bi^o-fqori/a, h(,
destruction of life, Orph.H.73.8.

bi^o-fqo/ros, on,
destructive of life, xruso/s Ps.- Phoc.44.

bi^o/w, bioi= Arist.HA558a20; biou=si Democr.200, Arist.HA576b2; biou=n E.Fr.238, etc.; part. biou=ntes Arist.HA566b24; subj. biw=si Emp.15.2: impf. e)bi/oun Hp.Epid.5.48: fut. biw/somai E.Alc. 784, Ar.Eq.699, Pl.R.344e, Men.Pk.399; later biw/sw Id.Mon.270, App.BC4.119: aor. 1 e)bi/wsa Hdt.1.163, Pl.Phd.113d, X.Oec.4.18, Arist.HA585a21; but in earlier writers aor. 2 is more used, o)bi/wn Isoc.9.71, Is.3.1 codd.; 3sg. imper. biw/tw Il.8.429; subj. biw= Pl.Lg.872c; opt. biw/|hn Id.Ti.89c, v.l. for bioi/h in Id.Grg.512c; inf. biw=nai Il.10.174, Aeschin.3.174, etc.; part. biou/s Hdt.9.10, Th.2.53, al.: pf. bebi/wka Isoc.15.27 and 28, Pl.Phd.113d, etc.:—Med., bio/omai Hdt.2.177, Arist.EN1180a17: for aor. Med. v. biw/skomai:— Pass., fut. biwqh/somai M.Ant.9.30: pf. bebi/wmai (v. infr.).—In early writers pres. and impf. are mostly supplied by za/w: Hom. has only aor. 2:—
live, pass one's life (opp. za/w,
live, exist), be/lteron h)\ a)pole/sqai e(/na xro/non h)e\ biw=nai Il.15.511, cf. 10.174; a)/llos me\n a)pofqi/sqw, a)/llos de\ biw/tw 8.429; bi/on biou=n Pl.La.188a, etc.; b. parano/mws, metri/ws, e)ndo/cws, D.22.24, Lys.16.3, Plu.2.145f: with neut. Pron., a)p' au)tw=n w(= au)to\s bebi/wken a)/rcomai . . from the very
actions of his own
life, D.18.130:—Pass., ta\ soi\ ka)moi\ bebiwme/na
the actions of our
life, ib.265, cf. Isoc.15.7, Lys.16.1; ta\ pepragme/na kai\ beb. D.22.53; toiou/twn o)/ntwn a(\ tw=| bdelurw=| tou/tw| . . bebi/wtai Id.21.151; e)pithdeuma/twn oi(=a tou/tw| bebi/wtai Id.22.78; o(/ ge bebiwme/nos [bi/os] Id.19.200; impers., bebi/wtai/ [moi] I
have lived, Lat.
vixi, Cic.Att.12.2.2, 14.21.3: —Med. in act. sense, Hdt.2.177, Arist.EN1180a17.
survive, e)bi/w kauqei/s Hp.Epid.5.16.—bio/mesqa (as if from bi/omai) is found h.Ap.528 and 3pl. bi/ontai Orac. ap. Phleg.Mir.2, cf. be/omai.
bio/wntai, -to, v. bia/w.

bipi/nnion, to/, Dim. of Lat.
bipennis, Edict. Diocl. in IG5(1).1406.9 (Asine).
bipta/zw, for bapti/zw, Epich.175, Sophr.114.
bi/rrh: pura/gra, oi( de\ dre/panon, Hsch. bi/rroc: dasu/ (Maced.), Id.

bi/rros, o(, Lat.
birrus, a kind of
cloak, Artcm.2.3, PGiss.76.4 (ii A.D.), Edict.Diocl.19.26, al., Hierocl.Facel.99, Suid. (Cf. bu/rros.）
birrwqh=nai: tapeinwqh=nai, Hsch.

bi/sbh, h(,
pruning-hook (Messap.), Hsch.:—hence bisbai=a, ta/, a festival, = kladenth/ria, Id.
bi/skaris: ei=dos bota/nhs, Hsch.
bista/kion, to/, = pist., Posidon.6, v.l. in Nic. Th.891, acc. to Ath. 14.649d.
bi/stac: basileu/s (Pers.), Hsch. bisth/nh: kardi/a, Id.
bi/sxun, Adv. = sfo/dra o)li/gon (Lacon.), Hsch., cf. Hdn.Gr.1.509.

bi/swn [i^], wnos, o(,
bison, Paus.10.13.1, Opp.C.2.160.

bi/tos, o(,
tyre, Edict. Diocl.15.31a:—hence bitwto/s, h/, o/n,
with tyres, troxoi/ ib.34; sara/gara, karou=xon b.,
with tyred wheels, ib.36,37.
bi/ttakos, ou, o(, = yi/ttakos, Eub. 123, Ctes.Fr.57.3.
bi/w|, biw/|hn, biw=nai, biw/tw, v. bio/w. biw/|ato, v. bia/w.

biw/leqros, on,
destructive of life, Hdn.Epim.203, Zonar.

biw/nhs, ou, o(, (w)ne/omai)
one who buys food on the public account, Hsch., Suid.
bi/wr (i. e. vi/w(r）: i)/sws (Lacon.), Hsch.

biw/simos, on, (bio/w)
to be lived, xro/nos E.Alc.650; ai( b. h(me/rai Lib. Decl.2.34; esp. ou) biw/simo/n e)sti/ tini 'tis not
meet for him to
live, Hdt. 1.45; ti/ ga\r mo/nh| moi th=sd' a)/ter b.; S.Ant.566; ou)k a)\n h)=n biw/sima a)nqrw/poisi Hdt.3.109.
likely to live, Thphr.HP9.12.1, Arr.An. 2.4.8.

bi/wsis, ews, h(,
way of life, LXX
Si.prol.12, Act.Ap.26.4: in a Jewish Inscr., e)na/retos b. IGRom.4.655 (Acmonia, i A. D.); e)n mia=| b. mat' a)llh/lwn PMasp.158.26 (vi A. D.).

bi^-w/skomai, causal of bio/w,
quicken, make or
keep alive, once in Hom. in aor., su\ ga/r m' e)biw/sao, kou/rh Od.8.468; cf. bio/ssao: the pres. occurs in the compd. a)nabiw/skomai. later in pass. sensc,
rcvive, e(/teroi to/poi biw/skontai Arist.Mete.351a35; simply,
live, biwsame/nw| IG14.2100; biw/skesqai Arr.Ind.9.

bi^-wte/on,
one must live, Pl.Grg.500d, Lib.Decl.35.15.

bi^-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
fil for life, lively, th\n dia/noian b. kai\ eu)mh/xanos, = biomh/xanos, Arist.HA616b27; acc. to Phryn.332 (who condemns the word), = xrh/simos e)n tw=| bi/w|, as in Sotad.6.12.
of or
pertaining to life, Plb.4.73.8, D.S.2.29, Ph. 2.159; xa/rites Plu.2.142b; a)hdi/ai Artem.2.30; h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) M.Ant.7.61; ta\ b. krith/ria, opp. logika/, S.E.P.2.15; me/rimnai b. Ev.Luc.21.34; b. fronti/s Iamb.Protr.21.a/; b. su/mbola
business documents, PTeb.52.9 (ii B. C.); b. qrhskei/a
popular superstition (cf. bi/os 111), Sor.1.4; o( b. no/mos Arr.Epict.1.26 tit.; ta\ b. ib.3, cf. Plu.2.679d. Adv. -kw=s
in the tone of common life, D.T.629;
in popular language, Gal.10.269. biwtika/, ta/,
victuals, PRyl.125.11 (i A. D.); h( b. a)gora/ BCH44.74 (Lagina).

bi^-wto/s, o/n,
to be lived, worth living, mostly with neg., e)/moig' o( me/llwn bi/os ou) b. S.OC1692 (lyr.), cf. Ar.Pl.197 (dub.), Pl.Ap.38a; ou) biwto\n ou)d' a)nasxeto/n Antiph.190.
10; ou)k h)=n moi b. tou<*>to poih/santi D.21.120; a)=r' ou)=n b. h(mi=n e)stin meta\ moxqhrou= sw/matos Pl.Cri.47e.

bi^-wfelh/s, e/s,
useful for life, Ph.2.88, al., Luc.Am.51; of persons, Ptol.Tetr.183: Comp., Ph.2.633: Sup., ib.480, Agath.1.7. Adv. -lw=s S.E.M.1.279.

bla^beraugh/s, e/s,
baneful-gleaming, Man.4.309.

bla^bero/s, a/, o/n,
harmful, b. to\ qu/rhfin Hes.Op.365 (= h.Merc.36); opp. sumfe/ron, Democr.237; opp. w)fe/limos, X.Cyr.8.8.14; b. kai\ zhmiw=des Pl.Cra.417d. Adv. -rw=s Id.Phdr.243c; opp. w)feli/mws, Id.Chrm.164c, cf. Plu.2.599b.

bla/b-h [a^], h(, (v. bla/ptw)
harm, damage, A.Pr.763, IG12.18, etc.; peponqe/nai . . e)s bla/bhn fe/ron S.OT517; ti/s b.
; c. inf., Id.OC1187; oi(=s h)=n e)n b. teixisqe/n Th.5.52; proskalou=mai/ se . . bla/bhs tw=n forti/wn Ar.V.1407; b. qeou=
mischief from a god, E.Ion520, cf. S.Ant.1104; of a person, h( pa=sa b. who is naught but
mischief, Id.El.301, cf. 784, Ph.622: pl., e)n o)/mmasin bla/bas e)/xw A.Ag.889, cf. Eu. 799; ai(mathra\s qhga/nas, spla/gxnwn bla/bas ne/wn ib.859. bla/bhs di/kh an action
for damage done, D.21.25; b. tetrapo/dwn
damage done by eattle, Plu. Sol.24; b. tw=n qhri/wn Id.2.642b (pl.); oi)kh=os kai\ dou/lhs th\n b. ei)=nai o)fei/lein Sol. ap. Lys.10.19; oi( peri\ th=s b. no/moi . . a(plou=n to\ bla/bos keleu/ousin e)kti/nein D.21.43; diplh=n th\n b. o)fei/lein （o)flei=n Meier) Din.1.60, cf. Foed.Delph.Pell.1 B7.
blab-o/eis, essa, en, = blabero/s, Nic.Al.186.

bla/b-omai, = bla/ptomai, only 3sg., bla/betai de/ te gou/nat' i)o/nti Il.19.166;
stumble, hesitate, of a speaker, ib.82; of a bowstring, Anacreont.31.26.

bla/b-os, gen. eos, contr. ous, to/, = bla/bh, Hdt.1.9, E.Heracl.255, Ion998, Ar.Ra.1151, Antipho 5.91, Pl.Lg.843c, Foed.Delph.Pell.2 A12, Arist. Pol.1328a14, PRyl.126.19 (i A. D.); distd. from bla/bh, D.21.43 (v. bla/bh 2). (More Attic than bla/bh acc. to Moer.103.)
blabu/rei: pteru/ssetai; Hsch. blaburi/a: ei)kaiologi/a, Id. blabu/ssein: bla/ptesqai, Id. blagi/s: khli/s (Lacon.), Id. blada/n: nwqrw=s, Id.

bla^da^ro/s, a/, o/n, = pladaro/s,
flaccid, cj. in Gal.19.88:—Hsch. has bla^do/s and bla^du/s (which is prob. in Hp.
Aër.20). (With bladu/s cf. Skt.
mrdús 'soft', Lat.
mollis; cf. me/ldomai, a)maldu/nw.)
bla/zein: mwrai/nein, Hsch. bla/qron, = blh=xnon, Id. blai/: blhth/ (leg. blhxh/) (Lacon.), Id. blai=kos: o( dalo/s, kla/dos, o)/zos, EM199.31.

blais-o/omai, Pass.,
to be crooked, pf. e)blai/swtai Arist.HA498a21; but bebl- Id.IA713b4, Gal.18(1).677.

blais-o/s, h/, o/n,
bent, distorted: hence,
splay-footed, Hp.Art.53, cf. 82 (Comp.); e)s to\ b. r(e/pwn ib.62, cf. Gal.18(1).674, al.; oi( b. tw=n a)nqrw/pwn X.Eq.1.3; also,
bandy, b. karki/noi Batr.297, cf. Arist.HA526a23; ta\ b. tw=n o)pisqi/wn
the hollow of the hind-leg in which bees carry the pollen, ib.624b2: generally,
twisted, crooked, plata/nistos AP4.1.17 (Mel.); kisso/s ib.7.21 (Simm.).
blais-w/dhs, es, = blaiso/s, Gal.6.328.

blai/s-wsis, ews, h(, = blaiso/ths, Gal.UP3.9. mctaph.,
retorting of a dilemma on its proposer, Arist.Rh.1399a26.
blaito/nous: o( blais o/pous, EM199.32.

bla_k-enno/mion te/los tax paid by astrologers at Alexandria (because
fools consult them), EM 199.11.

bla_/k-euma, atos, to/,
stupid trick, Eust.1405.33.

bla_k-eu/w,
to be slack, lazy, X.An.2.3.11, 5.8.15, Phld.Hom.p.39 O., etc.; e)n th=| katata/sei Hp.Fract.17; b. kai\ a)podeilia=n D.H.9.31:—Med. (which is cited from X. by Eust.1405.32), = trufa/w, Hld.7.27; but Act. in this sense, Procop.Arc.9. c. acc.,
lose or
waste through laziness, Luc.Ep.Sat.26.
bla_k-i/as: i)xqu\s poio/s, Hsch.
bla_k-o/ths, htos, h(, = blakei/a, Steph. in Hp.1.63,97D.

bla_k-w/dhs, es,
lazy, X. Eq.9.1 (Comp.); blakw=des bai/nein kai\ qru/ptesqai walk
mincingly, of a coxcomb, Hld.4.7. Adv. -dw=s
indolently, stolidly, Poll.3.123: Comp. -e/steron ibid.
bla/mma, atos, to/, = bla/bh, opp. w)fe/lhma, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.71 (pl.), Phld.Rh.1.215 S.(pl.).; expl. of si/nos, Gal.18(2).445.
bla/nos: tuflw/dhs, Hsch.

bla/c, bla_ko/s, o(, h(,
stolid, stupid, Pl.Grg.488a; b. kai\ h)li/qios X.Cyr. 1.4.12; b. kai\ a)/frwn Arist.EE1247a18; qeo\s kola/zei tou\s bla=kas X.Oec.8.16, cf. Plb. 16.22.5; b. a)/nqrwpos Heraclit.87: usually of persons, but b. i(/ppos, opp. qumoeidh/s, X.Eq.9.12: Comp. blako/teros or -w/teros Id.Mem.4.2.40: Sup. blako/tatos or -w/tatos (but -i/statos ap.Ath.) ib.3.13.4. name of a
fish, o(\s e)n tw=| sunousia/zein dusapolu/tws e)/xei, Erot. s.v. blakeu/ein. (Perh. bla_- < mla_-, cf. Skt.
ml[amacracute]yati 'become soft', malako/s: Hsch., a)po/ tinos i)xqu/os dasw/dous (leg. dusw/dous).)
blapt-h/rios, on, = sq., Opp.H.2.456.

blapt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
hurtful, mischievous, duna/meis Ph.1.14, cf. S.E.M.6.4, etc.: c. gen., a)nqrw/pwn Str.15.1.45, cf. Phld.Piet.99,100. Adv. -kw=s Arr.Epict.3.23.4, Ptol. Tetr.168.

bla/ptw, fut. -yw E.Heracl.704, etc.: aor. e)/blaya, Ep.bla/ye Il.23.774: aor. 2 e)/bla^bon Q.S.5.509: pf. be/bla^fa D.19.180, Plb.12.26.2, e)/blafa （kat-) IG7.303.51 (Oropus):—Pass., fut.bla^bh/somai Isoc.1.25, Pl.Men.77e, Grg.475d, Hp.Mi.373a; bebla/yomai Hp.Acut.16: also fut. Med. bla/yomai (in pass. signf.) Th.1.81, 6.64: aor. 1 e)bla/-fqhn Il.16.331, etc.: aor. 2 e)bla/bhn [a^], 3pl. e)/blaben, bla/ben, 23.461, 545, part. bla^bei/s A.Ag.120 (lyr.) (aor. Med. bla/yanto only in Q.S.5.466): pf. be/blammai Il.16.660, etc.:—
disable, hinder, mh/ tin' e(tai/rwn bla/ptoi e)launo/ntwn Od.13.22; bla/yas de/ moi i(/ppous Il.23.571; b. po/das
disable the feet for running,
lame them, ib.782:—Pass., zwo\n e(/le blafqe/nta kata\ klo/non
entangled in the mêlée, 16.331; o)/zw| e)/ni blafqe/nte muriki/nw| [the horses]
caught in a branch, 6.39; bla/ben a(/rmata kai\ taxe' i(/ppw chariots and horses
were stopped, 23.545; *dio/qen blafqe/nta be/lemna
stopped, baffled by Zeus, 15.489, cf. 484; beblamme/nos h)=tor
stopped in his life (s. v.l.), 16.660. c. gen.,
hinder from, to/n ge qeoi\ bla/ptousi keleu/qou Od.1.195; ou)de/ tis au)to\n bla/ptein ou)/t' ai)dou=s ou)/te di/khs e)qe/lei Tyrt.12.40 (repeated in Thgn. 938):—Pass.,blabe/nta loisqi/wn dro/mwn
arrested in its last course, A.Ag.120 (lyr.). of the mind,
distract, pervert, mislead, of the gods, to\n de/ tis a)qana/twn bla/ye fre/nas Od.14.178, cf. Trag.Adesp. 455: c. acc. pers., Il.22.15, Od.23.14; so of Ate, fqa/nei de/ te pa=san e)p' ai)=an bla/ptous' a)nqrw/pous Il.9.507; also of wine, Od.21.294; blafqei/s, Lat.
mente captus, Il.9.512: so c. gen., h(/ te [*persefo/nh] . . bla/ptousa no/oio Thgn.705; no/ou beblamme/nos e)sqlou= Id.223. after Hom.,
damage, hurt, oi(=si mh\ bla/yh| qeo/s (sc. ta\ te/kna) A.Eu. 661, etc.: with neut. Adj., plei/w b. tina/ Th.6.33; mei/zw Pl.Ap.30c; a)/llo ti X.HG1.1.22, etc.:—Pass., mega/la bebla/fqai Id.Cyr.5.3.30; beblamme/nos to\n o)fqalmo/n PStrassb.52.2 (ii A. D.), etc.: c. acc. cogn., b. tou\s bi/ous mei/zous bla/bas
do greater
mischiefs to . . , Posidipp.12.4: c. dupl. acc., b. th\n po/lin tou\s u(poloi/pous
rob her of . . , App.BC2.131:—Pass., tosou/sde blabh=nai th\n po/lin
lose them, Id.Hann.28; to\ blabe/n, = bla/bh, Pl.Lg.933e. c. acc. rei, b. lo/gon
mar the prophecy, Pi.P.9.94; tou\s o(/rkous
violate them, Arist.Fr.148. (blap-< mlap- (
mḷq[uglide]), cf. Skt.
marcáyati 'injure',
mṛktás 'wounded', Lat.
mulco 'maltreat'.)
bla/samon, to/, metath. for ba/lsamon, v.l. in Nic.Al.64.

bla/skei: le/gei, kapni/zei, Hsch. blaski/as, o(, a
fish, Id. blasta/: platagw/nia (Sicel), Id. blasta/zein: blima/zein, Id.

blasta/nw, S.OC611, etc. (later blaste/w, Thphr.CP2.17.4(interpol. in A. Ch.589, corrupt in Pass. -oume/nh S.Fr.255.7)); Ion. impf. blasta/neske (v.l. bla/stesken) Id.Fr.546: fut. blasth/sw Thphr.HP 2.7.2, blasth/somai Alex. Trall.12: aor. 2 e)/blaston S.Fr.341, etc.: aor. 1 e)bla/sthsa Emp.21.10, Hp.Nat.Puer.26, etc. (not in Att.): pf. bebla/sthka Id.Oss.12, Hellanic. 1 (b) J., Plu.2.684c; e)bla/sthka E.IA 594 (lyr.), Eup.329: plpf. e)beblasth/kei Th.3.26:—
bud, sprout, grow, prop. of plants, A. Th.594, S.OC697 (lyr.), Th.l.c., Ar.Nu.1124, etc.; h)= blasto\s ou)k e)/blasten; S.Fr.341; ei)s i)/a sou . . , kai\ e)s kri/na blasth/seien o)ste/a IG14.607（Carales). metaph.in Poets,
shoot forth, come to light, bla/ste na=sos e)c a(lo/s, of Rhodes, Pi.O.7.69; of children,
to be born, Id.N.8.7; a)nqrw/pou fu/sin blastw/n
born in man's nature, S.Aj.761, cf. OT1376, El.440; a)/rguros kako\n no/mism' e)/blaste Id.Ant. 296; b. d' a)pisti/a Id.OC611; me/gist' e)/blaste no/mima Id.El.1095 (lyr.); not common in Prose, Th. l.c., Pl.R.498b, Phdr.251b, Iamb.Myst.3.28. causal,
make to grow, produce, propagate, in pres., Hp.Alim.54: metaph., b. xa/rites eu)/noian Aristeas 230: mostly aor.1 e)bla/sthsa A.R.1.1131; qeo\s . . a)/mpelon e)bla/sthsen Nonn.D.36.356, cf. LXX Ge.1.11, Nu.17.8:—Pass., blasthqei/s Ph.1.667.
blastari/zousa: e)pikrotou=sa, Hsch. blasta/rion: e(/lic a)mpe/lou, EM330.30.

blast-a/w, late form of blasta/nw, trans.,
bring forth, LXX Ec. 2.6: intr., Sch.Pi.P.4.113.
blast-ei=on, to/, = bla/sth, Nic.Al.609(pl.).

bla/st-h, h(, = blasto/s, S.Ichn.276, Pl.Lg.765e, etc.; petrai/a b. the
growth of stone, S.Ant.827 (lyr.). of children, bla/stai gene/qlioi patro/s
birth from a father, Id.OC972; paido\s bla/stai Id.OT717, cf. Tr.382, Trag.Adesp.373.

bla/st-hma, atos, to/, = bla/sth 1, kissi/nois b. E.Ba. 177, cf. Isoc. 1.52, Thphr.HP1.1.9, PLond.1.131rix 191 (i A. D.). metaph.,
offspring, offshoot, mhtro\s b. A. Th.533; pe/knwn glukero\n b. E.Med.1099 (lyr.), cf.IG12(7).496.3（Amorgos), etc.; also of animals, E.Cyc.206; w)= xruse\ b. xqono/s Trag.Adesp.129.1: also in late Prose, Jul. Or.7.232d.
excrescence, Hp.Hum.1;
eruption on the skin, Aret.CD1.2.

blast-hmo/s, o(,
growth, blasthmo\n a)ldai/nonta sw/matos polu/n A.Th.12, cf. Supp.318.
blast-h/mwn, on, gen. onos, = blastiko/s, Nic.Al.548.

bla/st-hsis, ews, h(,
budding, sprouting, Arist.HA564b2, Thphr.HP3.5.4(pl.).

blast-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
in active growth, sprouting, Id.CP1.11.4; b. w(=rai
sprouting season, Id.Od.63.

blasto-dreph/s, e/s,
plucked as young shoots, prob. in Nic.Fr.74.20.

blasto-kope/w,
cut off young shoots, in Pass., o(/tan u(po\ pneuma/twn -hqh=| Thphr.HP4.14.6, cf. CP5.9.13.

blasto-loge/w,
pick off young shoots, ib.3.16.1, Gal.6.619, PLond.1.131rxxiii 507 (i A. D.):—Subst. blasto-logi/a, h(, Thphr. l.c., POxy.1631.13.
blasto/n, to/, = sq., Nic.Fr.74.52.

blastofu^e/w,
put forth shoots, prob. cj. in Thphr.CP1.11.7.
blasto/w, = blasto\n parati/qhmi, An.Ox.1.96.

blasfhm-e/w, pf. beblasfh/mhka D.18.10:—
speak profanely of sacred things, ei)s qeou/s Pl.R.381e;
offer rash prayers, Id.Alc.2.149c; b. kata/ tinos
utter imprecations against, Aeschin.1.180.
speak ill or
to the prejudice of one,
slander, peri\ th=s e)mh=s diatribh=s Isoc.15.2, cf. D.l.c., ib.82; b. kata/ tinos Isoc.12.65, cf. Arist.Fr.44; o(/sa ei)s h(ma=s e)blasfh/mhsan D.51.3; b. tina/ Babr.71.6, Ev.Luc.23.39, etc.:
abs., Phld.Lib.p.8 O.:—Pass.,
to have evil spoken of one, beblasfhmhme/nous Id.Vit.p.12 J., cf. 1 Ep.Cor.10.30.
speak impiously or
irreverently of God, blaspheme, ei)s to\n *ku/rion LXX Da.3.29(96); ei)s to\ pneu=ma to\ a(/gion Ev.Marc.3.29; ei)s ta\ qei=a Vett. Val.58.12; tou\s qeou/s Id.67.20: abs., LXX 2 Ma.10.34, al., Ev.Matt.9.3.

blasfhm-i/a, h(,
word of evil omen, profane speech, D.25.26; blasfhmi/an e)fqe/gcato, at a sacrifice, E.Ion1189; ei)/ tis parasta\s toi=s bwmoi=s blasfhmoi= b. pa=san Pl.Lg.800c; pa=san b. i(erw=n kataxe/ousi ib.d.
defamation, slander, Democr.177, D.10.36, 18.95; b. poiei=sqai ei)/s tina Aeschin. 1.167, cf. Ep.Eph.4.31; o(/las a(ma/cas blasfhmiw=n whole cart-loads
of abuse, Luc.Eun.2.
irreverent speech against God, blasphemy, h( ei)s to\ qei=on b. Men.715: in pl., LXX Ez.35.12, al.; tou= *pneu/matos
against . . , Ev.Matt.12.31; pro\s to\n qeo/n Apoc.13.6.

bla/sfhm-os, on,
speaking ill-omened words, evil-speaking, Arist.Rh.1398b11: c. gen.,
against . . , Plu.2.1100d, etc. of words,
slanderous, libellous, de/doika mh\ bla/sfhmon me\n ei)pei=n a)lhqe\s d' h)=| D.9.1, cf. Luc.Alex.4 (Sup.). Adv. -mws Philostr. VA4.19, App.BC2.126.
blasphemous, e)/qnh LXX 2 Ma.10.4; r(h/mata Act.Ap.6.11; lalei=n bla/sfhma Apoc.13.5: Subst.,
blasphemer, LXX 2 Ma.9.28, 1 Ep.Ti.1.13, etc.

bla/tta, h(, Lat.
blatta, purple, Edict.Diocl.24.2:—Dim. blatti/on, to/, Lyd.Mens.1.21.
bla/ttan: xo/rtos, h)\ la/xanon, Hsch. blattoi=: paidarieu/etai, Id. blau=des: e)mba/des, Id.

blau/t-h, h(,
slipper, Hermipp.47.4, Lysipp.2, Herod.7.58: mostly in pl., blau/tas su/rwn Anaxil.18.2; b. u(podedeme/nos Pl.Smp. 174a.
blaut-i/on, to/, Dim. of foreg., Ar.Eq.889, Aristodem.8, AP6.293 (Leon.); blau/ria in Hsch., Cyr.

blaut-o/w,
beat with slippers, Hsch.; also, = u(pode/w, Id.
blaxa/n: o( ba/traxos, Hsch.
bla/xnon, to/, = blh=xnon, Phan.Hist.25, Sch.Nic.Th.39:—also bla/qron and bla/xron, Hsch.

bla/yis, ews, h(,
harming, damage, Pl.Lg.932e (pl.).

blayi/-ta^fos [i^], on,
violating the grave, a)tasqali/h IG14.934.4.

blayi/-frwn, on, gen. onos, (frh/n)
maddening, fa/rmaka Euph.14.2; a)/th Tryph.411, cf. Orph.H.77.3, etc. = frenoblabh/s, A.Th.725.
bleai/rei (Boeot. for e)leai/rei）: oi)ktei/rei, Hsch. (bleerei= cod.).
ble/qra, = ple/qra, BCH9.382 (Thespiae, iii B. C.).
bleqra/nasin: i)xqu=n, Hsch. blei=, = bli/ssei, v.l. in Id. blei/hs, blei=o, v. ba/llw. bleke/mucos: blakw/dhs, Id. ble/kuc, v. ble/tuges.

blemeai/nw,
exult, sqe/nei\) blemeai/nwn, of a lion, Il.12.42; of Hector, 8.337; cf. a)blemh/s.

ble/nna, h(, = mu/ca,
mucous discharge, Hp.Mul.1.58 (pl.); of the humour '
phlegm', Prodic.4, etc.

ble/nnos, ous, to/,
slime, Arist.HA591a28. b., o(,
fish allied to kwbio/s, baiw/n, Sophr.43, Opp.H.1.109.

blenno/s, h/, o/n,
drivelling, Epich.119, Sophr.51.

blennw/dhs, es,
slimy, mucous, Hp.Morb.2.12, Arist.HA591a26.
ble/oron (prob. ble/qron, cf. be/reqron, be/qron）: ba/qos, desmwth/rion, Hsch. blepa/zontes: ble/pontes, Id.

blepedai/mwn, on, gen. onos,
ghostlike, Com.Adesp.85; a nickname of the Socratics, Paus.Gr.Fr.209.
blepetu/zei: skardamu/ttei, ble/pei, Hsch.

ble/phsis, ews, h(,
look, glance, Ar.Fr.757; pro\s ble/phsin by
eye, ba/ptein PHolm.16.33.

ble/pos, ous, to/, = ble/mma,
look, *)attiko\n b. Ar.Nu.1176, cf. Theoc. 23.12.

blept-e/on,
one must look, ei)/s ti Pl.Lg.965d, Arist.APr.44a36, etc.

blept-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for sight, ai)/sqhsis App.Anth.3.158;
sharpseeing, Hdn.Epim.101 (Sup.).

blept-o/s, h/, o/n,
to be seen, S.OT1337.

ble/pw, Sol.11.8, etc.: impf. e)/blepon Batr.67: fut. ble/yomai D. 25.98, Dor. inf. bleyei=sqai IG4.951.75 (Epid.), later ble/yw LXX Is. 6.9, Aristid.2.46J., etc.: aor. e)/bleya (v. infr.): pf. be/blefa （a)po-) Antip.Stoic.3.254 (codd. Stob.); be/blofa （e)m-) PLond.1.42.21 (ii A. D.):—Pass., aor. e)ble/fqhn （pros-) Plu.2.68of: pf. be/blemmai to be supplied in Ath.10.409c, cf. Eust. 1401.16:—chiefly in pres. and aor. Act. in early writers: Med. (exc. fut.) and Pass. only late:—
see, have the power of sight (dist. fr. o(rw=
perceive, be aware of, cf. Plot.6.7.37), opp. tuflo/s ei)mi, S.OT302, cf. 348, OC73, Ar. Pl.15, etc.; ble/pontes e)/blepon ma/thn A.Pr.447; ble/pontas a)qliwta/tous Alex.234; mh\ ble/pwn o( ma/ntis h)=| lest he
see too clearly, S.OT747; o( ble/pwn
the seer, Hebraism in LXX 1 Ki.9.9; o)li/gon ble/pwn short-
sighted, POxy.39.9 (i A. D.).
look, ble/f' w(=de S.Tr.402; e)pi\ e)moi/ Id.Aj.345 (s. v.l.); ei)/s ti A.Pers.802; e)pi/ ti Th.7.71; ei)s ta\ tou/twn pro/swpa D. 18.283; pw=s ble/pwn
; with what
face? S.Ph.110; o)/mmasin poi/ois b.
; Id.OT1371; b. a(/ma pro/ssw kai\ o)pi/ssw Pl.Cra.428d: with Adv., filofro/nws, e)xqrw=s b. pro/s tinas, X.Mem.3.10.4, Smp.4.58: freq. folld. by noun in acc., fo/bon b.
look terror, i. e. to
look terrible, *quia\s w(\s fo/bon ble/pwn A.Th.498; Com., e)/bleye na=pu
looked mustard, Ar.Eq.631; a)ndrei=on . . kai\ ble/pont' o)ri/ganon Id.Ra.603; blepo/ntwn ka/rdama Id.V.455; purri/xhn ble/pwn
looking like a war-dancer, Id.Av. 1169; ai)/keian ble/pwn
looking like one disgraced, ib. 1671; sku/th b., of a slave, Eup.282, Ar.V.643; b. a)pisti/an Eup.309: also folld. by Adj., me/ga b. dub. in Semon.19; fqonera\ b. Pi.N.4.39; gli/sxron b. Euphro 10.16, cf. Men.Epit.479, Jul.Caes.309c: by inf., a(rpa/zein b. Men.Epit.181; o)rxei=sqai mo/non b. Alex.97: by part. neut., ti/ pefrontiko\s ble/peis
; E.Alc.773. b. e)s
look to,
rely on, ei)s e)/rgon ou)de\n gigno/menon ble/pete Sol.11.8; e)s qeou/s S.Ant.923; ou)ke/t' e)sti\n ei)s o(/ ti ble/pw Id.Aj.514; e)/s se dh\ ble/pw, o(/pws . . in the hope that . . , Id.El.954: metaph. also,
have regard to, h( politei/a b. ei)s plou=ton Arist.Pol.1293b14; of aspects, oi)ki/ai pro\s meshmbri/an ble/pousai . . , X.Mem.3.8.9; pe/tra ble/pousa pro\s no/ton Str.4.1.4; ka/tw ga\r oi( o)do/ntes ble/pousi Arist.HA502a1; o(/tan to\ ou)=qar ble/ph| ka/tw ib.523a2.
look longingly, expect, propose, c. inf., Ar.Ach.376, V. 847.
look to a thing,
beware, a)po/ tinos Ev.Marc.8.15; ti Ep.Phil.3.2: c. acc. pers., b. e(autou/s Ev.Marc.13.9; ble/pe sa（u）to\n a)po\ tw=n *)ioudai/wn BGU1079.24 (i A. D.); b. i(/na . . 1 Ep.Cor.16.10; b. e(autou\s i(/na mh\ . . 2 Ep.Jo.8; ble/pete ti/ a)kou/ete Ev.Marc.4.24. trans.,
see, behold, c. acc., S.Aj.1042, etc.; e)c au(tou= blepo/menon self-
evident, S.E.M.1.184; ta\ blepo/mena
the visible universe, LXX Wi.13.7. zh=| te kai\ b. fa/os
sees the light of day, A.Pers.299, cf. E.Hel. 60; no/stimon b. fa/os A.Pers.261; ble/ponta nu=n me\n o)/rq' e)/peita de\ sko/ton (i. e. being blind) S.OT419: hence, without fa/os,
to be alive, zw=nta kai\ ble/ponta A.Ag.677; ble/ponta ka)mpne/onta S.Ph.883, cf. 1349, Aj.962; of things, a)lhqh= kai\ ble/ponta
actually existing, A.Ch. 844.
look for, mei=zo/n ti b. Pl.Chrm.172c. Astrol. of signs equidistant from the tropical points,
to be in aspect, b. a)/llhla Ptol.Tetr.36, Heph.Astr.1.9. (ble/fara occurs in Hom., but not ble/pw exc. in Batr. l.c.)
ble/tenon: blitw/dh （blht-cod.), Hsch. ble/tuges: fluari/ai: also ble/kuges, Id.:—sg. ble/kuc, Hdn.Gr.2.482. ble/tues: ai( bde/llai, Hsch.

blefa^r-i/zw,
wink, Sch.Ar.Eq.292.

blefa^r-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the eyelids, collyria Cael.Aur.TP4.2.17.

blefa^r-i/s, i/dos, h(,
eyelash, Ar.Ec. 402: mostly in pl., Id.Eq.373, X.Mem.1.4.6, Arist.PA658a11. = ble/faron,
eyelid, Id.HA504a29.

blefa^r-i=tis, idos, h(,
of or
the eyelids, tri/xes Paul.Aeg.6.13.

blefa^roka/toxos, on,
holding the eyelid, mudi/on Paul.Aeg.6.8.

ble/fa^ron, Dor. gle/fa^ron, to/:—mostly in pl. (as always in Hom.),
eyelids, ble/far' a)mfi\ kai\ o)fru/as Od.9.389, al.; of sleep, fi/la ble/far' a)mfikalu/yas 5.493; u(/pnos a)po\ blefa/roii+n (dual) Il.10.187; u(/pnon e)pi\ blefa/roisin e)/xeuen Od.20.54, al.; pau=ron e)pi\ glefa/rois u(/pnon a)nali/skoisa Pi.P.9.24; glefa/rwn a(du\ kla/i+stron ib.1.8; ble/fara ke/klh|tai S.Fr.711; b. sumbalei=n, koima=n u(/pnw|, A.Ag.15, Th. 3; of weeping, da/kru xamai\ ba/len e)k blefa/roii+n Od.17.490, cf. 23.33; of death, lu/ein b. S.Ant.1302: in Prose, Antipho Soph. 81a, Pl. Ti.45d, PPetr.3p.23 (iii B. C.): rarely in sg., E.Or.302; b. to\ a)/nw kai\ ka/tw Arist.HA491b19, cf. PA657b14. in pl.,
eyes, blefa/rwn kuanea/wn Hes.Sc.7 (where the fem. Adj. points to a nom. h( ble/faros); freq. in Trag., skotw/sw b. kai\ dedorko/ta S.Aj.85, cf. Tr. 107 (lyr.): in sg., of the sun, a(me/ras b. Id.Ant.104 (lyr.); of the curtain of darkness at nightfall, nukto\s a)fegge\s b. E.Ph.543.

blefa^ro/-custon, to/,
an instrument for trimming the eyelids, Paul. Aeg.3.22.12.

blefa^ro-spa/c,
arching the eyebrows, Hdn.Gr.1.43.
blefa^ro-to/- mon, to/, surgical instrument, Hermes38.280.

bleyi/as, ou, o(, a
fish, = kefali=nos, Dorioap.Ath.7.306f.

ble/yis, ews, h(,
act of sight, to\ blepo/menon to\ o)/n, ou\x h( b. Plot.6.2.8.
sight (i. e.
thing seen), pro\s th\n ble/yin a)naflexqei/s Plu. Pel.32. metaph.,
contemplation, consideration, sumfero/ntwn Epicur.Ep.3p.63U.

blh/dhn, Adv.
by throwing, hurling, Hsch. blh/etai, v. ba/llw.
blh/qa, v. blh=ma 4.
blhqrh/n: traxei=an, oi( de\ <a(>palh/n, Hsch.

blh=ma, atos, to/, (ba/llw)
throw, cast, of dice, a)/lla blh/mat' e)n ku/bois balei=n E.Supp.330; of a missile, D.H.10.16; of
the missile itself, Ph.2.431, Max.Tyr.9.8 (pl.).
shot, wound, Hdt.3.35, Hp.Prorrh.2.14(pl.).
coverlet, AP7.413 (Antip.). = a)/rtos e)nteqrumme/nos kai\ qermo/s, Seleuc. ap. Ath.3.114d (blh/qa in Hsch.).
blh/menos, v. sub ba/llw. blh=nai: a)lhqei=s, Hsch.
blh=r, Aeol. for de/lear, Alcm.130.
blh=rai: ai( kni/dai, a)/lloi xo/rton, oi( de\ tw=n o)spri/wn th\n kala/mhn, Hsch.

blh/s, hto/s, o(, h(,
thrown, prob. f.l. for a)blh/s, Call.
Fr.anon.341.
blh=sqai, v. ba/llw. blh/ssa<n>: bo/trun h(mipe/<pe>iron, Hsch. blh/ssanon: futo\n sxi/nw| o(/moion, Id. blhsta/s: o( xersai=os skorpi/os, Id.

blhstr-i/zw,
toss about, e(auto
 b., as a sick person on his bed, Hp. Morb.3.7; blhstri/zontes e)mh
 fronti/d' a)n' *(ella/da gh=n Xenoph.8.2: metaph., e)mauto
 po/lin e)k po/lews fe/rwn e)blh/strizon Id.45:—Pass., = blhstri/zein e(auto/n, Aret.CA1.1.

blhstr-ismo/s, o(,
tossing, restiessness, Hp.Epid.1.26. b/.

blh/t-eira, h(,
thrower, darter, o)i+stw=n Alex.Aet.4.5.

blht-e/on,
one must throw or
put, Ev.Marc.2.22.
blht-i^ei=: katabalei=, nikh/sei, Hsch.

blht-iko/n, to/, = blhto/n (v. blhto/s 2), Thphr.Fr.178.
striking, b. zw=|a, opp. da/keta (
biting), prob. for blhta/ in Ael.NA3.32.
blh=to, v. ba/llw.
blh=ton, v. bli/ton.

blh=t-ron, to/,
fastening: band or
hoop, custo\n kollhto\n blh/troisi Il.15.678. = blh=xnon, Nic. Th.39 (gen.sg., v.l. bli/trou; Sch. gives nom. blh=tros. rw/sas: e)mbalw/n, Hsch.
blhx-a/zw, = sq., Autocr.3.

blhx-a/omai, aor. e)blhxhsa/mhn AP 7.657 (Leon.), Longus 3.13:—
bleat, of sheep and goats, probati/wn blhxwme/nwn Ar.Pax 535, Fr.387.5; blhxw/menoi probati/wn ai)gw=n
te . . me/lh Id.Pl.293; of infants, ta\ de\ sugku/yanq' a(/ma blhxa=tai Id.V. 570: metaph. of men, c. acc. cogn., pa/tagon Porph.Chr.35; blhxoi=nto (as if from blhxe/omai) is v.l. for blhxw=|nto in Theoc.16.92.

blhx-a/s, a/dos, h(,
bleater, o)/i+as peri\ b. Opp.C.1.145.
blhx-hqmo/s, o(, = foreg., Ael.NA5.51, Nonn.D.14.157.
blh/x-hma, atos, to/, = blhxh/, Hsch. (pl.): sg., = mwro/s, probatw/dhs, Id.

blhx-hta/, w=n, ta/,
bleaters, i.e.
sheep, Ael.NA2.54; b. te/kna
sheepish lads, Eup.103.

blh=xnon, to/ (v.l. blh=xron, as in Sch.Theoc.3.14, Cyr. (blh/xra Hsch.)), = pte/ris,
male fern, Aspidium Filix-mas, Dsc.4.184.

blhxro/s, a/, o/n,
faint, gentle, a)/nemoi Alc.16; of the rivers of hell,
dull, sluggish, Pi.Fr.130; pela/gh A.R.4.152;
gentle, opp. a)kra/xolos, Phld.Lib.p.44 O.; b. puretoi/
slight, Hp.Aph.5.64, cf. Plu.Per.38; b. sfugmoi/ Hp.Mul.1.37; nou=sos -ote/rh ib.36; u(/pnou b. o)/neiar Q.S. 2.182. Adv. -rw=s
slightly, Hp.Mul.2.203;
weakly, b. ei)=xon kai\ ou)k i)sxurw=s Ctes.Fr.29.42: Comp. -o/teron Hp.Morb.2.61. metaph.,
slight, small, b. a)p' a)rxa=s B.10.65; xa/rin ou) b. Id.12.227.—Not in Hom. (who has a)blhxro/s), nor in Att.; h in all dialects.
blh=xros, h(, = glh/xwn, Thphr.CP1.7.4, Ps.-Dsc.3.31.
blh=xron, v. blh=xnon.

blhxw/dhs, es,
bleating, sheepish, Babr.93.5.

blh/xwn, h( (later o(, Gp.8.7), gen. wnos, also blhxw/, gen. ou=s; Ion. glh/xwn, blhx-w/, Dor. gla/xwn, blhx-w/ (on the forms see Phryn.PS p.53 B., Sch.Ar.Pax711), dat. glh/xwni h.Cer.209; blhxoi= Thphr.HP 9.16.1: gen. glhxou=s Hp.Morb.3.17; gla/xwnos Boeot. ap. Ar.Ach. 869: acc. gla/xwna ib.861, Theoc.5.56; glh/xwna Herod.9.13; glaxw/ Ar.Ach.874; blhxw/ Id.Lys.89:—
pennyroyal, Mentha Pulegium, Il.cc., Dsc.3.31, etc.

blhxwni/as, ou, o(,
prepared with pennyroyal, kukew/n Ar.Pax712.
blhxw/nion, to/, = blh/xwn, Sch.Theoc.5.56.

bliaro/n: a)blebe/s, Hsch.: bliaro/n: lau=ron, EM201.41. blibro/n: lag<a>ro/n, Hsch. bli/des: yeka/des, Id. bli/zw, = bli/ttw, Id. s.v. blei=, cf. EM200.33. blihxw=des: blixanwdes （blixw=nes cod.), Hsch. bli/kanos, o(, = ba/traxos, Hsch., EM201.42:—also bli/xas, Hsch.: bli/karos, Suid. blika/s or bli/kas,
fig-leaf, Hsch., EM201.41.

bli_m-a/zw, Lacon. bli_m-a/ttw,
feel hens to see if they are fat, Ar.Av. 530: hence sens. obsc., Cratin.302, Ar.Lys.1164, S.Fr.484:—Pass.,
to be squeezed, Hp.Epid.5.1.
handle, treat, b. tou\s a)ci/ous e)pieike/steron Aristeas 188. = bli/ttw, EM200.47.

bli_/m-a^sis, ews, h(,
lewd handling, Hsch.
bli/mh: prophlakismo/s, u(/bris, Hsch., EM201.40. blino/n: dalo/n, Hsch. bli/c: sunexw=s, Id. bli/ssw, v. bli/ttw.

blisthri/s, i/dos, h(, (bli/ttw)
honey-taking, xei/r AP9.226 (Zon.).

bli^ta/s, a/dos, h(,
worthless woman, Men.955.
blita/xea, ta/, = kogxu/lia or sela/xia, Epich.193: but bli/taxos: ba/traxos, Hsch.

bli^to-ma/mmas or bli^to-ma/mas, ou, o(,
booby, Ar.Nu.1001, cf. Phryn. PSp.55 B.

bli/ton, to/,
blite, Amaranthus Blitum, Hp.Vict.2.54, 3.75:—written blh=ton Id.Aff.41, Thphr.HP1.14.2, Dsc.2.117: in pl., Thcopomp.Com.62, Diph.14.

bli/ttw, aor. e)/bli^sa Pl.R.564e:—
cut out the comb of bees, take the honey, l.c.; sfhkia\n b. S.Fr.778: metaph., b. to\n dh=mon
rob the people
of their honey, Ar.Eq.794, cf. Lys.475:—Pass., plei=stondh\ . . toi=s khrh=si me/li bli/ttetai prob. in Pl. l.c.; b. ta\ smh/nh the hives
have their honey taken, Arist.HA554a15, cf. 627b2. bli/ssein: = mala/ssein, Erot.Fr.16. (For mli/t-
yw, cf. me/li.)

bli/turi, to/,
twang of a harp-string: hence of a
meaningless sound, S.E.M.8.133, D.L.7.57, Artem.4.2, Gal.8.662.

blituri/zomai, Pass.,
sound like a harp-string, coined by Gal.8.662.
bli/turon e)sti\ futo\n h)\ fa/rmakon, h)\ xordh=s mi/mhma, EM201.43.
bli/twnas: tou\s eu)h/qeis, Hsch.

bli_x-a^nw/dhs, es, of fish,
clammy, Diph.17.15.

bli_x-w/dhs, es,
clammy, sticky, of wounds or ulcers, Hp.VC19ap.Erot. (glisxrw=des codd.), cf. Archig. ap. Orib.46.23.3.
blose/men: skotwqh=nai, Hsch.

blosu^ro/mma^tos, on,
grim-eyed, prob. in Cerc.Oxy.1082Fr.28.

blosu^ro/s, a/, o/n, also o/s, o/n v.l. in Hes.Sc.250:—
hairy, shaggy, bristling, meidio/wn blosuroi=si prosw/pasi Il.7.212; tw\ de/ oi( o)/sse lampe/sqhn blosurh=|sin u(p' o)fru/sin 15.608, cf. Hes.Sc.147; of lions, ib. 175; of the *kh=res, ib.250; h( de\ suo\s blosurh=s, to describe a woman, Phoc.3.3; b. xai/th Lyr.Alex.Adesp.11.4; a)/rktoi, fw/kh, Opp.H.2.247, 5.38; pordali/wn blosura\s du/santo kalu/ptras Nonn.D.14.131; later,
grim, fearful, a)/gos A.Eu.167 (lyr.); a)/krh A.R.2.740; ku/mata AP9.84 (Antiphan.), cf. 278 (Bianor); fa/smata a)rxagge/lwn Iamb. Myst.2.3.
virile, burly, gennai/ous te kai\ b. ta\ h)/qh Pl.R.535b; b. ge th\n yuxh\n e)/xeis Nicostr.35; of a woman, mai=a gennai/a kai\ b.
masculine, Pl.Tht.149a; blosurwta/th to\ ei)=dos, of Boudicca, D.C.62.2; also,
coarse, pi/tta Thphr.HP9.2.3 (Comp.), cf. CP6.12.5 (Comp.).
solemn, dignified, semno\n kai\ b. o(ra=n Ael.VH12.21; of persons, semnh\ kai\ b. Aristacnet.1.7, cf. Him. Or.23.12. Adv. -w=s Hld.10.27.

blosu^ro/-ths, htos, h(,
grimness, Eust.1194.46.

blosu^ro/-frwn, on, gen. onos,
savage-minded, A.Supp.833 (lyr.).
blosu^r-w/phs, ou, o(, later masc. of sq., Opp.C.1.144.

blosu^r-w=pis, idos, h(, (w)/y)
grim-looking, *gorgw/ Il.11.36.
blosu^r-wpo/s, o/n, later form of foreg., D.P.123.
blo/xon, = bde/llion, Dsc.1.67. blu/dion: u(gro/n, ze/on, Hsch.

blu/zw, aor. e)/blu^sa A.R.4.1446, Q.S.1.242, AP7.352, etc.; poet. opt. blu/sseie AP11.58 (Maced.): aor. Pass. e)blu/sqh Orac. ap. Eus.PE 5.16:—
bubble, gush forth, of liquids, A.R.l.c., Orac. in Paus.5.7.3; e)k phgh=s Philostr.VA3.45: c. dat., b. *auai/w|
with wine, AP11.58 (Maced.): c. acc. cogn., me/qu b.
spout wine: metaph. of Anacreon, ib. 7.27 (Antip. Sid.); u(/dwr Orph.A.599, cf. Nonn.D.17.125, al.; xrusi/on Lyd.Mag.3.45: metaph., ai)sxra\ kaq' h(mete/rhs e)/bluse parqeni/hs AP 7.352.

blu/sis [u^], ews, h(,
bubbling up, AP9.819:—also blu/sma, atos, to/, Hdn.Epim.11: blusmo/s, o(, Gloss.
blusta/nw, = sq., Procl.in Cra.p.80P., Mich.in PN51.1, Et.Gud.
bluxa/zw, = molu/nw, in pf. part. Pass., Hsch.

blu/w, = blu/zw, c. dat., fo/nw| blu/ousai Lyc.301: c. acc., de/mas oi( e)/bluen u(/dwr Nonn.D.19.287: c. gen., par' o)/rei qermw=n u(da/twn blu/onti OGI199.11. [u_ between two long syll. in Ep., a)na-blu/eske A.R. 3.223, cf. 4.1417.]

blwqro/s, a/, o/n,
tall, pi/tus b. Il.13.390; b. o)/gxnh Od.24.234, cf. A.R.4.1476, Q.S.8.204; blwqrh=| e)pi\ poi/h| Arat.1089. (Perh. cf. Skt.
mūrdhā´ 'head', OE.
molda 'head'.)

blwm-o/s, o(, = ywmo/s,
morsel of bread, Call.Fr.240; cf. o)kta/blwmos: —Dim. blwm-i/dion, to/, Eust.1817.55: blwmiai=oi a)/rtoi prob. l. in Philem.Gloss. ap. Ath.<*>.114e. blwmoi/: straboi/, Hsch.

blwro/s, o(,
fig-leaf, Hsch.

blw=sis, ews, h(,
arrival, presence, Hsch.
seat, di/frou b. Trag.Adesp. 150.

blw/skw, Nic. Th.450, (kata-, pro-) Od.16.466, 21.239: fut. molou=mai A.Pr.689 (lyr.), S.OC1742 (lyr.): aor. 2 e)/molon Pi.O.14.18, etc., Ep. mo/lon （e)k-, pro-) Il.11.604, Od. 15.468, freq. in Trag., also Dor. (as aor. of pres. e(/rpw 'go') IG4.952.14 (Epid.), SIG558.26 (Ithaca), and sts. in Prose, X.An.7.1.33, Plb.30.9.5, Plu.Cleom.38; imper. mo/le Cratin.111: pf. me/mblwka Od.17.190, E.Rh.629; part. -kw/s Call.Aet.1.1.7 (cf. be/blwken: h)remei=, fu/etai, Hsch.): later fut. bla/cw （kata-) Lyc.1068: aor.1 e)/blwca Id.448, 1327: aor. 2 e)/blw: w)/|xeto, Hsch., cf. mole/w:—
go or come, mostly Poet. in aor. 2, deu=ro molo/ntes Od.3.44; molou=sa poti\ me/gar' ll.6.286; of Time, pri\n dwdeka/th mo/lh| h)w/s 24.781; me/mblwke ma/lista h)=mar
has passed, Od.17.190; o(/te to\ ku/rion mo/lh| A.Ag.766 (lyr.): freq. with Preps., molei=n ei)s oi)/kous, e)pi\ do/mon, S.OT1010, E.Or.176 (lyr.); pro\s xqo/na S.Ph.479; a)po\ *strumo/nos, e)k *dio/s, A.Ag.192 (lyr.), Pr.667; kata\ gai/as E.Alc. 107 (lyr.): c. acc. only, e)/molen *(/hras lao/n Pi.N.10.36; gh=n molo/ntes *(ella/da A. Pers.809, cf. Ag.968, Supp.239, S.Ph.1332, E.Rh.289; pri\n fa/os molei=n xqo/na ib.223; h(/bhs te/los m. Id.Med.921, cf. IT1421: c. dat. pers., mhde/ moi . . qa/natos mo/loi Sol.21, cf. S.OC70, Ant.233, etc.; di' e)/xqras m. tini/, dia\ ma/xhs molei=n tini/, E.Ph.479, IA1392; ei)s u(/popta m. tini/, = u(popteu/ein tina/, Id.El.345.—Rare in Prose (v. supr.); used by Ar. only in lyr. (Av.404, Th.1146, 1155, al.), or in the mouth of a Laconian, Id.Lys.984, cf. Plu.2.220e, 225d (both from Apophth.Lac.).

bo/a, h(, a
fish, = sa/lph, Pancrat. ap. Ath.7.321f.
bo-a_go/s, o(, v. bouago/s:—hence bo-a_gi/dhs, ou, o(, of Heracles, Lyc. 652.

bo-a/grion, to/,
shield of wild bull's hide, Il.12.22, Od.16.296, AP9.323 (Antip.).

bo/-agros, o(, (bou=s)
wild bull, Philostr. VA6.24.
boadei=: o)knei=, Hsch.
boa_qo/os, Dor. for bohqo/os (q. v.); name of a Delphic month, SIG 672.78.
bo-a/nqemon, to/, = bou/fqalmon, Hp.Mul.1.78, Nic.Fr.74.38.

bo-a/nqrwpos, o(,
bull-man, of the Minotaur, Tz.H.1.489.

bo/ac, a_kos, o(, Ion. bo/hc, contr. bw=c, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.8.356a, Arist.HA610b4, Gp.20.7.1:—a
grunting fish, sacred to Hermes, called from the sound it makes,
Box boops, Epich.29, Ar.Fr.475, Numen. ap. Ath.7.286f, Speus.ibid.; cf. bo/wy.

boa/rios, a, on, = Lat.
boarius: a\gora\ boari/a, =
forum boarium at Rome, D.H.1.40, cf. D.C.78.25.

bo-armi/a, h(, (a)rari/skw)
ox-yoker, epith. of Athena, Lyc.520.

bo/-arxos, on,
beginning with an ox, of a sacrifice in which an ox is the first victim, tri/ttoa IG12.5 (v B. C.).
bo-a=tis, idos, h(, v. bohth/s.
bo-au/lion, to/, Dim. of sq., Epic. in Arch.Pap.7.7, Orph.A.438.

bo/-aulos, o(, (bou=s, au)lh/)
ox-stall, Thcoc.25.108:—also bo/-aulon, to/, A.R.3.1290.

boa/w, Ep. 3sg. boa/a|, 3pl. boo/wsin, part. boo/wn, Il.14.394, 17.265, 15.687: Ion.impf. boa/aske A.R.2.588: fut. boh/somai Th.7.48, etc.; Dor. boa/somai Ar.Nu.1154 (lyr.); later boh/sw A.R.3.792, AP7.32 (Jul.), etc. (boa/sw E.Ion 1447 (lyr.) is aor. subj.): aor. e)bo/hsa Il.11.15, S.Tr. 772, etc.; Ep. bo/hsa Il.23.847; Dor. bo/asa B.16.14; Ion. e)/bwsa Il.12.337, Hdt.1.146, Hippon. 1, Herod. 3.23; sts.in Com., Cratin. 396, Ar. Pax 1155: pf. bebo/hka Philostr.VS2.1.11:—Med., bow/menos Ar.V. 1228 (perh. Pass.): Ep.aor. boh/sato Q.S.10.465, Ion. e)bw/sato Theoc. 17.60; part. bohsa/menos Ant.Lib.25.3:—Pass., Ion. aor. e)bw/sqhn Hdt.6.131: pf. bebo/hmai AP7.138 (Aceratus), Ion. part. bebwme/nos Hdt.3.39: plpf. e)bebo/hto Paus.6.11.3:—
cry aloud, shout, o)cu\ boh/sas Il.17.89; o(/sson te ge/gwne boh/sas Od.6.294; pa=sa ga\r po/lis boa=| A. Ag.1106 (lyr.); w(s dra/kwn b. Id.Th.381; b. gramma/twn e)n cullabai=s ib.468; oi( bohso/menoi
men ready to shout (in the e)kklhsi/a), D. 13.20; o( dh=mos e)bo/hseu . . , of acclamations, POxy.41.19 (iii/iv A. D.), cf. Charito 1.1, al., IG12(9).906 (Chalcis, iii A. D.). of things,
roar, howl, as the wind and waves, ou)/te . . ku=ma to/son boa/a| poti\ xe/rson Il.14.394;
resound, echo, a)mfi\ de/ t' a)/krai h)i+o/nes boo/wsin 17.265; boa=| de\ po/ntios klu/dwn A.Pr.431 (lyr.), etc.; boa=| d' e)n w)si\ ke/lados
rings, Id.Pers.605; to\ pra=gma fanero/n e)stin, au)to\ ga\r boa=| it
proclaims itself, Ar.V.921; fai/netai au)ta\ ta\ stoixei=a boa=n w(s e(lko/mena Arist. Metaph.1091a10. c. acc. pers.,
call to one, call on, Pi. P.6.36, E.Med.205 (lyr.), Hdt.8.92, X.Cyr.7.2.5, Herod.4.41:— Med.bohsa/menoi dai/monas Ant.Lib.l.c. c. acc.,
call for, shout out for, S.Tr.772; b. th\n boh/qeian Hell.Oxy.10.2. c. acc. cogn., b. boa/n Ar.Nu.1153 (lyr.); b. me/los, i)wa/n, S.Aj.976, Ph.216 (lyr.); b. loigo/n A.Ch.402 (lyr.); a)/lgos E.Tr.1310(lyr.): c. dupl. acc., boa/saq' u(me/naion a)oidai=s i)axai=s te nu/mfan
sound aloud the bridal hymn in honour of the bride, ib.335 (lyr.); e)/legon i)h/i+on e)bo/a ki/qaris E.Hyps. Fr.3(1).iii 10.
noise abroad, celebrate, h( r(a/fanos h(\n e<*>/boa=te Alex. 15.7; prh/gmata bebwme/na a)na\ *)iwni/hn Hdt.3.39; e)bw/sqhsan a)na\ th\n *(ella/da Id.6.131; oi( bohqe/ntes e)pi\ xrh/masi Lib.Or.59.155; beboh=sqai a)po\ tou= *maraqw=nos, e)k tw=n a)dikhma/twn, Id.Decl.11.18, 5.53. c. inf.,
cry aloud or
command in aloud noice to do a thing, S.OT1287, E.Andr.297 (lyr.); boa=n tini a)/gein X.An.1.8.12; e)bo/wn a)llh/lois mh\ qei=n ib.19; also,
cry aloud that . . , Epicrat.11.31(anap.); b. o(/ti . . X. An.1.8.1, Antiph.125.5. Pass.,
to be filled with sound, pa=san de\ xrh\ gai=an boa=sqai u(mnw|di/ais E.Hel.1434;
to be deafened, Ar.V. 1228. (Cf. boh/.）
boei-ako/s, h/, o/n, = sq., EM254.44.

boei-ko/s, h/, o/n, （bou=s） = bo/eios,
of or
for oxen, zeu/gh b. wagons
drawn by oxen, Th.4.128, X.An.7.5.2, cf. Ar.Fr.109; kre/as b. Poll.6.55:—the form boi+ko/s, freq. in codd. as in D.H.8.87, is censured by Hdn.Gr.2.416, but cf. i(erei=on boi+ko/n Milet.1(7).203a (i B. C.); qusi/a boi+kh/ Inscr.Prien. 112.109 (i B. C.); boi+ka/, =
oxen, GDI1158（Elis); b. kth/nh BGU1189.12 (i A. D.).

bo/ei-os, a, on, Ep. and Ion. bo/eos, h, on （bo/veon Glotta4.201 (Apulian vase) is dub.): (bou=s):—
of an ox or
oxen, esp.
of ox-hide, de/rma bo/eion Od.14.24; boe/oisin i(ma=sin Il.23.324; boei/as a)spi/das 5.452; bo/ea kre/a Hdt.2.37,168; ta\ b. kre/a Pl.R.338c; ga/la b. E.Cyc.218, Arist.HA521b33, Dsc.4.83, Porph.Abst.4.17; podi\ boei/w| to\n qeo\n e)lqei=n, of Dionysus, Plu.2.364f: metaph., b. r(h/mata
bull-words, Ar.Ra.924. boei/h or boe/h (sc. dorh/), h(,
ox-hide, a)de/yhton boe/hn Od.20.2, 142; boo\s mega/loio boei/hn Il.17.389;
ox-hide shield, boe/h|s ei)lume/nw w)/mous au)/h|si stereh=|si ib.492; bow=n t' eu)= poihta/wn (contr. for boe/wn) 16.636. = boeu/s, lu/sante boei/as h.Ap.487, cf. 503 (s. v. l.).

boeu/s, e/ws, o(,
rope of ox-hide, e)u+stre/ptoisi boeu=si Od.2.426.

boh/, Dor. boa/, h(,
loud cry, shout, in Hom. mostly
battle-cry, boh\n a)gaqo/s Il.2.408, al.; boa=s d' e)/ti mhd' o)/nom' ei)/h let there be not even the name
of war, Thcoc.16.97; later of prayer, *(ellhniko\n no/misma qusta/dos b. A.Th.269; kakofa/tida b.
cry of mourning, Id.Pers.936 (lyr.); b. kai\ oi)=ktos And.1.48; kraugh\ kai\ b. D.54.9; also,
song of joy, i)/tw cu/naulos boa\ xara=| E.El.879(lyr.), cf. Pi.N.3.67, Ar.Ra.212; of oracles, a)ei/dousa . . boa\s a)\s a)\n *)apo/llwn keladh/sh| E.Ion 92 (lyr.);
shout, murmur of a crowd, Pl.Lg.700c(pl.); qo/rubos kai\ b. Id.Ti.70e; of things,
roar of the sea, Od.24.48;
sound of musical instruments, au)loi\ fo/rmigge/s te boh\n e)/xon Il.18.495, cf. Pi.O.3.8, P.10.39 (pl.); b. sa/lpiggos A.Th.394;
cry of birds, S.Ant.1021; qhri/wn b. E.Ba. 1085; boh\n qwu/+ssein, a)u+tei=n, S.Aj.335, E.Hec.1092(lyr.); e)fqe/gcato boh/ tis Id.IT1386; boa/somai ta\n u(pe/rtonon boa/n Phryn.Com.46 (lyr.); boh\n i(sta/nai Antiph.196.2; o(/son kai\ a)po\ boh=s e(/neka as far as
sound went, only in appearance, Th.8.92, cf. X.HG2.4.31. = boh/qeia,
aid called for, succour, A.Supp.730, Ag.1349.S.OC1057 (lyr.). (
g[uglide]o[uglide]ā, cf. Skt.
jō-guvē (intensive of
gávatē) 'proclaim aloud'.)

bohgenh/s, e/s,
born of an ox, of bees, AP9.363.13 (Mel.).

bo-h/gia, ta/, festival at Miletus, SIG577.71 (written boih-); but bo-hgi/a, h(, a form of
contest, perh., = taurokaqayi/a, Michel838 (Didyma).

bo-hgoi/, oi(,
ox-drivers in a procession, dub. in Inscr.Prien. 112.108 (i B. C.).

bohdo/n, Adv.
like oxen, pi/nein Agatharch.38.

bohdrom-e/w, Dor. boa_-,
run to a cry for aid, haste to help, pro\s do/mous E.Or.1356; e)p' e)sxa/ran Id.Heracl.121; pro\s to\ nikw/menon Plu.Sert.19; su\n i(/ppois, *)arx. *delt. 1.57 (Thermon).
run with a cry, App.Hann.42: c. inf., tu/rannon a)nelei=n Id.BC2.119.

bohdro/m-ia, wn, ta/,
games in memory of
the succour given by Theseus against the Amazons, Plu.Thes.27; *b. pe/mpein lead a procession
at the B., D.3.31.

bohdrom-i/h, h(,
helping, aiding, Max.381 (pl.).
bohdro/m-ios, on, = bohdro/mos, of Apollo, Call. Ap.69, Paus.9.17.2. Dor. *badro/mios (sc. mh/n), name of month at Rhodes, SIG644.19 (ii B. C.), etc.
bohdrom-iw/n, w=nos, o(, name of a month at Athens, etc., D.3.5, Arist.HA578b13, SIG282.18 (Priene, iv B. C.), etc. (Written *boi- IG22.657, al.)

boh/drom-os, on,
giving succour, E.Ph.1432; b. podi/ Id.Or. 1290 (lyr.).

boh/q-arxos, o(,
captain of auxiliaries, name of a Carthaginian officer, Plb.1.79.2, App. Pun.70.

boh/q-eia, h( (Dor. boa/qoia SIG421.36（Thermon)),
help, aid, Th.2.22, etc.; b. tw=| lo/gw| pro/s tina Pl.Prm. 128c; h( u(pe\r tw=n dikai/wn b. D.56.15; boh/qeian e)/xein pro\s u(gi/eian, pro\s th\n e(ka/stou u(perbolh\n mhxana=sqai, Arist.PA651b1, 652a32: nom.sg., as exclamation '
help!', Plb.13.8.5: pl., Gorg.Pal.33, D.18.302, Arist. Rh.1383a29; ai( pro\s eu)/ploian b. Ph.2.46, cf. Act.Ap.27.17.
medical aid, cure, ki/ndunos i)sxuro/teros pa/shs b. Plu.Alex.19.
force of auxiliaries, h( para\ *dionusi/ou b. X.HG7.1.20; new=n b. Th.4.8: opp. regular forces, D.4.32.

bohq-e/w (sts. written boihqe/w, IG22.237 (iv B. C.), BGU1007.12 (iii B. C.)), Ion. bwqe/w, only Hsch. bwqe/ontes, not in Hdt. (but cf. Eust.812.59) or Hp., cf. bohqh/sw Michel 12.15 (Erythrae, iv B. C.); Dor. boa_qoe/w SIG421.27 (Thermon); Aeol.

ba_qo/hmi (q. v.):—Med., fut. -h/somai Lib.Or.1.128:—
come to aid, succour, assist, aid, c. dat., th=| sfete/rh| Hdt.1.82; toi=sin h)dikhme/nois E.IA79; pro\s tou\s au(tw=n yilou/s X.HG1.2.3; tini\ a)nti/a tino/s Hdt.5.99; tini\ pro\s to\ a)/nantes X.HG4.8.38; nausi\ b. tini/ poliorkoume/nw| ib.1.6.22; b. toi=s fi/lois ta\ di/kaia Id.Mem.2.6.25; b. toi=s tw=n prog<*>/nwn a)tuxh/masin Aeschin.3.169; b. tw=| lo/gw| Pl.Phd.88e; b. tw=| qew=|
maintain his
rights, Epist. Philipp. ap. D.18.157; b. toi=s no/mois Aeschin.1.33: c. dat. et acc., patri\ bohqw=n qa/naton Pl.Lg.874c; of a physician, b. tw=| qermw=| e)pi\ to\ yuxro/n Hp.VM13: abs., Plu.Alex. 19. abs.,
come to the rescue, Hdt.1.30, 7.158, A.Supp.613, etc.; b. para/ tina Hdt.9.57; e)pi/ tina
against one, Id.1.62, 4.125, Th.1.126, etc.; b. e)s . . Hdt.6.103; e)pi\ . . Th.3.97, 4.72; e)pi\ ta\s nau=s Id.8.11; e)kei=se D.4.41; b. pro/s ti
contribute to an object, v. l. in Arist.EN1155a14, cf. Metaph.1079b16, or
keep it
off, Id.Resp.474b24, HA621a13; xrh/masi
with money, Id.EN1130a19: Medic., bohqei= pro\s to\ kw/neion
it is an antidote to . . , Thphr.HP9.20.1; freq. in Dsc. as b. toi=s fagou=si 4.83. Pass.,
to be assisted, receive help, para/ tinos Arist. Rh. 1383b28; bohqh/somai LXX Da.11.34, but bohqhqh/somai Is.44.2; e)boh/qhn ib.10.3, 2 Ch.26.15 (v.l. e)bohqh/qhn）; i(/n' w)= bebohqhme/nh PRyl.122.12 (ii A. D.); esp. of patients,
derive benefit, Dsc.4.82, Plu.2.687f: impers., e)moi\ beboh/qhtai tw=| teqnew=ti Antipho 1.31; tau/th| moi bebohqhme/non e)gego/nei filosofi/a| Pl.Ep.347e.

boh/q-hma, atos, to/,
resource, Arist.Rh.1405a7 (pl.);
assistance, pro\s th\n ma/xhn Plb.1.22.3: in pl.,
succours, ta\ -mata tou= suggra/mmatos Diog.Oen.2.
remedy, Hp.VM13, D.S.1.25, Dsc.4.83, S.E.P.3.280.
bohq-hma^tiko/s, h/, o/n, = bohqhtiko/s, Dsc.Alex.Praef., Gal.19.395.

bohq-h/simos, on,
curable, Thphr.HP9.16.7.

boh/q-hsis, ews, h(,
aid, succour, Hp.Praec.8, dub. in Aen.Tact.16.4; pro\s th\n th=s u(giei/as b. Alex.Aphr.in Sens.98.22.

bohq-hte/on,
one must help, X.HG6.5.10, D.1.17, etc. Adj. -hte/os, a, on, Jul.Or.7.229a.

bohq-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
ready or
able to help, serviceable, tivi/ Arist. Rh.1374a24; toi=s pe/nhsi Plu.Sol.29; tw=n deome/nwn Diotog. ap. Stob. 4.7.62; pro/s ti so as to
keep it off, Arist.Pol.1267a16; or towards
promoting it, Id.HA515b9: Comp. -w/teron, to\ a)/rren tou= qh/leos ib. 608b15: Sup. -w/tatos Iamb.VP25.111.

bohq-o/os, Dor. boa_-, on, (boh/, qe/w, cf. boh-dro/mos)
hasting to the cry for help or
the call to arms, Il.13.477; b. a(/rma a chariot
hasting to the battle, 17.481.
aiding, helping, Pi.N.7.33, B.Fr.34:—Subst.,
helper, prob. Id.12.103, Theoc.22.23, Call.Del.27:—in Prose bohqo/s, o/n,
assisting, auxiliary, nh=es Th.1.45: c. dat., o( toi=s no/mois b. Lys.Fr.53.1; freq. as Subst.,
assistant, Hdt.5.77, 6.100, Antipho 1.2, Pl.R.566b, al.; th=s e)pitroph=s BGU1047iii 11 (ii A. D.); tou= strathgou= POxy.1469.10 (iii A. D.), etc.
bohq-ou=ra, h(, (with Lat. termination -<*>) = boh/qeia, Lyd.Mag. 3.6,13.

bohl-a^si/a, h(,
driving of oxen, cattle-lifting, Il.11.672.
place where cattle are pastured, cattle-run, AP7.626.
struggle with a bull, Hld. 10.31.

bohl-a^te/w,
drive away oxen, Ar.Fr.758: generally,
urge on, ou(\s h( *klea/nqous mwri/a bohlatei= Sosith.4; possibly,
drive with shouts, Opp.C.4.64.
tend oxen, Lyc.816, Plu.Phil.4.

bohl-a/ths [a^], ou, o(, fem. bohl-a/tis, idos, h(: （bou=s, e)lau/nw):—
one that drives away oxen, cattle-lifter, S.Ichn.117, AP11.176 (Lucill.).
ox-driving, r(a/bdos APl.4.200 (Mosch.);
ox-tormenting, mu/wy A.Supp.307.
cattle-driver, Lys.7.19, Pl.Plt.261d, PLond.3.1177.112 (ii A. D.). b. diqu/rambos the dithyramb
which gains a bull for the prize, Pi.O.13.19.

bohl-a^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for cattle-driving: -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
the herdsman's art, Pl.Euthphr.13c.
bo/hma, v. bo/a_ma.

bohno/mos, o(, h(,
tending oxen, Theoc.20.41.
bo/hc, v. bo/ac.

bo-h/rotos, on,
ploughed by oxen, Nic.Fr.43.

bo/-hsis, ews, h(, = boh/,
cry, shout for assistance, Thd., Quint.Ps.21(22).2.

bo-hth/s, ou=, o(,
clamorous, Hp.Ep.19, prob.l. in Morb.Sacr.15, cf. Hsch. s.v. h)pu/ta: Dor. fem., boa=tis au)da/ A.Pers.575 (lyr.).
bo-htiko/s, h/, o/n, gloss on foreg., Sch.A. l.c.

bo-hto/s, h/, o/n,
shouted or
sung aloud, qrh/noisi bohto\n u(mh/naon Epigr.Gr.418.7 (Cyrene).
bo-htu/s, u/os, h(, Ep. for bo/hsis, Od.1.369.

boqr-eu/w,
dig a trench or
pit, Gp.9.6.2:—also boqr-e/w, Nonn.D.47.69, and boqr-i/zw, Heliod. ap. Orib.46.22.16.

boqr-i/on, to/, Dim. of bo/qros,
small trench, to set plants in, Gp.8.18.2, Alciphr.3.13.
small ulcer, Hp.Liqu.6. in pl.,
sockets of the teeth, Gal.2.754.

boqroeidh/s, e/s, '
pitting' on pressure, of tumours, Hp.Mul.2.118.

bo/qr-os, o(,
hole, trench, or
pit dug in the ground, bo/qron o)ru/cai Od. 10.517; bo/qrou t' e)ce/streye [th\n e)lai/an] Il.17.58;
trough, Od.6.92: generally,
hollow, X.An.4.5.6;
grave, IG14.238 (Aerae); ritual
pit for offerings to u(poxqo/nioi qeoi/, b. kai\ me/gara Porph.Antr.6.

boqr-o/w, = boqreu/w, Gal.8.951 (Pass.); of caries, Heliod. ap. Orib.46.22.1; of a tumor '
pitting' on pressure, Aët.15.1.

boqu/n-ion [u_], to/, Dim. of sq., '
fossette', Zos.Alch.p.222 B.
bo/qun-os, o(, = bo/qros, Cratin.210, X.Oec.19.3, BGU1122.17 (i B. C.). a meteorological phenomenon, Arist.Mete.342a36, Mu.392b4.

boqun-wth/s, ou=, o(,
ditcher, Aq.4 Ki.25.12.
boid-a/rion, to/, Dim. of bou=s, Ar.Av.585, Fr.82.

boi/d-hs, ou, o(,
like an ox, quiet, stupid, Men.1002.
boi/d-ion, to/, Dim. of bou=s, Ar. Ach.1036, Arist.HA522b14, PSI1.84 (iv/v A. D.):—also boii/+dion, AP7.169; bou/dion (rejected by Phryn.69), Hermipp.35.2, PFlor. 150.2 (iii A. D.).
boikei=: gami/skei, Theognost. Can.19.4. boiki/a: h( qera/paina, AB1354. = voiki/a, ga=r kai\ boiki/ar e)/gkthsin Schwyzer 425.24 (Elis, iii/ii B. C.).
boi+ko/s, v. boeiko/s. Adv. -kw=s Porph.Abst.3.3.

bo/i+nos, h, on, = bo/eios, Gloss.; b. sa/lpigc
having boo\s protomh/
as mouthpiece, Eust.1139.58.

boio/n, to/,
cycle of fifty years, Hdn.Gr.1.376.

boi+sti/, Adv.
in ox-language, lalei=n Porph.VP24.

*boiwt-a/rxhs, ou, o(, Boeotarch, one of the chief magistrates of the Boeotian league, Hdt.9.15, Th.4.91, Hell.Oxy.11.3, etc.:—also *boiw/t-arxos, X.HG3.4.4: hence *boiwt-arxe/w,
to be a Boeotarch, Th.4.91, D.59.99.

*boiwt-arxi/a, h(,
office of Boeotarch, Ael.VH13.42, Plu.Pel.25: pl., Id.2.785c.

boiwt-ia/zw, th=| fwnh=|
speak Boeotian, X.An.3.1.26, Com.Adesp. 677.
side with the Boeotians, in politics, etc., X.HG5.4.34, Aeschin.3.139:—also boiwt-i/zw, Plu.2.575d codd. boiwt-i/dion [ti_], to/, Dim. of *boiw/tios, Ar.Ach.872.

*boiwtiourgh/s, e/s, (e)/rgon)
of Boeotian work, kra/nos X.Eq.12.3.

*boiwto/s, o(,
a Boeotian, Il.2.494, etc.:—*boiwti/a, h(, Boeotia, so called from its
cattle-pastures:—Adj. *boiw/t-ios, a, on, Boeotian, Hes. Fr.132, etc.; with a notion of
gluttonous, ou(/tw sfo/dr' e)sti\ tou\s tro/pous *b. Eub.39, cf. 34; ei)mi\ ga\r *b. polla\ . . e)sqi/wn Mnesim.2; o)cu/peinon a)/ndra kai\ *b. Demonic.1; and of
dull, stupid, Plu.2.995e: prov., u(=s *boiwti/a Pi.O.6.90, cf. Fr.83; also *b. no/mos, melody used in kiqarw|di/a, S.Fr.966, Plu.2.1132d; *boiw/tion me/los Sch.Ar.Ach.13:— also boiwt-iko/s, h/, o/n, po/lemos D.S.14.81, Plu.Lys.27, and boiwt-iako/s, h/, o/n, IG11.161B122 (Delos, iii B. C.), Str.9.2.11. Adv. -iakw=s (v.l. -ikw=s) ibid.; *boiwtiaka/, ta/, title of work by Hellanicus, Sch.Il.2.494:—fem. *boiwti/s, i/dos, X.HG5.1.36.
*boko/pia or *bouko/pia, ta/, festival at Lindus, IG12(1).792, al.

bolai=os, a, on, (bolh/)
violent, qu/nnos Trag.Adesp.391, cf. Eust. 1404.52.
bolauge/w, Astrol., = a)ktinobole/w, tina\ a)kti=si or e)n a)kti/nessi, Man. 4.272,431.

bo/lba, h(, = Lat.
vulva, AP11.410 (Lucill.).

bolb-a/rion, to/, Dim. of bolbo/s, Epict.Ench.7. -i/dion, to/,
small cuttle-fish, with a strong smell, Hp.Mul.2.133: -i/tion, Gal. 19.89.
bo/lbiqos, o(, v. bo/liton.

bolb-i/nh, h(,
star-flower, Ornithogalum umbellatum, Thphr.HP7.3.9, Matro Fr.2.3.
bolb-i/on, to/, Dim. of bolbo/s, Hp.Mul.2.196.
bolb-i/skos, o(, AP11.35 (Phld.).
bolb-iti/nh (prob. l. for bolbotu/nh), h(, = bolbi/dion, Arist. and Speus. ap. Ath.7.318e:—also bolb-iti/s, i/dos, h(, Epich.61.
bo/lbi^ton, to/, or bo/lbi^tos, o(, Thphr.HP5.5.3, Dsc.2.167, Archig. ap. Gal.12.173, worse forms of bo/liton, -tos, acc. to Phryn.335.

bolbo-eidh/s, e/s,
bulb-like, bulb-shaped, Dsc.2.144, Aët.12.63.

bolbo-ka/sta^non, to/,
earth-nut, = bou/nion, Alex. Trall.5.6.

bolbo/s, o(,
purse-tassels, Muscari comosum, Ar.Ec.1092, Pl.R. 372c, Arist. Pr.926a6, Thphr.HP7.13.8, Theoc.14.17, Dsc.2.170: freq.in Com, Pl.Com.173.9, etc.; identified with u(/dnon by Sch.Ar.Nu. 188; also of other bulbous plants, b. e)metiko/s, =
Narcissus Tazetta, Dsc.4.156; b. a)/grios, = kolxiko/n, ib.4.83; b. e)riofo/ros, =
Scilla hyacinthoides, Thphr.HP7.13.8 (an Indian kind, perh.
Euodendron anfractnosum, Phan.Hist.28); b., = na/rkissos, Ps.-Dsc.4.158; = h(merokalle/s, Id.3.122; bolboi/ perh. =
eyes on root-stock of ka/lamos, Dsc.1.85.
bolbotu/nh, v. bolbiti/nh.

bolbofa^kh=, h(,
soup of bulbs and lentils, Com.Adesp.367,368, Ath. 13.584d.

bolbw/dhs, es,
bulbous, Thphr.HP7.13.9.

bolbwru^xe/w,
dig bolboi/, Com.Adesp.959.

boletismo/s, o(,
angling, Orac. in Ath.Mitt.25.399 (Aezani).

bole/w, = ba/llw, Theol.Ar.37, Eust.1405.4; in early writers Ep.pf. Pass. bebo/lhmai
to be stricken with grief and the like , a)/xei+ . . bebolhme/nos h)=tor Il.9.9, cf. Od.10.247; pe/nqei+ . . bebolh/ato pa/ntes Il.9.3; a)mhxani/h| bebo/lhsai A.R.4.1318; a)mfasi/h| bebo/lhto Q.S.7.726. in literal sense, mh/thr a)mf' au)to\n bebolhme/nh
falling about his neck, A.R.1.262; *bow/ths . . a)nte/llei bebolhme/nos' *)arktou/roio
dominated by Arcturus, Arat.609.

bolew/n, w=nos, o(,
dunghill, Din. ap. Harp., Philem.221 codd., Nic. ap. Harp., Eust.1404 fin.

bolh/, h(,
throw:
stroke or
wound of a missile (opp. plhgh/, of sword or pike), Od.17.283, cf. 24.161; b. pe/trwn E.Or.59; li/qwn Phld.Ir.p.31 W. (pl.); me/xri li/qou kai\ a)konti/ou bolh=s Th.5.65; b. e)/rwtos
shafts of love, AP12.160; bolai=s . . sfo/ggos w)/lesen grafh/n by its
stroke or
touch, A.Ag.1329;
swing of a(lth=res, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.34.1. ku/bwn bolai/
throws or
casts of dicc, S.Fr.429. metaph., b. o)fqalmw=n
quick glances, Od.4.150; ka/tw . . blemma/twn r(e/pei b. A.Fr.242, cf. Philostr.VS2.27.5. b. kerau/nioi thunder-
bolts, A. Th.430; bolai\ h(li/ou sun-
beams, S.Aj.877, cf. E.Ion 1134; xrusou= . . bolai=s
with golden
rays, of a statue, IG14.1026 (iii A. D.); bolai\ xio/nos
radiance, E.Ba.662; ta\s yuxa\s oi(=on bola\s ei)=nai le/gousin Plot.6.4.3. bolai/, = w)di=nes, Procop.Goth.4.22.
payment, a)podw/sw e)pi\ bolai=s dusi/n Stud.Pal.20.139 (vi A. D.).
boli/dion, to/, Dim. of boli/s 2, Olymp. in Mete.298.33.

boli/zh, h(,
female slave, Cretan word in Seleuc. ap. Ath.6.267c.

boli/zw, (boli/s)
heave the lead, take soundings, Act.Ap.27.28, Eust. 563.30:—Pass.,
sink in water, Gp.6.17.

entryFree.sense:
= a)nabo/limoi d.,
deferred, adjourned suits, *)arx. *)ef. 1911.133 (Gonni): bo/li^mon, to/,
period of delay, BCH37.204 (Chios): hence boli^modi^kastai/, oi(,
judges who try b. di/kai, *)arx. *)ef. 1911.129 (Gonni).

div0.entryFree: bo/limos, = mo/libos, SIG241.28 (Delph., iv B. C.), IG4.1484.275 (Epid., iv B. C.): Syracusan acc. to EM204.40.
bo/linqos, o(, perh. = bo/nasos, Arist.Mir.830a7.

bo/lion, to/,
counter used in the game of pettoi/, Hsch., EM666.16, Eust.1396.59. = po/lion, Ps.-Dsc.3.110.

boli/s, i/dos, h(,
missile, javelin, Plu.Demetr.3.
sounding-lead, Sch.Il.24.80. a)strapw=n boli/des
flashes of lightning, LXX Wi. 5.21; a)straph\ boli/s (sic) ib.Za.9.14.
cast of the dice, AP9.767 (Agath.).
die, ib.768 (Id.).

bolistiko/s, h/, o/n, (bo/los)
to be caught by the casting-net, Plu.2.977f.
boli/t-aina [i^], h(, = bolbi/dion, Arist.HA525a19, 621b17; cf. o)/zolis.

boli/t-inos, h, on,
of cow-dung, Ar.Ra.295; ske/los Cratin.inc.17 Mein.

bo/lit-on, to/ (bo/li^tos, o(, acc. to Sch.Ar.Ra.295:—also bo/lbiqos, o(, PMag.Par.1.1439),
cow-dung, mostly in pl., Cratin.39, Ar.Ach.1026, Eq.658: prov., boli/tou di/kh vexatious action, Sch.Ar.Eq. 658.
bo/lla, Aeol. for boulh/, Plu.2.288b, IG12(2).6.38, etc.:—bo/llaos, = boulai=os, ib.68.8:—bolleu/w, for bouleu/w, ib.6.34.
bo/llomai, Aeol., = bou/lomai, Sapph.Supp.5.17, Theoc.28.15.

bollwto/s, h/, o/n, (Lat.
bulla) possessing knobs, peronei/dwn zeu=gos bollwtw=n CPR12.4(i A. D.).
boloi/, oi(, shortening of o)boloi/, Amphis 30.12, Hsch.

boloktu^pi/h, h(,
rattling of dice, AP9.767 (Agath.).

bo/lomai, Ep., Ion. (IG12(9).189.31 (Eretria, iv B. C.)), Arc. (ib.5 (2).3.9 (Tegea, iv B. C.)), = bou/lomai, *trwsi\n dh\ bo/letai dou=nai kra/tos Il.11.319; ei) . . bo/lesqe au)to/n te zw/ein ktl. Od.16.387; nu=n d' e(te/rws e)bo/lonto qeoi/ (vulg. e)ba/lonto) 1.234, cf. A.R.1.262; ei)/ ti bo/leste (2pl.) SIG1259.5 (iv B. C.).

bo/los, o(,
throw with a casting-net, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.62; me/ga di/ktuon e)s b. e(/lkei draws it back for
a cast, Theoc.1.40: metaph., ei)s b. kaqi/stasqai, e)/rxesqai, fall within
the cast of the net, E.Ba.848, Rh.730.
net, Herod.7.75, Ael.NA8.3; for birds, AP6.184 (Zos.).
thing caught, i)xqu/wn b.
draught, catch, of fishes, A.Pers. 424, Plu.2.91c; bo/lon a)nspa/s asqai land one's
catch, E.El.582.
casting of teeth, Arist.HA576b13 (pl.), GA748b9; katamaqei=n to\n b. examine a horse's
teeth, Hierocl.Facet.37.
