cast of dice, Poll.7.204, Plaut.Rud.360. bo/los: qu/ra, phlo/s (i. e. bw=los). Hsch.
bo/lubdos, o(, = mo/lubdos, Tab.Defix.107 (iv B. C.).
bo/lunqon, to/, = bo/liton, Hsch.

bomba/zw,
jeer at, Suid.

bomba/c, interjection,
prodigious! Ar.Th.45; intensified, bomba^lobomba/c, ib.48.

bombau/lios, o(, (bombe/w, au)lo/s) comic compd. for a)skau/lhs,
bagpiper, with play on bombulio/s, Ar.Ach.866.

bomb-e/w, (bo/mbos)
make a booming noise; in Hom. always of falling bodies, trufa/leia xamai\ bo/mbhse pesou=sa Il.13.530; ai)xmh\ xalkei/h xama/dis bo/mb. pes. 16.118, cf. Od.18.397; bo/mbhsan . . kata\ r(o/on the oars
fell with a loud noise . . , 12.204; bo/mbhsen de\ li/qos the stone
flew humming through the air, 8.190; of the sea,
roar, Simon. 1; of thunder,
roll, rumble, Nonn.D.1.301;
hum, of bees, etc., Arist.HA535b6, 627a24, Theoc.3.13, Pl.R.564d; bombei= de\ nekrw=n smh=nos S.Fr.879; of mosquitoes,
buzz, Ar.Pl.538; of birds, liguro\n bombeu=sin a)kanqi/des AP5.291 (Agath.): generally of sound,
buzz in one's ears, Pl.Cri.54d; but w)=ta bombei= moi Luc.DMeretr.9.2: c. dat. instr., ko/xlw| b. Nonn.D.36.93.

bomb-hdo/n, Adv.
buzzing, with a hum, A.R.2.133, Luc.Pisc.42.
bomb-h/eis, essa, en, = bombhtiko/s, APl.4.74; ku=ma Nonn.D.3.32.

bo/mb-hsis, ews, h(,
buzzing: buzzing crowd, LXX Ba.2.29.

bomb-hth/s, ou=, o(,
buzzing, e(smo/s AP6.236 (Phil.):—fem. bomb-h/tria, *nu/mfai Orph.H.51.9.

bomb-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
humming, Eust.945.23:—also bomb-iko/s, h/, o/n, to\ tw=n qrh/nwn b. Sch. metr.Pi.O.1.
bomboi/a: kolumba\s e)lai/a (Cypr.), Hsch.: bomboilado/nas: e)niautou/s, Id.
bombo/xulon, = mandrago/ras, Dsc.4.75.
bombru/zwn: tonqoru/zwn, bow=n, Hsch. bombruna/zein: brenqu/esqai, Id.

bombu_k-i/as ka/lamos reed
used for making deep-toned flutes (cf. bo/mbuc 11), Thphr.HP4.11.3.

bombu_/k-inos, h, on,
silken, i(ma/tia Lib.Decl. 33.6; sindw/n Ps.-Callisth.3.28.

bombu/kion [u_], to/, species of
mason-bee, Chalicodoma muraria, Arist.HA 555a13 (v.l. bombukoeidw=n).
small buzzing insect, Sch. Ar.Nu.158.
cocoon of silk-worm, Arist.HA551b14.

bombu_koeidh/s, e/s,
like silk, u(fh/ Dsc.3.16.

bombu^leu/mata, ta/,
kickshaws, Com.Adesp.960.
bombu/lh, h(, = lh/kuqos, Hsch., Sch.A.R.2.569.
*bombuli/a, h(, title of Athena in Boeotia, Hsch.
bombu^li-a/zw, (bombe/w) = borboru/zw, Arist.Pr.949a13 (v.l. -i/zousin).
bombu^/li-on, to/, = bolbi/dion, Gal.19.89.

bombu^li-o/s or bombu^li-u/lios, o(,
buzzing insect: humble-bee, Ar.V.107, Isoc.10.12, Arist.HA623b12, 629a29;
gnat, mosquito, Hsch.
cocoon of the silk-worm (v.l. bombuli/s), Arist.HA551b12.
narrow-necked vessel that
gurgles in pouring, Hp.Morb.3.16, IG11(2).154A68 (Delos, iii B. C.), Socr. ap. Ath. 11.784d, Luc.Lex.7. (On the accent v. Hdn. Gr.1.116, al.)
bombu^li/s, i/dos, h(, = pomfo/luc, Hsch. cf. bombulio/s 1.2.

bo/mbuc, u_kos, o(,
silk-worm, Arist.HA ap.Ath.7.352f. insect like a wasp, Hsch.
silk garment, Alciphr.1.39.
deeptoned flute, A.Fr.57.3, Arist.Aud.800b25, Poll.4.82, Plu.2.713a.
cap of a flute, Poll.4.70.
lowest note on the flute, Arist.Metaph. 1093b3:—hence Comp. bombuke/steros,
deeper in tone, Nicom.Harm. 11. Lacon., = sta/mnos, Hsch., AB1354.

bombw/dhs, es, = bombhtiko/s, Ael.
N A6.37; of intestinal flatus, Gal.7.241.
bombw/n, w=nos, o(, late form for bonbw/n, Moeris94, Hdn.Gr.1.23, 2.483.

bo/nasos or bo/nassos, o(,
European bison, aurochs, Bos bonasus, Arist.HA498b31, 630a18, PA663a14, Str.15.1.69.

boo-bosko/s, o(,
herdsman, Suid.

boo/-glhnos, on,
ox-eyed, Nonn. D.7.260. dmhth/r, h=ros, o(, (dama/w)
slaying oxen, le/onte Q.S. 1.524, cf. 587.

boo-zu/gion [u^], to/,
ox-yoke, LXX Si.26.7.

boo-qu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
slaver of oxen, Suid.

bo/o-kley, contr. bou=kley, o(,
stealer of oxen, S.Fr.318.

boo-klo/pos, on,
ox-stealing, Orph.A.1057, Nonn.D.1.337; cf. bouklo/pos.

boo/-krairos, on,
ox-horned, ib.13.314.

boo-kta^si/a, h(, (ktei/nw)
slaying of oxen, A.R.4.1724 (pl.).

boo/-kti^tos, on, (kti/zw) of Thebes,
founded where the heifer lay, Nonn.D.25.415.

boo-no/mos, o(,
herdsman, Cyr., Suid.

boo-pro/swpos, on,
ox-faced, Porph.Abst.3.16 codd. boo-rrai/sths, ou, o(,
slayer of oxen, Tryph.361.

boo-sko/pos, on,
looking after oxen, Nonn.D.31.225 (bo/oskos, Hsch. may be f.l. for this word).

boo-sso/os, on, (seu/w)
driving oxen wild, of the gadfly, Nonn.D.11.191: contr., bousso/on o(/n te mu/wpa . . kale/ousin Call. Fr.46, cf. Cerc.8.2.
ox-driving, ke/ntra Q.S.5.64, cf. Nonn.D.11.149, al. = bohla/ths 1, epith. of Hermes, ib.4.31.
boo-sta/sion [a^], to/, = sq., Stud.Pal.20.74 (iii A. D.).
boo/-sta^sis, ews, h(, = bou/stasis, Call.Del.102.

boo/-stiktos, on, dub.sens., quhlh/ (of an offering
of bull's blood) Nonn.D.5.281.

boo/-stolos, on,
riding on a bull, nu/mfh, of Europa, ib.1.66.

boo-sfa^gi/a, Ion. -i/h, h(,
slaughter of oxen, APl.4.101.
boo-tro/fos, on, = boutr-, D.P.558, Nonn.D.14.377, PLond.5.1654 (iv A. D.).

boo/w,
change into an ox, Eust.70.28.

bora/, h(,
food, prop. of carnivorous beasts, ponti/ois da/kesi do\s bora/n A.Pr.583 (lyr.), cf. Ch.530; qhrsi\n a)/qlion b. E.Ph.1603, cf.S.Ant.30; kuno\s b. Ar.Eq.416; o( le/wn . . [xai/rei] o(/ti b. e(/cei Arist.EN1118a23; of cannibal feasts, Hdt.1.119; krew=n . . oi)kei/as bora=s of their own flesh
served as food, of the children of Thyestes, A.Ag.1220, cf. 1597; bora=s tou= . . *o<*>di/pou go/nou
food torn from the body of the son of Oedipus, S.Ant.1017, cf. 1040; bora=| xai/rousin a)nqrwpokto/nw|; E.Cyc.127; ou) ga\r e)n gastro\s b. to\ xrhsto\n ei)=nai in
gluttony, Id.Supp.865: less freq. of simple
food, Pi.Fr.124.5, A.Pers.490, S.Ph.274, etc. (borra/ is prob. f.l. for forba/ in AP3.14.) (Cf. bibrw/skw:
g[uglide]er[schwa]-, cf. Skt.
-gara- in compds. (cf. dhmo-bo/ros, Lat.
carni-vorus) 'devouring',
giráti 'swallow', Lat.
vorare, Lith.
gérti 'drink', etc.)
bora/zw, = tre/fw, EM205.6 (but -a/|zw, 737.21).

bo/rassos, o(,
growing spadix of the date with immature fruit, Dsc. 1.109.

bo/raton, to/,
jumiper, Juniperus foetidissima, D.S.2.49. = bra/qu, Dsc.1.76.

bora/w,
eat, EM216.14.

borbor-i/zw, (bo/rboros)
to be like mud, e)n geu/sei Dsc.5.75. borbori/zei: goggu/zei, molu/nei (Cypr.), Hsch.
borbor-ismo/s, o(, = borborugmo/s, Cael.Aur.CP3.20.194.
borbor-i=tai, oi(, name of a guild at Thera, IG12(3).6.

borboro/-qu_mos, on,
muddy-minded, Ar.Pax753.
borboro-koi/ths, ou, o(, Mudcoucher, name of a frog, Batr.230.

borboro/ph, h(,
filthily lewd, Hippon.110.

bo/rboros, o(,
mire, filth, Asius 1, Heraclit.13, A.Eu.694, Ar.V. 259, Pl.Phd.69c, LXX Je.45.6, 2 Ep.Pet.2.22. etc.: distd. fr. phlo/s
clay, moist earth, Luc.Prom.Es1;
sewer, Hsch.: metaph.,
foul abuse, tosou=ton b. kath/ntlhsa/s mou Luc.Lex.17.

borboro-ta/racis, o(,
mud-stirrer, Ar.Eq.309.

borboro-fo/rba, h(, fem. Adj.
feeding on filth, PMag.Par.1.1402.

borbor-o/w,
make muddy, Arist. GA763a29 (Pass.). -u^gh/, h(, = sq., Hsch.

borbor-w/dhs, es,
miry, filthy, phlo\s -e/steros Pl.Phd.111d; i)lu/s Arist.HA547b20; qa/latta Men.25; of pus or pitch,
turbid, Hp. Aph.7.44, Thphr.HP9.2.3: metaph., bi/os Ph.1.322.
borbor-wpo/n: ai)sxro/n, borbo/rw| e)mfere/s, Hsch.
borbo/r-wsis, ews, h(, = borborugmo/s, Archig. ap. Aët.9.40.

borbu/la, h(, a
cake made of poppy and sesame, Hsch. bordw/n, w=nos, o(, = bourdw/n, Philagr. ap. Aët.1<*>.51.

*borea/dhs, ou, o(,
son of Boreas, D.S.4.44; Ep. *borhi+a/dhs AP9.550 (Antip.).

*bore/as, ou, o(: Aeol. *bori/ais Ale.Supp.7.13; Ion. *bore/hs Hom., or *borh=s, e/w, Hdt.7.189; Att. *borra=s, a=, Cratin.207, Th.6.2, al., Pl.Criti.112b, PPetr.1.21.11 (iii B. C.), Ev.Luc.13.29, etc.; but gen. *bore/ou IG12.373.29:—
north wind, personified as Boreas, Od.5.296, etc.: generally, opp. no/tos, *b. kai\ a)parkti/as Arist.Mete.363b14, cf. Mu.394b20 (pl.), HA612b5 (pl.); *b. pne/ousin o)rniqi/ai PHib.1.2-. 59 (iii B. C.).
the north, pro\s *bore/hn (v.l. -rh=n） a)/nemon towards
the north. Hdt.2.101; pro\s *bore/an tou= o)/rous Th.2.96, cf. 6.2; *borra=|
to the north, BGU1127.12 (i B. C.), etc.; cf. *boro/hn: th\n fu=san, Hsch.

*borea/s, poet. *boreia/s and *borhi+a/s, a/dos, h(,
Boread, daughter of Boreas, S.Ant.985 (lyr.), Orph.A.738:—also *borhi/+s, i/+dos, Nonn.D. 33.211. as fem. Adj.,
northern, pnoai/ A.Fr.195.

*bore-asmo/s, o(,
festival of Boreas at Athens, Hsch. (pl.).

*bore/-hqen, Adv.
from the north, D.P.79.

*bore/-hnde, Adv.
northwards, Id.137.
*bore-h=tis, idos, h(, fem. of *bo/reios, Id.243.
boreiai=os, a, on, = bo/reios, APl.4.230 (Leon.).
boreino/s, h/, o/n, = bo/reios, A.D.Synt.94.15, CPHerm.28.13 (iii A. D.): —also borino/s, h/, o/n, POxy.498.8 (ii A. D.): borrino/s, h/, o/n, ib.243.21 (i A. D.), etc.
*boreio/qen, poet. for *bore/hqen, Nonn.D.6.127.
borei=on: gasth\r e)skeuasme/nh pws, Hsch.

bo/reios, a, on, also os, on S.OC1240 (lyr.): Ion. borh/i+os, h, on:—
from the quarter of the north wind, northern, opp no/tios, qa/lassa Hdt. 4.37, 6.31; b. a)kta/
exposed to the north, S.l.c.; to\ b. tei=xos Ar.Fr.556, And.3.5, Pl.R.439e; th=s *pleia/dos borei/ou genome/nhs having appeared
in the north, Arist.
H A542b11.
of the north wind, b. xeimw/n a winter
during which northerly winds prevail, Hp.Aph.3.11, Arist.Pr. 859b21; e)/ar ib.860a13; bo/reia, ta/,
northerly winds, ib.944a1, etc. (rarely in sg., Ar.V.265; o(/tan h)=| bo/reion X.Cyn.8.1); borei/ois
in the time of northerly winds, Arist.
H A574a1, al.; borei/wn o)/ntwn ib.592a14: Comp. -o/teros Arat. 247, Alex.Aphr.in Metaph.446.34: Sup. -o/tatos Man.4.241. bo/reion, = e)llebori/nh, Ps.-Dsc.4.108; bo/reios, = a)ei/zwon to\ me/ga, ib.88.
boreu/s, o(, = bore/as, in oblique cases borh=os, -h=i, -h=a, Arat.430, 829,882, etc.: nom. pl. borei=s Alciphr.1.1.

boreu/w,
blow from the north, xeimw=nos boreu/ontos Thphr.Sign.53.
borha/: bota/nh pa=sa (fort. poia/), Hsch.
*borhi+a/s, borh/i+os, *borh=s, v. *boreia/s, bo/reios, *bore/as.
borqagori/skea: ta\ xoi/reia kre/a: and borqagori/skoi: mikroi\ xoi=roi (Lacon.), Hsch.; cf. o)rqagori/skos.
*borqei/a, h(, *)orqi/a, title of Artemis, IG5(1).864, al.
bori-ai=os, a, on, = bo/reios, Phlp.in Ph.894.19:—also bori-ako/s, IGRom.4.1603 (Chondriae).
bo/rmac, = mu/rmhc, also bu/rmac, Hsch.
bo/rmos, o(, = bro/mos, Dieuch. ap. Orib.4.7.20, EM205.3, Hsch.

boropoio/s, o/n, (poie/w)
inducing appetite, Eust.1538.30.

boro/s (A), a/, o/n, (bora/)
gluttonous, Ar.Pax 38, Arist.Phgn.810b18: Sup., Mnesith. ap. Orib.21.7.7, Luc.Tim.46. Adv. -w=s Ath.5.186c.
inducing appetite, Asclepiad. ap. Eust.1538.30.

boro/s (B), ou=, o( (for voro/s),
juice of pressed grapes (Lacon.), Hsch.
borra/zwn: yofw=n, Hsch.
*borr-a=qen, = *bore/hqen, Thphr.Sign.11, IG22.1241, al., Hp.Vict.2.37.
-a<*>os, a, on, also os, on AP9.561 (Phil.), = bo/reios, A.Th.527, AP6.245 (Diod.), etc.

*borr-aphliw/ths, ou, o(,
north-cast wind, Ptol. Tetr.67:—Adj. *borr-aphliwtiko/s, h/, o/n,
north-castern, ibid.
*borr-a=s, a=, o(, v. *bore/as.

borro/-liy, li^bos, o(,
north-west wind, PMag.Par.1.1646, Ptol. Tetr.60:—hence Adj. borro-li^bu^ko/s, h/, o/n,
north-western, ib.39.
borso/n: stauro/n (Elean), Hsch. bo/rtaxos: ba/traxos, Id.
bo/rubos, = o)/robos, Ostr.Strassb.606 (i/ii A. D.).
bo/rues, oi(, = o)/rues, Hdt.4.192.

*borusqe/n-hs, ous, o(,
Borysthenes, Dniepr, Hdt.4.18:—hence *borusqen-ei/ths or *borusqen-i/ths, ou, Ion. *borusqen-ei/+ths, ew, o(,
an inhabitant of its banks, Hdt. 4.17, Men.883, etc.

bo/sis, ews, h(, (bo/skw)
food, fodder, i)xqu/si Il.19.268; oi)wnoi=s kai\ qhrsi/ Q.S.1.329; b. kai\ trofh/ Porph.Antr.15.

bosk-a/dios [a^], a, on,
foddered, fatted, xh/n Nic.Al.228.

bosk-a/s, a/dos, h(,
feeding, f.d, nhdu/s Id.Th.782; o)rtali/s Id.Al.293. of birds
which feed themselves, not artificially fed, Aët.9.30 (cf. bosko/s). as Subst., kind of
duck, perh.
teal, Anas crecca, Arist. HA593b17, Alex.Mynd. ap. Ath.9.395d.

bosk-ew/n, w=nos, o(,
feeder, Hsch.

bosk-h/, h(,
fodder, food, pasturage, A.Eu.266 (lyr.); pe/tesqai e)pi\ boskh/n Arist.
H A624a27, cf. PLond.5.1692 (vi A. D.): pl . . mh/lwn te boska/s A.Fr.44.5, cf. E.Hel.1331 (lyr.).

bo/sk-hma, atos, to/,
that which is fed or
fatted: in pl.,
fatted beasts, cattle, S.Tr.762, E.Ba.677, X.HG4.6.6; of sheep, E.Alc.576 (lyr.), El.494; e)mh=s xero\s b., of horses, Id.Hipp.1356 (lyr.); of dogs, X.Cyr.8.1.9; zh=n a)po\ boskhma/twn Arist.Pol.1319a20: dual, of a couple of pigs, Ar.Ach.811: sg., of
a single beast, a)/kanqa ponti/ou b. A.Fr.275.3; e)n tro/pw| boskh/matos piaino/menon zh=n Pl.Lg.807a; opp. qhri/on, Arist.MM1204a38, Str.16.4.16.
food, b. phuonh=s A.Supp.620, cf. S.El.364, Ar.Ra.892; a)nai/maton b. daimo/nwn
prey drained of blood by the Erinyes, A.Eu.302.

bosk-hma^tw/dhs, es,
brutish, bestial, qhriw=des kai\ b. Str.5.2.7, cf. Ocell.4.14, M Ant.4.28; a)nai/sqhtos kai\ b. Aristid Quint.2.6: coupled with zw| w/dhs, Iamb.Protr.21.ie/; b. e)/nnoiai Procl.in Cra.p.68P.

bo/sk-hsis, ews, h(,
feeding, pasture, Sm.Ec.1.14, Hieroel.Facet.47.

bosk-hte/on,
one must feed, to\n pate/rz Ar.Av.1359.

bosk-h/twr, oros, o(,
herdsman, EM 205.52, Sch.Il.12.302.

bosko/s, o(,
herdsman, Aesop.316, interpol. in AP7.703 (Myrin.); b. proba/twn
shepherd, interpol. in Dsc.4.119. as Adj.,
feeding itself (= Lat.
agrestis, non pastus), fasiano/s, xh/n, Edict.Diocl.4.18 (variant for a)/grios), 22; cf. boska/s.

bo/skw, impf. e)/boskon, Ep. bo/ske Il.15.548: fut. -h/sw Od.17.559, Ar.Ec.590: aor. e)bo/skhsa Gp.18.7: pf. bebo/skhka PMag.6.13 (iii B. C.):—Pass. and Med. (v. infr. 11); Ion. impf. boske/skonto Od.12.355: fut. boskh/somai Sarap. in Plu.2.398d, Dor. boskhseu=mai Theoc. 5.103: aor. e)boskh/qhn Nic. Th.34, Babr.89.7. prop. of herdsmen,
feed, tend, ai)po/lia Od. 14.102; taw)=s Stratt.27; o( bo/skwn
the feeder, Arist.HA540a18. generally,
feed, nourish, bo/skei gai=a
. . a)nqrw/pous Od.11.365, cf. 14.325; gaste/ra boskh/seis 17.559; pa/nta bo/skousan flo/ga . . *(hli/ou S.OT1425;
maintain, keep, e)pikou/rous Hdt.6.39; nautiko/n Th.7.48; gunai=kas Ar.Lys.260; oi)ke/tas ib.1204, Herod.7.44: metaph., b. no/son S.Ph.313; pra/gmata b. troubles, i.e. children, Ar.V.313. Pass., of cattle,
feed, graze, Od.21.49, etc.; cu/loxon ka/ta Il.5.162: c.acc.,
feed on, poi/hn h.Merc.27,232, cf. A.Ag.118 (lyr.), Arist.HA591a16, al.; tini/ A.Th.244. metaph.,
to be fed or
nurtured, i)ugmoi=si Id.Ch.26 (lyr.); kou/fois pneu/masin S.Aj. 558; e)lpi/sin E.Ba.617; b. tini/ or peri/ ti
run riot in a thing, AP 5.271 (Paul. Sil.), prob. in 285 (Id.). (
g[uglide]ō, cf. Lith.
guotas 'herd'.)

bo/smoron, to/, an Indian
millet, ragi, Eleusine coracana, Str.15.1.13 and 18:—also bo/smoros, o(,
Peripl. M. Rubr.14,41.

bo/spor-os, o(, (boo\s po/ros Opp.H.1.617) wrongly expld. by the Greeks as
Ox-ford, name of several straits, b. *kimme/rios, *qra/|kios, Hdt.4.12,83, etc. (also applied to the Hellespont by A.Pers.723, 746, S.Aj.884, Sch.adll. cc.):—Adj. bospo/r-eios, on, S.Fr.707:
bospo/r-ios, a, on, Id.Aj.l.c.:
bospor-ei=on, to/, name of a temple, Dccr.Byz. ap. D.18.91:

bospor-i/ths [i], ou, o(,
dweller on the Bosporus, S.Fr.503:

bospor-a_no/s or bospor-hno/s, o(,
inhabitant of the kingdom of Bosporus, Str.7.4.7, 11.2.10, 16.2.39.

bostru^x-hdo/n, Adv.
curly, like curls, Luc.Hist.Conscr.19, Philops. 22.
bostru^x-idh=: polukamph=, Hsch.

bostru^x-i/zw,
curl hair, Anaxil.42; a)/rrenes bebostruxisme/noi D.H.7.9: metaph.,
dress out, dialo/gous kteni/zein kai\ b. Id.Comp.25.

bostru^/x-ion, to/, Dim. of bo/struxos, AP 11.66 (Antiphil.):—
vine-tendril, Arist.HA549b33, cf.544a9: in pl., = ste/mfula,
pressed grapes, Hsch.

bostru^x-i/ths [i_], oi)=nos wine
made from pressed grapes, Aë.15.21.

bostru^xo-eidh/s, e/s,
curly, Adv. -dw=s Gal.2.900:—the Adj. may perh. be read in Hsch. for bostruxidh= and bostruxh=ndes. -omai,
to be curled, Ach. Tat.1.19.

bo/stru^x-os, o(, heterocl. pl. bo/struxa in AP5.259 (Paul. Sil.), 6.71 (Id.): acc. pl. bo/struxas Dionys.Av.2.7:—
curl, lock of hair, Archil. 58, A.Ch.178, Ar.Nu.536, etc.: in sg. collectively,
hair, a)mpe/tason b. w)/mois E.Hipp.202 (lyr.). poet.,
anything twisted or
wreathed, puro\s a)mfh/khs b.
thunderbolt, A.Pr.1044: in pl.,
tendrils, Philostr. VA3.4. metaph.,
ornament, th=s h)pei/rou, of Smyrna, Aristid. Or.18(20).9; of Nicomedia, Lib.Or.61.12; e(sti/as xrusou=s b., of a son, Him. Or.23.7.
winged insect, perh.
male of the glow-worm, Arist.HA551b26. in pl.,
sea-wecd, Dionys.Av. l.c.

bostru^x-w/dhs, es,
curly, geneia/s Philostr.VS2.5.1.

bota/mia, ta/, (bo/skw)
pastures, dub. in Th.5.53.

bota/nh [a^], h(, （bo/skw)
pasture, Il.13.493, Pl.Prt.321b, etc.; e)k bota/nhs a)nio/nta Theoc.25.87; e)n b. Id.28.12; e)/grontai e)s bota/nan E.Fr.773.29; b. a( le/ontos the lion's
pasture, i.e. Nemea, Pi.N.6.42: metaph., w(/sper e)n kakh=| b. trefo/menoi Pl.R.401c.
fodder, Od. 10.411.
herb, Thphr.HP4.4.13, Dsc.1 Praef.1 (pl.), etc. in pl.,
plants, as material for making clothes, opp. dorai/, Diog. Oen. 10.
weeds, Thphr.HP2.7.5, POxy.729.22 (ii A. D.): in pl., Gp. 2.46.2. i(era\ b., = peristerew/n, Dsc.4.60.

bota/nh-qen [a^], Adv.
from the pasture, Opp.H.4.393.

botanh-fa/gos [fa^], on,
herbivorous, ib.3.424.

botanh-fo/ros, on,
herb-bearing, Nonn. D.25.526.
bota^n-i/dion, to/, Dim. of bota/nh, Sch.Pi.N.6.71.

bota^n-i/zw,
root up weeds, Thphr.CP3.20.9, PLond.1.131rii 42 (i A. D.), GP.3.3.13:— Pass., ib.2.24.3.

bota^n-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of herbs, fa/rmaka Plu.2.663c; h( b. para/dosis the science
of herbal remedies, Dsc.1 Praef.1:—ta\ -ka/ Id.2 Praef.; b. i)atro/s
herbalist, Gal.Thras.24; -koi/, oi(,
herb-gatherers, Id.14.9.
bota^/n-ion, to/, Dim. of bota/nh, Thphr. CP2.17.3, Dsc.2.156: Pl., Antiph.142.3 (s. v.l.). b. *(ermou=, = lino/zwstis, Dsc.4.189.

bota^n-ismo/s, o(,
weeding, GP.2.24 tit., BGU197.17 (i A. D.), PFlor. 20.22 (ii A. D.).

bota^no-loge/w,
gather herbs, Hp.Ep.16.
root up weeds, PGiss.56.11 (vi A. D.).

bota^no-logi/a, h(,
weeding, POxy.1631.26 (iii A. D.).

bota^no-lo/gos, o(,
gatherer of herbs, Zonar.

bota^nw/dhs, es,
herbaceous, Ath.2.62d: Comp., Dsc.4.173.
rich in herbs, GP.2.46.2.

bo/teios, a, on, (boto/n)
of a sheep, kw/dia PFay.107.4.
bote/w, = bo/skw, Ep. pres. part. botei/wn Call.Fr.7.5P., cf. Hsch.: —Pass., Nic. Th.394.

bot-h/r, h=ros, o(, (bo/skw)
herdsman, Od.15.504; oi)wnw=n b.
a soothsayer, A.Th. 24; ku/wn b.
herdsman's dog, S.Aj.297: in later Prose, D.H.2.2, Plu.Rom.7, al.:—fem. bo/teira, epith. of Demeter, Eust. 1723.14.

bot-hriko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a herdsman, e(orth/ Plu.Rom.12; ku/pella AP6.170 (Thyill.).
bo/ths, ou, o(, = bou/ths, EM218.42.

bo/tis, ios, h( (?), a
fish or
plant (dub.), Sophr.64:—boti/s: bo/ltion, Hsch.

boto/n, to/, (bo/skw)
beast, A.Ag.1415, S.Tr.690: mostly in pl.,
grazing beasts, Il.18.521, S.Aj.145 (lyr.), etc.; opp. qhri/a, Pl.Mx. 237d; but also of birds, Ar.Nu.1427; of the ostrich, Opp.H.4.630.
bo/tra^xos, v. ba/traxos.

botreu/s, e/ws, o(,
vintager, PLond.2.189.58 (ii A. D.).

botr-u/dion [u_], to/, Dim. of bo/trus,
small cluster, Alex. 172.13, Dsc. 1.21, al., Longus 2.13.
an ear-ring of this pattern, Com. Adesp. 962, Hsch.

botr-u_do/n, Adv.
like a bunch of grapes: in clusters, b. pe/tontai, of bees, Il.2.89, cf. Gp.15.2.29, Him.Or.28.1; ti/ktei [o( polu/pous] w)|a\ b. Arist.Fr.334, cf. Opp.H.1.550; ta\ a)/nqh pe/fuken b. Thphr.HP3.16.4: metaph. of a crowd, Luc.Pisc.42.

botru^-hro/s, a/, o/n,
of the grape kind, Thphr.HP1.11.5.

botru^-hfo/ros, on,
grape-bearing, a)/mpelos Ph.1.681.

botru^/-i+os, a, on,
of grapes, futo/n AP6.168 (Paul. Sil.).

botru^-i/+ths [i_] (sc. li/qos), ou, o(,
calamine, Dsc. 5.74:—also fem. botru^-i=tis, idos, h(, Plin.HN34.101, Gal.12.220.
botrumo/s: trughto/s, Hsch.

botru^o/-dwros, on,
grape-producing, Ar.Pax 520 (paratragoed.).

botru^o-eidh/s, e/s,
like a bunch of grapes, Dsc.4.189. Adv. -dw=s Orib.45.18.23.

botru^o/-eis, essa, en,
full of grapes, clustering, oi)na/s Ion Eleg.1.4; kisso/s AP9.363.12 (Mel.); ploxmoi/ A.R.2.677; de/ndrea IG14.1389 ii 10.

botru^o/-kosmos, on,
decked with grapes, Orph.H.52.11.

bo/tru^on, to/,
cluster of berries, Thphr.HP3.7.3; bo/trus, dub. in Luc.Bacch.2. = qla/spi, Ps.-Dsc.2.156. a kind of
medicine, Plin.HN28.44.

botru^o/omai, of vines,
form clusters, Thphr.CP1.18.4.

botru^o/-pais, paidos, o(, h(,
grape-born, child of the grape, xa/ris AP 11.33 (Phil.). Act.,
bearing grapes, a)/mpelos Theoc.Ep.4.8.

botru^o-sta^gh/s, e/s,
dripping with grapes, Archestr.Fr.60.3.

botru^o-ste/fa^nos, on,
grape-crowned, of a vine-bearing district, Archyt. Amph.1; kwmw|di/a dub. in IG3.3688.

botru^o-fore/w,
bear grapes, Ph.2.54.

botru^o-xai/ths, ou, o(,
with clustering hair, AP9.524.

bo/trus, uos, o( (heterocl. pl. bo/trua, ta/, Euph.149),
bunch of grapes, me/lanes d' a)na\ bo/trues h)=san Il.18.562, etc.: pl.,
grapes, Hp.Vict.2.55: prov., bo/trus pro\s bo/trun pepai/netai Jul.Or.7.225b. = sq. 1, bo/trus ko/mhs AP 5.286（Agath.), cf. Nonn.D.1.528, etc.
clustered ear-ring, Ar.Fr.320.10. = a)mbrosi/a and a)rtemisi/a, Dsc.3.114.
oak of Jerusalem, Chenopodium Botrys, ib.115.
the Pleiades, Sch.Il.18.486.

bo/tru^xos, o(, = bo/struxos, Pherecr.189, cj.in E.Or.1267 (lyr.).
peduncle of bunch of grapes, Gal.6.577.
botru^xw/dhs, es, restored metri gr. for bostruxw/dhs, E.Ph.1485 (lyr.).
botru^w/dhs, es, = botruoeidh/s, E.Ba.12, Thphr.HP3.13.6, al.

bou-, prefix used in compos. (cf. bouga/i+os, etc.),
huge, monstrous. (From bou=s, cf. i(/ppo-.)
bou=a, h(, = a)ge/lh pai/dwn, at Sparta, Hsch.

bouageto/n: u(po\ bow=n ei(lkusme/non zu/lon (Lacon.), Hsch. boua_go/r, o(, (a)/gw) Lacon.,
leader of a bou=a at Sparta, Id., IG5(1).257, al.:—also boa_go/r, ib.292:—boua_go/s, boa_go/s, ib. 283,523. boua/krai,
palms (Lacon.), Hsch. boua/rxh, gloss on bou/prwros, Id.

bouba/leios [a^], a, on,
of an antelope, ke/ras Hdn. Gr.2.438.

bouba/lia [ba^], wn, ta/, a kind of
bracelets, Nicostr. 33, Diph.59, Lib. Decl.32.30, cf. EM206.16; *)erwti/wn kai\ boubali/wn zeu=gos IG11(2).161 B118 (Delos, iii B. C.). sg., bouba/lion, to/, = si/kus a)/grios, Ps.-Dsc.4.150, Hp. ap. Hsch. (but in masc. form bouba/lios, o(, Id. ap. Gal.19.89).

bou/ba^lis, ios, h(, an African
antelope, Bubalis mauretanica, Hdt.4.192, A.Fr.330: gen. boubali/dos Arist.HA515b34: gen. pl. -i/dwn D.C. 48.23: also an Indian species, Ael.NA13.25. (On the accent v. Hdn. Gr. 1.90: -i/s, Hsch.）

bou/ba^los, o(, = foreg., Arist.PA663a11, Plb.12.3.5, D.S.2.51, Str. 17.3.4, Ph.2.353, J.AJ8.2.4, Opp.C.2.300. = a)stra/galos, Hsch.
buffalo, Agath.1.4.
bouba/ras, = me/gas kai\ a)nai/sqhtos, Hdn.Gr.1.57; cf. bouba/rai: mega/lai, Hsch.: also expld. as = megalonau/ths (cf. ba=ris), Id., cf. EM 206.18:—bou/baris, Philist.56 (-ba/rtis cod. Hsch.).

bou/bast-is, ios, h(, Egyptian divinity, Hdt.2.137, etc.:—hence *boubastei/a, h(, Pythag. name for
five, Theol.Ar.31.

boubast-ei=on, to/,
temple of Bubastis, BGU820.18:

bouba/st-ia, ta/,
festival of B., OGI56.37 (Canopus), IG9(1).86 (Phocis).

bou/bastis, o(,
groin, Aët.4.21:—hence boubastika/, ta/,
remedies for sores in the groin, ibid.
boubaukalo/saulos, com. compd., prob. in Anaxandr.41.5.
bou/bela: kre/a bo/eia, Hsch.

bou-bh=tis, ios, h(,
stream for watering cattle, Tab. Herad.2.13.

bou-bo/sion, to/, (bo/skw)
cattle-pasture, Call.Ap.49, Arat.1120: in pl.,
grazing, Str.12.4.7.
bou-bi/lic: sitapoxi/a, Hsch.
bou/-bosis, ews, h(, （bo/skw） = bou/brwstis, EM206.24.

bou-bo/ths, ou, o(,
giving pasture to cattle, prw=nes Pi.N.4.52. as Subst.,
herdsman, Id.I.6(5).32.

bou/-botos, on,
grazed by cattle, Od.13.246, AP6.114 (Simm. or Phil.).

bou/-brwstis, ews, h(,
ravenous appetite, Opp.H.2.208, Call. Cer.103, AP11.379 (Agath.):
famine, Epigr. Gr.793.3: in Hom. only metaph.,
grinding poverty or
misery, Il.24.532 (but expld. by Sch. as = oi)=stros).

boubw/n, w=nos, o(,
groin, Il.4.492, etc.; koino\n me/ros . . mhrou= kai\ h)/trou b. Arist.HA493b9: in pl., me/xri boubw/nwn Pherecr.23, cf. Luc. Tim. 56. in pl.,
glands, Hp.Epid.2.2.24.
swollen gland, Id.Aph.4.55, Arist.Pr.883b21, Men.Georg.51, J.Ap.2.2. = Lat.
bubo, owl, Id.AJ18.6.7, 19.8.2.

boubwn-iako/s, h/, o/n,
for the groin, of a bandage, Sor.Fasc.12.514 C. (also boubwn-iko/s).

boubwn-iasko/pos, o(,
one who treats boubw=nes
by magic, Hsch., EM206.25.

boubwn-ia/w,
suffer from swollen groins, Ar. V.277, Call. Com.26, J.Ap.2.2: c. acc., tw\ nefrw/ Ar.Ra.1280:—hence Subst. boubwn-i/a_sis, ews, h(, Gal.19.566.
boubw/n-ion, to/, = a)sth\r *)attiko/s, Dsc.4.119.

boubwn-i/skos, o(,
bandage for the groin, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.55 tit.

boubwno-eidh/s, e/s,
like a boubw/n, Poll.4.198.

boubwno-kh/lh, h(,
inguinal hernia, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.57.5, Gal.7.730:—hence Adj. boubwno-khliko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from it, Aët.4.26, Paul.Aeg.6.66.

boubwno/-omai, Pass.,
swell to a boubw/n, Hp.Gland.8.

boubwno-fu/lac[u^], akos, o(,
truss for hernia, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.57 tit.
boubwnw/dhs, es, = boubwnoeidh/s, Ruf. ap. Orib.44.17.3.

bou-ga/i+os [a_], o(, （gai/w)
bully, braggart, only voc. as term of reproach, Il.13.824, Od.18.79; applied to those who lived on milk in Dulichion and Same, Nic.Fr.131.
bou-genh/s, e/s, = bohgenh/s, Emp.61.2, Call.Fr.230; of bees, Philet.22, AP9.548 (Bianor); *dio/nusos Plu.2.364f: metaph. of souls, Porph.Antr.18.

bou/-glwsson, to/ (masc. form
buglossos Plin.HN25.81),
bugloss, Anchusa italica, Dsc.4.127, Opp.H.1.99. b. me/ga, = kri/ssion, Ps.-Dsc.4.118. a surgical instrument, perh.
tongue-depressor, Hermes38.280.

bou/-glwssos, Att. -ttos, o( (Matro Conv.77) and h( (Archestr. Fr.32.2), a fish,
sole, Epich.65, Xenarch.8.4, Speus. ap. Ath.7.329f, Dorioib.330a; classed with sela/xh, Arist.Fr.280.

bou-gonh/s, e/s,
born of an ox, of bees, Gp.15.2.14; bougonh/ (nom.) ibid.tit. is perh. f.l. for bougonh=:—also bou-goni/a, title of poem by Eumelus, Varro RR 2.5.5.
bou-da/kh: h( bou/prhstis, Hsch.

bou-deyh/i+on, to/,
tannery, Id.
bou/dion, to/, v. boi/+dion.

bou-do/kos, on,
receiving oxen, e)xi=nos (i.e. le/bhs) Call.Fr.250b.

bou-do/ros, on, (de/rw)
flaying oxen, galling, Hes.Op.504 (bou/dora codd., boudo/ra Sch.T.ll.17.550, cf. Eust.1117.53).
for flaying, ma/xaira Babr.97.7: as Subst., Hsch., prob. in Tim.Pers.28. prov., b. no/mw| of those who deserve flaying, Diogenian.3.66.

bou-du/ths [u^], ou, o(, a bird, perh.
wagtail, Dionys.Av.3.2.

bou-zu/ghs [u^], o(, epith. of an Attic hero
who first yoked oxen, Arist. Fr.386, Hsch.; Heracles, acc. to Suid.
keeper of bullocks at Eleusis, IG3.71; i(ereu\s B. ib.3.294, cf. Eup.96,97.

bou-zu/gios [u^] (sc. a)/rotos), o(,
ritual ploughing, at Athens, Plu.2.144b:—also *bouzu/gia, ta/, Ph.2.630.

bou-qerh/s, e/s,
affording summer-pasture, leimw/n S.Tr.188.
bou-qh/leia, h(, = da/malis, Gp.17.2 tit. (pl.).

bou-qoi/nhs, ou, o(,
beef-eater, epith. of Hercules, APl.4.123, Eust.962.7.

bou-qo/ros, on,
vaccas iniens, tau=ros A.Supp.301.
bou/-qoros, = bouqerh/s, Hsch. s. h. v.
bou/-qouton, to/, a plant, = a)me/maron (Lacon.), Hsch.

bou-qu^si/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
sacrifice of oxen, IG14.830 (Puteoli), AP7.119, Porph. Abst.2.55; *(/hras in her honour, Pi.N.10.23: in pl., Id.O.5.6, D.C. 46.40.
bou-qu/sion [u^], to/, = foreg., Sch.A.R.1.516.

bou-qu^te/w,
slay or
sacrifice oxen, S.OC888, E.El.785, Jul.Mis.362c, etc.: also in later Prose, Plb.32.15.2, D.C.42.28, al.: generally,
sacrifice, slaughter, b. u(=n kai\ tra/gon kai\ krio/n Ar.Pl.819; ta\s qusi/as ta\s kaqhkou/sas IG2.594.5; tw=| *)apo/llwni ib.12(7).389.16, cf. POxy.1021.16 (i A. D.).
bou-qu/ths [u^], ou, o(, name given to Pythagoras, Procl.in Euc.p.426F.

bou/-qu^tos, on,
of or
belonging to sacrifices, esp.
of oxen, timai/ A.Supp.706 (lyr.); h(donh/ E.Ion664;
accompanied by sacrifices, e(ortai/ B.3.15.
on which oxen are offered, sacrificial, e(sti/a S.OC 1495 (lyr.); e)sxa/ra Ar.Av.1232; h)=mar, a(me/ra, A.Ch.261, E.Hel. 1474 (lyr.).
bou-qw/nhs: bou/xeilos, Hsch.

boukai=os, o(, (bou=kos)
cowherd, Nic.Th.5.
one who ploughs with oxen, Theoc.10.1,57 (prob. a pr. n.), Nic.Fr.90.
bouka^na/w, bouka^nismo/s, v. sub buk-.
boukanh=, = a)nemw/nh (Cypr.), Hsch.

bou-ka/ph [a^], h(,
ox-stall, Hsch.

bou-ka/phlos [a^], ou, o(,
cattledealer, Poll.7.185.

boukardi/a, h(, a
gem, Plin.HN37.150.
bouka/tios, o(, a month in west central Greece, SIG241.105 (Delph.), IG7.1777 (Thespiae), etc.: *bouka/tia, ta/, festival held therein, SIG2438.42, al. (Delph.).

bou/kella, h(, = Lat.
bucella, small loaf, PFlor.74.13 (ii A. D.).

bou-ke/nths, ou, o(,
goader of oxen, ox-driver, Diogenian.7.86.

bou/-kentron, to/,
ox-goad, LXX Ec.12.11.
bou-ke/raos, on, = bou/kerws, Nonn. D.14.319.
bou/-keras, aos (also bou/keron, to/, Hippiatr.117, dat. -w| Thphr.HP8.8.5), to/, = th=lis, Il. cc., Nic.Al.424.

bou-ke/rws, wn, gen. w,
horned like an ox or
cow, a)/galma Hdt.2.41; b. parqe/nos, of Io, A. Pr.588 (lyr.); *)/iakxos S.Fr.959. = foreg., Dsc.2.102.
bou-kefa/las, a, o(, the horse of Alexander the Great, Str.15.1.29, Plu.Alex. 61, Arr.An.5.14.4.

boukefa/lion [a^], to/,
ox-head, used as an ornament, Lys.Fr.34, SIG695.71 (Magn. Mae.); b. xrusa= SIG2588.199 (Delos, ii B. C.).

bouke/fa^los, on,
bull-headed, epith. of Thessalian horses, to\n bouke/falon kai\ koppati/an Ar.Fr.42, cf. 41. = tri/bolos, Ps.-Dsc. 4.15. bouke/falon, to/, = foreg., IG2.736B11, Chron.Lind.C.114.

bouki^ni/zw,
blow the trumpet, stro/mbois S.E.M.6.24:—also bu_ka^ni/zw or bou-i^ni/zw, Eust.1321.33, etc.: bouki^na/twr, o(, = Lat.
buccinātor, Lyd.Mag.1.46, etc.; cf. buka/nh.
bouklo/pos, = booklo/pos, qeo/s Porph.Antr.18.

boukol-ei=on, to/,
residence of the a)/rxwn basileu/s at Athens, Arist. Ath.3.5.

boukol-e/w,
tend cattle, e(/likas bou=s boukole/eskes (Ep. impf.) Il.21.448, etc.: abs., Parth.4.1, Luc.DDeor.3:—Med., boukolei=sqai ai)=gas Eup.18:—Pass., of cattle,
graze, e(/los ka/ta boukole/onto, of horses, Il.20.221, cf.Ar.Pax153: metaph. of meteors,
range through the sky, Call.Del.176. c. acc. rei,
graze on, *trhxini/da Euph. 114. of persons, boukolei=s *saba/zion
you tend, serve him (with allusion to his
tauriform worship), Ar.V.10:—Med., mh\ pro/kamne to/nde boukolou/menos po/non
ruminating, pondering, A.Eu.78. metaph.,
cheat, beguile, pa/qos Id.Ag.669; to\ dh/mion Ar.Ec.81, cf. Men.Sam.251; ai( ti/tqai tou\s pai=das dia\ muqologi/as boukolou=sin Max.Tyr.10.3; b. lu/phn Babr.19.7; a)llotri/ois ko/smois to\ th=s fu/sews a)prepe/s b. Luc.Am.38:—Med., e)lpi/si boukolou=mai I
feed myself on hopes,
cheat myself with them, Alciphr.3.5, cf. Luc.Trag.29; e)piqumi/ais Id.Am.2:—Pass., Stoic.3.147; boukolei=sqai u(po\ e)nupni/wn Porph.Marc.6.

bouko/l-hma, atos, to/,
beguilement, th=s lu/phs Babr.136.9.

bouko/l-hsis, ews, h(,
tending of cattle, Plu.2.802e.

boukol-hth/s, ou=, o(,
deceiver, Hsch.

boukol-i/a, h(,
herd of cattle, h.Merc.498, Hes.Th.445, Hdt.1.114.
tending of cattle, A.R.1.627 (pl.). perh. = boukolei=on, Crates Gramm. ap. Ath.6.235c. = kakologi/a, Hsch.

boukol-ia/zomai, boukol-ia/sdomai, fut. -aceu=mai:—
sing or
write pastorals, Theoc.5.44, al., Mosch.3.120.

boukol-iasmo/s, o(,
singing of pastorals, Ath.14.619a (v.l. -ismo/s).

boukol-iasth/s, ou=, o(,
pastoral poet, Theoc.5.68.
boukol-i/zw, = boukolia/zomai, Eust.1416.39.

boukol-iko/s, h/, o/n,
rustic, pastoral, a)oida/ Theoc.1.64,70, etc.; ta\ b.
pastoral poetry, Hermog.Id.2.3. b. me/tron metre
used by pastoral poets, Plu. Metr.2; tomh/ '
bucolic' caesura, ib.3. boukoliko/s, o(, official in cult of Dionysus, IG22.1368.123.
bucolicon, = pa/nakes *)asklhpi/eion, Plin.HN25.31.
boukol-i/nh, = ki/gklos, Hsch.

bouko/l-ion, to/,
herd of cattle, Hdt.1.126, X.HG4.6.6, Theoc.8.39, 25.13, etc. ta\ b.
district of lower Egypt,
inhabited by shepherds, Hld.1.5, BGU625.6 (ii/iii A. D.), etc.
means of beguiling, peni/hs AP9.150 (Antip.), = ib.255 (Phil.); but with play on 1.

boukol-i/s (sc. gh=), i/dos, h(,
cattle-pasture, D.H.1.37; b. po/a ib.39.

boukol-i/skos, o(, a kind of
bandage, Gal.18(1).777.

bou/kol-os, o(,
tending kine, bouko/loi a)/ndres, a)groiw=tai, Il.13.571, Od.11.292, al.; b. dou=los Pl.Ion540c; poimh\n ai)po/los . . kai\ b. Cratin.281: also abs., Hdt.1.110, PGoodsp.Cair.30 ixI (ii A. D.), etc.; be/lei bouko/lou ptero/entos, i.e. the gadfly, A. Supp.557 (lyr.); b. i(/ppwn Ael.NA12.44.
worshipper of Dionysos in bull-form, in pl., title of play by Cratinus, cf. E.Fr.203, IG12(9).262 (Eretria, i B. C.), IGRom.4.386 (Pergam.), Luc.Salt.79, Hsch. s.v. purpere/gxei. b. tou= *)osora=pi
devotee of Sarapis, UPZ57.7. (bou=s,
q[uglide]el-, cf. Lat.
colo: in these words bwkol- is found as v.l. for boukol- in some codd. of Theoc.）

boukonisth/rion, to/,
bullring, IGRom.3.484 (Oenoanda, ii A. D.).
bouko/pia, ta/, v. boko/pia. bouko/pos, gloss on bouplh/c, Hsch.

bou-ko/ruza, hs, h(,
severe cold in the head, Men.1003.

bou-ko/ruzos, on,
stupid and
drivelling, Hsch.
bou=kos, Dor. bw=kos (v.l.), o(, = boukai=os, Theoc.10.38. (Perh. a pr. n.)

bou-kra/nion [a_], to/,
ox-head, EM207.55. = a)/mpelos me/laina, Ps.-Dsc.4.183. = a)nti/rrinon, ib.130, Gal.19.82.
machine for reducing dislocations, Orib.49.4.74.

bou/-kra_nos, on,
bull-headed, Emp.61.3, Call.Fr.203, Plu.2.358d. bou/kra_non, to/,
ox-head, Gem.3.3.

bou/-kri_os, o(,
ox-ram, fabulous monster, Ps.-Callisth.3.17.
bou/kthsis: fushtikh/, Hsch.; cf. bu/kths.

boulai=os, a, on, (boulh/)
of the council, epith. of certain gods as having statues in the Council Chamber (*esti/a boulai/a: h( e)n th=| boulh=| i/drume/nh, Harp.), th\n *(esti/an e)pw/mose th\n b. Aeschin.2.45; of Zeus and Athena, Antipho6.45, cf. IG3.272, SIG1011.6 (Chalcedon), Corn.ND9, Plu.2.789d; of Artemis, IG22.916,al.; Themis, Plu.2.802b; qeoi\ b., name of thirty stars, D.S.2.30; of a man, qew=n boulai=os a)na/ktwn, = imperatorum divorum
consiliarius, IG4.1475 (Epidaurus). Subst. boulai/a, h(, = boulei/a, Milet.7.71; but boulai=a: ta\ bebouleume/na, and bou/leon (sic): bou/leuma, Hsch.
bou/laka: bo/lou o)/noma, i.e. throw at dice, Hsch.

boula/paqon, to/, Lat.
bulapathum, Rumex scutatus, Plin HN20.235.
boulapterou=n, etym. of blabero/n （boulo/menon a(/ptein r(ou=n), Pl.Cra. 417e.

boularx-e/w,
to be a bou/larxos, IG9(1).65 (Daulis), 226 (Drymaca), Arist.Pol.1295b12.

boularx-i/a, h(,
office of bou/larxos, IG9(1).228 (Drymaea), 12(2).484.7 (Mytilene).

bou/larx-os, o(,
president of the senate, as at Thyateira, IGRom.4.1230; at Amorgos, IG12(7).287, cf.Milet.3.230, 7.70.
adviser of a plan, A.Supp.11,970.
boula_fo/ros, Dor. for boulhf-.
boulax-eu/s, e/ws, o(, (perh. bou=s, lagxa/nw) dub. sens. in Milet.1(7). p.323 (Didyma).

boulax-e/w,
to be boulaxeu/s, ib.3(2) Nos.168,171.
boul-ei=on, to/, = bouleuth/rion, SIG1011 (Chalcedon), 614.34 (Delph., ii B. C.), Ps.-Hdt.Vit.Hom.12.

boul-ekklhsi/a, h(,
joint session of boulh/
and e)kklhsi/a, Inscr.Prien.246.9 (iii A. D.) (pl.).

bou/l-euma, atos, to/,
resolution, purpose, A.Pr.171 (lyr.), 619, Ar.Av.993, etc.: freq. in pl., Pi.N.5.28, Hdt.3.80, S.OT45, A.Th.594, Pl.R.334a, D.18.296: prov., toi=s oi)kei/ois b. a(li/skesqai 'to be hoist with one's own petard', Lib.Or.59.20.
sitting of a boulh/, foita=n ei)s ta\ b. Philostr.Her.19.6.
boul-euma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Ar.Eq.100.
boul-eu/s, e/ws, o(, Counsellor, title of Zeus, SIG1024.17 (Myconos).

bou/l-eusis, ews, h(,
deliberation, Arist.EN1112b22. as Att. law-term,
conspiracy against life, Arist.Ath.57.3; against property, Hyp.Ath. 18.
wrongful retention on the list of state debtors of the name of one who has paid his debt, D.25.28 and 73, Arist.Ath.59.3.

boul-eute/on,
one must take counsel, o(/pws . . A.Ag.847; ti/ xrh\ dra=n S.El.16; peri/ tinos Isoc.6.90: pl., bouleute/a Th.7.60.
boul-euth/r, h=ros, o(, = bouleuth/s, Hsch. s.v. ma/stroi.

boul-euth/rion, to/,
council-chamber, seat of a boulh/, Hdt.1.170, A.Eu.570,684, E.Andr.1097, And.1.36, D.18.169, Pl.Grg.452e, Michel1203 (Iasos), etc.; = Lat.
curia, Plu.Cic.31, Hdn.5.5.7.
Council, Senate, D.H.2.12; of local boulai/, PLond. 2.408.14 (iv A. D.), etc.; of individuals, do/lia bouleuth/ria treacherous
counsellor, E.Andr.446; r(usa\ b. Theopomp. Com. 75 (paratrag.).

boul-euth/rios, on,
giving advice, kakw=n t' *)adra/stw| tw=nde bouleuth/rion A.Th.575.

boul-euth/s, ou=, o(,
councillor, senator, Il.6.114, Hdt.9.5, Pl.Ap.25a, etc.; at Athens,
one of the 500, Antipho6.45, And.1.43, Ar.Th.808; at Rome,
senator, D.H.2.12, Plu.Rom.13,
etc.
plotter, contriver, qana/tou, plhgh=s, Antipho 4.3.4.

boul-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the council, b. o(/rkos oath
taken by the councillors, X.Mem.1.1.18; no/moi ap.D.24.20; b. timai/ CIG1716 (Delph.); a)rxh\ b. right
to sit in the boulh/, Arist.Pol.1275b19; of the Roman Senate, ti/mhma, e)sqh/s, D.C.54.17, 40.46; -ka/, ta/,
funds at the disposal of a council, POxy.1416.3 (iii A. D.).
able to advise or
deliberate, o( b., opp. o( polemiko/s, Pl.R.434b, cf. 441a, Arist.EN1140a31, 1152a19; to\ b.
the deliberative faculty, Id.Pol.1260a12. Subst., -ko/n, to/, in the Athen. theatre,
seats reserved for the Council, Ar.Av.794, Hsch. the
deliberative and judicial element in the state, Arist.Pol.1329a31; at Rome,
senatorial order, Plu.Rom.13.
bou/l-eutis, idos, h(, fem. of bouleuth/s, A.Fr.172 (= Pl.Com.88).

boul-euto/s, h/, o/n,
devised, plotted, A.Ch.494.
matter for deliberation, Arist.EN1113a2, etc. bouleuto/s, = bouleuth/s, Hsch.

boul-eu/w, Il.2.379, etc., aor. e)bou/leusa Od.5.23, etc., Ep. bou/l- Il.14.464: pf. bebou/leuka S.OT701:—Med. and Pass., v. infr.: (boulh/):—
take counsel, deliberate, in past tenses,
determine or
resolve after deliberation: abs., w(\s bouleu/sante Il. 1.531; bouleue/men h)de\ ma/xesqai
in council or in battle, Od.14.491; b. o(/pws o)/x' a)/rista ge/noito 9.420, cf. 11.229; dusmene/essi fo/nou pe/ri b. 16.234; e)/s ge mi/an bouleu/somen (sc. boulh/n) we
shall agree to one plan, Il.2.379; qumw=| b. Od.12.58; b. peri/ tinos Hdt.1.120, Th.3.28, 5.116: in Prose, chiefly Med. in this sense, v. infr. B. c. acc. rei,
deliberate on, plan, devise, b. boula/s Il.24.652, al.; ou) . . tou=ton me\n e)bou/leusas no/on au)th/; Od.5.23; o(do/n 1.444; fu/cin Il.10.311,398; ke/rdea Od.23.217; yeu/dea 14.296: c. dat. pers., tw=| ga/r r(a qeoi\ bou/leusan o)/leqron Il. 14.464, cf. Hdt.9.110; qa/nato/n tini Pl.Lg.872a; b. ph=ma/ tini Od.5.179, etc.; ke/leuqon A.Pers.758; poina/s Id.Ag.1223; new/tera b. peri/ tinos Hdt.1.210:—Pass. (with fut. Med., A.Th.198), aor. e)bouleu/qhn Hdt. 7.157, Th.1.120, Pl.R.442b: pf. bebou/leumai (usu. in med. sense, v. infr. B):—
to be determined or
planned, yh=fos kat' au)tw=n bouleu/setai A. l.c.; bebou/leutai ta/de Id.Pr.998, cf. Hdt.7.10.d/; ta\ bebouleume/na, = bouleu/mata, Id.4.128; ta\ bouleuo/mena X.Cyr.6.2.2; pw=s sfw=|n bebou/leutai Pl.Euthd.274a. c. inf.,
take counsel, resolve to do, to\n me\n e)gw\ bou/leusa . . ou)ta/menai Od.9.299, cf. Hdt.1.73, 6.52,61, etc.:— Pass., toi=si e)bebou/leuto to\ paidi/on prosoudi/sai Id.5.92.g/.
give counsel, ta\ lw=|sta b. A.Pr.206; b. dunato/s Pl.Lg.694b: c. dat. pers.,
advise, i(/na sfi/si bouleu/hsqa Il.9.99, cf. A.Eu.697.
sit in council, of the Spartan ge/rontes, Hdt.6.57;
to be a member of a boulh/, Arist.Pol.1282a30; esp.
of the Council of 500 at Athens, Antipho 6.45, And.1.75, X.Mem.1.1.18, Arist.Ath.62.3; h( boulh\ h( bouleu/ousa Lys.13.19; boulh\n b.
to be a member of the b., ib.20; bouleu/ein laxw/n Pl.Grg.473e. Med., fut. -eu/somai A.Ag.846, Ch.718, Th.1.43, Pl.Smp. 174d: aor. e)bouleusa/mhn S.OT537, etc.; Ep. boul- Il.2.114; e)bouleu/qhn D.H.15.7: pf. bebou/leumai Hdt.3.134, S.El.385, Th.1.69, E.Supp.248, Pl.Chrm.176c (also in pass. sense, v. supr.):—more freq. in Att. Prose than Act., abs.,
take counsel with oneself, deliberate, Hdt.7.10.d/, Arist.EN1112b11,20; paraxrh=ma ou)de\ -sa/menos D.37.13; a(/ma tini/ Hdt.8.101; peri\ tou= me/llontos tw=n oi)kei/wn Th.3.44, cf. Pl.Phdr.231a; peri/ ti Id.R.604c; u(pe/r tinos ib.428d; pro\s th\n gegenhme/nhn cumfora/n Th.7.47: c. acc. cogn., b. bou/leuma And.3.29; boulh/n Pl.Plt.298b, etc.; i)/son ti h)\ di/kaion Th.2.44:—also like Act.,
take counsel, pro/s tinas LXX 4 Ki.6.8.
act as member of council, and so
originate measures, b. kai\ kri/nein Arist.Pol.1281b31; to\ bouleuo/menon ib.1291a28. c. acc. rei,
determine with oneself, resolve on, kakh\n a)pa/thn bouleu/sato Il.2.114 (Med. here only in Hom.); a)lloi=o/n ti peri/ tinos Hdt.5.40, cf. Pl.Ap.32c. c. inf.,
resolve to do, Hdt.3.134, Pl.Chrm.176c. rarely folld. by Relat., b. o(/ ti poih/seis ibid.; b. o(/pws . . with subj., X.Cyr.1.4.13; b. pw=s tis, c. fut., Id.An.3.4.40; pw=s kai\ ti/ prakte/on ei)/h Plb.1.33.3; i(/na Ev.Jo.12.10.
bouleyi/h, dub. sens. of the Amazons, Xanth. ap. Hsch.

boulh/, h(, Dor. bwla/ Decr.Byz. ap. D.18.90, Aeol. bo/lla Schwyzer 623.1 (ii B. C.), Plu.2.288b: acc. pl. boula^/s Hes.Th.534: (bou/lomai):—
will, determination, esp. of the gods, Il.1.5, etc.
counsel, design, boula\s bouleu/ousi Il.24.652, etc.: generally,
counsel, advice, opp. ma/xesqai, Il.1.258, cf. 2.202, etc.; kakh\ b. Hes.Op.266; pra=tos . . kai\ boula=| kai\ xersi\n e)s *)/area IG9(1).658 (Ithaca); nukti\ boulh\n dido/nai Hdt.7.12 (but e)n nukti\ b. didou\s e)mautw=| Men.Epit.35); e)n b. e)/xein ta\ geno/mena Hdt.3.78; b. poiei=sqai, = bouleu/esqai, Id.6.101, etc.; b. dido/nai X. Cyr.7.2.26; b. protiqe/nai peri/ tinos D.18.192; b. a)/gein Polyaen.7.39; e)n boulh=| gene/sqai po/teron . . D.H.2.44; tou/tois ou)k e)/sti koinh\ b. they have no common
ground of argument, Pl.Cri.49d; boulh=s o)rqo/ths h( eu)bouli/a Arist.EN1142b16: in pl.,
counsels, A.Pr.221, Th. 842 (lyr.); e)n boulai=s a)/ristos, e)n boulai=si kra/tistos, Epigr.Gr.854, IG3.716.
deliberation, Arist.EN1112a19, D.9.46.
decree, b. ei)shgei=sqai And.1.61; b. a)/kuron qei=nai Id.2.28.
Council of elders, Senate, boul h\n i(=ze gero/ntwn Il.2.53, cf. Od.3.127, A.Ag.884; esp. at Athens, Council or
Senate of 500 created by Cleisthenes, Hdt.9.5, Ar.V.590, Antipho 6.40, etc.; commonly called h( b. (or h( b. oi( pentako/sioi Aeschin.3.20, to distinguish it from h( b. h( e)n *)arei/w| pa/gw| ibid.; also b. a)po\ kua/mou Th.8.66); in other states, as at Argos, Hdt.7.149; at Thebes, X.HG5.2.29; of the Roman Senate, D.H.6.69, etc.; of local
senates, POxy.58.14 (iii A. D.), etc.; boulh=s ei)=nai to be
of the Council, a member of it, Th.3.70 (whence Sch. and Suid. made a Subst. boulh=s, o(）; a)nh\r boulh=s th=s *(rwmai/wn Paus.5.20.8; a)/ndra e)k th=s boulh=s Id.7.11.1.

boul-hgore/w,
speak in the Senate, App.BC3.51.

boul-hgori/a, h(,
speech in the Senate, Poll.4.26.

boul-hgo/ros, o(,
one who speaks in the Senate, ib.25.

boul-h/eis, essa, en,
of good counsel, sage, Sol.33.1.

bou/l-hma, atos, to/,
purpose, Gorg.Hel.6 (pl.), Ar.Av.993, Isoc.3.15, D.18.49 (pl.);
intent, tou= nomoqe/tou Pl.Lg.769d, 802c (pl.), al.; to\ b. th=s kri/sews
intention to judge, Id.Phlb.41e: pl., boulh/masi *moi/rhs IG 12(7).303.
meaning, ou)dei\s safw=s pare/dwke to\ b. Ael.Tact.18.1; to\ b. tou= poihtou= Hipparch.1.4.9, al.
intention of a testator, BGU 361ii 23 (ii A. D.): hence,
will, testament, POxy.907.1 (iii A. D.), PLips. 29.7 (iii A. D.).
express will, consent, th=s sugklh/tou Plb.6.15.4.

boul-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg. 1.3,
will, testament, PMasp.151.304 (vi A. D.).

boul-hte/os, a, on,
to be wished for, to\ b. Arist. MM1208b38. boulhte/on,
one must wish for, Id.Rh.Al.1420b23.

boul-hto/s, h/, o/n,
that is or
should be willed, ou)/te xrh/simon ou)/te b. Phld.Rh.1.185S.: to\ b.
object of desire or
will, Pl.Lg.733d, Arist.EN 1113a17. Adv. -tw=s Procl.in Prm.p.752S.

boulhfo/ros, on,
counselling, advising, in Il. a constant epith. of princes and leaders, b. a)/ndra 2.24, al.; title of Artemis, SIG2660.3 (Milet.): also c. gen., b. *)axaiw=n, *trw/wn, Il.24.651, 5.180; in Od.9.112 ou)/t' a)gorai\ b. ou)/te qe/mistes, cf. Pi.O.12.5: in later Prose, = bouleuth/s, oi( tou= mia/smatos b. Agath.3.5. Adv. -rws
like a counsellor, Men.123.

bouli_m-i/a, h(,
ravenous hunger, Timocl.13.3, Arist.Pr.887b39.

bouli_m-i/a_sis, ews, h(,
suffering from boulimi/a, Plu.2.695d.

bouli_m-ia/w,
suffer from boulimi/a, Ar.Pl.873, X.An.4.5.7, Arist.Pr.887b38, Erasistr. ap.Gell.16.3.10, Plu.Brut.25.
bou/li_m-os, o(, = boulimi/a, Id.2.693f, Erasistr. ap. Gell.16.3.9, Sor.2.4, etc.; b. e)sq' a(/nqrwpos Alex.135.17.

bouli_m-w/dhs, es,
of the nature of bou/limos, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.30.15 (also bouli_m-iw/dhs, Gal.13.122).
bouli_m-w/ttw, boulimia/w, Suid.

bou/lios, on, （boulh/） bouleutiko/s 1.2,
sage, A.Ch.672 (in Comp. -w/teros, prob. (for dou/lios) in Id.Supp.599 (lyr.).

bou/lla, h(,
tin, PHolm.2.4, PLeid.X.6.

boulo-gra^fi/a, h(,
registration of senatorial decrees, CIG4015 (Ancyra):—hence boulo-gra^fe/w, Ostr.1549.
boulo-kopi/dhs, ou, o(, Com. name, on analogy of dhmoko/pos, AB221.3.

bou/lomai (Ep. also bo/lomai, q. v.), Dor. bw/l- (q. v.), Aeol. bo/ll- (v. bo/lomai), Thess. be/ll- IG9(2).517.20, Boeot. bei/l- ib.7.3080, bh/l- SIG1185.18 (Tanagra, iii B. C.), Locr.and Delph. dei/l- IG9(1).334.3, GDI2034.10, Coan, etc. dh/l- (q. v.), Ion. 2sg. bou/leai Od.18.364, Hdt.1.11: impf. e)boulo/mhn Il.11.79, etc.; h)boulo/mhn E.Hel.752, D.1.15, etc.; Ion. 3pl. e)boule/ato codd. in Hdt.1.4, 3.143: fut. boulh/somai A.Pr.867, S.OT1077, etc.; later fut. boulhqh/somai v.l. in Aristid.Or.48(24).8, Gal.13.636: aor. e)boulh/qhn, also h)b- (v. infr.), boulhqei/s S.OC732, IG22.1236, etc., but Ep. aor. subj. 3sg. bou/letai (from *bo/ls-e-tai) Il.1.67: pf. bebou/lhmai D.18.2; also be/boula （pro-) Il.1.113 (e)be/boule dub. in Epigr. in Berl.Sitzb.1894.907):— forms with augm. h)- are found in Att. Inscrr. from 300 B.C. onwards, as IG22.657, al., and occur frequently in Mss. as h)bou/lonto v.l.in Th. 2.2, 6.79, h)bou/lou Hyp.Lyc.11; said to be Ionic in An.Ox.2.374.— An Act. bou/lhte ( = bou/lhsqe) Mitteis Chr.361.10 (iv A. D.):—
will, wish, be willing, Hom., etc.: usu. implying choice or preference (cf. IV) opp. e)qe/lw 'consent', ei) bou/lei, e)gw\ e)qe/lw Pl.Grg.522e, cf. R. 347b, 437b; e)a\n bou/lh| su\ . . e)a\n qeo\s e)qe/lh| Id.Alc.1.135d; a)\n oi(/ te qeoi\ 'qe/lwsi kai\ u(mei=s bou/lhsqe D.2.20; ou)/t' a)kou/ein h)qe/let' ou)/te pisteu/ein e)bou/lesqe Id.19.23; but e)qe/lw is also used = 'wish', le/cai qe/lw soi, pri\n qanei=n, a(\ bou/lomai, E.Alc.281 (so e)qe/lw ei)pei=n Pl.Prt.309b, but fra/sai ti bou/lomai Ar.Pl.1090): Hom. uses bou/lomai for e)qe/lw in the case of the gods, for with them
wish is will: e)qe/lw is more general, and is sts. used where bou/lomai might have stood, e.g. Il. 7.182.—Construct.: mostly c. inf., *trw/essin e)bou/leto ku=dos o)re/cai 11.79, etc.; sts. c. inf. fut., Thgn.184; c. acc. et inf., Od.4.353, and freq. in Prose: when bou/lomai is folld. by acc. only, an inf. may generally be supplied, as kai/ ke to\ bouloi/mhn (sc. gene/sqai) Od.20.316; e)/tuxen w(=n e)bou/leto (sc. tuxei=n) Antiph.18.6; plakou=nta b. (sc. se le/gein) Id.52.11; kai\ ei) ma/la bou/letai a)/llh| [*poseida/wn] (sc. tou=to gene/sqai) Il.15.51; so ei)s to\ balanei=on bou/lomai (sc. i)e/nai) Ar.Ra. 1279; bouloi/mhn a)/n (sc. to/de gene/sqai) Pl.Euthphr.3a. in Hom. of gods, c. acc. rei et dat. pers., *trw/essin . . e)bou/leto ni/khn he
willed victory to the Trojans, Il.7.21, cf. 23.682: later c. acc., to\ boulo/menon th\n politei/an plh=qos
that supports the constitution, Arist.Pol.1309b17. Att. usages: bou/lei or bou/lesqe folld. by Verb in subj., bou/lei la/bwmai;
would you have me take hold? S.Ph.761; bou/lei fra/sw; Ar.Eq.36, cf. Pl.Phd.79a, R.596a; pou= dh\ bou/lei a)nagnw=men; Id.Phdr.228e. ei) bou/lei if
you please, S.Ant.1168, X.An.3.4.41; also ei) de\ bou/lei, e)a\n de\ bou/lh|, to express a concession, or if
you like, Pl.Smp.201a, etc.; ei) me\n b., fronh/sei, ei) de\ b., i)sxu/i Id.R. 432a. o( boulo/menos
any one who likes, Hdt.1.54, Th.1.26, etc.; e)/dwken a(/panti tw=| boulome/nw| D.21.45; o( b. the 'common in former', Ar. Pl.918 (whence, in jest, bou/lomai ib.908); o(/stis bou/lei who or which ever
you like, Pl.Grg.517b, Cra.432a. boulome/nw| moi/ e)sti, c. inf., it is
according to my
wish that . . , Th.2.3; ei) soi\ b. e)sti\n a)pokri/nesqai Pl.Grg.448d; also ta\ qew=n ou(/tw boulo/men' e)/stai E.IA33; to\ kei)nou boulo/menon his
wish, ib. 1270; but with pass. sense, to\ b. the
object of desire, Luc.Am.37, Plu.Art.28. ti/ boulo/menos;
with what
purpose? Pl.Phd.63a, D.18.172; ti/ boulhqei\s pa/rei
; S.El.1100.
mean, Pl.R.362e, 590e, etc.; ti/ h(mi=n bou/letai ou(=tos o( mu=qos
; (folld. by b. le/gein w(s . . ) Id.Tht.156c; ti/ b. shmai/nein to\ te/ras D.H.4.59; bou/letai ei)=nai
professes or
pretends to be, Pl.R.595c; b. to\ o)/noma e)pikei=sqai Id.Cra.412c; freq. in Arist., to\ a)kou/sion bou/letai le/gesqai ou)k ei) . . EN1110b30; b. a)/swtos ei)=nai o( e(/n ti kako\n e)/xwn ib.1119b34; b. o( pra=os a)ta/raxos ei)=nai ib.1125b33;
tend to be, h( tou= u(/datos fu/sis b. ei)=nai a)/xumos Id.Sens.441a3; b. h)/dh to/te ei)=nai po/lis o(/tan . . Id.Pol.1261b12, cf. 1293b40; h( fu/sis b. me\n tou=to poiei=n polla/kis, ou) me/ntoi du/natai ib. 1255b3, cf. GA778a4, al.
to be wont, X.An.6.3.18. folld. by h)/ . . ,
prefer, for bou/lomai ma=llon (which is more usu. in Prose), bou/lom' e)gw\ lao\n so/on e)/mmenai h)\ a)pole/sqai I
had rather . . , Il.1.117, cf. 23.594, Od.3.232, 11.489, 12.350; b. to\ me/n ti eu)tuxe/ein . . h)\ eu)tuxe/ein ta\ pa/nta Hdt.3.40; b. parqeneu/esqai ple/w xro/non h)\ patro\s e)sterh=sqai (for polu\n xro/non, ma=llon h)/ . . ) ib.124, cf. E.Andr. 351; less freq. without h)/ . . , polu\ bou/lomai au)th\n oi)/koi e)/xein I much
prefer . . , Il.1.112, cf. Od.15.88. (
g[uglide]el-g[uglide]ol-, cf. the dialectic forms.)

boulo/ma^xos, on,
strife-desiring, Ar.Pax1293 (hex.).

bou-lu/sios [u_] w(/ra the time
for unyoking, Arat.825.
bou/-lu^sis, ews, h(, = sq., only in Cic.Att.15.27.3.

bou-lu_to/s (sc. kairo/s), o(,
time for unyoking oxen (early afternoon, Hld.2.19, cf. Eust.1614.44, but
evening, Ael.NA13.1, cf. Philostr.Her.19.20), Ar.Av.1500, A.R.3.1342, Luc.Cat.1, etc.; u(po\ . . a)ste/ra boulutoi=o IG14.2012.15 (Sulp. Max.): —Hom. only in Adv. boulu_to/nde, Il.16.779, Od.9.58.

bou-ma^ne/s, to/, a
plant, Hsch.

bou/-masqos or bou/-mastos (so in PSI4.429 (iii A. D.)) (sc. a)/mpelos), h(,
vine bearing large grapes, Virg.G.2.102, Plin. HN14.15, Macr.Sat.3.20.7.

bou-meli/a, h(,
ash, Fraxinus excelsior, Thphr.HP3.11.4, 4.8.2 (v.l. boume/lios, o().

bou-me/trhs, ou, o(,
official in charge of sacrifices (Aetol.), Hsch.

bou-molgo/s, o(, (a)me/lgw)
cowmilking, AP6.255 (Eryc.).

bou/-mu_koi, oi(,
loud bellowings, a kind of subterranean noise, Arist.Pr.937b39; in Hsch. bou/mu_kai.
bounai/a, h(, epith. of Hera, because her temple stood on a bouno/s, Paus.2.4.7.

bounia/s, a/dos, h(,
French turnip, Brassica Napus, Agatharch.51, Nic.Fr.70.3, J.AJ3.7.6, Dsc.2.111.

bouni/zw, (bouno/s)
heap up, pile up, LXX Ru.2.14,16.

bou/nion, to/,
earth-nut, Bunium ferulaceum, Dsc.4.123. = peristerew/n, Ps.-Dsc.4.59. Dim. of bouno/s 1,
hill, Inscr. Prien. 42.41 (ii B. C.).

bou=nis, idos, h(,
hilly, *)api/an bou=nin A.Supp.117 (lyr.); voc. i)w\ ga= bou=ni, pa/ndikon se/bas (prob. for bouni=ti e)/ndikon) ib.776 (lyr.).

bouni/ths [i_], ou, o(,
dweller on the hills, of Pan, AP6.106（Zon.). cf. bwni/ths.

bouno-ba^te/w,
walk on or
mount hills, prw=nas AP6.218 (Alc.).

bouno-eidh/s, e/s,
hill-like, hilly, D.S.5.40, Str.11.8.4, Plu.Thes.36, etc.

bou-nome/w,
pasture cattle, Str.13.1.7.

bou-nomi/a, h(,
pasturage, Pi. Pae.3.27.

bou/-nomos, on,
grazed by cattle, of pastures, A.Fr.249, S. El.181 (lyr.). a)ge/lai bouno/moi (parox.) herds
of grazing oxen, Id.OT26.

bouno/s, o(,
hill, mound, Cyrenaic word, acc. to Hdt.4.199; freq. in Syracusan poets, acc. to Phryn.333, cf. Philem.49, 142, LXX Ex. 17.9, al., Plb.3.83.1, Schwyzer 289.168 (Rhodian, ii B. C.), Str.3.2.9, BGU1129.14 (i B. C.), etc.
heap of stones, etc., LXX Ge.31.46; si/tou PFlor.58.12.
clot of blood, Cyr. s.v. qro/mbos, cf. Hsch. s.v. qro/mboi.
altar, Hsch. = stiba/s (Cypr.), Id. (Barbarous word acc. to Ael.Dion.Fr.93.)

bounw/dhs, es, = bounoeidh/s,
hilly, Plb.2.15.8, etc.; qi/s Plu.Crass. 25.

bou/pais, aidos, o(,
big boy, Ar.V.1206, Eup.402, A.R.1.760, BCH 47.85 (Philippi), Agath.2.14(pl.).
child of the ox, = bougenh/s, of bees, in allusion to their fabulous origin, AP7.36 (Eryc.). a
fish (nisi leg. i)sxuro/s), Hsch. = bouko/los, Suid.
boupa/lina, ta/, prob. = bouba/lia (v. bouba/lion), SIG2588.171 (Delos, ii B. C.):—also boupali/des: periskeli/des, Hsch.

bou/pa^lis, ews, o(, h(, (pa/lh)
wrestling like a bull, i.e.
hard-struggling, a)eqlosu/nh APl.4.67.

bou-pa/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos, (pa/omai)
rich in cattle, AP6.263 (Leon.), 7.740 (Id.).
bou/-peina, h(, = boulimi/a, Lyc.581, Call.Fr.7.11 P.

bou-pela/ths [a^], ou, o(,
herdsman, A.R.4.1342, Nic.Al.39, Opp.C.1.534, Androm. ap. Gal.14.37.

bou-pla^no/ktistos, on, (bou=s, pla/nh, kti/zw)
founded by the wandering cow, of Troy, lo/fos Lyc.29.

bou-pla/sths, ou, o(,
cowmodeller, of the sculptor Myron, AP9.734 (Diosc.).

bou/-pleuros, h(, (cf. Sch.Nic.l.c.)
bishop's weed, Ammimajus, Nic.Th.585.

bou-plhqh/s, e/s,
full of oxen, Euph.52.

bou/-plhktros, on,
goading oxen, a)/kaina AP6.41 (Agath.).

bou-plh/c, h=gos, o( (also h(, Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.4, EM371.40),
ox-goad, qeino/menai bouplh=gi (gender undetermined) Il. 6.135.
axe for felling an ox, AP9.352 (Leon.), Timo4.1, Q.S.1.159.
bou-poi/htos, on, = bou/pais 11, AP12.249 (Strat.).

bou-poi/mhn, enos, o(,
herdsman, ib.7.622 (Antiphil.).

bou-po/los, on,
tending oxen, Hsch.; cf. bouko/los.

bou-pompo/s, o/n,
celebrated with a procession of oxen, e(orth/ Pi.Fr.193.

bou-po/ros, on, (pei/rw)
ox-piercing, b. o)belo/s a spit
large enough for a whole ox, Hdt.2.135, cf. E.Cyc.302; a)mfw/boloi sfagh=s . . boupo/roi spits
fit to pierce an ox's throat, Id.Andr.1134; b. o)beli/skos X.An.7.8.14.

bou-prho/nes,
great precipices, Hsch.

bou/-prhstis, idos or ews, h(, (prh/qw)
poisonous beetle, which being eaten by cattle in the grass causes them to swell up and die, Hp.Nat.Mul. 32, Arist.Fr.376, Nic.Al.346, Dsc.2.61.
hare's ear, Bupleurum protractum, Thphr.HP7.7.3.

bou-pro/swpos, on,
with the face of an ox or
cow, Porph.Abst.3.16 (boo- codd.), Lyd.Mens.4.46, Phlp. in GA185.11.

bou/-prw|ros, on, (prw=|ra)
with the forehead or
face of an ox, S.Tr.13 (ap.Str.10.2.19; Laur. Ms. bou/kranos）; b. pro/swpa Philostr. Jun.Im.4. b. e(kato/mbh offering of 100 sheep
and one ox, SIG604.8 (Delph., ii B. C.), Plu.2.668c, Hsch.; b. qusi/a Delph.3(2).66; e)/pemyan *kei=oi dwdekhi/+da b. tau=ron Dürrbach
Choix d' Inscriptions de Délos p.183 (ii A. D.).
bou/-prws: a)sqe/neia, Hsch.
bou/ptinon, = tri/fullon, Hsch.

bourga/rios, o(, = Lat.
burgarius, SIG880.52 (Thrace).

bourdw/n, w=nos, o(, = bordw/n,
mule, IG5(1).1115 Bi37, Edict.Diocl. 14.10, PLips.87.1 (iv A. D.):—hence bourdwna/rios, o(,
muleteer, Edict. Diocl.7.17, Sch.Ar.Th.498: bourdwna/rion, to/, Dim. of bourdw/n, PRyl.238.11 (iii A. D.).
bourikupa/rissos: a)/mpelos (Perga), Hsch.
bou/rinon, = to/, = kunokefa/lion, Ps.-Apul.Herb.86.

bourixa/llion, to/, senator's
ox-cart, Lyd.Mag.1.18.

bou/rugxos, o(, a large
fish, Hsch. bou/rutos, o(,
mighty river, Id.

bou=s, Dor. bw=s Theoc.9.7, GDI5005.5 (Gortyn), o( and h(: gen. boo/s (written boio/s GDIiv p.883 No.62 (Erythrae)), poet. also bou= A. Fr.421, S.Fr.280: acc. bou=n IG12.45A11, etc., bw=n Il.7.238 and Dor., IG4.914.18, al. (Epid.), SIG56.16 (Argos), Theoc.27.64, Ion. and poet. also bo/a Pherecyd.162 J., AP9.255 (Phil.): dual bo/e Hes.Op. 436: pl., nom. bo/es, rarely contr. bou=s Ar.Fr.760, Plu.Aem.33, etc.: gen.bow=n, contr. bw=n Hes.Th.983; Bocot. bouw=n IG7.3171.45: dat. bousi/, Ep. bo/essi, bosi/ AP7.622 (Antiphil.); Boeot. bou/essi IG7.3171.38: acc. bo/as Il.5.556, al., bou=s 1.154, al., S.Aj.175 (lyr.), and Att., Antiph. 172.5, etc. (but later bo/as Ev.Jo.2.14, POxy.729.16 (ii A. D.), etc.):—
bullock, bull, ox, or
cow, in pl.
cattle, commonly fem.: to mark the male Hom. adds a word, b. a)/rshn Il.20.495; or tau=ros b. 17.389; as a measure of value, boo\s a)/cion 23.885, cf. 7.474 and v. a)lfesi/boios, e(kato/mboios. bou=s a)/grios
buffalo, Arist.HA499a4. bou=s e)n *suri/a|
zebu, ib.606a15; b. e)n *paioni/a|, perh.
urus, Id.Mir.842b33. boo\s o)/mma, = bou/fqalmos, AP4.1.52 (Mel.). metaph. of any
dam or
mother, mi/a b. *krhqei= te ma/thr kai\ *salmwnei= Pi.P.4.142; a)/pexe th=s b. to\n tau=ron A.Ag.1125. = boei/h or boe/h (always fem.),
ox-hide shield, nwmh=sai bw=n Il.7.238; tukth=|si bo/essin 12.105; bo/as au)/as ib.137; ge/rra leukw=n b. X.An.5.4.12. a
fish, perh.
Notidanus griseus, Arist.HA540b17, Fr. 280. a fish of the Nile, Str.17.2.4. e)/bdomos b.
crescent loaf, Clidem.16.
seam, Poll.7.65.
the constellation Taurus, Max.162. = ma/stic, Hsch. prov., b. e)pi\ glw/sshs e)pibai/nwn Thgn.815; bou=s e)pi\ glw/ssh| be/bhke A.Ag.36; of people who keep silence from some weighty reason, to\n bou=n e)piti/qhmi th=| glw/tth| Jul.Or.7.218a; bou=s e)mbai/nei me/gas Strattis 67 (wrongly expld. by Zen.2.70, etc., of bribery with coins bearing type of ox); b. e)n po/lei 'bull in a china-shop', Diogcnian.3.67; b. e)n au)li/w|, of a useless person, Cratin.32; b. lu/ras 'pearls before swine', Macho ap.Ath.8.349c. (bou=s (from bwu/s, Skt.
gaús) acc. bw=n (Skt.
gā´m) are old forms: stem bwv-bov-, cf. Lat. (Umbr.)
bos, etc.)
bou/sbaton: th\n *)/artemin (Thracian), Hsch.
bouse/li_non, to/, = smu/rnion, Plin.HN20.118, Archig. ap. Gal.12.406.
boush/: dou/lh, Hsch. bousi/a: gogguli/di o(/moion (Thess.), Id.

bouska^fe/w,
undermine, Lyc.434.
bouskhth/rion: ei)s eu)ru/hn: ei)/rhtai kakos xo/lws e)pi\ tou= gunaikei/ou ai)doi/ou, Hsch.

bou-so/h, Lacon. bouo(/a, h(,
herd, EM208.6, 391.19.
bou-so/os, v. boosso/os.

bouso/s, h(,
pasture for oxen, Schwyzer 664.15 (Orchom. Arc., iv B. C.).

bou/staqmon, to/,
ox-stall, E.Hel.29, IA76, Lyc.92 (pl.): in masc. form, a)mfi\ bousta/qmous E.Hel.359 (lyr.):—as Adj., bousta/qmou ka/phs S.Ichn.8.
bou-sta/nh: boostasi/a, Hsch.: also, = ma/stic or plhgh/, Id.

bou-sta/s, a/dos, h(,
where oxen are stalled, au)lai/ S.Fr.321.
bou-sta^si/a, h(, = bou/staqmon, Luc.Alex.1.
bou-sta/sion [a^], to/, = foreg., PFlor. 50.60 (iii A. D.), Gp.2.27.2, Olymp. in Mete.113.22.
bou/-sta^sis, ews, h(, = foreg., A.Pr.653 (pl.), IG11(2).145.19 (Delos, iv B. C.), D.H.1.79.

bou-strofhdo/n, Adv.
turning like oxen in ploughing; of writing from left to right and right to left alternately, Euph. ap. Harp. o( ka/twqen no/mos, Paus.5.17.6, Hsch.

bou/-strofos, on,
ploughed by oxen, Lyc.1438; but, parox. bou-stro/fos, on,
ox-guiding, desma/ AP6.104 (Phil.);
ox-tormenting, mu/wy ib.95 (Antiphil.).

bou/-su_kon, to/, (bou-)
a large, coarse fig, Hsch., cf. Varro RR2.5.4.

bou-sfa^ge/w,
slaughter oxen, E.El.627.

bou/ta^lis, h(, a)hdw/n, Aesop.85 (v.l. bw/t). bouta/nh,
part of ship to which rudder was fastened, Hsch.; also expld. as = ma/stic, or ma/xh, a)hdi/a, Id.
bou/taros: o( paxu/s, Hsch. boutele/sthn: qu/thn, Id.

bou/ths, ou, Dor. bou/tas a, o(, (bou=s)
herdsman, A.Pr.568 (lyr.), E.Andr.280 (lyr.), Theoc.1.80, AP6.255 (Eryc.), etc.:—as Adj., b. fo/nos the slaughter
of kine, E.Hipp.537. = o)ri/ganos (Cydonia), Hsch.

bou/ti_mos, on,
worth an ox, Hsch., EM207.5.

bou=tis or bou=ttis, h(,
vessel in the shape of the frustum of a cone, Hero
*Stereom.2.9; bou/th ib.1.52, Aët.3.133:—Dim. bou/tion Hippiatr.34.

bou/-tomon, to/, or bou/-tomos, o(, (te/mnw)
sedge, Carex riparia, Ar.Av. 662, Theoc.13.35: masc., Thphr.HP1.10.5: neut., ib.4.10.4, Theoc.
l.c., Gp.2.6.28, LXX Jb.8.11.
bou-to/ros, on, = boupo/ros, Suid.: bou/toron ya/kastron: nifa/d' u(etou=, Hsch.
bouto/wn: o(do/n, a)trapo/n, Hsch. (fort. bouo(/on, cf. bouso/h).

*boutra/gios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Melitaea, IG9(2).206i
b19.

bou/-tra^gos, o(,
ox-goat, fabulousanimal, Philostr.
V A6.24.

bou-tra^gotaura/nqrwpos, o(,
a compound of ox, goat, bull, and man, Tz.H.7.484.

bou-trofi/a, h(,
feeding of cattle, Agatharch.7.

bou-tro/fos, on,
ox-feeding: o( boutro/fos, = bou/ths, Poll.1.249, EM209.54; cf. bootro/fos.
bou/-trwkton, to/, = o)/robos, Hsch.

bou-tu/pos [u^], o(,
ox-butcher, slaughterer, A.R.2.91,4.468; esp. of the priest at the Dipolia (cf. boufo/nia), IG12.839,3.1163.2, Clidem. 17, Porph.Abst.2.30. = oi)=stros,
gadfly, Opp.H.2.529; but = e)mpi/s, Hsch.

bou-tu/rinos [u_], h, on,
of butter, mu/ron Dsc.1.54.

bou/-tu_ron, to/,
butter, to\ pi=on tou= ga/laktos Hp.Morb.4.51, cf. Arist.Fr.636, Plu.2.1109b, LXX Ge. 18.8, Sor.1.86, Dsc.2.72, Edict.Diocl.4.50:—also bou/tu_ros, o(, Gal.13.527. a
plant, Hsch.; o)/zei o( to/pos b. Ath.9.395a.

bou-tu_rofa/gos [a^], ou, o(,
butter-eater, Anaxandr.41.8 (prob.).

bou-fa/gos [a^], on,
ox-eating, Simon.179.4, AP7.426 (Antip. Sid.); of Hercules, Luc. Am.4, Porph.Abst.1.22, cf. AP9.59 (Antip.): expld. by polufa/gos, Hsch.
boufa/ras: gefu/ras, Hsch.
bou/faron: th\n eu)a/roton gh=n: fa/ros ga\r h( a)/rosis: kai\ e)pi/qeton boo/s, Hsch.

bou/fqalmon, to/, (bou=s, o)fqalmo/s)
ox-eye, Anacyclus radiatus, Dsc. 3.139, Nic.Fr.74.59. = xrusa/nqemon, Ps.-Dsc.4.58; = a)ei/zwon, Dsc.4.88; = boa/nqemon, Gal.19.87.

bou/fqalmos, o(, a
fish, Marc.Sid.8.

boufon-e/w,
slaughter oxen, Il.7.466.

boufo/n-ia (sc. i(era/), ta/, at Athens, ceremony at the Dipolia, at which
an ox was slain, Ar.Nu. 985, Androt.13, Paus.1.28.11, Ael.VH8.3.
boufon-iw/n, w=nos, o(, month at Delos, IG11.203A32,52 (iii B.C.); at Tenos, ib.12(5).824.

bou/fon-os, on,
ox-slaying, h.Merc.436; qera/pwn Simon.172.4; pele/keis D.S.4.12:—as Subst.,
priest, Paus.1.28.10.
at or
for which steers are slain, qoi=nai A.Pr.531 (lyr.).

bouforb-e/w,
tend cattle, E.Alc.8.

boufo/rb-ia, ta/,
herd of oxen, ib. 1031, IT301.

bouforb-o/s, o/n (fem. -forbh/, of Persephone, Hymn.Mag. 3.26),
ox-feeding:—as Subst.,
herdsman, E.IT237, Pl.Plt.268a.
bou/-fortos, on, = polu/fortos, AP6.222 (Theodorid.).

bou-xandh/s, e/s, (xanda/nw)
holding an ox, le/bhs ib.153 (Anyte); expld. by poluxw/rhtos, Hsch. xi_los, on,
rich in fodder, leimw/n A.Supp.540 (lyr.); *)arkadi/h AP6.108 (Myrin.).
bou-xrw/s tis: i)sxuro/s, h)\ i)/chros, Hsch.
bou/xwma: fro/nhma, Hsch.

bow/n, w=nos, o(,
cow-house, byre, Tab.Heracl.1.139, Phryn.PSp.52 B.
bow=na: o(do/n, and bow=nas: a)groiki/as, Hsch.

bo-wne/w,
buyoxen, IG2.163.17.

bo-w/nhs, ou, o(, (w)ne/omai) at Athens,
an officer who bought oxen for the sacrifices, D.21.171, IG2.163.18.

bo-w/nhtos, on,
purchased with an ox, Hsch.; ta\ b., name of a place in Sparta, Paus.3.12.1.

bo-wni/a, h(,
purchase of oxen, IG2.741a8. bowni/a: au)/lios qu/ra (Cret.), Hsch.

bo-w=pis, idos, h(, (w)/y)
ox-eyed, i.e.
having large, full eyes, bow=pis po/tnia *(/hrh Il.1.551, al., cf. Eup.403; of Artemis, B.10.99; Amphitrite, Id.16.110; Harmonia, Pi.P.3.91; of women, Il.3.144, 7.10, 18.40:—masc. bow/phs Eust.768.43. (o)/y) = megalo/fwnos, Hsch.

bo-wte/w,
plough, Hes.Op.391.

bo-w/ths, ou, o(,
ploughman, Lyc.268, Babr.52.3, APl. 4.333 (Antiphil.). the constellation
Boötes, Arat.92; but prob. = the star *)arktou=ros in Od.5.272.

bo-wti/a, h(,
arable land or
ploughing, Crito Hist.3.

bo/-wy, wpos, o(, small
fish with large eyes, Ar.Byz. ap. Ath.7.287a. (Expld. as more correct than bo/-wc, bw=c (q.v.).)
bra/: a)delfoi/ (Elean), Hsch.
bra=|, Aeol. for bra/|dion (i.e. vra/|dion), A.D.Adv.163.21, Hdn.Gr. 2.214.

bra^b-ei/a, h(,
office of brabeu/s: generally,
arbitration, judgement, o(/pws klu/oimi/ sou koina\s brabei/as E.Ph.450, cf. Lyc.1154.

bra^b-ei=on, Ep. bra^b-h/i+on, to/,
prize in the games, Men.Mon.653, 1 Ep.Cor.9.24, Plu.2.742c, Opp.C.4.197.
wand, baton given as a prize, timhqei\s xrusei/w|b. CIG3674 (Cyzicus, ii A.D.), cf.IG14.748 (Naples).

bra^/b-euma, atos, to/,
judge's award, S.Fr.317.

bra^b-eu/s, e/ws, o(, Att. pl. brabh=s: acc. sg. brabh= (v. infr.):—
judge at the games, S.El.690,709, Pl.Lg. 949a: generally,
judge, arbitrator, umpire, di/khs E.Or.1650; lo/gou Id.Med.274, etc.; *)ai/+dhn koino\n e)/qento brabh= Epigr. ap. D.18.289. generally,
chief, leader, muri/as i(/ppou b. A.Pers.302; filo/maxoi b. Id.Ag.230 (lyr.);
author, mo/xqwn tw=n e)n *)ili/w|, of Helen, E.Hel.703.

bra^b-euth/s, ou=, o(, = bra|beu/s, Is.9.35, POxy.1050.11 (ii/iii A.D.); b. tw=n lo/gwn Pl.Prt.338b; b. tou= dikai/ou o( dikasth/s Arist.Rh.1376b20, cf. Ph.2.346, al.; ai(rei=sqai/ tina b. Plu.Cat.Mi.44.
official of a religious confraternity, Buresch
Aus Lydien10, Ramsay
Eastern Provinces 320.

bra^b-eu/w,
act as judge or
umpire, e)n th=| klhrw/sei th\n tu/xhn brabeu/sein Isoc.7.23; o)rqw=s b. Axiop.2.7;
preside at an election, Plu. Cat.Mi.44. c. acc.,
arbitrate, decide on, ta\ tw=n a)/llwn di/kaia D.3.27, cf. Arist.Ath.9.2; kri/seis Plu.Cic.35; dikasth/rion ib.9; a(/millan Id.2.960a, etc.: c. acc. et dat., a)gw=na i)sxuro\n e)bra/beusen au)tw=| LXX Wi.10.12; prosh/kei basilei= ta\ di/kaia b. toi=s u(phko/ois Muson.8p.33H.:—Pass., brabeuqh/setai ta\ tou= pole/mou tw=| nenikhko/ti J.AJ6.9.1; ta\ para/ tn i brabeuo/mena Isoc.5.70; sune/bh . . th\n kri/sin brabeuqh=nai SIG685.37(Cret.).
direct, control, Michel163.10（Delos), AP12.56 (Mel.); nou=s b. pa/nta Ph.1.94:—Pass., Plb.6.4.3, Plu.Pel.13; pa/ntwn u(po\ tou= daimoni/ou -ome/nwn Phld.Herc.1251.7.
brabu/lh, = a)nemw/nh h( foinikh=, Ps.-Dsc.2.176.

bra/bu^lon, to/,
sloe, Prunus spinosa, Theoc.7.146 (wrongly expld. by Sch. as
damson), 12.3, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.20.4, Gal.6.621. = kokku/mhlon (q.v.), Seleuc. ap. Ath.2.50a, Clearch.82.

bra/bu^los, h(,
the tree which bears bra/bula, Aret.CA2.2, Gp.10.39. = bra/bulon, AP9.377 (Pall.).
seedling peach, Gp.10.13.5. (The forms bra/bilos, bra/bhlos are found in codd. of Gp. and AP, bra/bhlon EM211.3, bra/bilon codd. of Theoc. and Ath.）
bra/gos, = bra/xos (B), Hsch.

bragx-a^le/os, a, on, (bra/gxos)
hoarse, Hp.Acut.(Sp.)55.

bragx-a/w,
to have a sore throat, Arist.HA603b13, D.C.63.26, Porph.Abst.3.7.
bragx-ei/a, h(, = bra/gxos 1.1, Hsch.
bra/gx-h, h(, = bra/gxos 1.2, Xenocr. 52.
bragx-ia/zoisqe: pni/goisqe, Hsch.
bragx-ia/w, = bragxa/w, Arist.Pr. 901b5, Aud.804a18, LXX Ps.68(69).3; condemned by Phot. s.v. liqw=ntas.
bragx-ioeidh/s, e/s, = bragxoeidh/s, Arist.HA526b20.

bra/gx-ion, to/,
fin, dub. in Arion 1.4 (bra/gxioi codd. Ael.). in pl.,
gills of fishes, Arist.HA589b19, PA696b1, Theoc.11.54 (sg., Ael.NA16.12). = bro/gxion, bro/gxos, dub.l. in Arist.Spir.483a22, cf. HA603a32.
hull of a ship, Hsch.
bragx-iw/dhs, es, = bragxoeidh/s, Arist.HA526a26.

bragxoeidh/s, e/s,
like fishes' gills, Arist.PA684a20.

bra/gxos, o(,
hoarseness or
sore throat causing hoarseness, Hp.VM 19 (pl.), al., Th.2.49: pl., Arist.Pr.860a30,37. a
disease in swine (either
anthrax or
foot-and-mouth disease), Id.HA603a31. bra/gxos, to/, in pl., = bra/gxia, Opp.H.1.160; but bra/gxos, o(, in Ptol.Alm.8.1.

bragxo/s, h/, o/n,
hoarse, bragxa\ laruggio/wn AP11.382.2 (Agath.).

bragxw/dhs, es,
subject to hoarseness, Hp.
Aër.6, Epid.1.1. Adv. -dw=s Gal.13.4.
causing it, u(/data -e/stata Hp.
Aër.7.
bra^da^ni/zw ( = vrad-）: r(ipi/zw, tina/ssw (Aeol.), Hsch.
bra/dinos [a^], a, on, Aeol. for r(adino/s, Sapph.90,104.
bra/|dion, Aeol., = vra/|dion, EM210.43.
bra/dos [a^], eos, to/, = bra^duth/s, X.Eq.11.12, Epicur.Ep.1p.10U.

bra^du^-ana/foros, on,
slow-rising, ta\ b. tw=n zw|di/wn Anon.
in Ptol. Tetr.114.

bra^du^-ba/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos,
slow-walking, Arist.Phgn. 813a3.

bra^du^-bouli/a, h(,
slowness of counsel, Ph.2.662.

bra^du^/-ga^mos, on,
late in marrying, Ptol.Tetr.183.

bra^du^-genh/s, e/s,
late born, Sch. Lyc.1276.

bra^du^/-glwssos, Att. bra^/du^-ttos, on,
slow of tongue, LXX Ex.4.10, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.167, Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.13.

bra^du^-di_nh/s, e/s,
sloweddying or
whirling, Nonn.D.37.482.

bra^du^-h/koos, on, (a)kou/w)
slow of hearing, EM430.28.

bra^du^-qa/na^tos [qa^], on,
dying slowly, Gal.16.631.

bra^du^/-karpos, on,
late-fruiting, Thphr.CP5.17.6.

bra^du^-kata/foros, on,
slow in setting, zw/|dia Sch.Ptol. Tetr.114.

bra^du^-ki/nhtos [i_], on,
slow-moving, Gal.5.318, Adam.1.7: Comp. -to/teros Phlp.in Ph. 680.31: Subst. bra^du^-ki_nhsi/a, h(, Aristid.Quint.2.9, Diog.Oen.71.

bra^du^-kri/si^mos [ri^], on,
slow in reaching a crisis, Herod.Med.in Rh.Mus.58.95.

bra^du^-logi/a, h(,
slowness of speech, Poll.2.121 :—Adj. bra^du^-lo/gos, on, Sch.Ven.Il.3.155.

bra^du^-ma^qh/s, e/s,
slow in learning, Hsch. s.v. o)yimaqh/s :—Subst. bra^du^-ma^qi/a, h(, Zonar.

bra^du^/-noia, h(,
slowness of understanding, D.L.7.93.

bra^du^/-noos, on, contr. bra^du^/-nous, oun,
slow of understanding, Dam.Isid.81.

bra^du/nw, fut. -u^nw= LXX De.7.10: aor. e)bra/du_na Luc.Cont.1, App. BC1.69: plpf. e)bebradu/kein Luc.Symp.20: (bradu/s): trans.,
make slow, delay, LXX Is.46.13 :—Pass.,
to be delayed, ta)po\ sou= bradu/netai S.OC1628; h( d' o(do\s bradu/netai Id.El.1501. intr.,
loiter, delay, ei) bradu/noimen boh=| A.Supp.730 (so in Med., xei=ra d' ou) bradu/netai . . a(rpa/sai do/ru Id.Th.623); mh\ bra/dune S.Ph.1400; speu/dwn . . bradu/nw Pl.R.528d: c. inf., Polyaen.1.48.4; bradu/nei soi tou=to;
are you
slow, slack in this ? Philostr.Im.1.6.

bra^du^-peiqh/s, e/s, (pei/qomai)
slow to be persuaded, AP5.286 (Agath.).
reluctant, Nonn.D.4.313.

bra^du^-pepte/w,
digest slowly, Dsc.5.39.

bra^du^/-peptos, on,
slow of digestion, v.l. in Gal.6.770（Comp.).

bra^du^-peyi/a, h(,
slowness of digestion, Sor.1.51, Dsc.5.38 (pl.), Gal.7.62.

bra^du^-ploe/w,
sail slowly, Act.Ap.27.7, Artem.4.30, AB225.

bra^du^/-pnoos, on,
breathing slowly, Aret.SD1.10.

bra^du^-pore/w,
proceed slowly, of the sun, Placit.5.18.1.

bra^du^-po/ros, on,
slow-passing, of food, Hp.Acut.62, Ruf. ap. Orib.5.3.4, Philagr.ib.5.19.4; of humours, Gal.7.341: generally,
slow, o(/rasis Plu.2.626a; b. pe/lagos
slow to pass, ib.941b.

bra^du^/-pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,
slow of foot, slow, h)/lusis E.Hec.66 (anap.); o)/nos AP9.301 (Secund.), cf. 310 (Antiphil.); boulh/ ib.10.37 (Luc.).

bra^du/s, ei=a, u/: Comp. bradu/teros Th.4.8; metath. bardu/teros Theoc.29.30; bradi/wn Artem.1.70: Sup. bradu/tatos Ar.Fr.357, also bra/distos (metath. ba/rdistos Il.23.310,530, Doroth(?).ap.Heph. Astr.3.30) Aret.SD1.6, bradi/statos Ael.Fr.325 :—
slow, kixa/nei toi b. w)ku/n Od.8.329, etc.: c. inf., a)lla/ toi i(/ppoi ba/rdistoi qei/ein
slowest at running, Il.23.310; b. le/gein E.HF237, etc.; to\ b.
delay, Pl.Lg. 766e. Adv. brade/ws, xwrei=n Th.5.70; qei=n Pl.Prt.336a, etc.: Comp. -u/teron Hp.Prog.22, Pl.Tht.190a; bradute/rws Aen.Tact.16.12; bra/di^on Hes.Op.528, Sor.1.117 (condemned by Luc.Sol.7): Sup. -u/tata Pl.Ti.39b. of the mind,
dull, sluggish, e)pilh/smwn kai/ b. Ar.Nu.129; opp. a)gxi/nous, Pl.Phdr.239a; bra/distoi th\n gnw/mhn Aret.l.c.: c. inf., pronoh=sai bradei=s Th.3.38; to\ b. kai\ me/llon
slowness and deliberation, Th.1.84. Adv. brade/ws, bouleu/esqai ib.78; b. o)li/ghn o)rgh\n poiei=sqai Pl.Phdr.233c. in Egypt, of illiterates,
brade/ws, bradu/teron gra/fein, PTeb.316.101 (i A. D.), PRyl.173.13 (i A. D.); also brade/a gra/fousa BGU446.19 (ii A. D.). of Time,
tardy, late, su\n xro/nw| b. molw/n S.Tr.395, cf. Th.7.43; bradei=an . . o(do\n pe/mpwn S.Aj.738. Adv., e(/ws brade/ws h)=n th=s h(me/ras D.L.2.139: neut. as Adv., o)ye\ kai\ bradu\ th=s h(liki/as Hld.2.29; bra/dion a)pogalakti/zein Sor. l.c.

bra^du^-si_te/w,
eat late in the day, Alex. Trall.7.6:—Subst. bra^du^-si_ti/a, h(, Id.1.15, 11.1.

bra^du^-skelh/s, e/s,
slow of leg, *(/hfaiste AP6.101 (Phil.).

bra^dusmo/s, o(,
making slow, Sch.E.Or.426.

bra^du^tekni/a, h(,
lateness in having offspring, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.163.

bra^duth/s, h=tos, h(,
slowness, sluggishness, braduth=ti/ te nwxeli/h te Il.19.411; so of persons, S.Ant.932 (anap.), Th.1.71, 5.75, Pl.Phd. 109d, Thphr.Char.14.1: in pl., Isoc.4.141, D.18.246: lit.
slowness, opp. ta/xos, Pl.Ti.39b, cf. Arist. Ph.228b29.

bra^du-to/kos, on,
slow in bringing to birth, Arist.Pr.891b28 (Comp.). -xro/nios, on,
late, Sch.Il.2.325.
bra/dwn: a)du/natos, Hsch.

bra/zw,
boil, froth up, ferment, Call. Hist.3, Hld.5.16, Alex.Aphr. Pr.1.104.
growl, of bears, Poll.5.88; of elephants, Jubaap. Poll. l.c.; but bra/zein: to\ h(suxh= o)du/resqai, Hsch.

bra/qu, uos, to/,
savin, Juniperus Sabina, Dsc.1.76; also, =
J. foetidissima, ibid. (Aram.
b6raāt 'cypress'.)

bra/kai, w=n, ai(, Lat.
braccae, breeches, trews, worn by the Gauls, D.S. 5.30 (bra/kes (sic): a)nacuri/des, Hsch.):—Dim. bra/kia, ta/, Sch.Ar.V. 1082, PGiss.80.6 (iv A. D.), IG5(1).1406.23 (Edict. Diocl., Asine):— hence braka/rios, o(,
breeches-maker, ib.18, cf. POxy.1341 (iv A. D.):— but brakari/ai, ai(,
breeches, PGiss.90.6 (ii A. D.).
bra/kalon: r(o/palon, Hsch.

bra/kana, ta/,
wild herbs, Pherecr.13, Luc.Lex.2, Hsch.
brakei=n, brakei/s, Aeol., = sunie/nai, sunei/s, Hsch.
brake/llai, ai(, = bra/kai, BGU814.29 (iii A. D.).

bra/ket( r>on, to/,
pruning-hook, Hsch.; also = plh=qos, Id.
bra/kia, ta/, = bra/kai, PGen.80.6 (iv A. D.).
braki/as: traxei=s to/pous, Hsch. (fort. brax-, cf. r(axi/a).

bra/kos (i. e. vra/kos), eos, to/,
long robe, Sapph.70; u(da/tina b. Theoc. 28.11. = ka/lamos, Hsch.
bra/ptw, aor. inf. bra/yai, = ma/rptw, Hsch. (bra/cai is f.l. for bra/yai).

bra/sis [a^], ews, h(,
boiling, of water, Orib.5.33.3.

bra/sma, atos, to/,
boiling, me/xri brasma/twn e(pta/ Aët.6.80. v.l. for bre/gma, Dsc.2.159.
shaking motion, Herod.Med.in Rh.Mus.58.81.
brasma^ti/as, ou, o(, = bra/sths, opp. seismati/as, Posidon. ap. D.L.7.154, Amm.Marc.17.7.13 (pl.), Heraclit.All.38.
brassio/troxos: keramiko\s o( mh\ e)rrwgw/s, Hsch.

bra/ssw, Att. bra^du/-ttw, aor. e)/bra^sa Hp.Ep.23, etc.:—Pass., aor. e)bra/sqhn Aret.SA1.5: pf. be/brasmai (v. infr.):—
shake violently, throw up, of the sea, skolo/pendran . . e)/bras' e)pi\ skope/lous AP6.222 (Theodorid.); to\n pre/sbun . . e)/brase . . ei)s h)i+o/na ib.7.294 (Tull.Laur.): —Pass., o)ste/a . . be/brastai . . th=|de par' h)i+o/ni ib.288 (Antip.), cf. Opp. H.1.779;
boil, of surf, A.R.2.323, Opp.H.3.476; b. u(po\ ge/lwtos
shake with laughter, Luc.Eun.12.
winnow grain, Ar.Fr.271, Pl.Sph.226b. abs., = bra/zw,
boil, interpol. in Gp.7.15.20; dub. sens. in Hp. l.c. bra/ttein: plhqu/nein, baru/nein, Hsch.
bra/sswn, on, Homeric Comp. of braxu/s (q. v.).

braste/on,
one must winnow, Gp.3.7.1.

brasth/r, h=ros, o(,
winnowing-fan, Gloss.

bra/sths, ou, o(, (bra/ssw) of an earthquake,
upheaving the earth verlically, Arist.Mu.396a3.
brastiko/s, h/, o/n, f.l. for blastiko/s, Herm. ap. Stob.1.41.7.
brata/nan: toru/nhn (Elean), Hsch. brata/nei: r(ai/+zei a)po\ no/sou (Elean), Id. bra/taxos, v. ba/traxos.

brauka^na/omai, v.l. for bruxana/omai, Nic.Al.221;
cry, of infants, Hsch.

brau/kh, = a)kri/s, Hsch.: brau=kos, = mikra\ a)kri/s (Cret.), AB223; cf. breu=kos. brau/la: fqei/r, Hsch. brau=lon: koi=lon, Id. brau=na: kh/lh, ku/stis, e)nterokh/lh, Id. brauni/a: koilw/mata gh=s, Id. brauw=sa: kekragui=a, Id.
bra/xalon: xremetismo/n, Hsch.

bra/xea, ta/, as if from a nom. bra/xos, to/ (or braxe/a, neut. pl. of braxu/s, Arist.HA568b28):—
shallows, Hdt.2.102, 4.179, Th.2.91, Plb.1.39.3, etc.: sg. only late, Procop.Pers.1.19, Goth.1.1.
bra^xei/s, ei=sa, e/n, v. bre/xw.

bra^xi_a/lion, to/,
bracelet, Sm., Thd.2 Ki.1.10:—also bra^du-a/rion, to/, Aq. ibid., and braxio/lion, to/, Alex. Trall.1.15.

bra^x-i_o/nion, to/, = sq., Roussel
Cultes Égyptiens 235 (Delos, ii B. C.), Poll.5.99.

bra^x-i_onisth/r, h=ros, o(,
armlet, Plu.Rom.17, Tz.H.13.48.

bra^x-i/wn [i_], onos, o(,
arm (opp. ph=xus, Pl.Ti.75a, but = ph=xus, Arist.MA698b2), Il.13.529, Hdt.5.12, X.Eq.12.5, Arist.HA493b26, etc.; prumno\s braxi/wn
the shoulder, Il.13.532, 16.323; also,
shoulder of beasts, ib.594b13:—Poet. as a symbol of strength, e)k braxio/nwn by
force of arm, E.Supp.478.
bra^xi/wn [Ion. i^, Att. i_], bra/xistos, Comp. and Sup. of braxu/s.
braxma/zousai: xremeti/zousai, Hsch.
braxma=nes, oi(, Brahmans, D. Chr.49.7, Luc.Fug.6, etc.
bra/xos (A) [a^], o(, prob. f.l. for ba/traxos, Ephipp. 13.
bra/xos (B), eos, to/, v. bra/xea.

bra^xu^-ba/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos,
taking short steps, Arist.Phgn.813a5.

bra^xu^/-bi^os, on,
short-lived, Pl.R.546a, Arist.HA494a1, etc.: Comp., Hp.Art.41, Arist.HA501b23; of plants, Thphr.HP4.13.1 (= xeilidu/nion me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.2.180): Sup. -w/tatos Str.16.4.12.

bra^xu^-bi^o/ths, htos, h(,
shortness of life, Arist.Pr.964a35 (he also wrote peri\ makro- kai\ braxubio/thtos); of plants, Thphr.HP4.13.1.

bra^xu^-bla^bh/s, e/s,
harming slightly, Luc. Trag.323.

bra^xu^/-bwlos, on,
with small or
few clods, b. xe/rsos a
small spot of ground, AP6.238 (Apollonid.): *)/ikos ib.7.2 (Antip. Sid.).

bra^xu^-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos,
of small understanding, X. Eq.Mag.4.18 (Comp.).

bra^xu^-gra^fe/w,
write with a short syllable, Tz.H.8.701.

bra^xu^-da/ktu^los, on,
short-fingered, Polem.Phgn.86.

bra^xu^/-dromos, on,
running a short way, X.Cyn.5.21 (Sup.).

bra^xu^-e/peia, h(,
laconic style, dub.l.in Rutil.2.8.

bra^xu^-h=lic, -i^kos,
youthful, Eust.1554.2.
bra^xu^-qa/lassos [qa^], on, gloss on eu)/falon (sic, i. e. e)/falon), Hsch.

bra^xu^-kata/lhktos, on,
ending in a short syllable, A.D.Pron.50.24, Arc.192.20. Adv. -tws f.l. for -paralh/ktws (q. v.), Sch.Ar.Pl.1057, = Suid. s.v. paidia/. b. me/tron,
short by a foot, Heph.4.4, Aristid.Quint. 1.23:—hence bra^xu^-katalhkte/w,
to end so, Sch.Ar.Ra.317:—Subst. bra^xu^-katalhci/a, h(,
such an ending, Heph.
Poëm.5.

bra^xu^-ke/fa^los, o(, a
fish, Xenocr.19.

bra^xu^-ki/nhtos [i_], on,
accompanied by slight motion, e)ne/rgeia Porph.Gaur.1.3.

bra^xu^-kome/w,
wear short hair, Str.11.11.8.

bra^xu^-kwli/a, h(,
use of short members, Hermog.Id.1.12.

bra^xu^/-kwlos, on,
with short strings, of slings, Str.3.5.1.
consisting of short clauses, peri/odoi Arist.Rh.1409b31.

bra^xu^-loge/w,
to be brief in speech, Id.Rh.Al.1434b10, Plu.2.193d, Demetr.Eloc.242; w(=de e)braxulo/ghse, introducing a quotation, Philostr.VA4.33. lo/ghma, atos, to/,
pithy saying, Tz.H.5.317.

bra^xu^-loghte/on,
one must be brief in speech, Arist.Rh.Al.1441a18.

bra^xu^-logi/a, h(,
brevity in speech or
writing, Hp.Decent.12, Pl.Grg.449c; b. tis *aakwnikh/ Id.Prt.343b, etc.; h( *pittakou= b. Plu.2.153e, cf. Demetr.Eloc.243 (pl.); opp. mh=kos, Pl.Lg.887b.

bra^xu^/-logos, on,
short in speech, of few words, Id.Grg. 449c (Comp.), etc.; of the Spartans, Id.Lg.641e, Demetr.Eloc.7, etc. Adv. -gws Poll.4.24.
bra^xu^lo/s, = mikro/s, dub. in Hsch.

bra^xu^-me/reia, h(,
aggregate of small elements, nefeloeidh/s, the 'Milky Way', Gem.5.68.

bra^xu^/-metros, on,
short in measurement, Aristeas55.

bra^xu^-mogh/s, e/s,
losing one's breath rapidly, Hp.Epid.2.2.24.
bra^xu^-mu_qi/a, h(, = braxulogi/a, Suid.

bra^xu/nw,
abridge, shorten, i. e.
to be a sign of a brief attack, Hp. Aph.1.12;
use as short, sullabh/n Pl.Per.4:—Pass., opp. mhku/nomai, Luc.Hist.Conscr.55; -o/menon fwnh=en Heph.1.1, D.T.633.

bra^xu/-nwtos [u^], on,
short-backed, Orac. ap. Str.6.1.12, Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.9; ste/rnon xqono/s dub. in Pi.Pae.4.14.

bra^xu-o/neiros, on,
with short or
few dreams, u(/pnos Pl.Ti.45e; fantasi/ai Plu.2.686b.

bra^xu-paralh/ktws, Adv.
with short penult., Sch.Ar.Pl.253.

bra^xu-pnoe/w,
to be short of breath, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.21.9.

bra^xu/-pnoia, h(,
shortness of breath, Gal.7.836.

bra^xu/-pnoos, on, contr. bra^xu/-pnous, oun,
short of breath, Hp.Epid.3.17.ie/.

bra^xu-po/ros, on,
with a short orbit, of a cycle of births, Pl.R.546a; oi( b. o)/rniqes
of short flight, Philostr.VA3.48: Comp.,
completing an orbit in shorter time, Procl.Hyp.1.24.
with narrow passage, ei)/splous Plu.Mar.15 (dub.l.).

bra^xu-po/ths, ou, o(,
one that drinks little, Hp.Prorrh.1.16.

bra^xu-po/tos, on,
drinking little, Gal.17(1).755.

bra^xu/-pteros, on,
short-winged, Arist.PA644a20.

bra^xu/-ptolis, ews, h(,
little city, Lyc.911:—also bra^xu/-polis, Adj.
belonging to a small city, *nireu/s Eust.317.29.

bra^xu-rreph/s, e/s,
short in weight: Comp. -e/steron
a smaller weight, Damocr. ap. Gal.13.1004.

bra^xu-rrh/mwn, on, gen. onos, (r(h=ma)
brief of speech, Them.Or.26.315a.

bra^xu-rri_zi/a, h(,
shortness of root, Thphr.CP3.7.2.

bra^xu/-rri_zos, on,
with a short root, ib.1.

bra^xu/s, ei=a (Ion. e/a Hdt.5.49), u/, dat. pl. braxe/ois JHS33.317 (Thess.): Comp. braxu/teros, braxi/wn (cf. bra/sswn): Sup. braxu/tatos, bra/xistos:—
short, of Space and Time, b. oi)=mos, o(do/s, Pi.P.4.248, Pl.Lg.718e, etc.; [ai)w/n] prob. in B.3.74; bi/os Hdt. 7.46; kairo/s Call.Epigr.9; xro/nos A.Pr.939, Pers.713, etc.; mu=qos, lo/gos, Id.Pr.505, v.l. in Pers.713; e)n braxei= (Ion. braxe/i+) in
a short time, Hdt.5.24, Pl.Smp.217a codd.; dia\ braxe/os Th.2.83; makra\n sunh/qeian braxei= lu=sai xro/nw| Men.726; braxu\ th|di\ metastw=men
for a moment, Id.Georg.32; of distance, b. a)po/dosis
short return in ballplay, Antiph.234.6; e)pi\ braxu\ e)ciknei=sqai X.An.3.3.17; pro\ braxe/os lamb.VP25.112: Comp., h( fa/lagc -ute/ra e)ge/neto a)nadiploume/nh X.
