Cyr.7.5.5; ta/cin -ute/ran h)\ pro/sqen, baqute/ran de\ poih/santes Plb.1.33.10; braxu/tera toceu/ein X.An.3.3.7. Adv. braxe/ws, [pole/mous] e)p' a)llh/lous e)pife/rein
scantily, seldom, Th.1.141. of Size,
short, small, morfa/n b. Pi.I.4(3).53; braxu\s e)cike/sqai qew=n e(/dran too
puny to
reach . . , ib.7(6).44; b. teu=xos S.El.1113, cf. 757; b. tei=xos a
low wall, Th.7.29; braxu/ moi sto/ma pa/nt' a)nagh/sasqai my mouth is
too small to . . , Pi.N.10.19; kata\ b. proi+w/n
little by little, Th.1.64, cf. Pl. Sph.241c; para\ braxu/
scarcely, hardly, fugei=n Alciphr.3.5; braxu/ ti lwfa=n a)po\ no/sou kai\ pole/mou Th.6.12; a(lo\s braxu/
a small quantity of salt, Bilabel *)oyart.p.11. of Number,
few, e)n braxei= in
few words, Pi.P.1.82, S.El.673; e)n braxi/stois Pi.I.6(5).59; e)n braxute/rois Pl.Grg.449c; so dia\ braxe/wn in
few words, Id.Prt.336a; w(s a)\n du/nwmai dia\ braxuta/twn D.27.3, Lys.16.9, cf. Pl.Grg.449c; w(s e)n braxuta/tois Antipho 1.18. Adv. braxe/ws, a)pologei=sqai
briefly, in few words, X.HG1.7.5. of Value or Importance, of persons,
humble, insignificant, S.OC880; to\n me\n a)f' u(yhlw=n braxu\n w)/|kise E. Heracl.613; b. th\n dia/noian J.AJ12.4.1; of things,
petty, trifling, a)rxh\ b. e)lpi/dos S.OT121; xa/ris Id.Tr.1217; pro/fasis E.IA1180; b. tis a)sa/feia a
slight obscurity, Gal.18(1).304; lupei=n tina\ braxu/, opp. me/g' eu(rei=n ke/rdos, S.El.1304; ou) peri\ braxe/wn bouleu/esqai Th. 1.78, cf. 140; b. kai\ ou)deno\s a)/cion Id.8.76; b. ke/rdous e(/neka Lys.7.17; ou)si/a Is.10.25: neut. as Adv., braxu\ fronti/zein tino/s think
lightly of, D.17.4.
short, of vowels or syllables, Arist.Cat.4b34, Rh. 1409a18, Po.1458a15, Heph.1.1, D.T.631, etc.; h( b. prosw|di/a the sign ^, S.E.M.1.113. (Cf. Avest.
m[schwa]r[schwa]zu- 'short', Goth.
gamaurgjan 'shorten', Lat.
brevis.）

bra^xu/-shmos [u^], on, in Comp.,
containing fewer time-units, pou/s Aristid.Quint.1.24.

bra^xu-si/dhros [i^], Dor. bra^xu-si/da_ros, on, a)/kwn b. a dart
with a short, small head, Pi.N.3.45.

bra^xu-skelh/s, e/s,
shortlegged, S.Ichn.297, Arist.PA692b5, IA714a13, Gal.UP3.3, Gp.19.6.2.

bra^xu/-ski^os, on,
with a short shadow, Ach.Tat.Intr.Arat. 31.

bra^xu-stele/xhs, es,
with a short stem, Thphr.HP4.6.10.

bra^xu/-sti^xos, on,
of few verses, Eust.ad D.P.1039.

bra^xu-stomi/a, h(,
smallness of mouth, Eust.767.16.

bra^xu/-stomos, on,
with narrow mouth, limh/n Str.14.1.24; a)ggei=a Plu.2.47e.

bra^xu-sulla^bi/a, Ep. bra^xu-i/h, h(,
fewness of syllables, brevity, Call.Epigr.10.

bra^xu-su/lla^bos, on,
of short syllables, D.H.Comp.17, Longin.41.3; xro/nos,
occupied by a 'short', Bacch. Harm.94. of the pulse,
with rapid rhythm, Ruf.Syn.Puls. 4.4.

bra^xu-su/mbolos, on,
bringing a small contribution, AP9.229 (Marc. Arg.).

bra^xu-sw/ma^tos, on,
short of body, Plu.
Fr.inc. 149.

bra^xu-telh/s, e/s,
ending shortly, brief, LXX Wi.15.9.

bra^xu/ths [u^], htos, h(,
shortness, opp. mh=kos, Pl.Plt.283c; mele/ths braxu/thti with
shortness of practice, Th.1.138;
narrowness, deficiency, meta\ braxu/thtos gnw/mhs Id.3.42.
smallness, tou= ba/qous Arist.Mete.354a18.
shortness of a syllable, in prosody, Pl.R.400c (pl.), Arist.Po.1456b32, Plu.2.947e, S.E.M.1.100.
scantiness, tw=n o)/ntwn Lib.Or.62.59.
shallowness, qala/tths Scyl. 112. Rhet.,
use of a condensed or
allusive expression, Trypho Trop.p.202 S.

bra^xu^-tome/w,
prune close, Thphr.CP3.14.2, GP.5.32.

bra^xu^/-tomos, on,
cut short, clipped, Thphr.CP3.2.3.

bra^xu^-tone/w,
have a short to/nos (q. v.), of torsion-engines, Ph.Bel.53.30.

bra^xu^/-tonos, on,
with a short to/nos (q. v.), of torsion-engines, ib.53.34, Plu.Marc.15.

bra^xu^-tra/xhlos [tra^], on,
short-necked, Pl.Phdr.253e, Arist.HA597b26.

bra^xu^/-u+pnos, on,
of short or
little sleep, Id.Somn.454b19, HA537a2.

bra^xu^-feggi/ths [i_], ou, o(,
giving a feeble light, lu/xnos AP6.251 (Phil.).

bra^xu^/-fullos, on,
with few leaves, de/ndron ib.9.612.

bra^xu^-fwni/a, h(,
smallness, weakness of voice, Polyaen.1.21.2.

bra^xu^/-xeir, o(, h(, gen. xeiros,
short-handed, opp. makro/xeir, Eust.610.32.

bra^xu^-xro/nios, on,
of brief duration, ge/nos Pl. Ti.75c (Comp.); to\ b. tou= bi/ou Plu.2.107a.

bra^xu^/-wtos, on, (ou)=s)
with short handles, kw/qwn Henioch.1.
braxw/dhs: traxu/s, Hsch. (Cf. r(axi/s.）

bre/bion, to/, (Lat.
brevis) list, inventory, IG12(9).907.15 (Chalcis, iv A. D.), Cod.Just.4.21.22 (pl.); bre/ouion PLond.2.414.9 (iv A. D.).
bre/gkos, o(, a sobriquet of doubtful meaning, *fi/lippos o( b. Herod. 2.73. (Perh. breu=kos should be read.)

bre/gma, atos, to/,
front part of the head, Batr.228, Hp.VC2, Stratt.34, Arist.HA491a31, al., PA653a35, Herod.4.51, 8.9, etc.:—also bregmo/s EM212.14; bre/xma, brexmo/s, broxmo/s (q. v.) (prob. from bre/xw, because this part of the bone is longest in hardening, Hp.l.c., Arist. GA744a24). in pl.,
parietal bones, Gal.17(2).3.
substance found in peppercorns, Dsc.2.159. = a)po/bregma,
infusion, extract, D.S.3.32.
drenching with rain, Erot. s.v. u(/smata (pl.).

breka/rios, = brak-,
PLond.ined.2176 (vi A. D.).

brekekeke/c, formed to imitate
the croaking of frogs, Ar.Ra.209 sqq.
bre/ktai: fussh=tai, Hsch.

brekte/on,
one must soak, Gp.3.8.

brekto/s, h/, o/n,
soaked, Hippiatr.129.
bre/llion, to/, perh. f.l. for bde/llion, POxy.1142.3 (iii A. D.).
bre/mbos: e)/mbruon, Hsch. bremeai/nwn: h)xw=n, Id.

bre/mw, only pres. and impf. (aor. e)/bramen, vv.ll. e)/braxen, e)/bremen, Call.Del.140):—
roar, [ku=ma] r(hgnu/menon mega/la bre/mei Il.4.425; dusa/nemoi bre/mousin a)ktai/ S.Ant.592 (lyr.):—Med., ai)gialw=| mega/lw| bre/metai Il.2.210; of wind, me/ga bre/metai xalepai/nwn 14.399, cf. S.Ant.592 (lyr.), Ar.Th.998 (lyr.). after Hom., of arms,
clash, ring, E.Heracl.832; of men,
clamour, rage, b. e)n ai)xmai=s A. Pr.424 (lyr.), cf. Th.378; polloi=s me\n i(/ppois, muri/ois d' o(/plois b. E.Ph.113; deina\ b. tini/
against one, Id.HF962; of a mob, A.Eu. 978 (lyr.);
murmur, grumble, o( xamhla\ pne/wn a)/fanton b. Pi.P.11.30;
wail, in Med., blaxai\ bre/montai A.Th.350 (lyr.); but also of music, lu/ra bre/metai kai\ a)oida/ Pi.N.11.7; ligu\ lwto\s bre/mwn Pae.Delph.12; fqe/gma mhxanh=| bre/mon S.Ichn.278: c. acc., lwto\s o(/tan i(era\ pai/gmata bre/mh| E.Ba.161 (lyr.). (
mrem-, cf. Skt.
mármaras 'noisy', Lat.
murmur, Gk. mormu_/rw, Lat.
fremo, etc.)
*bre/mwn, Roarer, name of a dog, X.Cyn.7.5.
brenai/atai: dusxerai/nei, prospoiei=tai, Hsch. bre/ndos, = e)/lafos, Id., EM212.47.

bre/nqeios, a, on,
costly, mu/ron Sapph.Supp.23.19; without mu/ron, Pherecr.101.2.
brenqina/ ( brenqi/a Diogenian. ap. EM212.45), ta/, roots used by women to make face-paint, Hsch.; cf. b<r>enqinw=|: a)nqinw=|, Id.
bre/nqis, Cypr., = qri/dac, Nic.Fr.120 (-qic Hsch.).
bre/nqon, to/, = bre/nqeion mu/ron, Hsch.

bre/nqos, o(, an unknown
water-bird, Arist.HA609a23, Ael.NA5.48, but in Arist.HA615a16 (with v.l. bri/nqos) some kind of
singingbird ( = ko/ssufos, Hsch.).
haughty carriage, arrogance, Ath. 13.611e.
tomb, Hsch.

brenqu/omai [u_] (bra^xu^-u/nomai AP11.305 (Pall.)), only pres. and impf.,
bear oneself haughtily, hold one's head high, swagger, u(po\ fronh/matos Ar.Pax26, cf.Nu.362, Pl.Smp.221b, Luc.DMort.10.8; pro/s tina Ar. Lys.887; b. ti pro\s au(to/n Luc.Tim.54; b. e)pi/ tini
plume oneself on . . , Ath.14.625b; e)brenqu/eto Lib.Or.56.17, Agath.1.14; also,
take umbrage, b. kai\ a)ganaktw=n Ael.NA5.36. (Either from bre/nqos 11 or from bre/nqeios, as Phld.Vit.p.37 J., Sch.Ar.Lys.887.)

bre/nqus, uos, h(,
perfume of bre/nqeion mu/ron, Phld.Vit.p.37 J.
brentai/: brontai/, Hsch. bre/ouion, v. bre/bion.

bre/ntion, Messap., =
stag's head, Str.6.3.6; cf. bre/ndos.

bre/cis, ews, h(, （bre/xw） = broxh/,
a wetting, X.Eq.5.9.

*breta^niko/s or *bretta^niko/s, h/, o/n, British, nh=soi Arist.Mu.393b12. brettanikh/, h(,
scurvy-grass, Cochlearia anglica, Dsc.4.2, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.197 (
herba Britannica, Plin.HN25.20,99). = a(/limos, Ps.-Dsc.1.91.

bre/tas, to/, gen. bre/teos, dat. bre/tei A.Eu.259 (lyr.): pl., nom. and acc. bre/tea Id.Supp.463, but bre/th Id.Th.95 (lyr.), 185, etc.; gen. brete/wn ib.97 (lyr.), Supp.429 (lyr.); Ep. dat. breta/essin Nic. Fr.74.68:—
wooden image of a god, A.Eu.80, al., E.Alc.974 (lyr.), Ar.Eq.31, etc.; of a man, IG7.118 (Megara): in Prose, Str.8.7.2, Jul.Or.1.29d.
mere image, of a
blockhead, Anaxandr.11.
bre/ttana: fobera/, Hsch.

*bre/ttios, a, on, Bruttian, glw=ssa B., i.e.
barbarous, Ar.Fr.629 (dub.); B., o(, = drape/ths, D.S.16.15; *bretti/a: me/laina pi/ssa, AB 223.
breu=kos, v. brou=kos.

brefiko/s, h/, o/n,
infantile, Ph.2.84, Eust.767.16.

brefo/qen, Adv.
from a child, Eust.14.20, etc.

brefo-kome/w,
nurse children, Eust.565.40.

brefo-kto/nos, on,
childmurdering, Lyc.229.

bre/fos, eos, to/,
babe in the womb, foetus, b. h(mi/onon kue/ousan, of a mare, Il.23.266, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic.2.222.
new-born babe, Simon.37.15, Pi.O.6.33, A.Ag.1096 (lyr.); ne/on b. E.Ba.289 [not in S.]: in later Prose, LXX Si.19.11, BGU1104.24 (i B. C.), etc.; of beasts,
foal, whelp, cub, etc., Hdt.3.153, Phylarch.36, Ael.NA3.8, Opp.H.5.464, etc.;
nestling, Horap.2.99; e)k bre/feos from
babyhood, AP9.567 (Antip.); a)po\ b. 2 Ep.Ti.3.15. (Cf. Slav.
žrěbę 'foal'.)

brefotrofe/w,
rear infants, Tz.H.9.513.

bref-o/w,
form into a foetus, engender, Eust.1535.44:—Pass., Theol.Ar.6.
bref-u/llion, to/, Dim. of bre/fos, Luc.Fug.19, Eust. 565.50.

bref-w/dhs, es,
childish, Ph.1.394, Diog.Oen.9, Procl.Par. Ptol.284.
bre/x-ma, atos, to/, = bre/gma, Alciphr.3.5.
brex-mo/s, o(, = foreg.1, Il.5.586, Nic.Th.219, Q.S.13.155.

bre/xw, fut. -cw LXX Am.4.7, al., (a)po-) Gal.6.591, etc.: aor. e)/breca Hp.Mul.1.78, Pl.Phdr.254c, X.An.4.3.12, etc.:—Pass., fut. bra^xh/somai LXX Is.34.3: aor. e)bre/xqhn E.El.326, X.An.1.4.17, etc.: aor. 2 e)bra/xhn [a^] Hp.Mul.1.80, Arist.Pr.906b26, Sotion p.190 W., Gal.6.270, Anacreont.31.26; but e)bre/xhn PGiss.160v12 (ii A. D.), Wilcken Chr.341.6 (ii A. D.): pf. be/bregmai Pi.O.6.55, Hp.
Acut.(Sp.）47:—
wet, of persons walking through water, to\ go/nu Hdt.1.189; tou\s po/das Pl.Phdr.229a;
steep in water, Hp.VM 3; e)n oi)/nw| Id.Fract.29; b. xruse/ais nifa/dessi po/lin
shower wealth upon it, Pi.O.7.34; dakru/oisin e)/brecan o(/lon ta/fon IG14.1422; b. e)n da/krusi th\n strwmnh/n LXX Ps.6.7, cf. 77(78).27:—Pass.,
get wet, brexo/menoi pro\s to\n o)mfalo/n X.An.4.5.2; bre/xesqai e)n u(/dati
to be bathed in sweat or
drench themselves, Hdt.3.104 (so i(drw=ti b. th\n yuxh/n Pl.Phdr.254c); bebregme/nos
filled with water, opp. diero/s, Arist.GC330a17; of sponges, Id.Mete.386b5; a)/lfita b. e)n u(/dati Hp.Mul.2.110;
to be rained upon, Plb.16.12.3; o)/mbrois Str. 15.1.13; esp. in Egypt of the inundation of the Nile, ta\ brexe/nta pedi/a PFlor.331.6 (ii A. D.); h( bebregme/nh (sc. gh=) PTeb.71.2 (ii B. C.), OGI669.57 (i A. D.); gh= ou) brexome/nh LXX Ez.22.24:—but also intr. in Act.,
to be inundated, PPetr.3p.119 (iii B. C.), PTeb.106.19 (ii B. C.): metaph., a)kti=si bebregme/nos
steeped, bathed in light, Pi.O. 6.55; siga=| bre/xesqai Id.Fr.240; of hard drinkers, me/qh| brexqei/s E.El.326; bebregme/nos
tipsy, Eub.126.
rain, send rain, Ev. Matt.5.45; *zeu\s e)/brexe POxy.1482.6 (ii A. D.): c. acc., e)/brece *ku/rios xa/lazan LXX Ex.9.23; qei=on ib.Ge.19.24, cf. Ev.Luc.17.29; a)/rtous Al.Ex.16.4. impers., bre/xei
it rains, Telecl.54, Ep.Jac.5.17; o(/tan bre/xh| Arr.Epict.1.6.26; also i(/na u(eto\s bre/xh| Apoc.11.6.
brh=gma, atos, to/, and brh/ssw, variants for bh=gma, bh/ssw, Gal.19.89, Hp. ap. AB223, Hsch.
*brhsagenh/s, title of Dionysus, IG12(2).478.2:—also brhssai=os Hsch.; and brhseu/s CIG3160 (Smyrna); cf. briseu/s.

brh/ssw,
bleat, Hsch.
brhto/s: a)lektruw\n e)niau/sios, Hsch.
bri=, = briqu/ (for briqe/ws), A.D.Adv.157.13, Hsch.; = briaro/n, Hes. Fr.236.
bri/a, h(, = po/lis (Thracian), Str.7.6.1; but, = kw/mh, Hsch.
briagxo/nh, v. ba/traxos.
*bri/akxos, h(, = ba/kxh, S.Fr.779 (expld. by briarw=s i)akxa/zousa, Hsch., EM213.26): name of a Satyr on vases, Berlin 2256, BMus. E.253.

*bri^a/rews [a^], o(, gen. *bria/rho lbyc.45, (bria^ro/s) a hundred-handed giant, Aegaeon, Il.1.403, Hes.Th.714: *bria/rew sth=lai, older name for the Pillars of Hercules, Arist.Fr.678; cf. o)/brimos. （-rews is monosyll. in Ep.）

bri^a^ro/s, a/, o/n, Ion. briero/s, h/, o/n, Ep. Adj.
strong, ko/rus, trufa/leia, Il.16.413, 19.381, cf. Coluth.30; de/mas Tryph.19; r(i/za Nic.Th. 659; do/mos *ou)lu/mpoio Orph.Fr.248; of persons, Nonn.D.28.172, al.; stratih/ Epigr.Gr.448; le/wn IG14.1293 C.

bri^a^ro/ths, htos, h(,
strength, might, Eust.1289.14.

bri^a^ro/xeir, eiros, o(, h(,
strong-handed, Eust.586.2.

bri^a/w, (bri=)
make strong and mighty, Hes.Th.447. intr.,
to be strong, bria/wn Opp.H.5.96: in both senses, [*zeu\s] r(e/a me\n ga\r bria/ei, r(e/a de\ bria/onta xale/ptei Hes.Op.5.
bri/gka: mikro/n (Cypr.), Hsch.

bri/gkos, o(, a
sea-fish, Ephipp.12.3, Mnesim.4.38.
brigkw/menon: o)rgizo/menon, qumou/menon, Hsch. (leg. brimw/menon).

brigxo/s, o/n, of taste, between drimu/s (
pungent) and strufno/s (
astringent), Apollon. ap. Lyd. Mens.4.125.
briero/s, v. briaro/s.

bri/za, h(,
rye, Secale cereale, in Thrace and Macedonia, Gal.6.514. (Probably a Thracian word, cognate with Lith.
rugiai 'rye', Engl.
rye, etc.) Aeol. for r(i/za, A.D. Adv.157.20, Greg.Cor.p.576 S.
brizw/, ou=s, h(, = e)nupnio/mantis, Semus 5.

bri^h/pu^os, on, (a)pu/w)
loud-shouting, of Ares, Il.13.521.
bri/hron: mega/lws kexarisme/non, Hsch. (Cf. h)=ra.)

bri=qos, eos, to/,
weight, Hp.Mul.1.48, E.Tr.1050, Plu.Marc.15; tw=n a)tuxhma/twn ta\ me
 e)/xei ti b. kai\ r(oph
 pro\s to
 bi/on Arist.EN 1101a29.

bri_qosu/nh, h(,
weight, Il.5.839, 12.460, Nonn.D.1.298.

bri_qu/-kerws, wn, gen. w,
with heavy horns, Opp.H.2.290.

bri_qu/-noos, on,
grave-minded, thoughtful, AP9.525.3.

bri_qu/s, ei=a, u/,
heavy, e)/gxos Il.5.746, etc.; once in Trag., briqu/teros A.Ag.200 (lyr.), cf. Id.Eleg.5, Q.S.3.540 (Comp.).

bri/qw [i_], Ep. subj. bri/qh|si Od.19.112: Ep. impf. bri=qon 9.219: fut. bri/sw B.9.47, Ep. inf. -e/men h.Cer.456: aor. e)/bri_sa Il.12.346, etc.: pf. be/bri_qa 16.384, Hp.Mul.2.133, E.El.305: plpf. bebri/qei Od. 16.474:—Pass. (v. infr.):—poet. Verb (also in later Prose, v. infr.),
to be heavy or
weighed down with, c. dat., stafulh=|si bri/qousan a)lwh/n Il.18.561; bri/qh|si de\ de/ndrea karpw=| Od.19.112, cf. 16.474; u(po\ lai/lapi . . be/briqe xqw/n (sc. u(/dati) Il.16.384; bo/trusi, karpoi=s, Jul. Or.3.113a, 7.230d: metaph., a)la/stwr ci/fesi bri/qwn E.Ph.1557 (lyr.); o)/lbw| b. Id.Tr.216 (lyr.); pi/nw| . . be/briqa Id.El.305; ka/tw b. peri\ th\n u)/lhn Iamb.Myst.5.11. c. gen.,
to be laden with or
full of, tra/pezai si/tou kai\ kreiw=n h)d' oi)/nou bebri/qasi Od.15.334; pa/nta d' e)ri/qwn a)raxna=n bri/qei S.Fr.286; pedia\s bri/qousa zw/|wn kai\ futw=n Ph. 2.217. c. acc., bou/brwstis fo/non bri/qousa Epigr.Gr.793.4. abs.,
to be heavy, e)/ris . . bebriqui=a ( = barei=a) Il.21.385; eu)/xesqai . . bri/qein *dhmh/teros i(ero\n a)kth/n Hes. Op.466; so in Hp. and later Prose, h(=| a)\n . . bri/sh| wherein
the weight is thrown, Hp.Flat.10; bebri/qasin oi( titqoi/
are loaded, Id.Mul.2.133, cf. Ph.1.330, etc.; e)s go/nata h( kefalh\ b. Philostr.Im.1.18: but rare in Att., bri/qei o( i(/ppos
bows or
sinks, Pl. Phdr.247b; o(/tan bri/sh| [o( ku/klos] e)pi\ qa/teron me/ros
inclines to one side, Arist.Pr.915b3: metaph., pa=| tu/xa bri/sei how Fortune
will incline the scales, B.9.47. of men,
outweigh, prevail, e)e/dnoisi bri/sas Od.6.159: abs.,
have the preponderance in fight, prevail, w(=de ga\r e)/brisan *auki/wn a)goi/ Il.12.346; th=| de\ ga\r e)/brisan . . *(/ektwr *ai)nei/as te 17.512; bri/santes e)/bhsan charged
with their might, ib.233; later eu)doci/a| b.
to be mighty in . . , Pi.N.3.40; ei) . . xeiri\ bri/qeis h)\ plou/tou ba/qei S.Aj.130. trans.,
weigh down, load, o(/sper *kinu/ran e)/brise plou/tw| Pi.N.8.18; ta/lanta bri/sas A.Pers.346. Pass.,
to be laden, mh/kwn karpw=| briqome/nh
laden with fruit, Il.8.307; mo/roisi bri/qetai [h( ba/tos] A.Fr.116; tw=| d' ou) bri/qetai [h( tra/peza]; E.Fr.467; e)bri/qonto a)i+o/nes [sw/masi] Tim.Pers.108; plou=ton xrusw=| kai\ a)rgu/rw| -o/menon Jul.Or.2.86b: c. gen., pe/thla briqo/mena staxu/wn Hes.Sc.290; sumposi/wn . . bri/qont' a)guiai/ B.Fr.3.12; briqome/nhs a)gaqw=n trape/zhs Pherecr.190 (hex.); briqome/nh xari/twn AP5.193 (Posidipp. or Asclep.): abs., a)/cones briqo/menoi A.Th.153 (lyr.). (Cf. bri=.)

bri/kelos, o(, a name of a
tragic mask, Cratin.205, acc. to Did. ap. Hsch. also expld. as = i(stopo/dhs or ba/rbaros （brici\n (leg. bru/cin） i)/kela: ou(/tw de\ e)/legon tou\s barba/rous Paus. Gr.Fr.95).
briki/nnh: ei)=dos bota/nhs, Hsch.

briki/smata, ta/, name of a Phrygian
dance, Hsch.
briko/n: o)/non (Cyren.), Hsch.: brikoi/: ponhroi/, Id.

bri_m-a/zw,
roar like a lion, Suid., Hsch.: c. acc.,
roar against, PMag.Par.1.2247 (s. v. l.); also, = o)rga=n e)s sunousi/an (Cypr.), Hsch.
bri_m-ai/nw, = brima/omai, EM213.45: also in Med., Hsch.

bri_m-a/omai,
snort with anger, to be indignant, ei) su\ brimh/saio Ar.Eq.855, cf. Phld.Ir.p.49 W.:—Act. in Hsch.

bri_/m-h, h(,
strength, might, h.Hom. 28.10, A.R.4.1677. = a)peilh/, Hsch.
bellowing, roaring, bri/mas taurei/ous a)fiei\s xaropou= te le/ontos prob. in Orph.Fr. 79. = gunaikei/a a)rrhtopoii/+a, Hsch.
bri_/m-hma, atos, to/, = bri/mh, prob. l. APl.4.103 (Gem.), cf. Hsch.

bri_m-o/omai, = brima/omai, e)brimou=to tw=| *ku/rw|
was indignant with Cyrus, X.Cyr.4.5.9 (expld. by a)peilei= Ael.Dion.Fr.95): abs., Ph.1.681.
bri_m-o/s: me/gas, xalepo/s, Hsch.

bri_m-w/, ou=s, h(, epith. of Hecate and Persephone,
the Terrible one, A.R.3.861, Orph.Fr.31, Luc.Nec.20.

bri_m-w/dhs, es,
grim, stern, dub. in Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.45 (Comp.).

bri_/m-wsis, ews, h(,
indignation, Phld.Ir.p.26 W.: pl., ib.p.52 W.

brindei=n: qumou=sqai, e)reqi/zein, Hsch. bri/nnia, ta/,
lamb's flesh, Id. bri/c: qridaki/nh, kai\ ei)=dos a)/nqous, oi( de\ peristerew=na, Id.

bri_s-a/rma^tos, on, (bri/qw)
chariot-pressing, epith. of Ares, Hes.Sc. 441, h.Hom.8.1: [*qh=bai] Pi.Dith.Oxy.1604 Fr.1 ii 26.

bri_s-au/xhn, enos,
neck-pressing, i.e.
heavy, Hsch. s.v. o( b.
*bri_seu/s, e/ws, o(, title of Dionysus at Smyrna, SIG851 (written *breis-, ii A. D.), Aristid. Or.41 (4).5, Macr.Sat.1.18.9; cf. *brhsagenh/s.

bri_so/ma^xos, on,
prevailing in fight, EM668.55.

*bri^to/martis, h(, acc. -in SIG527.29 (Dreros, iii B. C.; where B. is distd. fr. Artemis), name of Artemis in Crete, =
virgo dulcis, acc. to Solin. 11.8(but a nymph in Call.Dian.190): gen. -ews, Str.10.4.14; -idos, EM214.23:—hence *bri^toma/rtia, ta/, festival at Delos, IG11 (2).145.34. (Derived from bri/ton, = a)gaqo/n, acc. to EM214.29.)
bri/tos: e)/tos, Hsch. britu/: gluku/ (Cret.), Id.

brogx-ei=on, to/,
bronchial cartilage, S.E.M.8.252.

brogx-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(, imaginary
system of ducts connecting heart with liver, Hp.Anat. 1.

bro/gx-ia, wn, ta/,
bronchial tubes, Id.Acut.17, Ruf.Anat.25, 27, cj. in Arist.HA603a32: later in sg., Aret.SD1.10.
cartilaginous rings of the trachea, Gal.UP7.7: in sg.,
one such ring, Id.8.2.
gills of fish, Id.5.199.
tubes passing through the ethmoid bone, Hp.Carn.16.

brogx-ia/zw,
gulp down, Hsch.

brogxo-kh/lh, h(,
tumour in the throat, Sor.1.69, Gal.19.443, Aët. 15.6, Vett. Val.110.5.

brogxo-khliko/s, o/n,
suffering from brogxokh/lh, interpol. in Dsc.4.119.

brogxo-para/tacis, ews, h(,
competition in gluttony, Ath.7.298e.

bro/gxos, o(,
trachea, windpipe, Hp.Epid.5.68, Arist.Pr.900a13, Gal.UP7.11, etc. generally,
throat, Hp.Aph.6.37, Aret.SA1.6.
gulp, draught, yuxrou= Apollon. ap. Arr.Epict.3.12.17. = ba/traxos, Hsch.

brogxwth/r, h=ros, o(,
neck-hole in a garment, J.AJ3.7.2.

brododa/ktulos, on, = r(odo-,
rosy-fingered, mh/na (leg. sela/nna) Sapph.Supp.25.8.
bro/don, i.e. vr-, Aeol. for r(o/don, Sapph.68.2, Supp.25.13, A.D. Adv.157.20.
brodo/pa_xus, = r(odo/phxus, Sapph.65.
bro/kos, = brou=kos, Hsch. = sq., in later Greek, Id.

bro/kwn, o(,
boorish person, Hsch.

brome/w, = bre/mw, only used in pres. and impf. (exc. fut. bromh/sw EM214.36); of flies,
buzz, Il.16.642; of wind,
roar, qu/ellai b. A.R. 4.787, cf. Nic.Al.596; of boiling broth, Id.Fr.68.5; also i)=sa *dii\ brome/ei, of a proud person, Rhian. 1.13.
bromi-a/zomai, = *bakxeu/w, from *bro/mios, AP9.774 (Glauc.).

bromi-a/s, a/dos, h(, fem. of sq. 11, qoi/na Pi.Dith.Oxy.1604 Fr.1 i 11; phgh/ Antiph. 52.12.
large cup, Ath.11.784d.

bro/mi-os, a, on, (bro/mos)
sounding, fo/rmigc Pi.N.9.8;
noisy, boisterous, whence, *bro/mios, o(, as a name of Bacchus, Id.Fr.75.10, A.Eu.24, E.Ph.649 (lyr.), al., Telecl. 55; w)= *dio/nuse B. Ar.Th.991; *bromi/ou pw=ma, i.e. wine, E.Cyc.123; podapo\s o( *bro/mios
; whence comes the
wine? Alex. 230.3, cf. APl.4.309, AP9.368 (Jul. Imp., with play on bro/mos (B)). Adj. *bro/mios, a, on, Bacchic, E.HF893 (lyr.), etc.; *b. xa/ris, of the Dionysia, Ar.Nu.311:—also *bromiw/dgs, es, Bacchic, phlo/s, of a drinking-cup, AP11.27 (Maced.): fem. *bromiw=tis, idos, h(, Opp.C.4.340: as Subst., Bacchante, ib.300. bro/mion, to/, name of a
plaster, Orib.Fr.90.

bro/mos (A), o(, (bre/mw)
any loud noise, as the
crackling of fire, Il.14.396, Thphr.Fr.165;
roaring of thunder, Pi.O.2.27; of a storm, A. Th.213 (lyr.), Fr.195 codd.; of the drum, [Simon.]179.7; of horses, A. Th.476; e)la/fw b.
belling, Alc.97 (cf. Poxy.1789.29); of the flute, h.Merc.452, cf. S.Fr.513: hence,
rage, fury, E.HF1212:— rare in Prose, bro/moi kai\ o)lolugmoi/ Epicur.Fr.143; of thunder, earthquake, or sea, Arist.Mu.395a13,396a12, Mir.843a8; of a volcano, Id.Fr.634. to/pos ei)s o(\n e)/lafoi ou)rou=si kai\ a)fodeu/ousi, Hsch.

bro/mos (B), also bo/rmos (Dieuch. ap. Orib.4.7.20, Hsch.), o(,
oats, Avena sativa, Hp.Vict.2.43, Dsc.2.94, Polem.Hist.88.
wild oats, Avena barbata, Thphr.HP8.9.2, Ps.-Dsc.4.137: also, = ai)gi/lwy, ibid.
bromw/dhs, freq. f.l. for brwm- (q. v.), Ath.3.88a, Plu.2.792b, etc.

bront-a^gwgo/s,
bringing thunder, PMag.Par.1.182.
bront-a/zw, = brontw=, ib. 1039, Hsch.

bront-ai=os, a, on,
thundering, *zeu/s Arist.Mu. 401a17, Orph.H.15.9; u(/dwr b. thunder-
rain, Hp.Epid.6.4.17.

bront-a/w,
thunder, *zeu\s d' a)/mudis bro/nthse Od.14.305, cf. Il.8.133; bronta=n ou)k e)mo\n a)lla\ *dio/s Call.Fr.490; so *brontw=n, title of Zeus in Phrygia, JHS5.258, etc. (but brontw=n qeo/s, =
Jupiter Tonans, IG14.982, cf.
D.C.54.4): metaph. of Pericles, Ar.Ach.531, cf. V.624; of a seller asking too high a price, Herod.7.65. impers., xeime/ria bronta=|
it thunders, Ar.Fr.46; bronth/santos
if it thunders, Arist.HA610b35. Pass.,
to be thunderstruck, Id.Div.Somn.463a13.

bront-ei=on, to/,
engine for making stage-thunder, Poll.4.130.

bront-h/, h(,
thunder, *dio\s mega/loio kerauno\n deinh/n te b. Il.21.199; u(po\ bronth=s patro\s *dio/s 13.796; *zhno/s te bronth=| Od.20.121; a)straph\ kai\ b. Hdt.3.86; b. steroph=| te A.Supp.34 (anap.); b. kai\ kerauni/a| flogi/ Id.Pr.1017; bronth=s mu/khma ib.1062 (anap.), cf. 1083 (anap.); b. d' e)rra/gh di' a)straph=s S.Fr.578, etc.: in pl., Id.OC1514, X.HG1.6.28, Thphr. Sign.21, etc.; xqo/niai b. Ar.Av.1745: metaph., tou/tou ta\s b. oi)=d' o(/ti dei/seis Lib.Ep.98.4.
the state of one struck with thunder, astonishment, e)pea/n sfi qeo\s e)mba/lh| b. Hdt.7.10.e/. （bromta_, cf. bre/mw.)

bro/nt-hma, atos, to/,
thunder-clap, A.Pr.993. = e)mbro/nthtos, Hsch.
bro/nt-hs, ou, o(, Thunderer, one of the three Cyclopes, Hes.Th.140.

bront-hsike/raunos, on,
sending thunder and lightning, *nefe/lai Ar.Nu.265 (anap.).

bront-h/sios *zeu/s, =
Jupiter Tonans, Mon.Anc.Gr.18.21.

bront-htiko/s,
thundering, epith. of *zeu/s, Eust. 141.27.

bronto-keraunopa/twr [a^], oros, o(,
father of the thunderbolt, epith. of Kronos, PMag.Par.1.3102.

bronto-poio/s, o/n,
thunder-making, Vett. Val.6.24, Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.4,24.

bronto-skopi/a, h(,
divination from thunder, Lyd.Ost.27 tit., al.

brontw/dhs, es,
like thunder, thundering, ktu/poi Agath.5.8, cf. Lyd. Ost.42, al., Sch.Ar.Ra.826.
charged with thunder, Vett.Val. 14.17, Ptol. Tetr.94.
bro/cai, v. *bro/xw.
bro/sswn, Aeol., = bra/sswn, Hsch.
bro/ta^xos, o(, Ion. for ba/traxos (q. v.), Xenoph.40.

bro/teios, on, also a, on Archil.15, Emp.2.9, E.Hipp.19, Supp.777:— poet.Adj.
mortal, human, A.Pr.116 (lyr.), etc.; b. mh=tis Emp.l.c.; b. ge/nos E.Fr.898.13; yuxh\n brotei/an Id.Supp.777; b. po/noi
of mortals, Alex.240.9:—in Hom. only bro/teos, h, on, fwnh/ Od.19.545; eu)nh/ h.Ven.47; also in Pi.O.9.34, Emp.100.17, A.Eu.171 (lyr.).
broth/sios, a, on, = foreg., e)/rga Hes.Op.773; a)nh/r Pi.P.5.3; de/mas Id.Pae.6.79; morfh/ E.Ba.4, Or.271; fqoggh/ Lyc.1321: in late Prose, b. ge/nos PMasp.151.18(vi A. D.).

broto-ba/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos,
trampling on men, AP15.21 (Theoc.).

broto/-ghrus, u,
with human voice, yittako/s ib.9.562 (Crin.).
broto-dai/mwn, o(, = h(mi/qeos, Hsch.

broto-eidh/s, e/s,
like a man, dei/khlon Man.6.446.

broto/-eis, essa, en, (bro/tos)
gory, e)/nara Il.6.480, etc.; a)ndra/gria 14.509. = bro/teios, Nonn.D.47.431 (s. v. l.).

broto-ke/rths, ou, o(, (kei/rw)
man-shaver, pedantic word for
barber, Alexarch. ap. Heraclid.Lemb.5.

broto-klw/steira, h(,
weaving the destiny of mortals, ko/smoio xorei/h Man.4.11.

broto-ktone/w,
murder men, A.Eu.421.

broto-kto/nos, on,
man-slaying, homicidal, qusi/ai E. IT384 (lyr.); kra/neia AP6.123 (Anyte): *)/arhs Orph.H.65.2; ou) th\n *oi)dipo/dao brotokto/non his
murderess, i. e. the Sphinx, Epigr.Gr. 1015.

broto-loigo/s, o/n,
plague of man, bane of men, *)/arhs Il.5.31, al., Od.8.115; of Apollo, Epigr.Gr.1034.29; once in Trag., A.Supp. 665 (lyr.); e)/rws AP5.179（Mel.).

broto/omai, Pass., (bro/tos)
to be stained with gore, bebrotwme/na teu/xea Od.11.41, Q.S.1.717; dra/kwn ka/ra bebr. Stesich.42.

broto/pous i(/ppos horse
with human feet, coin-legend in Head
Historia Numorum p.517 (Nicaea).

broto/s, o(, poet. Noun,
mortal man, opp. a)qa/natos or qeo/s, in Hom. usu. Subst., oi(=oi nu=n brotoi/ ei)si Il.5.304, al.; broto\s ei)s qeo/n E. Andr.1196 (lyr.); lo/gos tis *zh=na mixqh=nai brotw=| A.Supp.295; qeou= de\ plhgh\n ou)x u(perphda=| broto/s S.Fr.961; brotoi/,opp.nekroi/, Id.Ant. 850 (lyr.); but b. a)nh/r Il.5.361; and so b. e)/qnos Pi.P.10.28: as fem., b. au)dh/essa Od.5.334; b. ou)=san AP9.89 (Phil.); but brotai/: gunai=kes, Hsch. (s.v.l.): freq. in gen. pl., after polloi/ B.1.42, S.OT 981, etc.; after ti/s ib.437, etc.; brotoi/ never takes the Art. in Trag. and Com., exc. when an Adj. or Pron. is added, tw=n polupo/nwn b. E.Or.175; h(mei=s oi( b. Ar.Eq.601, Pax849, cf. Sannyr.1; oi( talai/pwroi b. Alex.66; oi( pa/ntes b. Men.538.8.—Rare in Prose, Pl. R.566d, Arist.Top.133a31, 149a7. of the
dead, A.Ch.129 (v.l. nekroi=s Sch.). (From *mroto/s (cf. a)/-mbrotos, morto/s), Skt.
mṛtás 'dead', Lat.
morior, etc.)

bro/tos, o(,
blood that has run from a wound, gore, in Il. always ai(mato/eis, 7.425, al.; me/las Od.24.189.

broto-sko/pos, on,
taking note of man, *erinu/es A.Eu.499 (lyr.).

broto-sso/os, on, (sao/w, sw/|zw)
man-saving, Orph.L.756.
broto-sto/nos klu/dwn dub. in E.Fr.669.

broto-stu^gh/s, e/s,
hated by men, *gorgo/nes A.Pr.799; dno/foi Id.Ch.51 (lyr.).

broto-feggh/s, e/s,
giving light to men, ai)/glh AP9.399.

broto/-fhlos, on,
deceiving men, Hsch.

broto-fqo/ros, on,
man-destroying, A.Eu.787 (lyr.), Supp.264, etc. sku=la brotofqo/ra
of slain men, E.Fr.266.

brotwfelh/s, e/s,
helpful to men, mele/ta B.12.191.
brou=, v. bru=n.

brou=kos, o(,
locust, or its
wingless larva (Ionic acc. to Hsch.), Thphr.Fr.174.4; brou=xos LXXLe.11.22, al., Ph.1.85, Lyd.Ost.56; collective in sg., Heph.Astr.1.20; Cypr. brou=ka, Hsch.; breu=kos (Cret. acc. to Hsch.), prob.as sobriquet in Herod.2.73.
broulloku/peros, h(, a kind of ku/peros, Aët.1.132.

broulo/s: ponhro/s, Hsch. brou=nos: e)neo\s h)\ maino/menos, Id. brou/c: tra/xhlos, bro/gxos, Id. brou/tides: gunai=kes ou(/tw kalou/menai, Cyr., Suid. brou=tos, = bru=tos, Hsch. brou=xal: qermo/s, Id. brou/xetos: ba/rbaros: also, = ba/traxos (Cypr.), Id.

broxeto/s, o(, (bre/xw)
wetting, rain, AP6.21.3.

broxh/, h(, (bre/xw)
rain, Democr.14.8, LXX Ps.67(68).10, Ev.Matt. 7.25, Ph.1.48, Gp.2.39.7.
moistening, Dsc.1.49, Philagr. ap. Orib.5.32.1, Mnesith.ib.8.35.11;
steeping, in brewing, PTeb.401.27 (i A. D.).
inundation of the Nile, in pl., POxy.280.5 (i A. D.), Heph.Astr.1.23.
irrigation, Thphr.HP9.6.3, PPetr.3p.119 (iii B. C.).

broxqi/zw,
take a mouthful, Arist.Pr.948a5.
clear the throat, tini/ with . . , Clearch.Com.2.
give to drink, Aq.Ge.24.17.

bro/xqos, o(,
throat, Theoc.3.54.
throatful (as vomited), Hp.Morb.2.69,74.
draught (that which can be swallowed at a gulp, Sch.Nic.Th.366), AP11.298, Phld.Mort.33.

broxqw/dhs, es,
shallow (acc. to Sch., cf. bro/xqos 11.2), limnh Nic. Th.366; to/pos tou= *nei/lou EM206.28.

broxi/zw,
hang, strangle, e(auto/n POxy.850.6; cf. Hsch.s.v.a)law=n: —Pass.,
to be ligatured, Gal.4.679.

broxiko/s, h/, o/n,
rainy, zw/|dia Cat.Cod.Astr.1.133.21,31.

bro/xion, to/,
pot, me/lanos POxy.326 (i A. D.).

broxi/s, i/dos, h(, Dim. of bro/xos, Opp.H.3.595; of a spider's
web, AP9.372 (pl.). (bre/xw)
ink-horn, ib.6.295 (Phan.). a measure of length, IG12(3).1232.10 (Melos).
brox-mo/s, = bre/gma, Hsch.; from bre/xw, EM285.16.

brox-mw/dhs, es,
damp, Democr.133.
bro/xus, Thess. and Aeol., = braxu/s, Sapph.2.7, IG9(2).460.13 (as pr.n. *bro/xus) ; cf. bro/sswn.

*bro/xw,
gulp down, only aor. 1 e)/broca AP9.1 (Polyaen.), subj. bro/ch| （brw/ch| codd.) ib.11.271, inf. bro/cai: r(ofh=sai, Hsch.: used by Hom. only in compds., a)nabro/cai,
swallow again, suck down again, a)ll' o(/t' a)nabro/ceie . . a(lmuro\n u(/dwr, opp. o(/t' e)ceme/seie, of Charybdis, Od.12.240; pa/ntas a)nabro/casa A.R.4.826; a(/lis a)nabe/broxen (Zenod., -be/bruxen vulg.) u(/dwr
has drunk up water enough, Il.17.54:—Pass., u(/dwr a)pole/sket' a)nabroxe/n Od.11.586. katabro/cai
gulp down (katabro/cai: katapiei=n, Hsch.), o(\s to\ katabro/ceie whoever
swallowed the potion, Od.4.222: aor. part. Pass. katabroxqei/s Lyc.55: misspelt kata-brw/ch| Id.742, -brw/ceie D.P.604, -brw/cas A.R.2.271.

broxwto/s, o/n,
formed by a noose, a)gxo/nh Neophr.3.2.
twisted, corded, of chain-work, b. e)/rgon Aq., Sm.Ex.28.15.
bru=, v. bru=n.
bru/a, h(, = muri/kh, Plin.HN13.116.

bru^-a/zw, fut. brua/somai Hsch., aor. a)n-ebru/aca Ar.Eq.602, other wise only pres.and impf.:—
swell, teem, karpoi=si b. Orph.H.53.10, cf. 33.7; o(po/tan ge [*zeu\s] brua/zwn oi)=kon e)se/lqh| ib.73.4; of a lioness,
to be pregnant, A.Fr.491;
bubble up, de/pas a)frw=| brua/zon Tim.Fr.7: metaph.,
wax wanton, A.Supp.878; a( li/qos oi)=de brua/zein AP9.756 (Aemil.): c. dat.,
revel in, Epicur.Fr.181; xai/rein kai\ b. prob. l. Id.Fr.600, cf. 605; ai( gunai=kes e)bru/azon tai=s *dwri/ais stolai=s Duris 50; tou= potou= lamprw=s h)/dh -ontos Hld.5.16.
bru/aq<m>on: bruasmo/n, Hsch., cf. Hymn.Is.89 (dub. sens.).

brua/kths, ou, o(, of Pan,
the jolly god, Poet. ap. Stob.1.1.30.

bru^a^l-igmo/s, o(,
noise, Hsch.
bru^a^l-i/zwn: diarrh/sswn, Id.

bru^a^l-i/kths or brualli/kths, ou, o(,
one who performs in a kind of war-dance, Stesich.79, Ibyc.53.
bruaniw=n (-i/wn cod.): metewrizo/menos kai\ korwn<i>w=n, Hsch.
bru/as, ou, o(, v. bu/as.

bruasmo/s, o(,
voluptuousness, Plu.2.1107a. b<r>uata/: bebusme/na au(/th, Hsch.

bru/g-dhn, Adv., (bru/kw) properly,
with clenched teeth: of a polypus,
tightly, AP9.14 (Antiphil.).

bru/g-ma, atos, to/,
a bite, gnawing, Nic.Th.483.

brugko/s: a)/fwnos, nekro/s, Hsch. brugxo/s, = bro/xos, Id. brudali/xa, h(,
female mask; also,
lewd woman (Lacon.), Id.

bru/zw, dub. sens. in Archil.32.2. Pass., e)bru/sqh: e)/pesen, Hsch. (Cf. Lith.
griúti 'collapse'.)

bru/qakes,
silken tunics, Hsch. bru/kai: ai( i(erai/ (leg. bru/kainai: i(erai/) (Dorian), Id. bru_ka^na/omai, = brux-, Id. brukedano/s: polufa/gos, oi( de\ makro/s, Id. bruketo/s, = brugmo/s, Id. bru/kos: kh=ruc (cf. bru/oxos）, oi( de\ ba/rbaros (cf. brou/xetos）, oi( de\ a)tte/lebos (cf. brou=kos), Id. bruktai/a, a kind of
plant, Id.

bru/kw or bru/xw [u_] (the former Att. acc. to Moer. and Ammon.; the distn. bru/kw
bite, bru/xw
gnash does not hold good), mostly pres.: fut. bru/cw Hp.Mul.1.2, Lyc.678: aor. e)/bruca Hp. Epid.5.86, Nic.Th.207, al., AP7.624 (Diod.), (e)p-) Archipp.35: aor. 2 e)/bru^xe AP9.252 (late, perh. impf.): for be/bru_xa, v. bruxa/omai: —Pass., v. infr.:—
eat greedily, gobble, gna/qos i(ppei/h bru/kei
champs the bit, Hom.Epigr.14.13; e(fqa\ kai\ o)pta\ [kre/a] . . bru/kein E. Cyc.358, cf. 372; pro\s tau=ta bru/ket' Ar.Pax1315;
bite, bru/kous' a)pe/desqai . . tou\s daktu/lous
biting, Id.Av.26; of smoke, o)da\c e)/bruke
ta\s lh/mas e)mou= Id.Lys.301; later, simply,
devour, consume, Nic.Al. 489, al.; bru/cas, of the sea, is perh. f.l. for bro/cas in AP7.624 (Diod.): metaph.,
tear in pieces, devour, of a gnawing disease, bru/kei S.Tr.987 (lyr.); bru/kei ga\r a(/pan to\ paro/n Cratin.58; ta\ patrw=|a bru/kei Diph. 43.27:—Pass., a)po/lwla, te/knon, bru/komai S.Ph.745; bruxqei\s a(li/ AP9.267 (Phil.).
gnash or
grind the teeth, tou\s o)do/ntas bru/xei Hp.Mul.1.7, etc., cf. AP15.51 (Arch.); to\ sto/ma b. Babr.95.45; b. tou\s o)do/ntas e)pi/ tina Act.Ap.7.54; also bru/xei alone, Hp. Mul.2.120; also intr., oi( o)do/ntes bru/xousi ib.1.36; bru=kon sto/ma Nic. Al.226, cf. Th.207, al.:—Med., bru/xontai Hp.Morb.Sacr.1 (prob.).

brullixi/zein,
wear a female mask, Hsch.; also, = a)ktai/nein, Id.:— Subst. brug-isth/s, cf. brudali/xa.

bru/llw,
cry for drink, of children (cf. bru=n), Ar.Eq.1126, cf. Sch. bru/llwn: u(popi/nwn, Hsch.
bru/mata: mhru/mata, Hsch. (murh/m- cod.).

bru=n ei)pei=n cry for
drink, of children, Ar.Nu.1382:—also bru= or brou=, Phryn.PSp.55 B., AB85 (brou=s Hsch.).
brunxo/n: kiqa/ran (Thracian), Hsch.

*bru/c, in acc. bru/xa,
depth of the sea, Opp.H.2.588: gen. bruxo/s prob. l. in Orph.A.1066.

bru^o/eis, essa, en,
weedy, potamo/s Nic.Th.208.
flourishing, Id.Al.371, 478.

bru/on [u^], to/, （bru/w)
oyster-green, Ulva Lactuca, b. qala/ssion Hp. Mul.1.53, cf. Arist.HA591b12, Dsc.4.98: pl., Plu.Caes.52; b. alone, Nic. Th.792; also, a
marsh-plant, ib.415.
tree-moss, Usnea barbata, Theoc.21.7, Dsc.1.21.
liverwort, Marchantia polymorpha, Id.4.53.
clustering male blossom of the hazel, Arist. HA624a34: generally,
catkin, Thphr.HP3.7.3, Nic.Th.71,898. = kaukali/s, Democr. ap. Ps.-Dsc.2.139.

bru^o/omai, aor. e)bruw/qhn, Pass.,
to be grown over with bru/on, Arist. Col.791b26, 792a1.

bru^ofo/ros, on,
catkin-bearing, Thphr.CP2.11.4.
bru/oxon: kh/ruka, Hsch. bru/sdhn: xu/dhn, Id. (cod. bru/gdhn).

bru/sis [u^], ews, h(,
bubbling up, Suid., Eust.1095.16: brusmo/s, o(, Arc.58.24.

bru/ssos, Att. bru/g-ttos, o(, a kind of
sea-urchin, Arist.HA530b5, Hsch.
bru/stai: krhmnoi/, also as place-name, Hsch.

*bru_swnoqra^su^ma^xeiolhyi^ke/rma^tos, on,
taking coin like Bryso and Thrasymachus, Ephipp.14.3.
bru/tana, bu/tana, Hdn.Gr.2.484.
bru^ta^nei=on, -eu/w, v. prut-.

bru/tea or bru/tia (so prob. in Cerc.4.34 [u_]), ta/, = ste/mfula,
refuse of olives or
grapes after pressing, Ath.2.56d, Hdn.Gr.2.484 (also expld. as ei)=dos skoro/dou, Hsch.): metaph., ta\ d' e)/sxata b. *musw=n Cerc. l.c.; to\ tw=n brute/wn po/ma Aret.SA1.9, SD2.9.
bru/thr (i. e. vru/-), hros, o(, Acol. for r(uth/r, A.D.Adv.157.20; = r(o/mbos, EM706.31.
brutiggoi/: xitw=nes, Hsch.

bru_t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
drunken with beer, Antiph.45 (codd. Ath.).

bru_/t-inos, h, on,
of or
for bru=ton, Cratin.96 (para\ prosdoki/an for bu/ssinos).
bru^ti/s, = r(uti/s, EM214.32.
bru/tixoi: ba/traxoi mikroi\ e)/xontes ou)ra/s, Hsch.
brutoni/a: r(i/za tis, Hsch.
bru/ton: zw=|on o(/moion kanqa/rw|, Hsch. s.v. bruti/nh.

bru=tos, o( (S.Fr.610), bru=ton, to/ (Ath.10.447c), elsewh. the gender is dub.:—
fermented liquor made from barley,
beer, Archil.32, Hecat.154J., Hellanic.66J., A.Fr.124.
bru/ttein: e)sqi/ein, Hsch.; also, = pure/ttein, EM216.25; = o)ru/ttein, Lex.Rhet.ib.28. bru/ttion: po/ma e)k kriqh=s, Hsch.
bruxa/na, = buka/nh, Hsch.
bru_xa^na/omai, rarer form of sq., Nic.Al.221.

bru_x-a/omai, aor. e)bruxhsa/mhn, Ep. brux- A.R.4.19, Max.Tyr. 31.3, D.C.68.24, (a)n-) Pl.Phd.117d; also e)bruxh/qhn (v. infr.): Ep. pf. be/bru_xa Od.5.412, al.: plpf. e)bebru/xei 12.242:—onomatop. Verb,
roar, bellow, prop. of lions, acc. to Hsch. and Ammon.; of a bull, tau=ros w(\s bruxw/menos S.Aj.322, cf. Ar.Ra.823; of wild beasts, deino\n d' e)bruxw=nto Theoc.25.137; of the elephant, Plu.Pyrrh.33: in Il. mostly of the
death-cry of wounded men, kei=to tanusqei/s, bebruxw/s 13.393; so bruxw/menon spasmoi=si, of Hercules, S.Tr.805, cf. 904; be/bruxa klai/wn ib.1072; deina\ bruxhqei/s Id.OT1265; later, of an infant's
wail, Men.1004; klai/wn kai\ b. Alciphr.1.35; also of
the roaring of waves, a)mfi\ de\ ku=ma be/bruxen r(o/qion Od.5.412, cf. Il.17.264; a)mfi\ de\ pe/trh deino\n bebru/xei Od.12.242, cf. Aristid.Or.17(15).14; bruxome/nh (as if from bru/xomai) is required by the metre in Q.S. 14.484, cf. bru/xetai: mai/netai, Hsch.; but bruxw=ntai, -w/menos shd. be read in Hp.Morb.Sacr.1, Luc.DMar.1.4.

bru_x-eto/s, o(, (bru/xw)
chattering of teeth, ague, Hsch.

bru_x-h/, h(, (bru/xw)
gnashing of teeth, o)do/ntwn A.R.2.83, Q.S.5.392. (bruxa/omai)
bellowing, Opp. H.2.530.

bru_x-hdo/n, Adv., (bru/xw)
with gnashing of teeth, AP9.371. (bruxa/omai)
with bellowing, A.R.3.1374, Nonn.D.29.311.

bru_x-hqmo/s, o(,
roaring, of the sea or a river, Arist.Mir.843a22, Opp.C.4.171 (pl.); le/ontos Max. Tyr.31.3, cf. Aesop.226. (bru/xw)
gnashing of teeth,
lamentation, Men.Epit.472.

bru_/x-hma, atos, to/,
roar, roaring, le/ontos APl.4.94 (Arch.), cf. Opp.C.3.36; improperly of sheep (cf. blhxa/omai), A.Fr.158 (pl.); of men, Plu.Mar.20, Alex. 51.

bru_x-hth/r, h=ros, o(,
roarer, of the constellation Leo, Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr.3.36.

bru_x-hth/s, ou=, o(,
roaring, b. xo/los AP6.57 (Paul. Sil.).

bru_x-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
roaring, bellowing, Tz.ad Lyc.739.

bruxia/w,
chatter (?), of a defect of speech, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.167.

bru/xios [u^], a, on, also os, on A.Pers.397: (*bru/c):—
from the depths of the sea, deep, a(/lmh A. l.c., Tim.Pers.96; a(/ls A.R. 1.1310; bruxi/a h)xw\ bronth=s the sound of thunder
from the deep, A.Pr.1082 (lyr.): metaph., bru/xion u(poste/nein heave a
deep sigh, Hld.6.9.
bruxi/s: klh=ma, Hsch.
bruxmh/, h(, f.l. for bruxh/, Q.S.4.241. bruxmo/s, v. brugmo/s.
bruxo/s, = bru/kos, Hsch. bru/xw, v. bru/kw; but bruxomai, v. bruxa/omai.

bru/w [u^], mostly pres.: impf., Pherecyd.Syr. ap. D.L.1.122, Nicaenet.7: aor. part. bru/sas Procop. (v. infr.):—
to be full to bursting: c. dat.,
swell or
teem with, esp. of plants, e)/rnos . . bru/ei a)/nqei+ leukw=|
swells with white bloom, Il.17.56, cf. E.Ba. 107 (lyr.); kissw=| ka/ra bru/ousan Eub.56.6; i)ou/lw|, qrici/, ko/mais, Philostr.Her.2.2, Alciphr.3.31, Luc.Am.12; gh= futoi=s bru/ousa Arist.Mu.392b15; also bru/ei i(era\ bouqu/tois e(ortai=s B.3.15: metaph., bi/os . . bru/wn meli/ttais kai\ proba/tois ktl. Ar.Nu.45; of men, b. do/ca| B.12.179; pamma/xw| qra/sei bru/wn A.Ag.169 (lyr.); a)gaqoi=si bru/ois Id.Supp.966 (anap.); mantikh=| b. te/xnh| Id.Fr.350.6; a)/llwn i)atro\s au)to\s e(/lkesi bru/wn E.Fr.1086; b. a)/nqesin h(/bas Tim.Pers.221; bru/ousan a)oida\n sofi/a| Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 20.4; e)mpo/rion plou/tw| bru/on Jul.Or.2.71d. c. gen.,
to be full of, xw=ros . . bru/wn da/fnhs e)lai/as a)mpe/lou S.OC16; bru/onta ste/fanon mu/rtwn Ar.Ra.329 (lyr.); stefa/nwn do/mos e)/bruen prob. l. in Nicaenet. l.c.; tra/pezan . . ko/smou bru/ousan Alex.86.3; karpo/n . . bru/ein smara/gdou li/qou Philostr.VA5.5; to/pos b. u(/lhs J.AJ13.3.1; fqeirw=n e)/bruon pa=s Pherecyd.Syr. l.c.: metaph., no/sou b. A.Ch.70. abs.,
abound, grow luxuriantly, S.El.422; of the earth,
teem with produce, X.Cyn.5.12, cf. Philostr. VA3.56; of water,
burst forth, u(/dwr bru/san e)c u(pono/mwn Procop.Arc.19. c. acc. cogn.,
burst forth with, gush with, gluku/, pikro\n [u(/dwr] Ep.Jac.3.11; th\n gh=n ta\ oi)kei=a bru/ein fhsi\n a)gaqa/ Ael.Fr.25; causal, *(=wrai b. leimw=nas Him.Or.1.19; r(o/da Anacreont.44.2.—Poet. and later Prose.

bru^w/dhs, es,
full of seaweed, Arist.HA543b1; ta\ b., =
seaweed, Gp.2.22.2; of a ship, b. e)pipa/gous prosa/gesqai Plu.2.641e. '
mossy', flabby, sa\rc pladaro\s kai\ b. Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.62, cf. Gal.10.195, Sor.1.82,95.
catkin-like, a)/nqos Dsc.1.87, 4.181. = dusw/dhs, Hsch.
bru^-w/nh, h(, = a)/mpelos me/laina, Nic.Th.939:—also bru^-wni/s, i/dos, h(, ib.858; cf.sq.

bru^-wni/a, h(, prop. = a)/mpelos me/laina, Dsc.4.183; also, = a)/mpelos leukh/,
bryony, ib.182, cf. Gal.11.827; b. a)gri/a, = xamai/pitus, Ps.-Dsc.3.158; b., fu/llon, ib.125.
bru^-wnia/s, a/dos, h(, = foreg., Colum.10.250.
brw/zw, = bibrw/skw, Herod.7.63.

brw=ma, atos, to/, (bibrw/skw)
that which is eaten, food, meat, Hp. VM6, Th.4.26, al.: metaph., Ar.Fr.333: freq. in pl., Hp.VM3, Antiph.246, Pl.Criti.115b, etc.; opp. o)/ya, Sosip.1.30.
cavity in a tooth, Hp.Epid.4.25, Dse.1.105, Archig. ap. Gal.12.859.
moth-eating, in pl., LXX Ep.Je.12. pl.,
filth, ordure, prob. in Ev.Marc.7.19; cf. brw=mos (B).

brwma/omai, (bre/mw)
bray, brwmhsa/menos Ar.V.618;
bellow, of the stag or hart, Arist.HA579a1.
suffer hunger, Hsch. (also aor. Act.).

brwma^ti/zw,
give to eat, Aq.De.8.3.
brwma/tion, to/, Dim. of brw=ma, Ath.3.111a.

brwma^tomica^pa/th [pa^], h(,
the false pleasure of eating made dishes, AP9.642 (Agath.).

brwm-e/w, (brw=mos)
smell rank, Al.Ex.7.18.
brw/m-h, h(, （bibrw/skw） = brw=ma, Od.10.460, Nic.Al.499, A.R.3.1058, Opp.C.2.352.

brwm-h/eis, essa, en, (brwma/omai)
brayer, i. e.
ass, Nic.Al.409,486.

brw/m-hsis, ews, h(,
braying of an ass, Ael.NA3.7, Poll.5.88.
brwm-hsth/s, ou=, o(, = sq., EM215.57; also, = xortofa/gos, ibid.

brwm-hth/s, ou=, o(,
brayer, i. e.
ass, Nic.Fr.74.30.
brwm-h/twr, oros, o(, = foreg., Id.Th.357.

brwmolo/gos, on,
foul-mouthed, Luc.Pseudol.24.
brw=mos (A), o(, （bibrw/skw） = brw=ma, Arat.1021.

brw=mos (B), o(,
stink, noisome smell, LXX Jb.6.7, al., Gal.7.214, Sch.Nic.Al.519, Dsc.Alex.Praef. (Condemned by Phryn.133; bro/mos is freq. f. l.)

brwmw/dhs, es,
stinking, foul-smelling, Str.5.4.6, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.8.355f, Diocl.Fr.138, Dsc.1.7, etc.; cf. bromw/dhs.

brwsei/w, Desiderat. of bibrw/skw,
to be hungry, Call.Fr.435.

brw/simos, on,
eatable, A.Pr.479, diph.13, LXX Le.19.23, Ev.Luc. 24.41; a(\ kai\ kusi\n peinw=sin ou)xi\ brw/sima Trag.Adesp.118.4.

brw=sis, ews, h(, Ep. brw/m-ios Hes.Th.797: (bibrw/skw):—
meat, opp. po/sis, Od.15.490, cf. Hp.Acut. 28, X.Mem.1.3.15, Pl.Lg.783c: in pl., opp. po/seis, Democr.235; b. a)nagkai/a Th.2.70.
pasture, proba/twn PLips.118.15 (ii A. D.).
eating, pai/dwn Pl.R.619c; e)rino\s a)xrei=os w)\n e)s brw=sin S.Fr.181.
taste, flavour, Nic.Al. 377.
corrosion, rust, Ev.Matt.6.19;
decay, Gal.6.422 (pl.), 12.879.

brwsth/r, h=ros, o(,
moth, Aq.Ho.5.12; cf. brwth/r.

brw-te/os, a, on,
to be eaten, Luc.Par.9, Porph.Abst.2.10. brwte/on
one must eat, Muson.Fr.18 B p.105 H.; a)nqrw/pois b. tau=ta Porph.Abst.2.4.

brw-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to eat, voracious, Arist.GA745a29, PA682a17 (Comp.), Fr.231 (Sup.), Plu.2.352f (Comp.). Adv. -kw=s, e)/xein EM 485.17, Eust.966.4, etc.
promoting this inclination, duna/meis dub. l. in Chrysipp.Stoic.3.199 (e)rwtikai/ Coraes).
gnawing,
a)/lghma Hp.Epid.7.52.

brw-to/s, h/, o/n,
to be eaten, Archestr.Fr.28; fa/rmakon, opp. poto/n, Porph.Abst.1.27. brwto/n, to/ （to\n b. Bull.Soc.Alex.6.45),
meat, opp. poto/n, X.Mem.2.1.1; brwtoi=si kai\ potoi=si E.Supp.1110, cf. LXX 1 Es.5.54, Aristeas 128, PSI1.64.21 (ii A. D.).

brw-tu/s, h(, Ion. for brw=sis,
eating, acc. brwtu_/n Il.19.205, Od. 18.407: gen. brwtu/os Philox.2.38.
food, AP11.371 (Pall.).
bu=, exclamation of admiration, EM216.55.

bu/as, ou, o(,
eagle-owl, Strix bubo, Arist.HA592b9 (v.l. bru/as） bu/as e)/buce
an owl hooted, D.C.56.29, 72.24. (Onomatop.)
bubla/rion, to/, Dim. of bu/blos, PLille7.7 (pl.); bibl-, AP11.78 (Lucill.).
bublei/dion, v. bibli/dion.

bubli/a, h(,
papyrus-bed, Tab.Heracl.1.58; cf. bu/blinos.

bubli^nope/di_los, on,
with sandals of bu/blos, Anon. ap. Eust.1913.44.

bu/blinos, h, on,
made of bu/blos (of various kinds), o(/plon neo\s a)mfieli/sshs bu/blinon Od.21.391, cf. Hdt.7.25,36; u(podh/mata, i(sti/a, Id.2.37,96; teu/xh Inscr.Prien.114.11 (i B. C.); e)pistolai/ LXX Is.18.2 (bibl-）; mas xa/la
papyrus-marsh, Tab.Heracl.1.92; zugi/des BGU 544.4 (bibl-, ii A. D.).
bublioqh/kh, v. bibl-.
bu/blioi: ta/fwn fu/lakes (Cypr.), Hsch.

bu/blos and bi/blos (v. sub fin.), h(,
the Egyptian papyrus, Cyperus Papyrus, Hdt.2.92, A.Supp.761, Str.17.1.15: in pl.,
stalks of papyrus, PTeb.308.7 (ii A. D.).
rind enclosing the pith of this plant, Thphr.HP4.8.4, etc.: generally,
bark, fellw=n kai\ bu/blwn Pl.Plt. 288e, cf. Hdt.2.96, Plot.2.7.2. in pl.,
slices of the pith used as writing-material, Hdt.5.58, Hermipp.63.13: sg.,
strip of b., bu/blon eu)ru/nantes a)nti\ diadh/matos Ph.2.522.
roll of papyrus,
book, Hdt.2.100, A.Supp.947, etc.: heterocl. pl., bu/bla, ta/, AP9.98 (Stat. Flacc.); esp. of sacred or magical
writings, bi/blwn o(/madon *mousai/ou kai\ *)orfe/ws Pl.R.364e, cf. D.18.259, Act.Ap.19.19, PPar.19.1 (ii A. D.); i(erai/ b. OGI56.70 (Canopus, iii B. C.); b. i(eratikh/ PTeb.291.43 (ii A. D.); so of the Scriptures, h( b. gene/sews ou)ranou= kai\ gh=s LXX Ge.2.4, etc.; h( b.
the Sacred Writings, Aristeas 316; b. *mwuse/ws, yalmw=n, profhtw=n, Ev.Marc.12.26, Act.Ap.1.20, 7.42; b. zwh=s Ep.Phil.4.3: pl., of magical
books, Act.Ap.19.19. a
division of a book, Plb.4.87.12, D.S.1.4, etc.; ai( b. the nine
books of Hdt., Luc. Herod.1. b. stefanwtri/s
flowering head of papyrus, Theopomp. Hist.22c, Plu.Ages.36. [u^, A.Supp.761.] (bu/blos, bu/blinos, bubli/on, etc., are the original forms: bibl-seems to have arisen in Attic by assimilation in bibli/on, and is found in earlier Attic Inscrr., cf. IG2.1b, etc., and prevails in Ptolemaic papyri; Inscrr. vary, bubli/a Test.Epict.8.32 (iii/ii B. C.); bibli/a IG5(1).1390.12 (Andania, i B. C.); in Roman times bubl- was restored.)
bubo/s, h/, o/n, = mesto/s, plh/rhs, me/gas, Sophr.115.
budoi/: oi( mousikoi/, h)\ krou=ma/ ti, Hsch.; cf. bi/dh.
bu=za, h(, = bu/as, Nic.Fr.55.
buzanti/a: ei)=dos o(rmia=s, Hsch.

bu/zhn, Adv.
close pressed, closely, b. klei/ein Th.4.8, cf. Arr.An.2.20.8, App.Pun.123, etc.; b. w)stizo/menoi Luc.Lex.4; ta\ b. sunesthko/ta sti/fh Ph.2.382. = a(qro/ws (cf. Erot.), Hp.Nat.Puer.15, Mul.1.5.
buzo/n: pukno/n, suneto/n, gau=ron de\ kai\ me/ga, Hsch.

bu/zw (A), (bu/w)
to be frequent, h( ptu/sis bu/zetai Aret.SA2.2; cf. foreg., and bu/zantes: plh/qontes, Hsch.

bu/zw (B),
hoot, bu/as e)/buce D.C.56.29, 72.24.
bu/qalon: bu/sma, Hsch.

bu^q-a/w, (buqo/s)
strike deep, r(i/za buqo/wsa Nic.Th.505.

bu^q-i/zw,
sink a ship, S.Fr.552; mi/an penth/rh e)bu/qisan Plb.2.10.5;
let down, a)gku/ras Them.in Ph.133.20;
bury, plunge, e(rpeto/n . . e)n muxw=| tou= phlou= Luc.Alex.13:—Pass., of a ship, etc.,
sink, D.S.11.18, Babr. 117.1, Plu.Caes.49, D.Chr.63.3; of a person,
to be plunged into the sea, Plu.2.831d.
overwhelm, submerge, of a flood, oi)ki/as Plu. 2.306f:—Pass., Id.Daed.7. metaph., b. a)nqrw/pous ei)s o)/leqron 1 Ep.Ti.6.9:—Pass.,
to be ruined, tou\s dia\ filokerdi/an buqizome/nous Phld.Mort.33; to\ nh=fon u(po\ tou= pa/qous buqi/zetai Alciphr.1.13; nou=s buqisqei\s qumw=| h)\ e)piqumi/a| Simp.in Ph.273.11, cf. Hld.7.12.

bu^/q-ios, a, on, also os, on Gal.2.634:—
in the deep, sunken, Luc.DMar.3.1; krhpi=das b. phcame/nh AP9.791 (Apollonid.); e)k b. i)lu/os from the mud
of the deep, Hymn.Is.71.
in or
of the sea, ta\ b. (sc. zw=|a)
water animals, AP6.182 (Alex. Magn.); b. *kroni/dhs Poseidon, Luc.Epigr. 34; te/xnh
fishery, Opp.H.3.15. metaph.,
deep, bu/qio/n ti kai\ deino\n fqe/ggesqai Plu.Crass.23; b. dia/noia Ph.1.194 (but e(/ws a)\n logismo\s b. oi)/xhtai vanishes
in the deep, ib.639, cf. Nonn.D.2.55);
abysmal, Dam.Pr.106.

bu^q-ismo/s, o(,
sinking, submersion, Hld.9.8.
bu^q-i=tis, idos, pecul.fem.of bu/qios, ya/mmos AP9.290 (Phil.).
buqmh/n, Hsch.

bu^qoku_ma^todro/mos, on,
traversing the depths of the sea, nau=tai
Lyr. Alex.Adesp. 32.1.

bu^qo/s, o(,
the depth, esp. of the sea, A.Pr.432 (lyr.), 2 Ep.Cor.11.25. generally, suniza/nein ei)s b. sink to the
bottom, Thphr.Od.29: metaph., e)c ou)ri/wn dramou=san e)s buqo\n pesei=n S.Aj.1083; a)nakoufi/sai ka/ra buqw=n Id.OT24; e)k buqou= khki=on ai(=ma from the
deep wound, Id.Ph.783; katafe/resqai ei)s b. Arist.HA619a7, etc.; th\n a)nafora\n poihsa/menos e)k tou= b. ib.622b7; e)n tw=| b. th=s qala/tths ib.537a8: metaph., e)n buqw=| a)texni/hs in
the depth of . . , Hp.Praec.7; e)n b. h( a)lh/qeia Democr.117; ei)/s tina b. fluari/as e)mpesw/n Pl.Prm.130d; a)qeo/thtos Plu.2.757c; u(pe/rkosmos b.
abyss, Dam.Pr.106,205.

bu^qo-ta^racoki/nhse [i_] (sic, voc.),
stirring the deep to movement, PMag.Par.1.184.

bu^qo-trefh/s, e/s,
living in the deep, LXX 3 Ma. 6.8.

bu_ka^n-a/w or bouka^na/w,
blow the trumpet, Plb.6.35.12.

bu_ka^/n-h, h(,
spiral trumpet, horn, Id.15.12.2, al., D.H.2.8. (From Lat.
būc[icaron]na.）

bu_ka^/n-hma, atos, to/,
sound of the trumpet, App.Pun.21.

bu_ka^n-hth/s, ou=, o(,
trumpeter, Plb.2.29.6, App.Hann.41.

bu_ka^n-ismo/s, o(,
deep note, bourdon, Nicom.Exc.4 (boukanismo/s Ptol.Harm.1.4).
bu_ka^n-isth/s, ou=, o(, = bukanhth/s, Plb.30.22.11, D.H.4.18.
bukh/hs: u(pnhlo/s, Hsch. buknistai/: ei)kastai/, Id. buko/s: dasmofo/ros, Id. bukta/: sxe/tlia, dei/laia, Id.

bu/kths, ou, o(,
swelling, blustering, bukta/wn a)ne/mwn Od.10.20. Subst.,
hurricane, Lyc.738,756.

bulla/: bebusme/na, Hsch.:—hence bullo/w,
stuff, pf. Pass. bebullw=sqai, Id. bulli/xai,
dances at Sparta, and bulli/xhs,
dancer, Id. bullixi/des: r(axi/des, Id. buneu/s: skeu/asma/ ti kri/qinon, Id.
bu_ne/w, = bu/w, xrusi/w| . . e)bu/noun to\ sto/ma Ar.Pax645.

bu/nh, h(,
malt for brewing, PHolm.15.33, PLeid.X.22, Aët.10.29. = peu/kh, Hsch.

*bu/nh [u_], h(, an old name of
the sea-goddess Ino or Leucothea, Lyc. 107: hence,
the sea itself, Euph.127.

bu/nhtos, o(, an Egyptian
garment, Hdn.Gr.1.219.
bu/nis, ews, dub. sens. in PMag.Leid.V.13.10,17.

bunnei=n,
hold in the mouth, Hsch.

bu_nok[opi/a], h(,
preparation of malt, prob. in PTeb.401.30 (i A. D.).
bu/c: buqo/s, Hsch. (Fort. bru/c.)

bu/ptein: bapti/zein, Hsch. bu/rqakos: ba/traxos, Id. buriko/menos: pnigo/menos, traxhlizo/menos, Id. burio/qen, = baur-, q. v., Id.: bu/rion: oi)/khma, Id. bu/rmakas: mu/rmhkas, Id. burmo/s: staqmo/s, Id. burro/s, = ka/nqaros (Tyrrhen.), Id. = bi/rros, BGU814.8 (iii A. D.).

bu/rsa, h(,
skin stripped off, hide (prop.
ox-hide, b. kai\ a)/lla de/rmata Hdt.3.110), Batr.127, Arist.HA531a11, etc.; bu/rshs o)/zein smell
of leather, Ar.Eq.892; bu/rshs ktu/pos
of the drum, E.Ba.513;
wineskin, Luc.Lex.6, Aristid.Or.26(14).18.
skin of a live animal, Theoc.25.238. in contempt, of the human
skin, h( kakh\ b. Herod.3.80.
screen or perh.
sail, Luc.Nav.4.

burs-ai/etos, o(,
leather-eagle, com. name of Cleon the tanner, Ar. Eq.197.
burs-a/tonos, = burso/tonos, Hsch.

burs-ei=on, to/,
tan-pit, Sch.Ar.Ach.724.
burs-eu/s, e/ws, o(, later word for bursode/yhs, Artem. 4.56, Act.Ap.9.43, PFay.121.15 (ii A. D.); guild of bursei=s at Thyatira, IGRom.4.1216.

burs-eu/w,
dress hides, tan, Hsch. s.v. skulode/yios.

burs-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of hides or
leather, duswdi/a Gp.6.2.7.
used by tanners, r(ou=s Hippiatr.35.
burs-imw/lous: bursodeyi/mous, Hsch.

burs-i/nh, h(,
leathern thong, Ar.Eq.59,449 (with a play on mursi/nh).

bu/rs-inos, h, on,
leathern, ploia/ria D.C.48.19.
burs-i/s, i/dos, o(, Dim. of bu/rsa, Hsch.
bursodey-ei=on, to/, = bursei=on, EM187.17.

bursodey-e/w,
dress or
tan hides, Ar.Pl.167, Artem.1.51.

bursode/y-hs, ou, o(, (de/yw)
tanner, Ar.Eq. 44, Pl.Smp.221e, Herod.6.88, PPetr.3p.78 (iii B. C.), Artem.2.20.

bursode/y-hsis, ews, h(,
tanning, Eust.887.24.

bursodey-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for tanning, Hp.Mul.1.78, Thphr.CP3.9.3: hence -ikh/, h(,
art of tanning, Socr.Ep.14.2.
bursode/y-imos, v. bursimw/lous.

bursode/y-ion, to/,
tan-pit, IG14.352i71 (Halaesa).
burso/-kappos, o(, dub. sens. (fort. -ka/phlos), sobriquet of Cleon, Com.Adesp.61.

burso-pa^gh/s, e/s, (ph/gnumi)
made of hides, r(o/ptra Plu. Crass.23.

burso-pafla^gw/n, o/nos, o(,
leather-Paphlagonian, nickname of Clcon, Ar.Eq.47.

burso-poio/s, o/n,
tanning hides, Din.Fr.89.19.

burso-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
leather-seller, Ar.Eq.136.
burso-tenh/s, e/s, = burso/tonos, tu/mpana E.Hel.1347 (lyr.).

burso-tome/w,
cut leather, Poll. 7.81.

burso-to/mos, on, (te/mnw)
leather-cutting, Man.4.320, Hsch. s.v. r(inoto/ros.

burso/-tonos, on,
with skin stretched over it, b. ku/klwma, = tu/mpanon, E.Ba.124 (lyr.).

burs-o/w,
cover with skins or
leather, Ath.Mech.12.10, al.

burs-w/dhs, es, lit.
leathery; of the pulse,
hard, Gal.8.456 (Comp.).
bu/rth: lu/ra, Hsch.

bu_sau/xhn, enos, o(, h(, (bu/w)
short-necked, Ar.Fr.725 (v.l. for mesau/x-), Xenarch.1.4.
*bu/sios, o(, a Dclphic month, IG22.1126.45, Plu.2.292e, etc.

bu/sma, atos, to/, (bu/w)
plug, bung, Hp.Mul.2.114 (pl.), Ar.Fr. 299; *sti/lpwnos bu/smata Stilpo's
stoppers, i. e. arguments with which he stopped his opponents' mouths, Diph.23.

bu/ssa, h(, = busso/s, Opp.H.1.453. a
bird, Ant.Lib.15.

bu/ssaloi: bo/qroi, and bussaleu/w,
sink to the bottom, Hsch.

bu/ssinos, h, on,
made of bu/ssos, sindw\n b.
fine linen bandage, used for mummy-cloths, Hdt.2.86; for wounds, Id.7.181; pe/ploi A.Pers. 125 (lyr.), E.Ba.821; fa/ros S.Fr.373; o)qo/nia b. OGI90.17 (Rosetta), PStrassb.91.16 (i B. C.), Aristeas 320; b. peribo/laia PStrassb.91.9 (i B. C.); bu/ssinon, to/, LXX Es.1.6 (pl.), al., Apoc.19.8; o)qo/nia kai\ bu/ssina PHolm.15.26. = porfurou=s, Hsch.
bussobarh=: mega/la, and bussofarei=: megalofarei=, Hsch.

bussodomeu/w, (dome/w)
build in the deep: hence,
brood over a thing
in the depth of one's soul, ponder deeply; Hom. only in Od., always in bad sense, kaka\ fresi\ bussodo/meuon 17.66, al.; mu/qous b. 4.676; do/lon fresi\ b. Hes.Sc.30: also in late Prose, o)rgh\n b. Luc.Cal.24; ta\ bussodomeuo/mena
secret designs, Hld.7.11:—also burs-dome/w, Eust. 1513.46, Suid.

bussome/trhs, ou, o(,
measuring the deeps, epith. of a fisherman, AP6.193 (Stat. Flacc.).

busso/s, o(, = buqo/s,
depth of the sea, Il.24.80, Hdt.2.28,96, Arist. HA547b15.

bu/ssos, h(,
flax, and
the linen made from it, Emp.93, Theoc.2.73, etc.; used of
perennial flax, Linum angustifolium, grown in Elis, Paus.6.26.6, and of
Linum usitatissimum, = li/non *(ebrai/wn, Id.5.5.2; also, in later writers, of
Indian cotton, Gossypium herbaceum, Poll. 7.76, Philostr.VA2.20; and of
silk, ta\ *shrika\ e)/k tinwn floiw=n cainoue/nhs bu/ssou Str.15.1.20.

buss-ourgo/s, o(,
byssus-weaver, PTeb.5.239 (ii B. C.):—hence buss-ourgiko/s, h/, o/n, e)rgalei=a ib.243.
buss-ofarei=, v. bussobarh=.

buss-o/frwn, on, gen. onos, （frh/n） = baqu/frwn,
deep-thinking, *)erinu/s A.Ch.651 (lyr.).

bu/ss-wma, atos, to/,
net woven of bu/ssos, AP6.33 (Maec.).
bu/stac, akos, o(, = mu/stac, Antiph.44.4.
busti/xois: toi=s e)n qala/tth| bro/xois, Hsch.
bu/stra, h(, = bu/sma, Antiph.180.
bu/tana: ko/nduloi, Hsch. bu/tqan: to\n ya=ra, Id. (fort. yh=na). butqo/n: plh=qos, Id. buti/nh, h(, = puti/nh (Tarent.); also, = a)mi/s, Id. bu/ttos: gunaiko\s ai)doi=on, Id.

bu/w Arist.HA632a18: fut. bu/sw [u_] Thalesap.D.L.1.35, (e)pi-) Cratin.186.4, (pro-) Ar.V.250: aor. e)/bu_sa Hp.Morb.3.14, (e)pi-) Ar. Pl.379:—Med., only in compds.:—Pass., aor. e)bu/sqhn （par-) Luc. Deor.Conc.10: pf. be/busmai, the tense chiefly in use (v. infr.):—
stuff, c. gen. rei,
stuff full of, only in Pass., nh/matos bebusme/nos
stuffed full of spun-work or spinning, Od.4.134; to\ sto/ma e)be/busto (sc. xrusou=) Hdt.6.125; a)na/gkhs bebusme/nos oi)=kos Nonn.D.9.298. c. dat. rei,
stop or
plug with, bu/sas th\n e(/drhn spo/ggw| Hp. l. c., cf. Arist. l.c.:—Pass., spoggi/w| bebusme/nos Ar.Ach.463; khri/w| Id.Th. 506; r(afa/nois th\n e(/dran beb. Alciphr.3.62; i(/ppos a)risth/essi beb. Tryph.308; a)fradi/h| te be/busto [po/lis] Id.450. abs., bebusme/nos th\n r(i=na
having one's nose
stopped, Hegesipp.1.26; beb. ta\ w)=ta
deaf, Luc.Cat.5; ei(=ma beb. a
close, thick-woven robe, Hp.Mul.1.1.
stow or
tuck away, ti u(po\ th=| pte/rugi Ael.NA11.18. (Root but-, cf. bu/zhn （<*bus-dhn）, bu/s-tra; cf. ze/butai: se/saktai, Hsch.）
buwth/n: th\n a)/rsin, Hsch. bw=: bou=n, Id., cf. Sch.Il.7.238.

bwbo/s, h/, o/n,
dumb, e)k geneth=s kwfoi\ kai\ b. Plu.
Fr.inc.149, cf. Phlp.in GA223.32; also, = phro/s, xwlo/s, Hsch.
bwbu/zein: salpi/zein, Hsch. bw/|dion, to/, = boi/+dion, Id. bwqe/w, Ion. contr. for bohqe/w, v.l. in Hdt.8.47.
bwqu/zein: boa=n, qwu/+ssein, Hsch. bwka/rin, prob. f.l. for swka/rion, Gp.20.42. bw/karos, = e)/ar (Troczen.), EM217.40.

bw/kkalis, i/dos, h(, an Indian
bird, Ael.NA13.25.
bwkol-ia/sdw, bwkol-iasth/s, bwkol-iko/s, bw/kol-os, Dor. for bouk-. bw=kos, o(, Dor. for bou=kos. bwko/s: trufero\s xitw/n, Hsch. (fort. bra/kos).
bwla/, Dor. for boulh/, SIG261.15 (Argos, iv B. C.), Decr.Byz. ap. D.18.90, etc.

bwla/zw, in pf. part. Pass. bebwlasme/na pedi/a
cloddy, Onos.10.4.

bwl-a/kion [a^], to/,
loamy soil, Hsch., Zonar.

bwl-a/kios [a^], a, on,
lumpy, loamy, opp. dry sandy soil, gh= Pi.P.4.228.
bw=l-ac, a^kos, h(, = bw=los, ib.37, Theoc.17.80, A.R.3.1334.
bwl-a/rion, to/, Dim. of bw=los, Str.16.4.18; libanwtou= M.Ant.4.15; *)/aqws b. tou= ko/smou Id.6.36; a(lo/s Aët.2.3.

bwl-hdo/n, Adv.
clod-like, Dsc.5.106.

bwlhnh/ (sc. a)/mpelos), h(, a kind of
vine grown in Bithynia, Gp. 5.17.5.

entryFree.sense: mushroom-shaped dishes, BGU781 iii 8 (ii A. D.).

div0.entryFree:
bwlh/ths, = bwli/ths, Ath.3.113e:—hence bwlhti=nos a)/rtos a loaf
of this shape, ibid.

bwlh/tion, to/,
saucepan, POxy.1657.4 (iii A. D.).

bw/linos, h, on,
made of clay, i. e.
of brick, Hsch.
bwli/on, to/, Dim. of bw=los, Ar.V.203, Arist.Mir.833b14.

bwli/s, h(,
cake used in sacrifices, Hsch.

bwli/ths [i_], ou, o(,
terrestrial fungus, Lat.
boletus, Gp.12.17.8, Gal. 6.655.
root of luxni/s, Plin.HN21.171.

bwlo-eidh/s, e/s,
cloddy, lumpy, Thphr.Ign.65, Erot. s.v. mw/luza. Adv. -dw=s Dsc.1.73.

bwlo-kope/w,
break clods of earth, Ar.Fr.761, Hp. Ep.17, Ael.Ep.19, PLond. 1.131riii50 (i A. D.): pf. bebwloko/phka Ar.Fr.57 D.: metaph. in mal. part., *)arx.*delt.2 App.47 (Thyrrheum).

bwlo-ko/pos, on,
clod-breaking, Cratin.5.

bwlo/-kri_qon, to/,
barley-cake for fodder,
PLond.ined.2360 (iii B. C.).

bwlo-loge/w,
sift out earth from corn, POxy.708.7 (Pass., ii A.D.).
bw/lomai, Cret. for bou/lomai, GDI5042.16 (iii B. C.).

bwlo/nai, ai(,
mounds, barrows, S.Fr.1035.

bwlo-poie/w,
make into clods, f.l. in Hp.Ep.17.

bwlo/-pu_ros, o(,
wheat-cake for fodder, Wilcken Chr.198 (iii B. C.),
PLond.ined.2360 (iii B. C.).
bwlo/ruxa (bw=los, o)ru/ssw）: th\n su=n (Lacon.), Hsch.

bw=los, h(, less freq. o( (v. sub fin.),
lump, clod of earth, ei)/koi d' u(po\ bw=los a)ro/trw| Od.18.374; u(gra=s a)rou/ras b. S.Aj.1286; w(s balw= tau/th| th=| bw/lw| X.Cyr.8.3.27; b. a)nista/nai Plu.Rom.11; bw=los a)/rouran, prov. 'carrying coals to Newcastle', Zen.2.74; esp. of
earth fraudulently mixed with corn, POxy.708.8 (ii A. D.); cf. a)/bwlos. in Poets,
land, soil, baqei=an b. a)rou=ntes Mosch.4.37, cf. AP9.561 (Phil.), etc.; *li/bussa kru/yei b. *)anni/bou de/mas Orac. ap. Plu.Flam.20, cf. Jul.Or.3.125b. generally,
lump, as of gold,
nugget, Arist. Mir.833b11, Str.3.2.8; xruse/a bw=los, of the sun, E.Fr.783, cf. Or.984 (lyr.); b. moli/bdou D.S.3.14. = bwli/ths, Sch.Nic.Al.526. = sparga/nion, Ps.-Dsc.4.21 (v. l.). (Fem. acc. to Phryn.37, Moer. 95; masc. in Arist. l.c., D.C.40.47, PHolm.2.31, etc.)

bwlo-strofe/w,
turn up clods in ploughing, Gp.2.23.14 (Pass.), Eust.581.16:—hence bwlo-strofhte/os, a, on, also bwlo-strofi/a, h(,
turning up of clods, and bwlo-stro/fion, to/,
dibble, Gloss.

bwlo-to/mos, on,
clodbreaking, mu/rmhkes AP9.438 (Phil.).
bwl-w/dhs, es, = bwloeidh/s, Thphr.Lap.42, PHolm.24.38.

bw/l-wsis, ews, h(,
formation of lumps, PHolm.8.3.

bwmai/nw, aor. e)bw/mhna,
swear, Hsch.
bwma/keuma [ma_], atos, to/, = bwmolo/xeuma, Apollod.Cyren. ap. Sch. Pl.R.606c (pl.), EM218.7.
bw/mac, a_kos, o(, h(, = bwmolo/xos, Agath.2.30, EM199.2, Suid. bw=mac, a^kos, h(, Dim. of bwmo/s, AB85. bw/menos: bwmo/s, Hsch.

bw/meusis, ews, h(,
erection of an altar, Hsch.
bwmiai=os, a, on, = sq., S.Fr.38.
bwmiko/s, h/, o/n, = bw/mios, BCH2.600 (Cibyra).
bwmi/nas: a)naba/seis, Hsch.

bw/mios, on, also a, on, v. infr.: (bwmo/s):—
of an altar, a)kta\n pa/ra bw/mion S.OT183 (lyr.); bw/mioi e)sxa/rai E.Ph.274; b. e(/drh Orph.A. 992. of a suppliant, bwmi/a e)fhme/nh
at the altar, E.Supp.93, cf. S.Ant.1301; a)mfi\ bwmi/ous lita/s E.Ph.1749 (lyr.).
*bw/mios, o(, name of a Lamian month, IG9(2).71.3, al.

bwm-i/s, i/dos, h(, Dim. of bwmo/s,
step, Hdt.2.125.
bwm-iska/rion, to/, Dim. of bwmo/s, IG14.1030:—also bwm-i/skion, to/, BGU162.12 (ii/iii A. D.).

bwm-i/skos, o(, Dim. of bwmo/s,
altar-shaped vessel, Hero Spir. 1.38, al.
bandage, Gal.18(1).823. Arith.,
solid or
solid number with all its dimensions unequal bounded by rectangles and trapezia, Hero
*Deff.114, Theo Sm.p.41 H., Nicom.Ar.2.16, Syrian. in Metaph.143.7, al. Geom.,
plane figure resembling the solid b. in appearance, Papp.878. name of a
constellation, Ptol.Alm. 8.1.
base of molar teeth, Poll.2.93.

bwm-i/stria, h(,
priestess, Nic.Al.217.

bwm-i=tis (sc. gh=), idos, h(,
consecrated land, Inscr.Perg. 157 D17.

bwmoeidh/s, e/s,
like an altar, Plu.Them.32.

bwmolo/x-euma, atos, to/, only in pl.,
ribald jests, Ar.Eq.902, Pax 748.

bwmolox-e/w,
beg, Poll.3.111. = foreg., Plu.2.407c.

bwmolox-i/a, h(,
mendicancy, Poll. 3.111.
coarse jesting, buffoonery, ribaldry. Pl.R.606c, Arist. EN1108a24, Plu.Lyc.12, etc.

bwmolox-iko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to ribaldry, Luc.Herm.58, Gal.6.228, al. Adv. -kw=s (Lat.
-ice), Id.Subf.Emp. 11.

bwmo/lox-os, on, (loxa/w) prop.
one that waited about the altars, to beg or steal some of the meat offered thereon, i(/na mh\ pro\s toi=si bwmoi=s a)ei\ loxw=ntes bwmolo/xoi kalw/meqa Pherecr.141; b. i(erei=s Man.5.119; expld. by i(ero/sulos, Hsch., Et.Gud. metaph.,
ribald, coarse, b. cunh/goros Ar.Eq.1358, cf. Ra.1085,1521, al., Arist.EN1108a25, Rh.1419b9, Luc.Merc.Cond.24, etc.; b. ko/lac AP11.323 (Pall.): Sup. -w/tatos Phld.Mus.p.77K.; bwmolo/xon ti e)ceurei=n invent some
ribald trick, Ar.Eq.1194; b. e)/pesin xai/rei Id.Ra.358; to\ b., = bwmoloxi/a, Plu.2.68asq. Adv. -xws Procop.Arc.9, Olymp.in Phd. p.70N. small
jackdaw, Arist.HA617b18.

bwmoni/khs [i_], ou, o(, at Sparta,
the lad who won the prize for the endurance of the voluntary whipping at the altar of Artemis Orthia, IG 5(1).554,al.:—hence bwmolox-ni_ke/w, ib.654.

bwmo/s, o(, (bai/nw)
raised platform, stand, for chariots, Il.8.441;
base of a statue, Od.7.100: but, mostly,
altar with a base, i(ero\s b. Il.2.305, etc.; pro\s bwmw=| sfagei/s A.Eu.305; bwmo\s a)rh=s fuga/sin r(u=ma Id.Supp.84 (lyr.); bwmw=n a)pei/rgein tina/ Id.Ch.293; a)guieu\s b. S.Fr.370; of suppliants, poti\ bwmo\n i(/zesqai Od.22.334; bwmo<*>si prosh=sqai, prospeso/nta bwmw=| kaqh=sqai, S.OT16, OC1158; bwmo\n i(/zein E.Ion1314: also in Prose, b. i(dru/sasqai Hdt.3.142, cf. Pl.Prt.322a; i(zo/menoi e)pi\ to\n b. Hdt.6.108; e)pi\ bwmw=n kaqe/zesqai Lys.2.11. later,
tomb, cairn, Epigr.Gr.319. title of poems by Dosiades and Besantinus, AP15.26and25, cf. Luc.Lex.25.
altar-shaped cake, IG2.1651
B,C, Poll.6.76. *zeu\s *bwmo/s, prob. a Syrian god, Hermes37.118 (Syria).
central fire in the system of Philolaus, acc. to Placit.2.7.7. in pl., = e)/mboloi, Hsch.

bwmo/speiron, to/,
round base or
torus of a column
placed upon a square plinth, CIG2782.31 (Aphrodisias), Rev.Phil.44.73 (Lydia).
bw=n, v. bou=s.
bw/nhma: ei)/rhma (Lacon.), Hsch.
bwni/ths, ou, Dor. bwmo/lox-tas, o(, -bouko/los, Call.Fr.157, Choerob.in An.Ox.1.184, Hsch.; but bounith=|si: toi=s bouko/lois, Suid.
bw=c, bwko/s, o(, contr. for bo/ac (q. v.).

bwreu/s, ews, o(,
pickled mullet, Xenocr.76:—Dim. bwri/dion, to/, Id.78.
*bwrqi/a: *)orqi/a (q. v.), Hsch.; cf. *borqei/a.

bw/rimos or bw=rmos, name of a Mariandynian
dirge, Poll.4.54.
bw=roi: o)fqalmoi/, Hsch.
bw=s, v. bou=s.

bwsarh/, Indian name for an
elephant, Peripl.M.Rubr.62.
bw/sas, bw=son, v. sub boa/w. bw/sesqe, poet. for biw/sesqe, A.R.1.685.
bwsidi/a, h(, = sq., Sammelb.1160.4.

bwsi/on, to/, dub. sens. of
a household utensil, b. xalkou=n Stud.Pal. 20.67 (ii/iii A. D.).
bwsth/r, h=ros, o(, = both/r, Hsch.

bwstre/w,
call on, esp.
call to aid, bwstrei=n de\ *krataii/+n Od.12.124, cf. Ar.Pax1146, al., Theoc.5.64;
cry after, a( *ku/pris to\n *)/erwta . . e)bw/strei Mosch.1.1; b. tini\ poiei=n ti Opp.C.4.293: abs., ta\ d' e)si/ga, ta\ d' e)bw/strei, of birds, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.7.8. (Formed from boa/w, cf. e)lastre/w, kalistre/w.)

bwta/rion,
vessel for slow heating, Zos.Alch.p.165 B.; cf. bou=tis.
bwta/zein: ba/llein, Hsch. bwth=res, gloss on bw/tores, Id.

bwti^a/neira [a^n], h(, （bo/skw)
man-feeding, nurse of heroes, epith. of fruitful countries, Il.1.155; xqw/n h.Ap.363, Hes.Cat.Oxy.1369 Fr. 1.16. bwti/on: stamni/on, Hsch.
bw/twr, oros, o(, = both/r, Il.12.302; bw/tores a)/ndres Od.14.102, AP 6.262 (Leon.).
bw/x: bota/nhs ei)=dos, Hsch.
